posts.title: hcr-You Might Be Attracting Toxic People for 5 Surprising Reasons
posts.markdown: 5 Reasons You Might Be Attracting Toxic People Without Realizing It 5 Shocking Reasons Toxic People Are Attracted To You Learning how to spot the toxic people in your life can be hard if you’re not sure what to look for. They function and look like your average person, but once they’ve made their way into your life, havoc, chaos and sorrow are often the only things they have to offer you. They enjoy latching onto happy, unsuspecting people, which is why some of the most genuine and kind folks often have to deal with toxic people the most. Here are five surprising reasons that you’re attracting toxic people in your life: **You’re really good at listening** People who are really good at listening to what others have to say are always highly valued, especially in a world that has become so distracted by the technology at our fingertips. Toxic people will use this great quality of yours as a platform to hear themselves speak. They can talk for hours about themselves (and the negative way they see the world) without showing any interest in what *you* have to say. They just like when others accept their view of the world as truth. **You give people the time of day** Generosity is undoubtedly a great quality to have, but when it comes to toxic people, it can be highly detrimental. Generosity is something that toxic individuals seek out on a regular basis, simply because they know that they can take advantage of a person who will do anything for them. They’re likely to grab hold and not let go if you’re always at their beck and call. **You have an easygoing nature** Easygoing people are fun to be around. They pretty much always keep their cool and are very good at diffusing uncomfortable situations with clever jests or kind words. They’re usually very patient and kind, a trait that stems from the inner peace that they’ve found. Unfortunately for these people, their inner peace is exactly what attracts toxic people, simply because they wish to disrupt it. **You’re good at solving conflict, building bridges** When arguments and feuds go unresolved, the bridge builder will go to great lengths to see the relationship mended. Many people love you for your ability to bring people together, and are often quite grateful. Toxic people love these types because they love to destroy bridges. Creating drama and conflict between others is something they truly enjoy. **You see humanity in a very positive light** I like to believe that most people see their fellow man as inherently good-natured and kind, just as I do. And I’d say that most people’s daily interactions with each other prove this to be true. However, every now and then we experience the dark side of folks. If you’re the type of person who has trouble finding the darkness in others, you could be inviting toxic people into your life without even realizing it. Do you put up with a crappy friend out of hope that they will change? Do you completely ignore their poor behavior and distasteful acts, choosing to hang out with them anyway? Maybe it’s time to re-evaluate your friendship. http://www.marcandangel.com/2015/08/16/7-surprising-reasons-youre-attracting-toxic-people/
posts.html:
5 Reasons You Might Be Attracting Toxic People Without Realizing It

5 Shocking Reasons Toxic People Are Attracted To You

Learning how to spot the toxic people in your life can be hard if you’re not sure what to look for. They function and look like your average person, but once they’ve made their way into your life, havoc, chaos and sorrow are often the only things they have to offer you.

They enjoy latching onto happy, unsuspecting people, which is why some of the most genuine and kind folks often have to deal with toxic people the most.

Here are five surprising reasons that you’re attracting toxic people in your life:

You’re really good at listening

People who are really good at listening to what others have to say are always highly valued, especially in a world that has become so distracted by the technology at our fingertips. Toxic people will use this great quality of yours as a platform to hear themselves speak.

They can talk for hours about themselves (and the negative way they see the world) without showing any interest in what you have to say. They just like when others accept their view of the world as truth.

You give people the time of day

Generosity is undoubtedly a great quality to have, but when it comes to toxic people, it can be highly detrimental. Generosity is something that toxic individuals seek out on a regular basis, simply because they know that they can take advantage of a person who will do anything for them.

They’re likely to grab hold and not let go if you’re always at their beck and call.

You have an easygoing nature

Easygoing people are fun to be around. They pretty much always keep their cool and are very good at diffusing uncomfortable situations with clever jests or kind words. They’re usually very patient and kind, a trait that stems from the inner peace that they’ve found.

Unfortunately for these people, their inner peace is exactly what attracts toxic people, simply because they wish to disrupt it.

You’re good at solving conflict, building bridges

When arguments and feuds go unresolved, the bridge builder will go to great lengths to see the relationship mended. Many people love you for your ability to bring people together, and are often quite grateful. Toxic people love these types because they love to destroy bridges.

Creating drama and conflict between others is something they truly enjoy.

You see humanity in a very positive light

I like to believe that most people see their fellow man as inherently good-natured and kind, just as I do. And I’d say that most people’s daily interactions with each other prove this to be true. However, every now and then we experience the dark side of folks. If you’re the type of person who has trouble finding the darkness in others, you could be inviting toxic people into your life without even realizing it.

Do you put up with a crappy friend out of hope that they will change? Do you completely ignore their poor behavior and distasteful acts, choosing to hang out with them anyway? Maybe it’s time to re-evaluate your friendship.

http://www.marcandangel.com/2015/08/16/7-surprising-reasons-youre-attracting-toxic-people/

posts.title: hcr-Chronic Migraines? Try a Bit of Lemon Juice With Salt
posts.markdown: Lemon Juice and Salt Can Cure a Migraine Headache in Just Minutes Get Rid of Your Migraine Headaches Using Lemon Juice and Salt Migraine headaches cause some of the most agonizing pain humans have ever felt. The worst ones can leave you bedridden or completely incapacitated. If you or a loved one suffer from migraines, we have some good news for you: lemon juice and salt water will clear them right up, and in record time. **What you’ll need** The solution is relatively simple to make: grab a glass of water, squeeze in as much lemon juice as you can from a lemon and then add about two teaspoons of salt. Mix the ingredients into a solution and then drink it, allowing a few minutes for the effects to kick in. One thing to be mindful of when making this drink is the type of salt you use in it. Preferably, you want to use a high quality salt, like pink Himalayan sea salt. This type of salt has about 80 different trace minerals in it, making it perfect for clearing up migraines. Additionally, salt helps boost serotonin levels, which is good for reducing inflammation and pain. **1 out of every 10 people are affected by migraines** Which is about [36 million people in the United States](http://tophealthnews.net/this-drink-will-stop-your-migraine-headache-within-minutes/). In fact, migraines are among the most common reasons that people call in sick to work. Symptoms of migraines include: - A throbbing head - Nausea - Dizziness - Increased sensitivity to smells, noises and light - Pain lasting anywhere from 2 hours to 72 hours - Numbness - Tingling **Why are you getting migraines in the first place?** Migraines happen for a lot of different reasons, so it’s not always obvious why you’re suffering from one. While we can’t say for certain why each individual migraine occurs, there is a list of known causes you can study in order to take preventative measures: - [Stress is one reason](http://www.webmd.com/migraines-headaches/guide/migraines-headaches-managing-stress). Chronic stress can cause headaches that eventually turn into the nightmares that are migraines. - The [consumption of alcohol](http://www.joybauer.com/photo-gallery/common-trigger-foods/alcohol/) has been linked to people’s development of migraines. - Allergies have been seen to set off certain reactions that can cause migraines. - Any sort of vitamin or mineral deficiency can start migraines. - The most common circumstances linked to migraines are [dehydration](http://www.webmd.com/a-to-z-guides/dehydration-adults) and an [imbalance of electrolytes](http://www.healthline.com/health/electrolyte-disorders). Not only will you feel incredibly sluggish or lethargic, but these conditions create the perfect environment for brewing headaches. > [Lemon Juice With Salt Can Stop Migraine Headache Within Minutes](http://www.lifehack.org/359570/lemon-juice-with-salt-can-stop-migraine-headache-within-minutes)
posts.html:
Lemon Juice and Salt Can Cure a Migraine Headache in Just Minutes

Get Rid of Your Migraine Headaches Using Lemon Juice and Salt

Migraine headaches cause some of the most agonizing pain humans have ever felt. The worst ones can leave you bedridden or completely incapacitated.

If you or a loved one suffer from migraines, we have some good news for you: lemon juice and salt water will clear them right up, and in record time.

What you’ll need

The solution is relatively simple to make: grab a glass of water, squeeze in as much lemon juice as you can from a lemon and then add about two teaspoons of salt.

Mix the ingredients into a solution and then drink it, allowing a few minutes for the effects to kick in.

One thing to be mindful of when making this drink is the type of salt you use in it. Preferably, you want to use a high quality salt, like pink Himalayan sea salt. This type of salt has about 80 different trace minerals in it, making it perfect for clearing up migraines. Additionally, salt helps boost serotonin levels, which is good for reducing inflammation and pain.

1 out of every 10 people are affected by migraines

Which is about 36 million people in the United States. In fact, migraines are among the most common reasons that people call in sick to work.

Symptoms of migraines include:

  • A throbbing head
  • Nausea
  • Dizziness
  • Increased sensitivity to smells, noises and light
  • Pain lasting anywhere from 2 hours to 72 hours
  • Numbness
  • Tingling

Why are you getting migraines in the first place?

Migraines happen for a lot of different reasons, so it’s not always obvious why you’re suffering from one. While we can’t say for certain why each individual migraine occurs, there is a list of known causes you can study in order to take preventative measures:

  • Stress is one reason. Chronic stress can cause headaches that eventually turn into the nightmares that are migraines.
  • The consumption of alcohol has been linked to people’s development of migraines.
  • Allergies have been seen to set off certain reactions that can cause migraines.
  • Any sort of vitamin or mineral deficiency can start migraines.
  • The most common circumstances linked to migraines are dehydration and an imbalance of electrolytes. Not only will you feel incredibly sluggish or lethargic, but these conditions create the perfect environment for brewing headaches.

Lemon Juice With Salt Can Stop Migraine Headache Within Minutes

posts.title: The Difference Between Pasture-Raised and Free-Range Eggs
posts.markdown: There are some people lucky enough to live in the countryside, raising chickens and collecting their own farm fresh eggs, but for most of us, buying eggs at the grocery store is common practice. Have you ever looked at all of the different kinds of eggs you can buy? I used to buy store brand, large-sized eggs in the 18-egg containers, but recently switched to ‘organic.’ Even then, the **[labels and words](http://health.usnews.com/health-news/blogs/eat-run/articles/2016-04-14/making-sense-of-egg-carton-labels)** used by marketers to describe their products to us aren’t exactly transparent. They’re used to make us feel better about our purchase. “Consumers are increasingly skeptical of ‘marketing terms’ that bear little relation to the realities of how the eggs are farmed, and rightly so,” says Jeff Hinds, vice president of quality assurance, compliance and food safety at **[Vital Farms](http://vitalfarms.com/)**. Knowing the differences in labels will help you make purchasing decisions more in line with your values. Here are four different labels used by marketers that describe how the eggs were farmed:   - ****Caged: **Held in confined cages as small as 67 square-inches, these hens usually never see daylight and eat a diet consisting of entirely soy or corn. In the United States, **[about 90 percent](http://health.usnews.com/health-news/blogs/eat-run/articles/2016-03-23/1-egg-8-ways)**of eggs are from hens who spend their entire lives laying eggs in their dark cages.** - **Cage-Free: **Confined to less than 1-square-foot of space, these hens have more space than caged hens, but are not completely ‘free.’ They usually live in crowded barns and have diet of only corn or soy. - **Free-Range: **With less than 2-square-feet for each hen, these birds have a bit more room than the previous two, but don’t live the life that “free-range” implies. Many of them live in darkness, eating only a corn or soy diet. - **Pasture-Raised:** Having the most space of all the hens, these chickens reside in at least 108 square-feet each, eating a diet that consists of many different things, like bugs, feed, grass, worms and whatever else they happen across. They’re let outside early in the morning, and then called in just before the sun falls. Additionally, **[one study](http://health.usnews.com/health-news/blogs/eat-run/2015/03/05/eggs-is-it-time-to-get-back-together-with-this-once-feared-food)** conducted at Pennsylvania State University found that pasture-raised hens laid healthier eggs. Healthier because they contained two times as much omega-3 fat, three times the vitamin D, four times more vitamin E, and about seven times more beta-carotene than hens consuming a traditional diet of corn and soy. This type of labeling is just the first step, however. Once you’ve familiarized yourself with the four categories above, the next part is becoming familiar with third-party verifications, such as “organic,” “**[Non-GMO Project Verified](http://health.usnews.com/health-news/health-wellness/articles/2015/04/29/are-gmos-really-that-harmful-to-eat)**” and “Certified Humane.” These labels typically require higher standards and stricter regulation of operational procedures. “A third-party certification from a recognized and trustworthy organization [is] a literal seal of approval,” says Adele Douglass of **[Certified Humane](http://certifiedhumane.org/)**. h/t [**US News**](http://health.usnews.com/health-news/blogs/eat-run/articles/2016-07-25/whats-the-difference-between-pasture-raised-and-free-range-eggs)
posts.html:
There are some people lucky enough to live in the countryside, raising chickens and collecting their own farm fresh eggs, but for most of us, buying eggs at the grocery store is common practice.

Have you ever looked at all of the different kinds of eggs you can buy? I used to buy store brand, large-sized eggs in the 18-egg containers, but recently switched to ‘organic.’

Even then, the labels and words used by marketers to describe their products to us aren’t exactly transparent. They’re used to make us feel better about our purchase.

“Consumers are increasingly skeptical of ‘marketing terms’ that bear little relation to the realities of how the eggs are farmed, and rightly so,” says Jeff Hinds, vice president of quality assurance, compliance and food safety at Vital Farms.

Knowing the differences in labels will help you make purchasing decisions more in line with your values. Here are four different labels used by marketers that describe how the eggs were farmed:

 

  • Caged: Held in confined cages as small as 67 square-inches, these hens usually never see daylight and eat a diet consisting of entirely soy or corn. In the United States, about 90 percent of eggs are from hens who spend their entire lives laying eggs in their dark cages.
  • Cage-Free: Confined to less than 1-square-foot of space, these hens have more space than caged hens, but are not completely ‘free.’ They usually live in crowded barns and have diet of only corn or soy.
  • Free-Range: With less than 2-square-feet for each hen, these birds have a bit more room than the previous two, but don’t live the life that “free-range” implies. Many of them live in darkness, eating only a corn or soy diet.
  • Pasture-Raised: Having the most space of all the hens, these chickens reside in at least 108 square-feet each, eating a diet that consists of many different things, like bugs, feed, grass, worms and whatever else they happen across. They’re let outside early in the morning, and then called in just before the sun falls.

Additionally, one study conducted at Pennsylvania State University found that pasture-raised hens laid healthier eggs. Healthier because they contained two times as much omega-3 fat, three times the vitamin D, four times more vitamin E, and about seven times more beta-carotene than hens consuming a traditional diet of corn and soy.

This type of labeling is just the first step, however. Once you’ve familiarized yourself with the four categories above, the next part is becoming familiar with third-party verifications, such as “organic,” “Non-GMO Project Verified” and “Certified Humane.” These labels typically require higher standards and stricter regulation of operational procedures.

“A third-party certification from a recognized and trustworthy organization [is] a literal seal of approval,” says Adele Douglass of Certified Humane.

h/t US News

posts.title: Japanese Engineer Creates Device That Moves Objects Through the Air Using Sound
posts.markdown: ![three-dimensional mid-air-levitation-acoustic-manipulation](http://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/three-dimensional-mid-air-levitation-acoustic-manipulation.gif) Science is pretty sweet. Especially when we’re able to use our understanding of one phenomena to replicate it in a variety of different ways, like with sound waves. Sound is the perfect tool for manipulating the space and materials around us because of how it exists in wave form. Now, just like a special effect in a big film production, engineers from the**[University of Tokyo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Tokyo)** and the **[Nagoya Institute of Technology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagoya_Institute_of_Technology)** have developed a device that moves objects through the air using only sound waves! The device features four ultrasonic speakers whose audio waves center on a focal point.  Watch as researchers use their device to manipulate objects through the air using nothing but sound.
posts.html:

Watch as researchers use their device to manipulate objects through the air using nothing but sound.

posts.title: This Is What Happens To Your Brain When You Go On Hiking , Doctors Say
posts.markdown: Growing up in the Rocky Mountains, I was surrounded by some of the most beautiful scenery in the United States. The town I currently live in sits at about 7000 feet of elevation; just up the road from behind my house is a 14,000-foot peak. Tall Aspen trees and green shrubbery cover most of the mountainous landscape, making for some unforgettable journeys through the serenity and peacefulness that this environment provides. It’s shaped much of who I am, and given me a deep appreciation for Mother Nature and all of the wondrous benefit she brings to mankind. There’s something inherently good about spending time in “nature.” You might be an avid outdoors person who knows this all too well. Or maybe you’re a homebody, preferring to spend much of your time indoors in the comfort of your own home. To these folks I must say, being outside is good for you. And doctors agree. **Reducing Negative Thought Patterns** **[New research](http://www.pnas.org/content/112/28/8567)** has found that being outside in nature reduces the amount of rumination one experiences (rumination being a focus on negative thought patterns). People who have consistent negative thoughts about themselves often suffer from anxiety, depression, and a host of other detrimental issues. When comparing folks who spent 90 minutes in an urban environment to folks who spent 90 minutes in a natural environment, those in the natural environment reported decreased levels of rumination and negative thoughts. They also exhibited less neural activity in the part of the brain associated with mental illness. The folks in the urban environment could not say the same. If you’re living in an urban area, think about spending a few hours each week outside in nature to reduce stress and improve mental health. **It Disconnects Us From Technology** **[In one study](http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0051474)**, creative problem solving was seen to increase by about 50 percent in individuals who went on a 4-day backpacking trip in a natural environment. During this trip, they were not allowed to use any technological device and were tasked with problems that required critical thinking and problem solving skills. This data suggests that being outside in nature helps to decrease mental fatigue, **[put our minds at ease](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1448497/)**, and stimulate creativity. **Hiking is exercising, and what’s good for the body is good for the mind** Depending on how difficult a hike you take on, you can burn anywhere from 400 to 700 calories per hour. Not to mention, it’s much easier on the body than other forms of exercise or cardio, like running. And aerobic exercise **[has been seen to promote](http://bjsm.bmj.com/content/early/2014/03/04/bjsports-2013-093184.abstract?sid=ecff0a48-d4fd-4a9d-b34a-156ca915a79e)** self-esteem and confidence, reduce stress levels and release endorphins in the body. After numerous studies have found the powerful benefits of hiking, doctors are actually handing out “**[nature prescriptions](http://www.webmd.com/balance/features/nature-therapy-ecotherapy)**” and suggesting forms of “**[ecotherapy](http://instituteatgoldengate.org/health)**” to combat the effects of anxiety, stress and depression. **So, are you ready to go for a hike?** If you’ve ever wanted to get into hiking or thought about spending time in nature, but aren’t exactly sure how to start, no worries! It’s easy, relatively inexpensive to get into, and a ton of fun. Imagine climbing a mountain peak and being able to see for days around you. Once you get into the habit of hiking, you’ll see the world differently, you’ll want to explore everywhere. If you’ve never hiked before, start out small on local trails with minimal elevation change. Don’t plan a trip up a 14’er or a week-long backpacking excursion. There are various resources for finding trail maps on the Internet, as well as phone apps that can identify which trails are right for you. A few tips: - Always check the weather so you don’t get caught in dangerous situations. If it’s midday and incredibly hot, bring ample water. If it’s going to rain or sleet, bring water-resistant clothing. - Wear the proper clothes. Moisture-wicking, breathable and light is what you want to keep dry and warm. Polyester, wool, fleece, silk, etc. - If it’s going to be sunny, bring sun protection. Sunscreen, hats, sunglasses, and [s**un protective clothing**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun_protective_clothing) will always benefit your hike. - Have fun! h/t [**Life Hack**](http://www.lifehack.org/363786/doctors-agree-hiking-good-for-your-mental-health)
posts.html:
Growing up in the Rocky Mountains, I was surrounded by some of the most beautiful scenery in the United States. The town I currently live in sits at about 7000 feet of elevation; just up the road from behind my house is a 14,000-foot peak. Tall Aspen trees and green shrubbery cover most of the mountainous landscape, making for some unforgettable journeys through the serenity and peacefulness that this environment provides.

It’s shaped much of who I am, and given me a deep appreciation for Mother Nature and all of the wondrous benefit she brings to mankind.

There’s something inherently good about spending time in “nature.” You might be an avid outdoors person who knows this all too well. Or maybe you’re a homebody, preferring to spend much of your time indoors in the comfort of your own home. To these folks I must say, being outside is good for you. And doctors agree.

Reducing Negative Thought Patterns

New research has found that being outside in nature reduces the amount of rumination one experiences (rumination being a focus on negative thought patterns). People who have consistent negative thoughts about themselves often suffer from anxiety, depression, and a host of other detrimental issues.

When comparing folks who spent 90 minutes in an urban environment to folks who spent 90 minutes in a natural environment, those in the natural environment reported decreased levels of rumination and negative thoughts. They also exhibited less neural activity in the part of the brain associated with mental illness. The folks in the urban environment could not say the same.

If you’re living in an urban area, think about spending a few hours each week outside in nature to reduce stress and improve mental health.

It Disconnects Us From Technology

In one study, creative problem solving was seen to increase by about 50 percent in individuals who went on a 4-day backpacking trip in a natural environment. During this trip, they were not allowed to use any technological device and were tasked with problems that required critical thinking and problem solving skills.

This data suggests that being outside in nature helps to decrease mental fatigue, put our minds at ease, and stimulate creativity.

Hiking is exercising, and what’s good for the body is good for the mind

Depending on how difficult a hike you take on, you can burn anywhere from 400 to 700 calories per hour. Not to mention, it’s much easier on the body than other forms of exercise or cardio, like running. And aerobic exercise has been seen to promote self-esteem and confidence, reduce stress levels and release endorphins in the body.

After numerous studies have found the powerful benefits of hiking, doctors are actually handing out “nature prescriptions” and suggesting forms of “ecotherapy” to combat the effects of anxiety, stress and depression.

So, are you ready to go for a hike?

If you’ve ever wanted to get into hiking or thought about spending time in nature, but aren’t exactly sure how to start, no worries! It’s easy, relatively inexpensive to get into, and a ton of fun. Imagine climbing a mountain peak and being able to see for days around you. Once you get into the habit of hiking, you’ll see the world differently, you’ll want to explore everywhere.

If you’ve never hiked before, start out small on local trails with minimal elevation change. Don’t plan a trip up a 14’er or a week-long backpacking excursion. There are various resources for finding trail maps on the Internet, as well as phone apps that can identify which trails are right for you.

A few tips:

  • Always check the weather so you don’t get caught in dangerous situations. If it’s midday and incredibly hot, bring ample water. If it’s going to rain or sleet, bring water-resistant clothing.
  • Wear the proper clothes. Moisture-wicking, breathable and light is what you want to keep dry and warm. Polyester, wool, fleece, silk, etc.
  • If it’s going to be sunny, bring sun protection. Sunscreen, hats, sunglasses, and sun protective clothing will always benefit your hike.
  • Have fun!

h/t Life Hack

posts.title: 6 Things That a Narcissist Will Never Do
posts.markdown: Can you spot a narcissist when you see them? You might have come across one and not even realized it. Many of them are naturally charismatic and easy to get along with, at first. But after spending some amount of time with them, red flags start popping up everywhere. However, it can be hard to notice them, because it’s not always what the narcissist *does,* but what the narcissist *doesn’t* do that should be alarming. Here are six things that narcissists are not likely to do: **They’ll never reveal the true version of themselves** Narcissists operate under a guise of falsehood, projecting a specific image of themselves that they think people will be most attracted to. They like to manipulate their way into your life under the premise that they’ll be a benefit to you, but their true malicious selves eventually surface, and oftentimes it’s too late to remedy the situation. **They’re not interested in creating ‘secure’ relationships** In order for the manipulation tactics of a narcissist to be working at 100 percent efficiency, they have to keep their relationships unstable and uncertain. They’re always working to make you feel on edge or unsure about the happenings of your life. If they can do this, it makes them feel superior to you. They derive security from your insecurity. **They will never accept full responsibility for their behavior** Remember how narcissists like to keep you on edge? They like to keep you questioning reality so that whenever you call them out on their poor behavior, they can turn the entire thing around and make it seem like your fault. They’re never to blame, but always involved oddly enough. **They’ll never give up control** Narcissists live by controlling the world around them, so when they’re unable to do so, they tend to become incredibly irritated and upset. As mentioned before, they gain their security from the insecurities of others, and a big part of that is so that they can control every aspect of the setting they currently find themselves in. **They will never see anyone as an equal** Narcissists have such inflated egos that they view themselves as the ultimate cream of the crop; no one can ever match up to their superiority as a person. They’re not keen on seeing others succeed or achieve in areas where they cannot, so they actively try to degrade and bring down any “rivals.” Whatever it takes to be on top. **They will never compliment others** Because narcissists see themselves as nothing short of God’s gift to mankind, they’re not about to start handing out compliments to just anyone. They expect the compliments to be flowing in the other direction, towards them. If you are blessed enough to be complemented by a narcissist, be skeptical about why they’re doing so.
