> “Synchronicity postulates a meaning which is *a priori* in relation to human consciousness and apparently exists outside man… I am only too conscious that synchronicity is a highly abstract and ‘irrepresentable’ quantity. It ascribes to the moving body a certain psychoid [consciousness] property which, like space, time, and causality, forms a criterion of its behavior.”

Jung, in conjunction with the physicist Wolfgang Pauli, explored the possibility that his concepts of the unconscious and synchronicity might be related to the unus mundus to which the unconscious is an expression; synchronicity, or “meaningful coincidence,” being made possible by the fact that both the observer and connected phenomenon ultimately stem from the same source, the *unus mundus*.” Any good physicist will tell you at the deepest level, everything is connected. Jung noticed we have rationality which follows causality and meaning (emotion/feeling) which appears to follow acausality, synchronistically. He noticed that synchronistic experiences (driven by meaning) seem to allow the violating of statistical laws, rather than deterministic laws. To clarify visibly, he created this chart:

![Jung's Synchronicity Chart](http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-W8EVeiR5b9Q/U1Z1Bui_uPI/AAAAAAAACbk/ugts0lRpEq4/s1600/Sch%C3%A9ma_synchronicit%C3%A9_in_English.png)

 Jung also noticed that moments of synchronicity require a selfless awareness. This is what he means by ‘individuation’ in his work: to become aware of consciousness on such a level that your awareness grows to a point where ego drops. The amount of discerned awareness from our unconscious allows the unification of external with internal. McKenna, although unacquainted to Jung, empathized in this way. McKenna realized “ego is the absolute impediment to Tao,” which he mentioned in one of his last lectures. He realized if you care about what people think, i.e. try to reconstruct a synchronistic event for someone, the synchronicity won’t fall in your favor. Moments of synchronicity are entirely anecdotal, and to attempt to replay a particular experience to replicate the moment of serendipity you felt will not work. The sin here is pride, which lies in the ego. Ego doesn’t let nature manifest its intentionality. It’s like fighting a wave in the ocean: the only results are wasted energy and a less symmetric swell of water. The dimension of authenticity can’t approach you if you have this lesser concern; it augments electromagnetic vibration against resonance with the unconscious archetype. This idea is exactly consistent with the Taoist Way. “The ‘absolute knowledge’ which is characteristic of synchronistic phenomena, a knowledge not mediated by the sense organs, supports the hypotheses of a self-subsistent meaning, or even expresses its existence.” The profundity of the experiences only allude to a cosmic pun. Nature can’t overtly express itself to us — this would compromise free will, but we can observe a great sense of humor.

**Cyclic Time**

I have touched upon the idea of time, and in looking at synchronicity one must come to the conclusion that a form of cyclical time is necessary, as a linear time doesn’t fit the idea, and time in general is the thorn in the equation for many. Though What is time other than a rhythmic interval we use to date events, created for us by the brain’s specific functioning? The brain doesn’t perceive reality as it actually is, it only perceives what is conducive to our fitness. I can’t see anything other than visible light, because excessive stimulus is a hindrance. So it isn’t outlandish to say that time too is constrained perceptually to us. Moreover, we know that the brain calculates linearly, so our idea of time follows suit. As humans we’re looking at a few inches of string claiming that it’s straight, ignorant to the eventual loop it makes. We also see on a molecular level: one cannot tell if a reaction is moving forwards or backwards. Therefore time seems cyclical, and although potentially cyclical, I postulate the degree of awareness one has can change the timeline one is on, analogous to an electron jumping to a higher orbital state as it moves around its circular orbit. One can envision an electromagnetic correlate to consciousness and the photon-electron game it plays.

Retrocausality is implicated in modern physics and coincides perfectly with the ideas of cyclic time and synchronicity. Additionally, the birth of retrocausalistic principles allows new premises which allow us to consider questions involving pre-birth and post-death. A rationalist would claim: “The ability to choose is not free, but depends on our biological inheritance,” as I have heard it stated in debate. But what bases our inheritance? As I claim, it is based from the free choices we make in this lifetime. To take karma as an example, and to look at it empirically (should we accept the ideas of the unconscious mind), the habits we create are offloaded into our unconscious mind and stay there as natural tendencies. An example is picking up trash: as I do it more it becomes ‘natural,’ and I may find myself doing it without my being aware of it. If we take the De (electromagnetic signature) of this unconscious emanation that is our built karma, we can see the potentiality veins for the future fissure as our life flows accordingly in a particular direction. So the direction I move can determine where I can/will move and where I have moved.

**Brain Activity**

Now let’s connect the idea of synchronicity to brain synchronization. In several studies, self-transcendent meditation has been shown to engender a change in the electromagnetic frequency of brainwave state to one of higher synchrony, that is, in-phase coherence of firing, and thus better communication between various brain parts. From this, intuition and speed of insight increase, as well as many other cognitive properties. Stanford did a study that looked at Tibetan Buddhist monks and found that thoughts were more coordinated and organized, and neuronal firing was of higher frequency. They explained “when an individual has a lot of nerve cells that fire well together, the size of the brain waves will be larger than when there are fewer nerve cells or when the nerve cells are not firing well together. The fact that the monks showed such high amplitude gamma wave activity is significant because it indicates that not only do they have a lot of healthy nerve cells, but these same nerve cells are also firing with a high degree of synchronization. Synchronizations of neural firing at high frequencies are thought to play a crucial role in integrating scattered neural processes into a highly ordered cognitive act such as memory and in inducing synaptic changes. In other words, when nerve cells are firing with a high level of synchronicity, brain cells are able to communicate with each other much more readily and the entire brain is able to function more efficiently.” *[http://web.stanford.edu/group/hopes/cgi-bin/hopes_test/meditation-and-hd/](http://web.stanford.edu/group/hopes/cgi-bin/hopes_test/meditation-and-hd/)*  
 We are brought back to the analogy of fighting a wave, though this time it seems it’s the ego which fights its own electromagnetic waves to prevent a more unified flow of electricity through the brain, and performance is impeded as a result. In McFadden’s 2002 study: “Synchronous firing has previously been demonstrated to correlate with awareness and perception, indicating that perturbations to the brain’s EM field also correlate with awareness. The brain’s EM field represents an integrated electromagnetic field representation of distributed neuronal information and has dynamics that closely map to those expected for a correlate of consciousness.” Again we see, as Jung mentioned, becoming aware of consciousness on such a level that ego drops is the point where unification occurs –In brain function, and in external with internal reality as a whole.

Higher levels of arousal correlate with better memory retention. Attributing more energy to a stimulus designates a higher importance. The pragmatic conclusion is that attributing a higher importance to a piece of information makes it more concrete and durable on the strings which pull future behavior. The strongest neural pathways are the ones we use the most. This is known. What is also known is that passion creates a spectacular level of external attention, so as to silence the DMN (default mode network, i.e. a neuroscientific correlate to ego) and attribute all attention to a task. During attention, when allocated to a single activity, we see that firing rate is constant, but in phase coherence of firing leads to a higher frequency (gamma) oscillation, with better cognitive and behavioral activity. When you attend to a stimulus, you increase gamma synchronization and decrease alpha in superficial layers. This is true in every visual processing pathway. So from this we see that attention enhances synchronicity between brain structures, and after a point, drops ego with it. Many define ‘Genius’ by an ability to hold an extraordinary degree of attention for long periods of time to a given task. (Again, what other than love for a topic can do this?) The synchronization of firing from this egoless, spectacularly focused attention must be the key here, and we know in flow states, attention is paramount. It is an active meditation of sorts, where attention is optimal and learning occurs most quickly and strongly. Geniuses alike are humble people. This is because they’ll tell you they didn’t think of their most brilliant ideas or consciously perform their most brilliant actions. The ideas/actions simply came to them, as if injected from a universal bank into their awareness. Vindicating this further, recently in 2016, San Francisco State University performed a study which found that complex ideas can enter consciousness automatically.

Selen Atasoy wrote a paper called “Consciousness with Connectome-specific Harmonic Waves,” where “We found that structured oscillatory patterns naturally self-organize on the human connectome for a wide-range of diffusion parameters in the model. …we observed a decrease in the frequency of coherent oscillations when excitatory activity is decreased, modelled by slower diffusion of excitation, or when inhibitory activity is increased, modelled by faster diffusion of inhibition in the neural field model.” Again, here we see less excitability, which can be looked at as attention in this context, decreases frequency of oscillation, moving us away from gamma consciousness. We can imagine it is the inhibition – our agency of ‘free-wont’ or egoic neglect – which can do this.  
 Hans-Peter Dürr, head of Germany’s Max Planck Institute of Physics, suggested it is the electromagnetic radiation surrounding electrons in a bio molecules that gives a living organism its coherence. Dürr’s suggestion may not be far off the mark, as Yale neuroscientist David A. McCormick collaborated with Haider and Fröhlich to come to a similar conclusion. They found “Whether or not these field potentials may also influence local neuronal network activity is still unknown, although the close apposition of pyramidal cell apical dendrites may provide one avenue for synchronization through local fields” Thus, neocortical neuronal networks may not only be defined by their anatomical interconnectivity and the status of the synaptic activity that binds them together but also by the spatially and temporally complex EFs in which they are embedded.” (Haider & McCormick, 2009), (Fröhlich & McCormick, 2010). These scientists found a feedback between brain activity and the endogenous electric field the brain creates. So unavoidably we crash into the possibility that even the thoughts and brain activity we experience are founded, at least in part, by the frequency of oscillation we are emanating. Therefore, coherent thoughts, including the ones of brilliance, are a potential byproduct of synchronistic electromagnetic movement of our brain’s endogenous electromagnetic field. And as we’ve seen, the ego is absolutely deleterious to an optimal natural rhythm.

Lastly, I’d like to bring attention to a 2014 study by Flavio Frohlich’s team, which found that weak, exogenously applied electric fields only significantly augmented our endogenous electric field when frequency of stimulation was consonant or at a harmonic of the endogenous frequency. In this way it seems that the information we store as truth exists at a particular frequency which is perceptible in others who share it, from an excitation/strengthening of one’s own knowing by the other. Recall back to the introduction, where empathy was looked at as a knowing of truth by an interpersonal mental resonance. Now from the Ego section, where Jonathan Haidt pointed out groups precipitate from differentiating truths. The mutual truths (i.e. intra-group resonance derived from a common subjective tenet) effectively bind these people together. And as we know, for some of the deepest truths, e.g. existential truth, a desire for vindication via resonance in others is critical.

> “For the weaker resonances, it can be argued that the widespread possession of a resonance of whatever strength aids neurons in the integration of their inputs. In effect, the establishment of even a weak resonance makes a neuron a good listener for activity within a specialized frequency band. A host of good listeners, mutually connected, should tune networks to operate in frequency ranges of special biological meaning.”

 Hutcheon, B., & Yarom, Y. (2000). *Resonance, oscillation and the intrinsic frequency preferences of neurons*. Here we see Hutcheon and Yarom posit that the specific frequency of a resonance attunes other brain parts to allow a connection to be made, specific to a biological state. The ego can be seen as the out-of-tune trumpet disorganizing an orchestra’s symphony. Its silencing allows for a deeper listening, and a wider breadth of brain functioning. The ego’s interruption – for its own prerogative – will never listen intently to the tune of possibility, for its mere presence precludes the experience.

Our brain’s default mode network was found to be activated when our core values are considered. As we know, our biases refract awareness, rather than reflect it. We naturally, usually unconsciously, superimpose conception to our experience, augmenting it. Stephen LaBerge uses experience of highest ‘potential’ synonymously with least egoic skew. Even intuitively, we see others are getting at this same idea, and have been for thousands of years, as seen in the early concepts of Wu-Wei and Sunyata, and the more recent concept of Flow.

**Thought as an interconnected process of EM feedback**

Even thought is controlled by a higher principle. As we now understand in the feedback of electromagnetic oscillation on brain activity, we can extrapolate this same idea to any interaction. In dialogue between two people, there exists two biochemical oscillators throwing waves at one another. The endogenous waves are undoubtedly augmented by the oncoming ones, and this is true for both parties. What changes, though, is the information embedded in these volleys, which determines directionality of conversation. This can be viewed as a constellation of thoughts and emotions which manifests itself in consciousness as an attitude which elicits a certain energy field.

I postulate that we can empirically observe synchronization as it occurs in dialogue when a mutual truth is perceived by both parties, and a subsequent resonance-induced spike in an EEG signal results from this acknowledgement of understanding. Understanding creates a form of ecstasy, and this profound joy can vindicate the understanding. Einstein said conceiving the theory of relativity was the happiest thought of his life. Though his resonance of subjective truth rang much deeper into the cosmic sink of information, far beyond a transfer between two people. Any flash of insight works in this way. Yuri Lazebnik studies communication and came to the same realization, though by different means. He studied the state of brain coupling, or “cumulative flow” between two people when they clicked, and could even finish the other’s words as their brain patterning was mimicked. He therefore realized that the individualistic talking vs. listening isn’t as true as it may seem. “Communication is a singular act encompassing two brains.” [http://nptel.ac.in/pdf/demyst_combined_dec2012.pdf](http://nptel.ac.in/pdf/demyst_combined_dec2012.pdf)  
 Mimicked patterning occurs in every encounter. Riveted audiences who are listening to a curator are actually mimicking the brain activity of the speaker via their mirror neurons. We become entranced in a single signal. One may even consider intelligence as the ability to effectively curate a collective consciousness, to sway the most energy to your specific state, e.g. truth. This is the act of eliciting an electromagnetic conscious field so powerful that it trumps the fields that oppose it and subsequently collapses more fields into it. (A phenomenon seen in Nuclear Magnetic Resonance imagining). Remember, if there is a feedback loop of EM on brain activity, those who agree with a speaker, athlete, etc. are mimicking his activity in their own mental state and perhaps subsequently increasing the vigor of the performer’s own act. When an audience is repulsed by a phenomenon, you’ll find performance of the act is lackluster. Similarity facilities cohesion. And passion is one of the strongest conscious forces. Magical things emerge from grouping people together who all share a common passion. (Festivals, political rallies, etc.). So perhaps a cumulative willingness to see a good show will enable a good show to come. As David R Hawkins stated,

> “Great attractors create context. The motives which arise from one’s principles to which one is committed, determines one’s capacity to understand and attribute significance.”

 Having such a visceral passion increases the ability to entrance an audience. This can be considered speaking from the soul, as the Taoists have noted, where others can’t help but taste the righteousness of the actions performed. Doing so, as the greats do, compel a consent of its viewers, as to submit the viewers’ field pattern into a synchronization that mimics this specific style of processing, decision making, and virtuosity of the performer.

**Symmetry**

The laws of the universe are symmetrical – physicists have shown us this. Empathy and reciprocity are also symmetrical. Symmetrical interactions send the moral message “we are all the same,” while asymmetrical interactions may send the message “I am special; better than you.” This is at an interpersonal level, as too is the inherent attractiveness of symmetry in faces. On a chemical level, pharmaceutical companies strive to create molecules minimizing unwanted side effects. It is important to highlight the relationship between molecular geometry and bioactivity. The concept of “chiral toxicology” is explored by chemists, who look at the diverse impact of chirality on multiple aspects of toxicology. To do this, appropriate chiral antidotes must be selected for therapeutic benefit and to minimize adverse events. This isn’t so much about the symmetry of the molecule, as most of biomolecules are chiral, but about the chemicals having the proper chiral configuration to coalesce with its receptor site. “Chirally correct” is the term required for a good drug, i.e. one that mimics the lock and key manner of natural products. In pharmaceuticals, we typically see only one enantiomer of a racemic drug as effective and therapeutic. The second enantiomer does not have the desired therapeutic affect and may actually have an adverse toxic effect. For this reason, optical purity is critical.

Consciousness is the same way. Manly P. Hall stated, “experiences are the chemicals with which the philosopher experiments.” No matter how much you learn, the only way to integrate all of what you are experiencing in your evolution of consciousness is to experience it in your three-dimensional reality.  
 From synchronization of brain activity, we can understand a symmetric and integrative consciousness to parallel the chemical proclivities of nature. We see nature favors a balanced paradigm, with no residual refuse. This is likely because nature favors the least energy expenditure in creation. The earth is round to minimize gravitational pull, bubbles are round to minimize surface tension energy. An enantiomer that doesn’t bind to a receptor is also wasteful, and the bodily consequence is typically harmful. The act of a molecule reaching and fitting its target receptor site can be looked at several levels of abstraction higher in an individual finding his passion. The energy goes into good use by a natural, instinctual predisposition of nature. The spontaneity of action while engaged in a passion-filled activity is similar to the fluidity of our natural biochemical processes. Forcing a behavior or a synthetic molecule into a receptor site never works quite as well and insinuates that holding a high moral standard creates a reciprocation from the universe.

We can surmise that minimizing energy in thought should be favored, which likely has a strong negative correlation with our egocentric self-critic. Any enlightened guru will tell you, when thought stops, you’re close. We need to use our own subjective truth to get closest to a perfect symmetry, to a level of enlightenment where the physical has realized its nature. Such a form of existence can only be transcendental, since, as the knowledge of future or spatially distant events shows, it is contained in a psychically relative space and time, that is to say in an irrepresentable space-time continuum. The axiom of relativity inhibits those with an ego from reaching this transcendental state. The ego neglects truth to protect a preexisting ideal it has grouped itself into. As consciousness progresses from an atom to a human, the only thing that evolves is the capacity to know, and the wisest members of society know their truth, or lack thereof.

Negative emotion (ex: anger, frustration) bring us further from absolute symmetry, as it’s associated with erratic, incoherent patterns, as seen in heart rhythm. Beating patterns change as emotions do, and the endocrine system secretes hormones directly into blood accordingly, which soon enter the central nervous system. Cortisol, for example, is a hormone released during stress, which shortens telomere length and expedites the aging process. Pent up anger, frustration, and jealousy are conducive to cortisol release. The inverse in hearth rhythm is true for positive emotions, and both can be measured via spectral analysis. Sine wave-like pattern are organized, and linked with reduction in mental dialogue, less stress, emotional balance, enhanced clarity, intuition, and cognition.  
 A study recently showed attractiveness and dance ability to be positively correlated. A rationalist would dismiss a confounding variable such as the confidence which comes with attractiveness to entirely create this finding, without understanding why such a rationale is arbitrary. Confidence can be seen as attractive because it means one has a high synchronization of neuron firing. Many ‘go’ signals from different areas leads to lesser inhibition and more fluid neuronal flow. On the deepest level, synchrony is attractive. If we are patterns of information, it’s quantified, and the greatly patterned are genetically attractive. (Born into a quantity). Even phenotype is a pattern of DNA expression, with symmetrical pattern being selected for. Neural firing and phenotypic make up are one in the same: a higher capacity for harmony.

Beauty is aligning external truth with internal truth. An instrumental purpose of beauty is attraction. A beautiful object is beautiful to people who appreciate the beauty. (Genetically agree/resonate, like pheromones do). Though as David Deutsche has pointed out, the beauty isn’t in the content of the information, it’s in the form. (E.g. music *represents* an emotion). It is not the sound of language, but the meaning behind the representation we have for the symbols verbalized, that resonate as truthful. We share feeling states through the similar association of symbols. Inescapably we see something innate within us that longs for cohesion. We want to be understood and we want to understand. As we can see in morality, confidence, facial symmetry, and chemical structure, a cosmic equation whispers ‘good’ in some sense. These qualities even create more harmonious brain waves in those who consent to them. They move the meta-pattern of information we are closer to complete synchronicity. Life doesn’t just give us sound. It gives us the opportunity to turn our sound into a symphony. Unfortunately excessive pride, stubbornness, jealously, blame, hostility, intolerance, denial, resentment, and separation aren’t conducive to a corroboration of truth. And as poet John Keats has said *“Beauty is truth, truth beauty.”  
*

<div style="font-size:0px;height:0px;line-height:0px;margin:0;padding:0;clear:both"></div>
posts.html:
There has been a strong inflation in the number of militant atheists pompously wagging fingers at the religious. ‘Faith is clearly not true, for it’s neither rational nor empirical in nature.’ Faith consists of a Truth that cannot be justified on an objective scale from one’s own subjectivity, and therefore any belief derived from an irreproducible means is undoubtedly false to the atheist. The thing that cannot be tested is not accepted; this is an atheist’s mindset. Additionally, atheists have the rationalized brain type to nimbly forgo the abstraction and metaphor many holy texts employ. I am not a foot-peddler for religion, but the obstinate narcissists of atheism must quiet.

Language is a means for information transfer. It is not the only way, nor is it omnipotent in its ability. Often, abstraction is needed to transfer immense concepts to others, in ways no other communicational technique can. The return of Christ is impossible, for he has died. And this is true, a physical rebirth is impossible – biology knows this. Though if the death was looked at as a degree of consciousness, this seems more public and reproducible of a substrate to maintain truth. If the second coming of Jesus were at a level of consciousness, the statement stands.

Causality isn’t my God. For if He were, He’d have competition. Synchronicity exists by His side, as Jung has conjectured: A field of instantaneous connection based on meaning, which works concurrently with physical spacetime. This is the science of consciousness, i.e. the science of the next 50 years. We don’t understand consciousness; we only understand space, time, and our material reality. Yet the thing which makes it all possible [consciousness] is either faced with apathy, neglectful ignorance, or fear. We know one of the two must be true: There is a physical process causing consciousness happenings, or there is a preexisting consciousness that organizes matter. The atheist will not consider the latter. Perhaps consciousness — its direction and its degree — affects radioactive break up and electron collapse. Perhaps pushing our consciousness into an imaginary space where a future physical reality is envisaged mimics the actual experience in regard to brain activity and increases the probability that such a future will unfold. This can be looked at as a path of least resistance, while keeping intention (strength and direction) of consciousness considered. If we want to trigger an action potential in a neuron, Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) can work analogously to bring the neuron closer to a depolarized state, where it is facilitated in the birth of a firing signal, leading to an entire cascade of new probabilistic realities. As David Deutsche has stated:

“If you are an artist and halfway through creating a work of art you see something in it that you want to bring out, then you are being attracted by a beauty that you have not yet experienced.”

The projection of consciousness to a future reality that meets an attraction within the individual will push his action there. An internal idea he passionately rips into an external state.

We again crash into this duality of internal and external world, but the rationalist only takes what he can see. Unfortunately, if to see is to understand… vision is dismal. One cannot understand the driving force and the internal calculations behind the artist’s piece; one cannot pack up his belongings and move into the artist’s mind. This is to say that one cannot mimic another’s conscious state or peer into another’s subjectivity.
Consciousness has eluded man for as long as we know. This is because once man is elucidated to his own consciousness, he is no longer man; he leaves the search. When a consciousness receives such a degree of resonate truth that it knows with all of its being that an answer is correct: this needs no secondary explanation, nor should it. It is at this point where the consciousness realizes the profound clarity that comes with the dismissal of a veil. A flash of insight can be used as comparison here. The high altitude burst of gamma frequency oscillation emitted when an individual gets access to such a degree of gamma state consciousness is when the highest degree of truth he has had in quite some time is elucidated. (Sheth, B. R., Sandkühler, S., & Bhattacharya, J. (2009).) Posterior beta and anterior gamma oscillations predict cognitive insight. So much so, it may actually be perceptible in an excited physiological state of the insula, right PFC, and anterior cingulate. A subsequent positive emotion generally follows suit too. Though one man may have a flash of insight into the nature of an external issue, another man may of himself. The man of internal insight has found a truth that resonates with a subjective piece of the universe; a phenomenon deafened to the atheist. Tell me how you expect such a resonance to be of any value to – never mind represented in – a different entity, with different strings. Such a resonance wouldn’t be consonant with a machine of a different assemblage. Understanding consists of a need to create an empathetic acceptance, a knowing of truth by an inter/intra-personal mental resonance.
It is natural that ignorance can cause a man to accept a false truth, which may aggregate into a foundation of ‘understanding,’ conflicting with our own. In argument this is the underlying battle, to move his truth in accordance with mine, without moving mine to his. One can also see that ego is the construct, unyielding and persistent. It is this persistence which forces a larger/more intelligent ego to compound his truth onto another’s, disregarding some of them along the way.

As John Lennox has pointed out, an atheist who stumbles upon a car engine can tell you exactly how the car engine works. The point is though, he cannot not give you an explanation of how it got there. This question is just as valid, but the atheist dismisses it. The two outlooks are as follows: It’s beyond empiricism to him and thus unprovable, or moreover, that the way in which the engine works brought it there. The rationalist asks ‘what’s going on,’ while those of faith prefer ‘who’s asking the question?’ In this competition for truth, the logic-minded look externally, while the religious look within. Thus we should not idolize logic, for it is inherently limited, and sometimes the alogical is true. Furthermore, Gödel’s theorem shows us that some truths are unprovable. Yet the limited intelligibility of the rationalist’s mind purports his foundation of logic as absolute, with every tenet axiomatic in nature.

Humans are hardwired to think linearly – it’s how we measure time. So for the rationalist, the caste we’re born into has no ultimate explanation, nor does an existence proceeding death. To look before the start is illogical for a linear mind. He didn’t choose where he grew up, he didn’t choose his parents, yet he’s born and it’s game on – ‘from here forward is what I’ll ‘consider,’ he says. One who looks at time cyclically finds sense in the ideas of heaven and hell, death and rebirth. Still the problem runs deeper. It is the rationalist’s incognizant fear of the unconscious mind that impedes the self-knowledge the spiritual knows and loves. To say you understand the unconscious mind is to flatly lie. We can either muster an implicit comprehension or claim it incomprehensible altogether. Though as Jung has observed, the unconscious is the only available source of spiritual experience. It is the medium from which religious experiences seem to flow. Coincidentally, Flow is also the coined term for the experience by which one meshes his consciousness with the environment, where egocentric individuality dissipates altogether. In this state there is no self-critic, and the unconscious mind drives behavior as we become immersed in our favorite activities. In these states we see performance is optimal, creativity is heightened, and intuition is bountiful.

Ego

To provide another analogy, we can look at the ego as a neuron. We have an adequate understanding of how the neuron fires mechanically but no confident way of knowing how the cascade of other summated signals – that is the unconscious – triggered that neuron with such temporal precision. As Freud explained, there is a ‘fringe of consciousness,’ with only the most salient information entering. It should be understood that it is the summation of subthreshold information – of which we are not aware – that creates the wave into conscious awareness.
For a moment, consider the question: What founds thought? We may consciously try to move thought in our desired direction, but what is that ruminating voice that pops into our inner dialogue throughout the day? Why are the contents sometimes even shunned by the conscious mind? This should not be the case for a consciously driven thought process. Think about a conversation or my writing this sentence. I don’t have a preexisting, consciously planned out script from which I’m typing. The content of my unconscious mind is being translated to conscious information in the form of language driven by the totality of my feeling states in what I’d like to convey. To provide a further example, think about your biggest habit. Perhaps it’s a nervous habit such as biting your nails or playing with your hair. As the frequency of these actions increase, you’ll soon realize that your hands are suddenly brought to your mouth more often. The neural pathways consistent with this activity become strengthened to such a degree that their aggregated signal is strong enough to sear this behavior into habitualization. For an undesirable habit, the behavior will continue until it crosses the individual’s fringe of consciousness, where he becomes conscious of the habit, and dismisses it. You can easily recognize yourself biting your nails, but consider ideas to work in the same way. Certainly the strength of feeling states and intentions are much more difficult to discern within our psyche. The underlying point here is that the ego is the part of our being which realizes the action and may take accountability for the action, but the belief of it driving the action is a foolish one.

We naturally identify with our conscious self, for it is the part of us we ‘see.’ However, we must understand though, that our ego is an illusory persona given to us by our brain. In neuroscience, the ego construct can be viewed as our particularly construed resting state networks (RMNs). Sub-networks within this domain include the Default Mode Network (DMN), which deals with self-reference, emotional reflection, autobiographical self-understanding, among other things. It serves as a comparative interpretation mechanism one uses to qualify one’s position in society by differentiation/dissection. Because, through evolution, a brain wired to optimize fitness was selected for, our interpretations are culturally based, and universally competitive. The pride of a currently held ideology (with which we identify) trumps the willingness to work together to get at a deeper, more unifying truth. This is because truth is relative to a group, and different groups precipitate from differentiating truths. Again, if we see that truths resonate, it is clear why groups harmonize within and clash without. Jonathan Haidt’s work on morality shows this, as we realize that truth is whatever is subjectively convincing at one’s current level of perception. At lower levels of consciousness (awareness), propositions are accepted as true, even when they are illogical. They express tenets neither intellectually provable nor practically demonstrable. Regardless, man will defend his position, however ignorant it may be.

Unfortunately as a resulting happenstance, Ego becomes God to people. Even more tragically, when ego drops, one can see the cosmic comedy of that relationship. The tragedy here is that the egocentric veil rarely drops in modern society. Ironically, the one experience of transcendence – beyond an egocentric self – which sits in absolute certainty, is the experience that also sits in a medium certain to catch everybody’s prejudices. To attempt to make oneself understood is impossible without far-reaching comprehension of another’s standpoint. Perhaps a future energetic discourse that transcends language could do it, but that’s neither here nor there. The atheist, without an empathic resonance of such an experience, discounts it.

“A necessity for the eradication of the incommensurability between observer and observed is needed. A “neural language.”

as W. Pauli mentions. The fear that prevents most from experiencing such transcendence is the fear of lost control. As humans, control is the thing we hold most dear to our heart. Imagining a life as a schizophrenic with no control over his actions is the worst nightmare possible for many. We take solace in the feeling of control the ego brings. Unfortunately egoic control is illusory, though one can choose to hold onto it. Our memories are constructed to fit a story, i.e., the memories our ego maintains to define who it thinks it is. This creates bias. Turning off memory allows highest clarity of sight. We think we are our story, and we identify with it as such. This is why the common paradigm of thought believes that the death of the ego is the death of the individual. The death one’s legacy to die must necessarily kill the man too. Anyone who has experienced an ego death – a profound spiritual experience – knows this is not the case, and the feeling of liberation from ego is ineffably beautiful.

We can look to the psychologically defined ‘insightful vs. analytic’ personal method of thinking to explain this rift between rationalists and spirituals. Insightfuls are less ‘loud’ in the mind, while considering possibilities. Analytics use ‘outsight’ where the loudest, obvious, quicker responses are reported. For a lot of day to day life, simple ‘outsight/analysis’ works. Analytics think linearly from front to back and vice versa. They also hold a tighter ‘cognitive control.’ Insightfuls think more laterally. The rationalist is the out-sighted analyst. He grips onto the self so tightly, as to surrender any other possible option. The spiritual is the insightful. Insight is derived from intuition and is the result of an understanding of the inner nature of things. With less weight on cognitive control and a more lateralized method of thought, these individuals are capable of undergoing a psychological appreciation of the fact that man is the victim of his conscious constitution more than he is the creator. To understand individuality is puppeted by a higher power still gives you a larger part in the play. But for the atheists the higher power is exclusively in ego, and stops at the State.

We can recognize prejudice and illusion only when we’re capable of taking a step back and looking back into the absolutism of our tenets, to objectively compare them with facts, while not producing an egocentric rationale as to why our conclusion is ‘still right.’ I have personally had conversations with friends where I fell victim to the same fallacy. I would notice that in discourse, one of us would realize he may be incorrect in the argument, and a subconscious transition in topic would occur, as to preserve the ego in admitting fault. This takes a great deal of awareness and mostly goes unnoticed. Donald Trump for example, is a master eluder who systematically transitions conversation once he realizes facts stack up against him, and one may say his ego is slightly larger than the layperson.

Unconscious Mind

I’d like to elucidate the unbeknownst benefit of egolessness with the following quote:

“Anyone who has insight into his own actions, and has thus found access to the unconscious, involuntarily exercises an influence on his environment. The deepening and broadening of consciousness produce the kind of effect which the primitives call “mana.” It is a sort of unintentional influence on the unconscious of others, a sort of unconscious prestige, and its effect lasts only so long as it is not disturbed by conscious intention.”

The quote by Jung explicates the prestige gifted upon ego absence. The Taoists call this power Wu-wei, in which De is the electromagnetic signature. In this state of being, there is no thought, as one is immersed in passion/love/oneness. Whilst in this state, the unconscious elicits a harmonious, attractive pattern, which can be perceived by others. This De signature is an ode of Truth. A sign of genuine character (unconsciously spoken), yet vibrated and perceived in the environment, often under the threshold of consciousness in another. Additionally, De comes from the unconscious, as do our virtues, which we consciously download as they’re considered. Taoist texts explain how “the universe works harmoniously according to its own ways. When someone exerts their will against the world in a manner that is out of rhythm with the cycles of change, they may disrupt that harmony, and unintended consequences may more likely result rather than the willed outcome.” We know this as ego, though Taoists don’t explicitly connote ego. Rather, they assert that one must just “place their will in harmony with the natural universe.” That is, to align true meaning with our actions, not to perform an action which promotes solely egoic prosperity. Wu-Wei is the method of achieving this. It is a form of “trying not to try” coined by Edward G. Slingerland. Buddhists call this state of spontaneity/nothingness ‘Sunyata.’ In Buddhist traditions “desire not to desire” is more fitting. The concept is the same, and logicians are left baffled altogether.

As mentioned earlier, Westerners are starting to come to the same psychological conclusion with the phenomenon we call ‘flow,’ coined by Mihály Csíkszentmihályi. In flow states, the seer and the doer merge. The observing consciousness and experiencing consciousness commune, and the driving force behind its creation is passion, for it wields “the capacity to narrow our focus so spectacularly, as to reduce the entirety of the world to the object of our desire.” Terrence McKenna alluded to the same idea in one of his talks, in which he stated:

“What I see is that the carrier of the field [of the cosmic giggle] in most people’s lives, is love. Love is some kind of output which messes with the entropic tendency toward probabilistic behavior in nature.”

We see love is the most potent and harmonic awareness one can have, and it brings people the furthest. Any exceptional athlete will tell you it was his passion that drove him. Underlying it all we see that humans gain a vitality. It is vitality, that life force, which gets you furthest. And it’s derived from love. Whether it’s in the form of intellectual truth, lifelong courtship, or any form of flow in between. It’s what drives us, keeps us alive and in good health. If you lose it, you lose life. This is the idea of the soul. The Chinese call it ‘Qi,’ the Indians ‘Prana,’ the Polynesians ‘Mana,’ the Amerindians ‘Orenda,’ and the ancient Germans ‘Od.’

Synchronicity

Let’s talk about Jung and Pauli’s theory of synchronicity as an acausal connecting principle. Please make note of the distinction between synchrony, which deals with temporal coherence of events, and synchronicity, which deals specifically with external events coinciding with internal states in a way which creates a meaningful connection. Jung stated:

“Synchronicity postulates a meaning which is a priori in relation to human consciousness and apparently exists outside man… I am only too conscious that synchronicity is a highly abstract and ‘irrepresentable’ quantity. It ascribes to the moving body a certain psychoid [consciousness] property which, like space, time, and causality, forms a criterion of its behavior.”

Jung, in conjunction with the physicist Wolfgang Pauli, explored the possibility that his concepts of the unconscious and synchronicity might be related to the unus mundus to which the unconscious is an expression; synchronicity, or “meaningful coincidence,” being made possible by the fact that both the observer and connected phenomenon ultimately stem from the same source, the unus mundus.” Any good physicist will tell you at the deepest level, everything is connected. Jung noticed we have rationality which follows causality and meaning (emotion/feeling) which appears to follow acausality, synchronistically. He noticed that synchronistic experiences (driven by meaning) seem to allow the violating of statistical laws, rather than deterministic laws. To clarify visibly, he created this chart:

Jung also noticed that moments of synchronicity require a selfless awareness. This is what he means by ‘individuation’ in his work: to become aware of consciousness on such a level that your awareness grows to a point where ego drops. The amount of discerned awareness from our unconscious allows the unification of external with internal. McKenna, although unacquainted to Jung, empathized in this way. McKenna realized “ego is the absolute impediment to Tao,” which he mentioned in one of his last lectures. He realized if you care about what people think, i.e. try to reconstruct a synchronistic event for someone, the synchronicity won’t fall in your favor. Moments of synchronicity are entirely anecdotal, and to attempt to replay a particular experience to replicate the moment of serendipity you felt will not work. The sin here is pride, which lies in the ego. Ego doesn’t let nature manifest its intentionality. It’s like fighting a wave in the ocean: the only results are wasted energy and a less symmetric swell of water. The dimension of authenticity can’t approach you if you have this lesser concern; it augments electromagnetic vibration against resonance with the unconscious archetype. This idea is exactly consistent with the Taoist Way. “The ‘absolute knowledge’ which is characteristic of synchronistic phenomena, a knowledge not mediated by the sense organs, supports the hypotheses of a self-subsistent meaning, or even expresses its existence.” The profundity of the experiences only allude to a cosmic pun. Nature can’t overtly express itself to us — this would compromise free will, but we can observe a great sense of humor.

Cyclic Time

I have touched upon the idea of time, and in looking at synchronicity one must come to the conclusion that a form of cyclical time is necessary, as a linear time doesn’t fit the idea, and time in general is the thorn in the equation for many. Though What is time other than a rhythmic interval we use to date events, created for us by the brain’s specific functioning? The brain doesn’t perceive reality as it actually is, it only perceives what is conducive to our fitness. I can’t see anything other than visible light, because excessive stimulus is a hindrance. So it isn’t outlandish to say that time too is constrained perceptually to us. Moreover, we know that the brain calculates linearly, so our idea of time follows suit. As humans we’re looking at a few inches of string claiming that it’s straight, ignorant to the eventual loop it makes. We also see on a molecular level: one cannot tell if a reaction is moving forwards or backwards. Therefore time seems cyclical, and although potentially cyclical, I postulate the degree of awareness one has can change the timeline one is on, analogous to an electron jumping to a higher orbital state as it moves around its circular orbit. One can envision an electromagnetic correlate to consciousness and the photon-electron game it plays.

Retrocausality is implicated in modern physics and coincides perfectly with the ideas of cyclic time and synchronicity. Additionally, the birth of retrocausalistic principles allows new premises which allow us to consider questions involving pre-birth and post-death. A rationalist would claim: “The ability to choose is not free, but depends on our biological inheritance,” as I have heard it stated in debate. But what bases our inheritance? As I claim, it is based from the free choices we make in this lifetime. To take karma as an example, and to look at it empirically (should we accept the ideas of the unconscious mind), the habits we create are offloaded into our unconscious mind and stay there as natural tendencies. An example is picking up trash: as I do it more it becomes ‘natural,’ and I may find myself doing it without my being aware of it. If we take the De (electromagnetic signature) of this unconscious emanation that is our built karma, we can see the potentiality veins for the future fissure as our life flows accordingly in a particular direction. So the direction I move can determine where I can/will move and where I have moved.

Brain Activity

Now let’s connect the idea of synchronicity to brain synchronization. In several studies, self-transcendent meditation has been shown to engender a change in the electromagnetic frequency of brainwave state to one of higher synchrony, that is, in-phase coherence of firing, and thus better communication between various brain parts. From this, intuition and speed of insight increase, as well as many other cognitive properties. Stanford did a study that looked at Tibetan Buddhist monks and found that thoughts were more coordinated and organized, and neuronal firing was of higher frequency. They explained “when an individual has a lot of nerve cells that fire well together, the size of the brain waves will be larger than when there are fewer nerve cells or when the nerve cells are not firing well together. The fact that the monks showed such high amplitude gamma wave activity is significant because it indicates that not only do they have a lot of healthy nerve cells, but these same nerve cells are also firing with a high degree of synchronization. Synchronizations of neural firing at high frequencies are thought to play a crucial role in integrating scattered neural processes into a highly ordered cognitive act such as memory and in inducing synaptic changes. In other words, when nerve cells are firing with a high level of synchronicity, brain cells are able to communicate with each other much more readily and the entire brain is able to function more efficiently.” http://web.stanford.edu/group/hopes/cgi-bin/hopes_test/meditation-and-hd/
We are brought back to the analogy of fighting a wave, though this time it seems it’s the ego which fights its own electromagnetic waves to prevent a more unified flow of electricity through the brain, and performance is impeded as a result. In McFadden’s 2002 study: “Synchronous firing has previously been demonstrated to correlate with awareness and perception, indicating that perturbations to the brain’s EM field also correlate with awareness. The brain’s EM field represents an integrated electromagnetic field representation of distributed neuronal information and has dynamics that closely map to those expected for a correlate of consciousness.” Again we see, as Jung mentioned, becoming aware of consciousness on such a level that ego drops is the point where unification occurs –In brain function, and in external with internal reality as a whole.

Higher levels of arousal correlate with better memory retention. Attributing more energy to a stimulus designates a higher importance. The pragmatic conclusion is that attributing a higher importance to a piece of information makes it more concrete and durable on the strings which pull future behavior. The strongest neural pathways are the ones we use the most. This is known. What is also known is that passion creates a spectacular level of external attention, so as to silence the DMN (default mode network, i.e. a neuroscientific correlate to ego) and attribute all attention to a task. During attention, when allocated to a single activity, we see that firing rate is constant, but in phase coherence of firing leads to a higher frequency (gamma) oscillation, with better cognitive and behavioral activity. When you attend to a stimulus, you increase gamma synchronization and decrease alpha in superficial layers. This is true in every visual processing pathway. So from this we see that attention enhances synchronicity between brain structures, and after a point, drops ego with it. Many define ‘Genius’ by an ability to hold an extraordinary degree of attention for long periods of time to a given task. (Again, what other than love for a topic can do this?) The synchronization of firing from this egoless, spectacularly focused attention must be the key here, and we know in flow states, attention is paramount. It is an active meditation of sorts, where attention is optimal and learning occurs most quickly and strongly. Geniuses alike are humble people. This is because they’ll tell you they didn’t think of their most brilliant ideas or consciously perform their most brilliant actions. The ideas/actions simply came to them, as if injected from a universal bank into their awareness. Vindicating this further, recently in 2016, San Francisco State University performed a study which found that complex ideas can enter consciousness automatically.

Selen Atasoy wrote a paper called “Consciousness with Connectome-specific Harmonic Waves,” where “We found that structured oscillatory patterns naturally self-organize on the human connectome for a wide-range of diffusion parameters in the model. …we observed a decrease in the frequency of coherent oscillations when excitatory activity is decreased, modelled by slower diffusion of excitation, or when inhibitory activity is increased, modelled by faster diffusion of inhibition in the neural field model.” Again, here we see less excitability, which can be looked at as attention in this context, decreases frequency of oscillation, moving us away from gamma consciousness. We can imagine it is the inhibition – our agency of ‘free-wont’ or egoic neglect – which can do this.
Hans-Peter Dürr, head of Germany’s Max Planck Institute of Physics, suggested it is the electromagnetic radiation surrounding electrons in a bio molecules that gives a living organism its coherence. Dürr’s suggestion may not be far off the mark, as Yale neuroscientist David A. McCormick collaborated with Haider and Fröhlich to come to a similar conclusion. They found “Whether or not these field potentials may also influence local neuronal network activity is still unknown, although the close apposition of pyramidal cell apical dendrites may provide one avenue for synchronization through local fields” Thus, neocortical neuronal networks may not only be defined by their anatomical interconnectivity and the status of the synaptic activity that binds them together but also by the spatially and temporally complex EFs in which they are embedded.” (Haider & McCormick, 2009), (Fröhlich & McCormick, 2010). These scientists found a feedback between brain activity and the endogenous electric field the brain creates. So unavoidably we crash into the possibility that even the thoughts and brain activity we experience are founded, at least in part, by the frequency of oscillation we are emanating. Therefore, coherent thoughts, including the ones of brilliance, are a potential byproduct of synchronistic electromagnetic movement of our brain’s endogenous electromagnetic field. And as we’ve seen, the ego is absolutely deleterious to an optimal natural rhythm.

Lastly, I’d like to bring attention to a 2014 study by Flavio Frohlich’s team, which found that weak, exogenously applied electric fields only significantly augmented our endogenous electric field when frequency of stimulation was consonant or at a harmonic of the endogenous frequency. In this way it seems that the information we store as truth exists at a particular frequency which is perceptible in others who share it, from an excitation/strengthening of one’s own knowing by the other. Recall back to the introduction, where empathy was looked at as a knowing of truth by an interpersonal mental resonance. Now from the Ego section, where Jonathan Haidt pointed out groups precipitate from differentiating truths. The mutual truths (i.e. intra-group resonance derived from a common subjective tenet) effectively bind these people together. And as we know, for some of the deepest truths, e.g. existential truth, a desire for vindication via resonance in others is critical.

“For the weaker resonances, it can be argued that the widespread possession of a resonance of whatever strength aids neurons in the integration of their inputs. In effect, the establishment of even a weak resonance makes a neuron a good listener for activity within a specialized frequency band. A host of good listeners, mutually connected, should tune networks to operate in frequency ranges of special biological meaning.”

Hutcheon, B., & Yarom, Y. (2000). Resonance, oscillation and the intrinsic frequency preferences of neurons. Here we see Hutcheon and Yarom posit that the specific frequency of a resonance attunes other brain parts to allow a connection to be made, specific to a biological state. The ego can be seen as the out-of-tune trumpet disorganizing an orchestra’s symphony. Its silencing allows for a deeper listening, and a wider breadth of brain functioning. The ego’s interruption – for its own prerogative – will never listen intently to the tune of possibility, for its mere presence precludes the experience.

Our brain’s default mode network was found to be activated when our core values are considered. As we know, our biases refract awareness, rather than reflect it. We naturally, usually unconsciously, superimpose conception to our experience, augmenting it. Stephen LaBerge uses experience of highest ‘potential’ synonymously with least egoic skew. Even intuitively, we see others are getting at this same idea, and have been for thousands of years, as seen in the early concepts of Wu-Wei and Sunyata, and the more recent concept of Flow.

Thought as an interconnected process of EM feedback

Even thought is controlled by a higher principle. As we now understand in the feedback of electromagnetic oscillation on brain activity, we can extrapolate this same idea to any interaction. In dialogue between two people, there exists two biochemical oscillators throwing waves at one another. The endogenous waves are undoubtedly augmented by the oncoming ones, and this is true for both parties. What changes, though, is the information embedded in these volleys, which determines directionality of conversation. This can be viewed as a constellation of thoughts and emotions which manifests itself in consciousness as an attitude which elicits a certain energy field.

I postulate that we can empirically observe synchronization as it occurs in dialogue when a mutual truth is perceived by both parties, and a subsequent resonance-induced spike in an EEG signal results from this acknowledgement of understanding. Understanding creates a form of ecstasy, and this profound joy can vindicate the understanding. Einstein said conceiving the theory of relativity was the happiest thought of his life. Though his resonance of subjective truth rang much deeper into the cosmic sink of information, far beyond a transfer between two people. Any flash of insight works in this way. Yuri Lazebnik studies communication and came to the same realization, though by different means. He studied the state of brain coupling, or “cumulative flow” between two people when they clicked, and could even finish the other’s words as their brain patterning was mimicked. He therefore realized that the individualistic talking vs. listening isn’t as true as it may seem. “Communication is a singular act encompassing two brains.” http://nptel.ac.in/pdf/demyst_combined_dec2012.pdf
Mimicked patterning occurs in every encounter. Riveted audiences who are listening to a curator are actually mimicking the brain activity of the speaker via their mirror neurons. We become entranced in a single signal. One may even consider intelligence as the ability to effectively curate a collective consciousness, to sway the most energy to your specific state, e.g. truth. This is the act of eliciting an electromagnetic conscious field so powerful that it trumps the fields that oppose it and subsequently collapses more fields into it. (A phenomenon seen in Nuclear Magnetic Resonance imagining). Remember, if there is a feedback loop of EM on brain activity, those who agree with a speaker, athlete, etc. are mimicking his activity in their own mental state and perhaps subsequently increasing the vigor of the performer’s own act. When an audience is repulsed by a phenomenon, you’ll find performance of the act is lackluster. Similarity facilities cohesion. And passion is one of the strongest conscious forces. Magical things emerge from grouping people together who all share a common passion. (Festivals, political rallies, etc.). So perhaps a cumulative willingness to see a good show will enable a good show to come. As David R Hawkins stated,

“Great attractors create context. The motives which arise from one’s principles to which one is committed, determines one’s capacity to understand and attribute significance.”

Having such a visceral passion increases the ability to entrance an audience. This can be considered speaking from the soul, as the Taoists have noted, where others can’t help but taste the righteousness of the actions performed. Doing so, as the greats do, compel a consent of its viewers, as to submit the viewers’ field pattern into a synchronization that mimics this specific style of processing, decision making, and virtuosity of the performer.

Symmetry

The laws of the universe are symmetrical – physicists have shown us this. Empathy and reciprocity are also symmetrical. Symmetrical interactions send the moral message “we are all the same,” while asymmetrical interactions may send the message “I am special; better than you.” This is at an interpersonal level, as too is the inherent attractiveness of symmetry in faces. On a chemical level, pharmaceutical companies strive to create molecules minimizing unwanted side effects. It is important to highlight the relationship between molecular geometry and bioactivity. The concept of “chiral toxicology” is explored by chemists, who look at the diverse impact of chirality on multiple aspects of toxicology. To do this, appropriate chiral antidotes must be selected for therapeutic benefit and to minimize adverse events. This isn’t so much about the symmetry of the molecule, as most of biomolecules are chiral, but about the chemicals having the proper chiral configuration to coalesce with its receptor site. “Chirally correct” is the term required for a good drug, i.e. one that mimics the lock and key manner of natural products. In pharmaceuticals, we typically see only one enantiomer of a racemic drug as effective and therapeutic. The second enantiomer does not have the desired therapeutic affect and may actually have an adverse toxic effect. For this reason, optical purity is critical.

Consciousness is the same way. Manly P. Hall stated, “experiences are the chemicals with which the philosopher experiments.” No matter how much you learn, the only way to integrate all of what you are experiencing in your evolution of consciousness is to experience it in your three-dimensional reality.
From synchronization of brain activity, we can understand a symmetric and integrative consciousness to parallel the chemical proclivities of nature. We see nature favors a balanced paradigm, with no residual refuse. This is likely because nature favors the least energy expenditure in creation. The earth is round to minimize gravitational pull, bubbles are round to minimize surface tension energy. An enantiomer that doesn’t bind to a receptor is also wasteful, and the bodily consequence is typically harmful. The act of a molecule reaching and fitting its target receptor site can be looked at several levels of abstraction higher in an individual finding his passion. The energy goes into good use by a natural, instinctual predisposition of nature. The spontaneity of action while engaged in a passion-filled activity is similar to the fluidity of our natural biochemical processes. Forcing a behavior or a synthetic molecule into a receptor site never works quite as well and insinuates that holding a high moral standard creates a reciprocation from the universe.

We can surmise that minimizing energy in thought should be favored, which likely has a strong negative correlation with our egocentric self-critic. Any enlightened guru will tell you, when thought stops, you’re close. We need to use our own subjective truth to get closest to a perfect symmetry, to a level of enlightenment where the physical has realized its nature. Such a form of existence can only be transcendental, since, as the knowledge of future or spatially distant events shows, it is contained in a psychically relative space and time, that is to say in an irrepresentable space-time continuum. The axiom of relativity inhibits those with an ego from reaching this transcendental state. The ego neglects truth to protect a preexisting ideal it has grouped itself into. As consciousness progresses from an atom to a human, the only thing that evolves is the capacity to know, and the wisest members of society know their truth, or lack thereof.

Negative emotion (ex: anger, frustration) bring us further from absolute symmetry, as it’s associated with erratic, incoherent patterns, as seen in heart rhythm. Beating patterns change as emotions do, and the endocrine system secretes hormones directly into blood accordingly, which soon enter the central nervous system. Cortisol, for example, is a hormone released during stress, which shortens telomere length and expedites the aging process. Pent up anger, frustration, and jealousy are conducive to cortisol release. The inverse in hearth rhythm is true for positive emotions, and both can be measured via spectral analysis. Sine wave-like pattern are organized, and linked with reduction in mental dialogue, less stress, emotional balance, enhanced clarity, intuition, and cognition.
A study recently showed attractiveness and dance ability to be positively correlated. A rationalist would dismiss a confounding variable such as the confidence which comes with attractiveness to entirely create this finding, without understanding why such a rationale is arbitrary. Confidence can be seen as attractive because it means one has a high synchronization of neuron firing. Many ‘go’ signals from different areas leads to lesser inhibition and more fluid neuronal flow. On the deepest level, synchrony is attractive. If we are patterns of information, it’s quantified, and the greatly patterned are genetically attractive. (Born into a quantity). Even phenotype is a pattern of DNA expression, with symmetrical pattern being selected for. Neural firing and phenotypic make up are one in the same: a higher capacity for harmony.

Beauty is aligning external truth with internal truth. An instrumental purpose of beauty is attraction. A beautiful object is beautiful to people who appreciate the beauty. (Genetically agree/resonate, like pheromones do). Though as David Deutsche has pointed out, the beauty isn’t in the content of the information, it’s in the form. (E.g. music represents an emotion). It is not the sound of language, but the meaning behind the representation we have for the symbols verbalized, that resonate as truthful. We share feeling states through the similar association of symbols. Inescapably we see something innate within us that longs for cohesion. We want to be understood and we want to understand. As we can see in morality, confidence, facial symmetry, and chemical structure, a cosmic equation whispers ‘good’ in some sense. These qualities even create more harmonious brain waves in those who consent to them. They move the meta-pattern of information we are closer to complete synchronicity. Life doesn’t just give us sound. It gives us the opportunity to turn our sound into a symphony. Unfortunately excessive pride, stubbornness, jealously, blame, hostility, intolerance, denial, resentment, and separation aren’t conducive to a corroboration of truth. And as poet John Keats has said “Beauty is truth, truth beauty.”

posts.title: Now Hiring: Baby Goat Cuddler
posts.markdown: Everyone dreams about ditching the routine 9 to 5 lifestyle in search of adventure, excitement and something new. Maybe you want to become a nature photographer, climbing mountains and then skiing down them. Maybe you want to start your own art gallery. Maybe you want to get involved in skydiving. Or maybe you just want to cuddle some goats and get paid for it. Yes? Does that sound like you? Okay, many of us have probably never thought of building a career around cuddling baby goats (or maybe that *is* your dream, I can’t speak for everyone), but it’s a real thing and the opportunity to do so is now! Based in Esmont, Virginia,**[Caromont Farm](http://www.caromontcheese.com/)**is looking to bring on a “assistant goat herdsman (or herdswoman) in training,” and it requires zero experience with goats. The only requisites the position has (aside from a love of goats!) is that you’re able to lift at least 50 pounds, along with a few other minor details. (Read here!) However, being able to speak Spanish is preferred. Maybe because they want their goats to speak two languages? (I’m not sure). The job is listed as an internship that provides on-farm housing, a weekly paycheck, and access to a full kitchen with locally-sourced foods. Also, you get to handle about 120 baby goats. Sound good? Sweet. Check out the **[Caromont Farms](http://www.caromontcheese.com/)**website for more information!
posts.html:
Everyone dreams about ditching the routine 9 to 5 lifestyle in search of adventure, excitement and something new.

Maybe you want to become a nature photographer, climbing mountains and then skiing down them. Maybe you want to start your own art gallery. Maybe you want to get involved in skydiving.

Or maybe you just want to cuddle some goats and get paid for it. Yes? Does that sound like you?

Okay, many of us have probably never thought of building a career around cuddling baby goats (or maybe that is your dream, I can’t speak for everyone), but it’s a real thing and the opportunity to do so is now!

Based in Esmont, Virginia, Caromont Farm is looking to bring on a “assistant goat herdsman (or herdswoman) in training,” and it requires zero experience with goats. The only requisites the position has (aside from a love of goats!) is that you’re able to lift at least 50 pounds, along with a few other minor details. (Read here!)

However, being able to speak Spanish is preferred. Maybe because they want their goats to speak two languages? (I’m not sure).

The job is listed as an internship that provides on-farm housing, a weekly paycheck, and access to a full kitchen with locally-sourced foods. Also, you get to handle about 120 baby goats. Sound good? Sweet.

Check out the Caromont Farms website for more information!

posts.title: Former Bricklayer Creates Stunning Art With Stone
posts.markdown: ![](https://assets.rbl.ms/3431436/980x.jpg) It’s always fun to read about the brave people who are willing to change their entire life to pursue a hobby or passion that they love. Many of us have jobs that require a specific set of skills that don’t often translate into anything creative. Especially those of us in the blue collar field of work, where much of the day is filled with manual labor. But Johnny Clasper, a former bricklayer from Yorkshire, England, is showing the world that tradespeople can be just as artful as anyone else. Using his natural abilities as a bricklayer, Johnny now builds stunning pieces of art using stones and rocks. ![](https://assets.rbl.ms/3431580/980x.jpg) Growing up, Johnny always enjoyed using his hands to create. He studied pottery, woodworking and metalwork, but didn’t really find his passion until after graduating from college where he learned brickworking. ![](https://assets.rbl.ms/3431493/980x.jpg) “At last something I really wanted to learn and really enjoyed doing,” Johnny said. “College taught me all about the modern ways of building while my time at work I learned many traditional techniques of laying stone, at the time I was always drawn to stone.. so many ways to lay it as opposed to bricks.” ![](https://assets.rbl.ms/3431523/980x.jpg) Clasper decided to make the switch from bricklayer to artist in 2010, when he rented a small studio space to use for a creative project he had in mind. Using leftover roof slate, Clasper set out to create a seed sculpture, a design he had had in mind for a while. ![](https://assets.rbl.ms/3431537/980x.jpg) But Clasper wasn’t entirely satisfied with his first project, so he kept building.
