posts.html:
It’s always fun to read about the brave people who are willing to change their entire life to pursue a hobby or passion that they love. Many of us have jobs that require a specific set of skills that don’t often translate into anything creative. Especially those of us in the blue collar field of work, where much of the day is filled with manual labor.

But Johnny Clasper, a former bricklayer from Yorkshire, England, is showing the world that tradespeople can be just as artful as anyone else. Using his natural abilities as a bricklayer, Johnny now builds stunning pieces of art using stones and rocks.

Growing up, Johnny always enjoyed using his hands to create. He studied pottery, woodworking and metalwork, but didn’t really find his passion until after graduating from college where he learned brickworking.

“At last something I really wanted to learn and really enjoyed doing,” Johnny said.

“College taught me all about the modern ways of building while my time at work I learned many traditional techniques of laying stone, at the time I was always drawn to stone.. so many ways to lay it as opposed to bricks.”

Clasper decided to make the switch from bricklayer to artist in 2010, when he rented a small studio space to use for a creative project he had in mind. Using leftover roof slate, Clasper set out to create a seed sculpture, a design he had had in mind for a while.

But Clasper wasn’t entirely satisfied with his first project, so he kept building. And building. Until finally, Clasper had developed an entirely unique craft that revolved around using stone creatively, as well as a successful business at the same time.

All photo credit goes to www.johnnyclasper.co.uk

You can check out more of Clasper’s work on his website, JohnnyClasper.co.uk!

posts.title: hcer-4 Reasons That Long Distance BFFs Make the Best BFFs
posts.markdown: Having a Long Distance BFF is Actually the Best For These 4 Reasons 4 Things That Make Your Long Distance BFF Your Best Friend If you have a BFF, you’re pretty lucky. Not everyone is blessed with loving friends, let alone one good, amazing friend who always has your back no matter what. I recently stumbled across a BFF of my own and I have to say, it’s a pretty great feeling. Maybe you have a BFF, but he or she lives across the world from you, making your relationship more long distance than anything. But that’s not necessarily a bad thing! Some of the closest and most passionate relationships happen at a distance, so if you have a long distance BFF, here are four reasons that they’re so great: **You don’t have any other choice but to communicate with one another** Because your long distance BFF might not run into you at the store, make a surprise visit to your place of work for some lunch, or get to meet up with you for happy hour on Friday, you have to actually work to communicate with them. This means you set aside time specifically for them to discuss the important happenings of life. Whether it’s a big promotion at work or a crazy story from the weekend, your communication is valued and genuine. **They help you see from other perspectives** It’s incredibly easy to get so caught up in your own life that you forget there’s an entire world that exists outside of your own. Your long distance BFF, who is outside of it all, knows exactly how to bring you back to a grounded state: they’ll tell you how it is, no sugarcoating. As someone who only has your best interests in mind, the long distance BFF will always give you real advice when you need it. You don’t need to worry about them having ulterior motives or wanting to stir up drama, because they’re a thousand miles away. **The time you do get to spend together is priceless** ‘Reunited and it feels so good’ has never been more accurate than when two long distance BFFs come together after a long time apart. This is definitely one case where absence makes the heart grow fonder. Even if the two of you talk on the phone regularly, you never run out of things to say and share when you finally meet up in person. **Your relationship takes work from both of you, work you can be proud of** Every person who’s ever had a BFF knows that it’s not always sunshine and rainbows. Having good friends isn’t always easy, but it’s almost always worth it. Having that BFF be long distance only adds to the work. You have to want it in order for it work. If you’re content sending a text every now and then when you remember something funny or simply don’t have time to communicate, you’re not showing the other person that you want them in your life. Good friends are hard to come by, so if you and your friend put in the time and effort to make it work, that’s something you can both be proud of. So, take the time to let your long distance BFF know just how important they are to you! > [Why long distance BFFS are actually the best](http://hellogiggles.com/long-distance-bff-the-best/)
posts.html:
Having a Long Distance BFF is Actually the Best For These 4 Reasons

4 Things That Make Your Long Distance BFF Your Best Friend

If you have a BFF, you’re pretty lucky. Not everyone is blessed with loving friends, let alone one good, amazing friend who always has your back no matter what. I recently stumbled across a BFF of my own and I have to say, it’s a pretty great feeling.

Maybe you have a BFF, but he or she lives across the world from you, making your relationship more long distance than anything. But that’s not necessarily a bad thing!

Some of the closest and most passionate relationships happen at a distance, so if you have a long distance BFF, here are four reasons that they’re so great:

You don’t have any other choice but to communicate with one another

Because your long distance BFF might not run into you at the store, make a surprise visit to your place of work for some lunch, or get to meet up with you for happy hour on Friday, you have to actually work to communicate with them.

This means you set aside time specifically for them to discuss the important happenings of life. Whether it’s a big promotion at work or a crazy story from the weekend, your communication is valued and genuine.

They help you see from other perspectives

It’s incredibly easy to get so caught up in your own life that you forget there’s an entire world that exists outside of your own. Your long distance BFF, who is outside of it all, knows exactly how to bring you back to a grounded state: they’ll tell you how it is, no sugarcoating.

As someone who only has your best interests in mind, the long distance BFF will always give you real advice when you need it. You don’t need to worry about them having ulterior motives or wanting to stir up drama, because they’re a thousand miles away.

The time you do get to spend together is priceless

‘Reunited and it feels so good’ has never been more accurate than when two long distance BFFs come together after a long time apart. This is definitely one case where absence makes the heart grow fonder.

Even if the two of you talk on the phone regularly, you never run out of things to say and share when you finally meet up in person.

Your relationship takes work from both of you, work you can be proud of

Every person who’s ever had a BFF knows that it’s not always sunshine and rainbows. Having good friends isn’t always easy, but it’s almost always worth it. Having that BFF be long distance only adds to the work. You have to want it in order for it work.

If you’re content sending a text every now and then when you remember something funny or simply don’t have time to communicate, you’re not showing the other person that you want them in your life.

Good friends are hard to come by, so if you and your friend put in the time and effort to make it work, that’s something you can both be proud of. So, take the time to let your long distance BFF know just how important they are to you!

Why long distance BFFS are actually the best

posts.title: 8 Science-Backed Reasons to NEVER Smoke Weed Again
posts.markdown: Just as alcohol prohibition changed the landscape of its time, the prohibition of marijuana is acting in much the same way. The Drug Enforcement Administration of the United States still classifies marijuana as a Schedule I drug, all of which are described as such: “Schedule I drugs, substances, or chemicals are defined as drugs with no currently accepted medical use and a high potential for abuse. Schedule I drugs are the most dangerous drugs of all the drug schedules with potentially severe psychological or physical dependence.” So, with the legalization of such a dangerous substance happening in various states around the country, you should at least be somewhat educated on what exactly makes marijuana such a harmful drug. Don’t be fooled by people claiming it to be harmless, the research is all right there! **It’s the deadliest drug available** ![8 Scientific Reasons You Should Never Smoke Weed](http://images.mic.com/cbgusump07gg3uhmf5ecjpnt1bwl2thgevbwwh3ble5trhmvhnnwnswl0bcfvdsj.jpg) Source: **[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention](http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/fastats/default.htm)** **It’s also the most dangerous drug of them all** ![8 Scientific Reasons You Should Never Smoke Weed](http://images.mic.com/rtxyshwdgpkxfvsevf28zygsbzsc88l9fuvoireoqgmqxwrubtxe6bggd3fgxmik.jpg) Source:**[Independent Scientific Committee on Drugs](http://www.sg.unimaas.nl/_OLD/oudelezingen/dddsd.pdf)** ***Zero***** medicinal benefits** ![8 Scientific Reasons You Should Never Smoke Weed](http://images.mic.com/b8sgi4mmeadszootbtrftnlnchhorye3jym6853vjhnsqgxqsjem13frnr4fp0tb.jpg) Source: **[Various studies](http://www.cnn.com/2015/04/15/health/marijuana-medical-advances/)** **It makes you more dumber** ![8 Scientific Reasons You Should Never Smoke Weed](http://images.mic.com/5hjpr8bhvsib2xh5lvask8qcvg6gz69jaqtaglfu1lob6zkq4gbft2o7l2tlcdd9.jpg) Source: **[National Institute on Drug Abuse](http://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/drugfacts/marijuana)** **It completely fries your brain** ![8 Scientific Reasons You Should Never Smoke Weed](http://images.mic.com/7n0swimmrwjifoe234ocbhphkbssf7m1f64czzaiqa4adfblyehdxisfqhjhpcmu.jpg) Source: **[The Journal of Neuroscience](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/35/4/1505.abstract)** **If you smoke weed, you can’t be athletic** ![8 Scientific Reasons You Should Never Smoke Weed](http://images.mic.com/vtqsojhlcdsgirymkpwvmrmiibbsjkb1hxyqarc2hcvkho1idx394glerqv07hqn.jpg) Source: **[Emory University School of Medicine](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25521349)** **Weed makes you do things you’ll come to regret** ![8 Scientific Reasons You Should Never Smoke Weed](http://images.mic.com/tccavyjjyrb0plgq8bsnxdlti2txif8jwrhys8wrknn6pfty3wgrwebq4kc6yetw.jpg) Source:**[NYU Medical Center](http://informahealthcare.com/doi/full/10.3109/00952990.2014.943371)** **Smoking weed turns you into a dangerous person** ![8 Scientific Reasons You Should Never Smoke Weed](http://images.mic.com/pkq7k2ujp3ial1z3zxn5p84iowqikfdvgdgrmeqrwbswf1xf8mfnlhq41f1ioi1x.jpg) Source: **[Reddit](http://www.reddit.com/r/AskReddit/comments/2gu6z6/what_is_the_1_thing_to_do_while_high/)** I mean, after looking at all of these studies and statistics surrounding weed, it’s pretty easy to see that not smoking it is in your best interest, right? At least you have the information available so you can make up your mind for yourself. Okay, so maybe weed isn’t the harmful, psychotic drug that government and pharmaceutical propaganda makes it out to be. But if you do decide that you want to try it, know that smoking any substance (whatever it may be) is detrimental to your health. If you’re like many people I know, and medicate regularly, using a water pipe, vaporizer, or eating edibles are the best ways to consume cannabis. It should also be added that any person who has not fully matured into adulthood is at a greater risk for any unwanted negative side effects of marijuana consumption. One study found that marijuana use in teenage boys, starting at age 15, resulted in thinning of the outer gray matter of the brain and increased risk of schizophrenia by age 19. While marijuana isn’t going to kill you, it can be addicting just like any other substance. Remember, everything in moderation. Don’t let any substance control your life.
posts.html:
Just as alcohol prohibition changed the landscape of its time, the prohibition of marijuana is acting in much the same way. The Drug Enforcement Administration of the United States still classifies marijuana as a Schedule I drug, all of which are described as such:

“Schedule I drugs, substances, or chemicals are defined as drugs with no currently accepted medical use and a high potential for abuse. Schedule I drugs are the most dangerous drugs of all the drug schedules with potentially severe psychological or physical dependence.”

So, with the legalization of such a dangerous substance happening in various states around the country, you should at least be somewhat educated on what exactly makes marijuana such a harmful drug.

Don’t be fooled by people claiming it to be harmless, the research is all right there!

It’s the deadliest drug available

Source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

It’s also the most dangerous drug of them all

Source: Independent Scientific Committee on Drugs

Zero medicinal benefits

Source: Various studies

It makes you more dumber

Source: National Institute on Drug Abuse

It completely fries your brain

Source: The Journal of Neuroscience

If you smoke weed, you can’t be athletic

Source: Emory University School of Medicine

Weed makes you do things you’ll come to regret

Source: NYU Medical Center

Smoking weed turns you into a dangerous person

Source: Reddit

I mean, after looking at all of these studies and statistics surrounding weed, it’s pretty easy to see that not smoking it is in your best interest, right? At least you have the information available so you can make up your mind for yourself.

Okay, so maybe weed isn’t the harmful, psychotic drug that government and pharmaceutical propaganda makes it out to be. But if you do decide that you want to try it, know that smoking any substance (whatever it may be) is detrimental to your health. If you’re like many people I know, and medicate regularly, using a water pipe, vaporizer, or eating edibles are the best ways to consume cannabis.

It should also be added that any person who has not fully matured into adulthood is at a greater risk for any unwanted negative side effects of marijuana consumption. One study found that marijuana use in teenage boys, starting at age 15, resulted in thinning of the outer gray matter of the brain and increased risk of schizophrenia by age 19.

While marijuana isn’t going to kill you, it can be addicting just like any other substance. Remember, everything in moderation. Don’t let any substance control your life.

posts.title: These Kids Are Hiding From Their Dog Under the Pool, the Dog is Having None of It
posts.markdown: After the Kids Hide Under the Pool, the Dog Does Something Hilarious This Dog Does Something Hilarious After the Kids Hide From Him Under the Pool One of the best parts of life is knowing that some of our most treasured memories are born from moments we never in a million years thought would happen. Sometimes they’re absolutely hilarious, making us laugh until we cry. Other times, they’re touching, sentimental and sweet. Either way, if you’re lucky enough to capture the moment on film, you can preserve it forever. Which is exactly what happened with this fortunate family after their dog began playing with the kids in the backyard. The kids knew that the dog would chase after them if they hid from him well enough. What better of a hiding spot than beneath the inflatable kiddie pool? The kids jumped underneath, hiding from their furry friend. But he’s no fool, he found his way underneath the pool to the kids. Once underneath, he quickly took off running in an attempt to get out from underneath, but didn’t realize he was carrying the pool with him! Unable to see anything, this precious dog bolted headfirst into a tree before scurrying around the rest of the yard trying to escape. This is just one of those times when we’re glad mom kept her cool with the camera long enough to capture a moment of pure hilarity and joy. I’m sure they’ll be reminiscing about this for years to come! http://www.wimp.com/black-lab-runs-pool-head/?utm_source=facebook.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=video/

After the Kids Hide Under the Pool, the Dog Does Something Hilarious

This Dog Does Something Hilarious After the Kids Hide From Him Under the Pool

One of the best parts of life is knowing that some of our most treasured memories are born from moments we never in a million years thought would happen. Sometimes they’re absolutely hilarious, making us laugh until we cry. Other times, they’re touching, sentimental and sweet.

Either way, if you’re lucky enough to capture the moment on film, you can preserve it forever. Which is exactly what happened with this fortunate family after their dog began playing with the kids in the backyard.

posts.title: hcrMailman Makes a Special Visit to This "Dangerous" Dog, and It's Caught on Video
posts.markdown: Caught on Video: Mailman Pays Special Visit to a “Dangerous” Dog “Dangerous” Dog Receives Special Visits From Mailman, and It’s All Caught on Video Mailmen and dogs are often portrayed as age-old enemies, fighting back and forth as the mailmen strive to deliver mail to houses, and the dogs do their best to keep the intruders away. But obviously it can’t be true that *all* dogs hate mailmen, just as all mailmen could not possibly hate dogs. I’ve known some mailmen to carry treats with them, just in case. But the video below shows us just how loving and caring our mailmen can be, especially to our furry companions. As you can imagine, traveling the same mail route every day has mailmen seeing a lot of the same puppy faces, so it’s only natural that they develop some sort of relationship. The video below was posted to social media along with this caption: “*Just want to share something cool! Every day, whether or not we have mail, this mailman always stops to see my dog, who is only nine months old. He always gets overlooked as a dangerous or unapproachable dog, maybe ’cause he’s big, I am not sure. He doesn’t bark at them or growl (maybe the odd couple times he barks at people but which dog doesn’t), but this guy here always makes an effort to get off his bike to give him a hug and a pat! I’m not sure who to tag on Facebook for him to see this! But thanks, man, keep up the good job, and you’ve definitely got a friend waiting for ya!!*“ https://www.facebook.com/michael.collins.52035/videos/10207210873818760/ Pretty sweet, right? Be sure to share with friends and family who would love this video! http://www.wimp.com/mailman-loves-this-dangerous-dog/?utm_source=facebook.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=video/
posts.html:
Caught on Video: Mailman Pays Special Visit to a “Dangerous” Dog

“Dangerous” Dog Receives Special Visits From Mailman, and It’s All Caught on Video

Mailmen and dogs are often portrayed as age-old enemies, fighting back and forth as the mailmen strive to deliver mail to houses, and the dogs do their best to keep the intruders away. But obviously it can’t be true that all dogs hate mailmen, just as all mailmen could not possibly hate dogs.

I’ve known some mailmen to carry treats with them, just in case. But the video below shows us just how loving and caring our mailmen can be, especially to our furry companions.

As you can imagine, traveling the same mail route every day has mailmen seeing a lot of the same puppy faces, so it’s only natural that they develop some sort of relationship.

The video below was posted to social media along with this caption:

“Just want to share something cool! Every day, whether or not we have mail, this mailman always stops to see my dog, who is only nine months old. He always gets overlooked as a dangerous or unapproachable dog, maybe ’cause he’s big, I am not sure. He doesn’t bark at them or growl (maybe the odd couple times he barks at people but which dog doesn’t), but this guy here always makes an effort to get off his bike to give him a hug and a pat! I’m not sure who to tag on Facebook for him to see this! But thanks, man, keep up the good job, and you’ve definitely got a friend waiting for ya!!“

https://www.facebook.com/michael.collins.52035/videos/10207210873818760/

Pretty sweet, right? Be sure to share with friends and family who would love this video!

http://www.wimp.com/mailman-loves-this-dangerous-dog/?utm_source=facebook.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=video/

posts.title: 5 Things You Should Never Say to Anxious or Depressed People
posts.markdown: Anxiety and depression often go hand-in-hand. What many people don’t realize is that people aren’t just anxious because they worry too much. And depressed people aren’t just sad for the sake of being sad. It’s often something they have no control over. It’s often a mental illness that they struggle to deal with constantly. I’ve witnessed the pain, frustration, and sadness that comes from fighting mental illness. It’s a terrible combination, feeling like you’re completely helpless and unable to do anything, while simultaneously worrying about *needing* to do something all the time. They’re contradicting ideals, and they make you want to scream. It’s something that they struggle with. Every. Day. If you know someone who struggles with depression or anxiety, here are five things you should avoid saying to them, because they’re tired of hearing them: **“Are you just going to sit around all day? / Being lazy today, huh?”** It’s not that they *want* to sit around being inactive all day, it’s that literally doing *anything* is impossible when you’re paralyzed by the incessant worrying of anxiety and the endless weight of depression. Be encouraging of the things they are able to do and don’t get upset when they don’t share the joy you have for the day. **“You’re not trying”** While you should never force someone to do something they don’t want to do, this advice should be followed tenfold when interacting with the depressed and anxious. You’ll understand after you try, and it results in a panic attack, mental break, overwhelming tears, or a total shut down of the body. If you’re getting frustrated with them, don’t persecute them for a perceived lack of effort. Just walk away. **“Cheer Up!”** Ah, of course! Why didn’t I think of that? I should just cheer up. Wrong. Say this to an anxious or depressed person and you’re bound to get punched in the face. Obviously they would love to cheer up and live a life that is cheery and joyful, instead of the dark, gloomy and sorrowful existence that looms over them. Happiness isn’t a choice they make at the start of their day. It’s a war to be waged every second they’re awake. **“You just need to calm down”** Just as ‘cheer up’ incites anger and frustration for the depressed, ‘calm down’ infuriates those who are anxious. Why do people think that saying these things will work, as if they came up with some novel idea as to how to deal with mental illness. If you were about to get hit by a car, you would be pissed at someone telling you to calm down, right? That’s pretty much anxiety, except the car is in your head, and it’s always just about to crash straight into you, but never does. **“You’re crazy / too emotional / sensitive / overreacting”** Indeed, you’re literally describing the symptoms and conditions that depressed and anxious people feel all the time. They know that they think irrationally. They know all about their craziness. They *know*. You pointing out the mental illness that they cannot change or get rid of doesn’t help on any level. > [Things not to say to someone with anxiety or depression](http://hellogiggles.com/someone-with-anxiety-depression/)
posts.html:

It’s often something they have no control over. It’s often a mental illness that they struggle to deal with constantly.

I’ve witnessed the pain, frustration, and sadness that comes from fighting mental illness. It’s a terrible combination, feeling like you’re completely helpless and unable to do anything, while simultaneously worrying about needing to do something all the time. They’re contradicting ideals, and they make you want to scream.

It’s something that they struggle with. Every. Day.

If you know someone who struggles with depression or anxiety, here are five things you should avoid saying to them, because they’re tired of hearing them:

“Are you just going to sit around all day? / Being lazy today, huh?”

It’s not that they want to sit around being inactive all day, it’s that literally doing anything is impossible when you’re paralyzed by the incessant worrying of anxiety and the endless weight of depression.

Be encouraging of the things they are able to do and don’t get upset when they don’t share the joy you have for the day.

“You’re not trying”

While you should never force someone to do something they don’t want to do, this advice should be followed tenfold when interacting with the depressed and anxious. You’ll understand after you try, and it results in a panic attack, mental break, overwhelming tears, or a total shut down of the body.

If you’re getting frustrated with them, don’t persecute them for a perceived lack of effort. Just walk away.

“Cheer Up!”

Ah, of course! Why didn’t I think of that? I should just cheer up. Wrong. Say this to an anxious or depressed person and you’re bound to get punched in the face. Obviously they would love to cheer up and live a life that is cheery and joyful, instead of the dark, gloomy and sorrowful existence that looms over them.

Happiness isn’t a choice they make at the start of their day. It’s a war to be waged every second they’re awake.

“You just need to calm down”

Just as ‘cheer up’ incites anger and frustration for the depressed, ‘calm down’ infuriates those who are anxious. Why do people think that saying these things will work, as if they came up with some novel idea as to how to deal with mental illness. If you were about to get hit by a car, you would be pissed at someone telling you to calm down, right?

That’s pretty much anxiety, except the car is in your head, and it’s always just about to crash straight into you, but never does.

“You’re crazy / too emotional / sensitive / overreacting”

Indeed, you’re literally describing the symptoms and conditions that depressed and anxious people feel all the time. They know that they think irrationally. They know all about their craziness. They know.

You pointing out the mental illness that they cannot change or get rid of doesn’t help on any level.

Things not to say to someone with anxiety or depression

posts.title: Research Says: Sarcastic People Are Different From Everyone Else
posts.markdown: Sarcasm is definitely an art that is derived from a specific type of humor. One that focuses largely on irony, and sometimes comes off as dry as the New Mexican desert. But it also takes a specific type of person to understand and use sarcasm well. And it turns out, the same type of person that gets labelled as ‘sarcastic,’ shares another common label: intelligent. Yes, sarcastic people can now revel in the fact that a **[Harvard Business School study](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147071011293317&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irmsgjvw0100rbdo000DA1axh7tosbe3ix&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fsarcastic-people-good-for-you%2F&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.hbs.edu%2Ffaculty%2FPages%2Fitem.aspx%3Fnum%3D49283&title=According%20to%20science%2C%20here%27s%20how%20sarcastic%20people%20are%20different%20from%20everyone%20else&txt=Harvard%20Business%20School)**claims sarcasm is the “highest form of intelligence.” What they looked at in their study was whether or not sarcasm was a higher form of cognitive functioning. Two of their studies found that, while sarcastic people definitely caused more conflict, they also exhibited greater creativity and intelligence following a sarcastic conversation or remark. Taking it further, a third study discovered that the enhanced creativity of sarcastic people is due to increased capacity for abstract thought, meaning these aren’t your regular old jokes, people. During a fourth study, researchers found something quite interesting: “when participants expressed sarcasm toward or received sarcasm from a trusted other, creativity increased but conflict did not.” This means that you might not mind this clever person cracking jokes at your expense if you actually like them. If all of this weren’t convincing enough, they also found that IQ has a lot to do with how well people are able to pick up on sarcasm. Less intelligent people struggle to detect witty and clever remarks (which is probably for the best). **[*The Smithsonian*](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147071028777614&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irmsgtgz0100rbdo000DA7kqlh8zg&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fsarcastic-people-good-for-you%2F2%2F%23read&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.smithsonianmag.com%2Fscience-nature%2Fthe-science-of-sarcasm-yeah-right-25038%2F%3Fno-ist&ref=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fsarcastic-people-good-for-you%2F&title=According%20to%20science%2C%20here%27s%20how%20sarcastic%20people%20are%20different%20from%20everyone%20else%20-%20Page%202%20of%202&txt=According%20to%20%3Cem%3EThe%20Smithsonian%3C%2Fem%3E)** says that “studies have shown that exposure to sarcasm enhances creative problem solving.” [They also note that](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147071030139515&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irmsgtgz0100rbdo000DA7kqlh8zg&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fsarcastic-people-good-for-you%2F2%2F%23read&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.smithsonianmag.com%2Fscience-nature%2Fthe-science-of-sarcasm-yeah-right-25038%2F%3Fno-ist&ref=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fsarcastic-people-good-for-you%2F&title=According%20to%20science%2C%20here%27s%20how%20sarcastic%20people%20are%20different%20from%20everyone%20else%20-%20Page%202%20of%202&txt=According%20to%20%3Cem%3EThe%20Smithsonian%3C%2Fem%3E) “scientists who have monitored the electrical activity of the brains of test subjects exposed to sarcastic statements have found that brains have to work harder to understand sarcasm.” So if you’re the quick-witted, sarcastic friend in your group, don’t get down when people can’t handle your sly jokes. They benefit from having you around. And if you get frustrated from time to time at your sarcastic friend, remember that they’re only stretching that witty brain of theirs, and when they do so, it makes you smarter as well!
posts.html:
Sarcasm is definitely an art that is derived from a specific type of humor.

One that focuses largely on irony, and sometimes comes off as dry as the New Mexican desert. But it also takes a specific type of person to understand and use sarcasm well. And it turns out, the same type of person that gets labelled as ‘sarcastic,’ shares another common label: intelligent.

Yes, sarcastic people can now revel in the fact that a Harvard Business School study claims sarcasm is the “highest form of intelligence.” What they looked at in their study was whether or not sarcasm was a higher form of cognitive functioning.

Two of their studies found that, while sarcastic people definitely caused more conflict, they also exhibited greater creativity and intelligence following a sarcastic conversation or remark.

Taking it further, a third study discovered that the enhanced creativity of sarcastic people is due to increased capacity for abstract thought, meaning these aren’t your regular old jokes, people.

During a fourth study, researchers found something quite interesting: “when participants expressed sarcasm toward or received sarcasm from a trusted other, creativity increased but conflict did not.” This means that you might not mind this clever person cracking jokes at your expense if you actually like them.

If all of this weren’t convincing enough, they also found that IQ has a lot to do with how well people are able to pick up on sarcasm. Less intelligent people struggle to detect witty and clever remarks (which is probably for the best).

The Smithsonian says that “studies have shown that exposure to sarcasm enhances creative problem solving.” They also note that “scientists who have monitored the electrical activity of the brains of test subjects exposed to sarcastic statements have found that brains have to work harder to understand sarcasm.”

So if you’re the quick-witted, sarcastic friend in your group, don’t get down when people can’t handle your sly jokes. They benefit from having you around. And if you get frustrated from time to time at your sarcastic friend, remember that they’re only stretching that witty brain of theirs, and when they do so, it makes you smarter as well!

posts.title: Why This Photo of Two Men On A Bus is Filling Our Hearts With Joy
posts.markdown: Oftentimes when we wake up in the morning, we have no idea how our day will go. Sure, we have an idea, we have plans and things we want to do, but life has a way of thrusting us into situations that we’ve never been in before. Like 21-year-old Godfrey Cuotto, a Hamilton, Ontario, student who boarded a local bus after grabbing a bite to eat downtown and was surprised by one man’s seemingly random affection toward him. After sitting down on the bus, a man from the front came back to Godfrey, wanting to shake his hand. With people on busses typically being less than social, Godfrey was shocked and somewhat confused, but shook the man’s hand nonetheless. After grabbing the man’s hand, he would not let go. “He kept holding my hand,” Godfrey told the **[*Huffington Post Canada*](http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2015/10/08/hamilton-man-bus-holding-hands_n_8265558.html)**. “I thought I was getting pranked at first, but he just needed comfort.” For the entire bus ride, the man holding Godfrey’s hand sat right next to him, kissing him, hugging him and just resting his weight on Godfrey. “I just allowed it, like what am I going to do?” Godfrey says. “Sometimes you just have to be selfless and put someone else’s needs above yours.” After the incident was documented and shared on Hamilton’s social media page, a family member of the man reached out to Godfrey, hoping to thank him. It was revealed that this man’s name is Robert, he has special needs, and suffers from cerebral palsy and deafness. Godfrey [suspects that the crowdedness of the bus](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147078347463516&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=iro1s6yw0100rbdo000DAh3zeezp8&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fphoto-of-two-men-on-a-bus%2F2%2F%23read&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.kiss925.com%2F2015%2F10%2F08%2Flisten-godfrey-cuotto-chats-with-jax-about-his-viral-act-of-kindness%2F&ref=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fphoto-of-two-men-on-a-bus%2F&title=Why%20this%20photo%20of%20two%20men%20on%20a%20bus%20is%20filling%20our%20hearts%20with%20hope%20-%20Page%202%20of%202&txt=Toronto%20radio%20station%20Kiss%2092.5) might have spooked Robert, so he decided to stay with Robert until they reached his final stop. Godfrey’s random act of kindness went a long way that day. Many people wouldn’t have given Robert the time of day, let alone stuck with him through the entire bus ride. But Godfrey shed any fears of social awkwardness, stepped out of his comfort zone, and supported a person who just needed someone to lean on. If that doesn’t inspire you to be kind and caring toward your fellow man, I don’t know what will!
posts.html:
Oftentimes when we wake up in the morning, we have no idea how our day will go. Sure, we have an idea, we have plans and things we want to do, but life has a way of thrusting us into situations that we’ve never been in before.

Like 21-year-old Godfrey Cuotto, a Hamilton, Ontario, student who boarded a local bus after grabbing a bite to eat downtown and was surprised by one man’s seemingly random affection toward him.

After sitting down on the bus, a man from the front came back to Godfrey, wanting to shake his hand. With people on busses typically being less than social, Godfrey was shocked and somewhat confused, but shook the man’s hand nonetheless. After grabbing the man’s hand, he would not let go.

“He kept holding my hand,” Godfrey told the Huffington Post Canada. “I thought I was getting pranked at first, but he just needed comfort.”

For the entire bus ride, the man holding Godfrey’s hand sat right next to him, kissing him, hugging him and just resting his weight on Godfrey.

“I just allowed it, like what am I going to do?” Godfrey says. “Sometimes you just have to be selfless and put someone else’s needs above yours.”

After the incident was documented and shared on Hamilton’s social media page, a family member of the man reached out to Godfrey, hoping to thank him. It was revealed that this man’s name is Robert, he has special needs, and suffers from cerebral palsy and deafness.

Godfrey suspects that the crowdedness of the bus might have spooked Robert, so he decided to stay with Robert until they reached his final stop.

Godfrey’s random act of kindness went a long way that day. Many people wouldn’t have given Robert the time of day, let alone stuck with him through the entire bus ride. But Godfrey shed any fears of social awkwardness, stepped out of his comfort zone, and supported a person who just needed someone to lean on.

If that doesn’t inspire you to be kind and caring toward your fellow man, I don’t know what will!

posts.title: Scientists Find That Night Owls Are Often Smarter Than Your Average Person
posts.markdown: A person’s sleep cycle is something that is often unique to them, and you would be absolutely shocked at how different they can be. Most people do the standard 8-hour rest toward the end of the evening, anywhere from 10 p.m. to midnight, but there are those who stay up well into the early morning, going to bed around 4 a.m. or so. My roommate in college split up his sleep into 4-hour intervals. He’d stay up super late (like 4 a.m.), sleep for four hours, go to class until about 2 p.m., come back and sleep for another four hours, and then do it all over again. ***[The New York Times](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147086138848911&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irpc8vha0100rbdo000DAuhda7ai29o8v&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fstay-up-late-smarter%2F&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2016%2F07%2F03%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Fobama-after-dark-the-precious-hours-alone.html&title=Science%20says%20that%20if%20you%20stay%20up%20late%2C%20you%E2%80%99re%20probably%20smarter&txt=%3Cem%3EThe%20New%20York%20Times%3C%2Fem%3E&loAsUuid=irpc8x2v-18bcdf92-8a63-4c52-b0c8-c630894f1842)*** even featured an article talking about how President Obama enjoys working into the early morning, snacking and watching sports as he tries to solve the problems of the world. So, it might not come as a surprise that one study, published in **[*Psychology Today*](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147086146572612&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irpc8vha0100rbdo000DAuhda7ai29o8v&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fstay-up-late-smarter%2F&v=1&out=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.psychologytoday.com%2Fblog%2Fthe-scientific-fundamentalist%2F201005%2Fwhy-night-owls-are-more-intelligent-morning-larks&title=Science%20says%20that%20if%20you%20stay%20up%20late%2C%20you%E2%80%99re%20probably%20smarter&txt=Psychology%20Today)**, found that children who stayed up later are smarter.**[One other study](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147086148121513&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irpc8vha0100rbdo000DAuhda7ai29o8v&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fstay-up-late-smarter%2F&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.independent.co.uk%2Flife-style%2Fhealth-and-families%2Fhealth-news%2Fif-you-want-to-get-ahead-be-a-night-owl-8547115.html&title=Science%20says%20that%20if%20you%20stay%20up%20late%2C%20you%E2%80%99re%20probably%20smarter&txt=another)** also found that early risers might perform better in school, but it’s the night owls who were more successful at later stages in life. The second study theorizes that: **“…intelligent children are more likely to grow up to be nocturnal because in ancestral times any activities at night would have been novel and would, therefore, have been more likely to attract people with inquisitive minds.”** If that weren’t enough, **[other articles note](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147086149590014&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irpc8vha0100rbdo000DAuhda7ai29o8v&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fstay-up-late-smarter%2F&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Findy100.independent.co.uk%2Farticle%2Fstaying-up-too-late-is-a-sign-of-intelligence-and-so-is-swearing--b1jnbhxkwb&title=Science%20says%20that%20if%20you%20stay%20up%20late%2C%20you%E2%80%99re%20probably%20smarter&txt=indy100)** that frowned-upon behaviors like poor handwriting, using curse words, and being a messy person, are all indicative of high intelligence. So, if any of this sounds like you, you have some ammunition for whenever people berate you for your seemingly “poor” habits!
posts.html:
A person’s sleep cycle is something that is often unique to them, and you would be absolutely shocked at how different they can be. Most people do the standard 8-hour rest toward the end of the evening, anywhere from 10 p.m. to midnight, but there are those who stay up well into the early morning, going to bed around 4 a.m. or so.

My roommate in college split up his sleep into 4-hour intervals. He’d stay up super late (like 4 a.m.), sleep for four hours, go to class until about 2 p.m., come back and sleep for another four hours, and then do it all over again.

The New York Times even featured an article talking about how President Obama enjoys working into the early morning, snacking and watching sports as he tries to solve the problems of the world.

So, it might not come as a surprise that one study, published in Psychology Today, found that children who stayed up later are smarter. One other study also found that early risers might perform better in school, but it’s the night owls who were more successful at later stages in life.

The second study theorizes that:

“…intelligent children are more likely to grow up to be nocturnal because in ancestral times any activities at night would have been novel and would, therefore, have been more likely to attract people with inquisitive minds.”

If that weren’t enough, other articles note that frowned-upon behaviors like poor handwriting, using curse words, and being a messy person, are all indicative of high intelligence.

So, if any of this sounds like you, you have some ammunition for whenever people berate you for your seemingly “poor” habits!

posts.title: Abandoned Olympic Venues Highlight Just How Much Money is Wasted on Luxury
posts.markdown: The 2016 Summer Olympic Games held in Rio, Brazil, mark the 28th iteration of the world’s beloved grand tournament. Originating in Greece some 120 years ago, the Olympic games have been hosted by 19 different countries since, and each country has showcased its architectural and technological prowess each time, dumping an endless amount of money into each venue. Humans are known for their extravagant nature, always enjoying the most grand forms of entertainment and competition, which is often what spurs the creation of such expensive venues. But very rarely are these venues ever mentioned again after they’ve served their purpose for the time. For whatever reasons, many of these structural amenities are completely forgotten about, never to be used again. But their skeletons still exist, serving as a reminder that, while the games of their time are certainly over, their effect on the environment and the memories they’ve created are still very much alive. ## posts.html:
The 2016 Summer Olympic Games held in Rio, Brazil, mark the 28th iteration of the world’s beloved grand tournament.

Originating in Greece some 120 years ago, the Olympic games have been hosted by 19 different countries since, and each country has showcased its architectural and technological prowess each time, dumping an endless amount of money into each venue.

Humans are known for their extravagant nature, always enjoying the most grand forms of entertainment and competition, which is often what spurs the creation of such expensive venues. But very rarely are these venues ever mentioned again after they’ve served their purpose for the time.

For whatever reasons, many of these structural amenities are completely forgotten about, never to be used again. But their skeletons still exist, serving as a reminder that, while the games of their time are certainly over, their effect on the environment and the memories they’ve created are still very much alive.

posts.title: 5 'What If' Questions That Will Challenge Your Perception of Reality
posts.markdown: Being able to think critically and abstractly are skills that a person must develop. And one of the best ways to do so is by not blindly agreeing with any and all information that’s presented to you at face value; by always having a bit of skepticism. Think for a second about how you consume information. Do you watch the news? Do you scroll through Facebook? Do you ask your friends, coworkers, or family members? Probably a little bit of each. But you never actually talk to the primary source of the information being given to you, do you? Here are five ‘what if’ questions that will jar your mind a bit, making you *really* think about the realities of the world around you: **What if everything you’ve ever been taught or told is a complete lie?** Once we’re born, we begin our journey through this life by learning about society and what other humans have been up to for the past 2000 years or so. We have no real way of knowing if authority figures and educational entities are telling us the truth about the world and its history. **What if education is designed to force us into a specific system of dependency?** ![tumblr_mm8opmBBPD1soyza9o1_500](http://thespiritscience.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/tumblr_mm8opmBBPD1soyza9o1_500.gif)             From a young age, we’re taught how to operate in a bureaucratic manner, always respecting authority and never questioning those above us. Are your goals and dreams unique? Or are they shaped by a specific ideology that’s drilled into your head as a kid? **What if gender roles weren’t given out at birth?** Babies come into this world with predetermined names, sets of toys and clothing, and expectations in society. But what if gender wasn’t a social construct? What if we perceived the only difference between genders as being entirely physical, rather than dividing people up? **What if we *****are***** the only form of intelligent life in the cosmos?** Or, what if we’re not? Is it worse to be all alone in this grand universe or know that there is life all around us and not be able to reach it? Maybe there is other intelligent life out there, but they want to destroy mankind. What would they even look and act like? **What if God was the end-all-be-all?** What are the implications of God being the creator of space and time itself? What if this God was omnipotent, omniscient, genderless, and within every living soul on the planet? What if God is the culmination of everything that is and once was?
posts.html:
Being able to think critically and abstractly are skills that a person must develop. And one of the best ways to do so is by not blindly agreeing with any and all information that’s presented to you at face value; by always having a bit of skepticism.

Think for a second about how you consume information. Do you watch the news? Do you scroll through Facebook? Do you ask your friends, coworkers, or family members? Probably a little bit of each. But you never actually talk to the primary source of the information being given to you, do you?

Here are five ‘what if’ questions that will jar your mind a bit, making you really think about the realities of the world around you:

What if everything you’ve ever been taught or told is a complete lie?

Once we’re born, we begin our journey through this life by learning about society and what other humans have been up to for the past 2000 years or so. We have no real way of knowing if authority figures and educational entities are telling us the truth about the world and its history.

What if education is designed to force us into a specific system of dependency?

 

 

 

 

 

 

From a young age, we’re taught how to operate in a bureaucratic manner, always respecting authority and never questioning those above us. Are your goals and dreams unique? Or are they shaped by a specific ideology that’s drilled into your head as a kid?

What if gender roles weren’t given out at birth?

Babies come into this world with predetermined names, sets of toys and clothing, and expectations in society. But what if gender wasn’t a social construct? What if we perceived the only difference between genders as being entirely physical, rather than dividing people up?

What if we are the only form of intelligent life in the cosmos?

Or, what if we’re not? Is it worse to be all alone in this grand universe or know that there is life all around us and not be able to reach it? Maybe there is other intelligent life out there, but they want to destroy mankind. What would they even look and act like?

What if God was the end-all-be-all?

What are the implications of God being the creator of space and time itself? What if this God was omnipotent, omniscient, genderless, and within every living soul on the planet? What if God is the culmination of everything that is and once was?

posts.title: hcr-Dog Gets Confronted About a Giant Mess, Quickly Points Out Who Actually Did It
posts.markdown: Confronted About the Giant Mess, This Dog Wastes No Time Pointing Out the Real Culprit This Dog Rats Out His Little Sister After Being Confronted About the Giant Mess ![Screen Shot 2016-08-09 at 3.56.51 PM](http://www.sun-gazing.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Screen-Shot-2016-08-09-at-3.56.51-PM.png) Tattletaling is widely regarded as one of the worst things you can do to another person or creature. We all make mistakes and screw up every now and then, and no one wants to get thrown under the bus when it comes to getting in trouble! In many cultures, tattletaling is a serious party foul, and it often comes with serious repercussions. In school, if you tell on another kid, it’s pretty much considered fair game if they dole out a form of punishment on you. As we grow older the consequences can become even more grave. People in prison or part of street cultures (gangs, etc.) see “ratting someone out” as the most severe form of betrayal, and it is usually paid back in full with vicious beatings or even death! But when you’re a dog, and your dog buddy destroys the house, sometimes you just *have* to rat out your friend. Because you know that if you don’t, it could possibly be your butt on the line! Dogs have an uncanny sense of guilt. They know when they’re doing something wrong, and when they get caught, you can see it on their faces. Which is pretty much exactly the situation for this little French Bulldog. Not only did she destroy the house, but her older Bull Mastiff brother doesn’t want any part of it. He’s ready to rat her out the second he’s confronted about the mess. While it’s already pretty obvious who the culprit is, the owner of these two pups couldn’t help but ask both of them what happened. She got the answer she was looking for when the Bull Mastiff kindly pointed his paw toward his little sister, ratting her out while increasing his chances of a treat at the same time. A winning situation for him! http://www.sun-gazing.com/mom-comes-home-confronts-dog-giant-mess-points-rats-guilty-party/
posts.html:
Confronted About the Giant Mess, This Dog Wastes No Time Pointing Out the Real Culprit

This Dog Rats Out His Little Sister After Being Confronted About the Giant Mess

Tattletaling is widely regarded as one of the worst things you can do to another person or creature. We all make mistakes and screw up every now and then, and no one wants to get thrown under the bus when it comes to getting in trouble!

In many cultures, tattletaling is a serious party foul, and it often comes with serious repercussions. In school, if you tell on another kid, it’s pretty much considered fair game if they dole out a form of punishment on you.

As we grow older the consequences can become even more grave. People in prison or part of street cultures (gangs, etc.) see “ratting someone out” as the most severe form of betrayal, and it is usually paid back in full with vicious beatings or even death!

But when you’re a dog, and your dog buddy destroys the house, sometimes you just have to rat out your friend. Because you know that if you don’t, it could possibly be your butt on the line!

Dogs have an uncanny sense of guilt. They know when they’re doing something wrong, and when they get caught, you can see it on their faces.

Which is pretty much exactly the situation for this little French Bulldog. Not only did she destroy the house, but her older Bull Mastiff brother doesn’t want any part of it. He’s ready to rat her out the second he’s confronted about the mess.

While it’s already pretty obvious who the culprit is, the owner of these two pups couldn’t help but ask both of them what happened. She got the answer she was looking for when the Bull Mastiff kindly pointed his paw toward his little sister, ratting her out while increasing his chances of a treat at the same time.

A winning situation for him!

http://www.sun-gazing.com/mom-comes-home-confronts-dog-giant-mess-points-rats-guilty-party/

posts.title: Cannabis Tampons Are a Thing, and They Could Change How You Deal With Your Period
posts.markdown: Periods are different for every girl, and sometimes they are absolutely terrible. If you’re one of the unlucky ones who dreads that time of the month because of how debilitating your period is, there might be some good news for you on the horizon. And it comes in the form of **[cannabis tampons](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147080155605115&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irocfavo0100rbdo000DA1pj4rpcsz9z0i&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fmarijuana-tampons-super-effective%2F&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fforiapleasure.com%2Fproducts%2Frelief-4-pack&title=Marijuana%20tampons%20are%20here%20and%20they%20could%20be%20SUPER%20effective&txt=%3Cspan%20style%3D%22font-weight%3A%20400%3B%22%3Ecannabis%20vaginal%20suppositories%3C%2Fspan%3E).** Kind of sounds a bit crazy at first, right? But when the whole point of these cannabis vaginal suppositories is to make cramps completely non-existent, it’s easy to get on board with them. Created by Foria, cannabis “tampons” were created specifically to combat the nasty symptoms one can feel when on their period. Retired gynecologist and California medical marijuana evaluation center director, [**Morton Barke, M.D**.](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147080158213216&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irocfavo0100rbdo000DA1pj4rpcsz9z0i&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fmarijuana-tampons-super-effective%2F&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.racked.com%2F2016%2F1%2F27%2F10834874%2Fweed-vagina-period-menstrual-cramps-cannabis-foria&title=Marijuana%20tampons%20are%20here%20and%20they%20could%20be%20SUPER%20effective&txt=%3Cspan%20style%3D%22font-weight%3A%20400%3B%22%3ERacked%3C%2Fspan%3E), says: “We know that cannabis does help pain. We do see a lot of patients with dysmenorrhea. Dysmenorrhea is painful menstrual periods. It’s a fantastic modality to help patients.**”** What’s cool about Foria’s cannabis products is that they’re all grown in Northern California and feature *zero* pesticides, which is a definite plus when it comes to things going in our bodies. If you’re not entirely familiar with how weed works, there **[two active compounds that provide much of the medicinal benefit](http://hightimes.com/medicinal/science/the-simple-answer-what-are-thc-cbd/)**: THC and CBD. THC is responsible for pain relief and mental relaxation, while CBD focuses largely on the soothing of muscles and nerves. Together, they make for a powerful and effective combination. Foria put **[their cannabis ‘tampons’](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147080162978710&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irocujbw0100rbdo000DAcggppjc8&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fmarijuana-tampons-super-effective%2F2%2F%23read&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fforiapleasure.com%2Fproducts%2Frelief-4-pack%23&ref=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fmarijuana-tampons-super-effective%2F&title=Marijuana%20tampons%20are%20here%20and%20they%20could%20be%20SUPER%20effective%20-%20Page%202%20of%202&txt=will%20cost%20you%20%2444)** on the market back in January, and so far, people have fallen in love with them. They’ve reported less intense cramping, which was Foria’s goal all along. The only downside is that they’re not exactly cheap.**[For $44](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147080162978710&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irocujbw0100rbdo000DAcggppjc8&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fmarijuana-tampons-super-effective%2F2%2F%23read&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fforiapleasure.com%2Fproducts%2Frelief-4-pack%23&ref=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fmarijuana-tampons-super-effective%2F&title=Marijuana%20tampons%20are%20here%20and%20they%20could%20be%20SUPER%20effective%20-%20Page%202%20of%202&txt=will%20cost%20you%20%2444)**, you get a pack of four suppositories, and before you can even buy them, you have to become a member of Foria. You’ll also have to figure out a way around your state’s potential laws surrounding marijuana, which will likely require a physician’s recommendation for the product as well as an application to be submitted and approved. As of right now, however, Foria’s new products show great promise and could just be the next best thing when it comes to relieving the awful pain and discomfort associated with periods, and that’s something to be excited about!
posts.html:
Periods are different for every girl, and sometimes they are absolutely terrible. If you’re one of the unlucky ones who dreads that time of the month because of how debilitating your period is, there might be some good news for you on the horizon. And it comes in the form of cannabis tampons.

Kind of sounds a bit crazy at first, right? But when the whole point of these cannabis vaginal suppositories is to make cramps completely non-existent, it’s easy to get on board with them. Created by Foria, cannabis “tampons” were created specifically to combat the nasty symptoms one can feel when on their period.

Retired gynecologist and California medical marijuana evaluation center director, Morton Barke, M.D., says:

“We know that cannabis does help pain. We do see a lot of patients with dysmenorrhea. Dysmenorrhea is painful menstrual periods. It’s a fantastic modality to help patients.”

What’s cool about Foria’s cannabis products is that they’re all grown in Northern California and feature zero pesticides, which is a definite plus when it comes to things going in our bodies.

If you’re not entirely familiar with how weed works, there two active compounds that provide much of the medicinal benefit: THC and CBD.

THC is responsible for pain relief and mental relaxation, while CBD focuses largely on the soothing of muscles and nerves. Together, they make for a powerful and effective combination.

Foria put their cannabis ‘tampons’ on the market back in January, and so far, people have fallen in love with them.

They’ve reported less intense cramping, which was Foria’s goal all along. The only downside is that they’re not exactly cheap. For $44, you get a pack of four suppositories, and before you can even buy them, you have to become a member of Foria.

You’ll also have to figure out a way around your state’s potential laws surrounding marijuana, which will likely require a physician’s recommendation for the product as well as an application to be submitted and approved.

As of right now, however, Foria’s new products show great promise and could just be the next best thing when it comes to relieving the awful pain and discomfort associated with periods, and that’s something to be excited about!

posts.title: The Nap Desk: Perfect for Those Looking to Catch Some Z’s at the Office
posts.markdown: With more and more research on the benefits of naps popping up, this wonderfully designed desk could become the norm in office settings. While I don’t work in an office anymore, I used to, and I can tell you that late nights without a comfy place to rest your eyes aren’t very fun. If you’re someone who spends much of their career life at a desk, this could be the best thing  since sliced bread. Or maybe you’re trying to maximize space in your room, in which case this desk works perfectly. Greek company **[Studio NL](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147070416363018&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irmqi4de0100rbdo000DAegf7sy66optc&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fnap-desks%2F&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.studionl.com%2F%23%2Fproduct-design%2F&title=Nap%20desks%20are%20here%20and%20it%27s%20all%20going%20to%20be%20OK&txt=Studio%20NL)** designed this nap desk for those who need a nice place to rest during a day of hard work. This prototype desk, dubbed “**[1.6 S.M. of Life](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147070416363018&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irmqi4de0100rbdo000DAegf7sy66optc&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fnap-desks%2F&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.studionl.com%2F%23%2Fproduct-design%2F&title=Nap%20desks%20are%20here%20and%20it%27s%20all%20going%20to%20be%20OK&txt=Studio%20NL)**,” essentially works like a bunk bed. Below your desk and workspace lies a plush, comfy zone to nap when the 3 p.m. crash rolls around. The desk surface is designed to slide forward too, so one person can work while another one snoozes. Which might not sound great if you’re a lone wolf, but probably sounds amazing to two-man teams. “The main concept was to comment on the fact that many times our lives are ‘shrinking’ in order to fit into the confined space of our office,” the designers **[said on *Archilovers*](http://www.archilovers.com/projects/77985/desk-convertible-to-bed.html#info). ** “This desk could be used for a siesta or for a few hours of sleep at night on those days when someone struggles to meet deadlines.” ![NapDesk2](https://images.hellogiggles.com/uploads/2015/09/23/NapDesk2.jpg) What’s even cooler is that the prototype has optional privacy walls that come with it, meaning you can really find some alone time when you need it most. You can’t buy one just yet, but keep an eye out for this innovative product when it hits the market if you’re looking to save some space or just need a nice place to nap while working to meet deadlines!

With more and more research on the benefits of naps popping up, this wonderfully designed desk could become the norm in office settings. While I don’t work in an office anymore, I used to, and I can tell you that late nights without a comfy place to rest your eyes aren’t very fun.

The desk surface is designed to slide forward too, so one person can work while another one snoozes. Which might not sound great if you’re a lone wolf, but probably sounds amazing to two-man teams.
