posts.title: Fireproof, Bulletproof, Eco-Friendly Homes Are Being Erected by Nigerians
posts.markdown: When it comes to eco-friendly homes, we’re all about them, especially ones that repurpose plastic. Plastic is something that continues to fill the world around us at an alarming rate. In fact, researchers estimate that by 2050, almost 100 percent of birds on the planet will have at least a little bit of plastic floating around in their stomachs. While there is a ton of information out there surrounding the implications of such widespread use (and the disposal) of plastics, a large majority of it still ends up in landfills. There are those who strive to reduce the amount of plastic that ends up in landfills and they go about doing so in some pretty creative ways. Some use discarded plastics to build artful sculptures in hopes of promoting awareness of the issue. Others are repurposing the plastic to be used in the construction of eco-friendly homes, like the people of Nigeria. ![Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud](http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2GN_Z6VHYwE/VjzmkpB16FI/AAAAAAAAO9Y/Mkfy5eJ6ZFM/s1600/Nigerians%2BAre%2BBuilding%2BFireproof%252C%2BBulletproof%252C%2BAnd%2BEco-Friendly%2BHomes%2BWith%2BPlastic%2BBottles%2BAnd%2BMud.jpg "Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud") Nigeria currently suffers from a very intense housing crisis. It’s become so bad that **[Nigeria needs to build almost 16 million new housing units](http://phys.org/)** to accommodate the population. And because traditional homes are so expensive to build, they had to come up with an alternative solution. After two NGOs suggested they build homes from plastic bottles, locals have adopted the idea and started working toward solving the housing crisis. ![Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud](http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-VyV5NSk3jkg/Vjzo9t9_-8I/AAAAAAAAO9w/44Qvi9OUba8/s1600/Nigerians%2BAre%2BBuilding%2BFireproof%252C%2BBulletproof%252C%2BAnd%2BEco-Friendly%2BHomes%2BWith%2BPlastic%2BBottles%2BAnd%2BMud.jpg "Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud") Kaduna-based NGO Development Association for Renewable Energies (DARE) and London-based NGO Africa Community Trust, put together this project that is designed to knock out two birds with one stone. Not only are they working to eradicate the homeless problem, but the use of plastic bottles in homes will help keep plastic out of landfills. ![Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud](http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-pPG7kenbbZg/VjznHiiw2RI/AAAAAAAAO9g/Eh9REzuRMtc/s1600/Nigerians%2BAre%2BBuilding%2BFireproof%252C%2BBulletproof%252C%2BAnd%2BEco-Friendly%2BHomes%2BWith%2BPlastic%2BBottles%2BAnd%2BMud.jpg "Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud") The best part? Not only will the homes produce zero carbon emissions, they are powered entirely by solar energy, and recycled methane gas from human and animal waste. Not to mention, because they’re built using mud, cement, and plastic bottles filled with sand, the structures are more solid than cinder blocks, are completely fireproof and bulletproof, and hold up quite well against earthquakes. The tallest these structures can be built is three stories, because of weight. But, the various different plastics used to create the homes allow for some of the most unique patterns and colors you’ve ever seen in a home’s design. ![Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud](http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-v2Z_zdezV3s/Vjzn0CfnFvI/AAAAAAAAO9o/QbtYYsKZCcE/s1600/Nigerians%2BAre%2BBuilding%2BFireproof%252C%2BBulletproof%252C%2BAnd%2BEco-Friendly%2BHomes%2BWith%2BPlastic%2BBottles%2BAnd%2BMud.jpg "Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud") Each home uses about 14,000 plastic bottles to complete. For perspective, Nigeria discards about three million bottles *every day*. And the United States dwarfs this number by discarding almost 130 million bottles every day. If we repurposed these bottles, as Nigeria is currently doing, we could build around 9,200 homes per day, a number that would certainly put a dent in the 3.5 million homeless people currently living in the United States. ![Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud](http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-DmTFe2t0Mo4/VjzpYl2VZ5I/AAAAAAAAO94/A9UUiKn7Bbs/s1600/Nigerians%2BAre%2BBuilding%2BFireproof%252C%2BBulletproof%252C%2BAnd%2BEco-Friendly%2BHomes%2BWith%2BPlastic%2BBottles%2BAnd%2BMud.jpg "Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud") ![Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud](http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0H0U0Pd4Kfw/VjzqyLbjkmI/AAAAAAAAO-A/pZMOAJ3QTBU/s1600/Nigerians%2BAre%2BBuilding%2BFireproof%252C%2BBulletproof%252C%2BAnd%2BEco-Friendly%2BHomes%2BWith%2BPlastic%2BBottles%2BAnd%2BMud.jpg "Nigerians Are Building Fireproof, Bulletproof, And Eco-Friendly Homes With Plastic Bottles And Mud")
posts.html:
When it comes to eco-friendly homes, we’re all about them, especially ones that repurpose plastic. Plastic is something that continues to fill the world around us at an alarming rate. In fact, researchers estimate that by 2050, almost 100 percent of birds on the planet will have at least a little bit of plastic floating around in their stomachs.

While there is a ton of information out there surrounding the implications of such widespread use (and the disposal) of plastics, a large majority of it still ends up in landfills.

There are those who strive to reduce the amount of plastic that ends up in landfills and they go about doing so in some pretty creative ways. Some use discarded plastics to build artful sculptures in hopes of promoting awareness of the issue. Others are repurposing the plastic to be used in the construction of eco-friendly homes, like the people of Nigeria.

Nigeria currently suffers from a very intense housing crisis. It’s become so bad that Nigeria needs to build almost 16 million new housing units to accommodate the population. And because traditional homes are so expensive to build, they had to come up with an alternative solution.

After two NGOs suggested they build homes from plastic bottles, locals have adopted the idea and started working toward solving the housing crisis.

Kaduna-based NGO Development Association for Renewable Energies (DARE) and London-based NGO Africa Community Trust, put together this project that is designed to knock out two birds with one stone. Not only are they working to eradicate the homeless problem, but the use of plastic bottles in homes will help keep plastic out of landfills.

The best part? Not only will the homes produce zero carbon emissions, they are powered entirely by solar energy, and recycled methane gas from human and animal waste. Not to mention, because they’re built using mud, cement, and plastic bottles filled with sand, the structures are more solid than cinder blocks, are completely fireproof and bulletproof, and hold up quite well against earthquakes.

The tallest these structures can be built is three stories, because of weight. But, the various different plastics used to create the homes allow for some of the most unique patterns and colors you’ve ever seen in a home’s design.

Each home uses about 14,000 plastic bottles to complete. For perspective, Nigeria discards about three million bottles every day. And the United States dwarfs this number by discarding almost 130 million bottles every day.

If we repurposed these bottles, as Nigeria is currently doing, we could build around 9,200 homes per day, a number that would certainly put a dent in the 3.5 million homeless people currently living in the United States.

posts.title: hcr-Ever Wonder Why a Dog Tilts Its Head At You? This is Why!
posts.markdown: Dogs Are Always Tilting Their Heads, and This is Why This is the Reason Dogs Are Always Tilting Their Heads ![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/d05d9b9f6cd069527c318f814eea2a97/tumblr_nrn1f6f66U1tq5ex7o1_400.gif) Okay, dogs tilting their heads at you is one of the most adorable things they can do. I’m not entirely sure why, but something about the curious look they get in their eyes and the way their ears bob back and forth a bit when they do it has me feeling all warm and fuzzy inside. Hopefully you’ve gotten to experience it for yourself, because it’s easily one of the most heart-melting sensations a person can feel. What’s even cooler is that we now know *why* they do it. [Mental Floss](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147071285767412&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irmvn3210100rbdo000DAoljp3g8ygnr3&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fdogs-tilt-heads%2F&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.mentalfloss.com%2Farticle%2F70205%2Fwhat-makes-dogs-tilt-their-heads&title=This%20is%20why%20dogs%20tilt%20their%20heads%2C%20in%20case%20you%20were%20wondering&txt=According%20to%20Mental%20Floss) reports that dogs like to tilt their heads as a way to empathize with their human companions (see, I told you it’s adorable). Or at least, they try to empathize with you. And this makes a lot of sense if you’ve ever owned a dog, because they somehow always pick up on our energies and are willing to lend a paw when we’re feeling down. Tilting of the head is just another way in which they try to express their support for you; they’re trying to tell you that they’re listening to your silly human problems. ![](http://images.hellogiggles.com/uploads/2015/11/03/dog-700x525c.jpg "This is why dogs tilt their heads, in case you were wondering") *Image courtesy of Shutterstock* Mental Floss also notes that tilting of a dog’s head can also be an attempt to decipher where a particular noise or sound is coming from. Just as it can be hard for humans to distinguish where a sound is coming from, dog’s ears are much more sensitive and capable of hearing noises, which means they’ve got a lot more information to sort through when it comes to sound. In this case, a dog tilting its head might just be so they can figure out exactly what noise is bothering them. However, in the end, a dog’s motivation for doing most of this is simply so they can protect you in the best way possible ([they’re that loyal](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147071289063517&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irmvnqmq0100rbdo000DA4lcf1lek&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fdogs-tilt-heads%2F2%2F%23read&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.the-scientist.com%2F%3Farticles.view%2FarticleNo%2F38279%2Ftitle%2FOrigin-of-Domestic-Dogs%2F&ref=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fdogs-tilt-heads%2F&title=This%20is%20why%20dogs%20tilt%20their%20heads%2C%20in%20case%20you%20were%20wondering%20-%20Page%202%20of%202&txt=that%E2%80%99s%20a%20fact.)). So, now you know! Your pup is just [trying to relate](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147071294177318&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irmvnqmq0100rbdo000DA4lcf1lek&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fdogs-tilt-heads%2F2%2F%23read&v=1&out=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nbcnews.com%2Fid%2F4625213%2Fns%2Fhealth-pet_health%2Ft%2Fpuppy-love----its-better-you-think%2F&ref=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fdogs-tilt-heads%2F&title=This%20is%20why%20dogs%20tilt%20their%20heads%2C%20in%20case%20you%20were%20wondering%20-%20Page%202%20of%202&txt=boost%20our%20mood) to you on some level, which is something we can all understand. > [This is why dogs tilt their heads, in case you were wondering](http://hellogiggles.com/dogs-tilt-heads/)
posts.html:
Dogs Are Always Tilting Their Heads, and This is Why

This is the Reason Dogs Are Always Tilting Their Heads

Okay, dogs tilting their heads at you is one of the most adorable things they can do. I’m not entirely sure why, but something about the curious look they get in their eyes and the way their ears bob back and forth a bit when they do it has me feeling all warm and fuzzy inside.

Hopefully you’ve gotten to experience it for yourself, because it’s easily one of the most heart-melting sensations a person can feel. What’s even cooler is that we now know why they do it.

Mental Floss reports that dogs like to tilt their heads as a way to empathize with their human companions (see, I told you it’s adorable). Or at least, they try to empathize with you. And this makes a lot of sense if you’ve ever owned a dog, because they somehow always pick up on our energies and are willing to lend a paw when we’re feeling down.

Tilting of the head is just another way in which they try to express their support for you; they’re trying to tell you that they’re listening to your silly human problems.

Image courtesy of Shutterstock

Mental Floss also notes that tilting of a dog’s head can also be an attempt to decipher where a particular noise or sound is coming from. Just as it can be hard for humans to distinguish where a sound is coming from, dog’s ears are much more sensitive and capable of hearing noises, which means they’ve got a lot more information to sort through when it comes to sound.

In this case, a dog tilting its head might just be so they can figure out exactly what noise is bothering them. However, in the end, a dog’s motivation for doing most of this is simply so they can protect you in the best way possible (they’re that loyal).

So, now you know! Your pup is just trying to relate to you on some level, which is something we can all understand.

This is why dogs tilt their heads, in case you were wondering

posts.title: 15 Superpowers That Introverts Have Over Extroverts
posts.markdown: **“I’m very picky with whom I give my energy to. I prefer to reserve my time, intensity and spirit exclusively to those who reflect sincerity.” – Dau Voire** In our society where the extrovert is constantly celebrated and the introvert often ignored, we don’t spend enough time reflecting on the benefits that a diversity of personalities can bring to the table. *To celebrate the importance of introverts I wanted to share 20 strengths that they have over extroverts!*   1. ** They are able to develop deeper focus.** Because they spend more time on quiet activities, introverts are able to concentrate more easily. This is a skill that they have typically learned over years of unintentional brain training. 1. ** They have stronger personal boundaries.** When you live outside the confines of the group, you don’t feel the need to adjust your feelings to suit everyone else. As a result, introverts are more upfront about what they want from a situation, which sets boundaries and actually prevents feelings from getting hurt in the long run. 1. ** Introverts don’t get bored.** Because they are stimulated by their internal worlds, they don’t constantly feel the need to seek entertainment from the outside and don’t get bored as easily their extroverted counterparts. 1. **They are easier to get along with.** Extroverts sometimes clash when there’s more than one loud person in the room, introverts on the other hand will happily take a backseat, or just avoid situations whereby there may be a lot of chest pounding or egotism. 1. ** Introverts have a lowered chance of obesity.** A **[study](http://foodpsychology.cornell.edu/research/extraverted-children-are-more-biased-bowl-sizes-introverts)** by Cornell Food and Brand Lab found that extroverts are more likely to take larger food portions, which in the long term can lead to obesity. 1. ** They understand themselves better.** Spending more time alone allows you time to reflect and learn to better understand yourself. **“Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well-ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is and pass some time in his own company.” – Seneca** 1. ** They learn from their mistakes.** Internal homework allows introverts to spend time reflecting on why things happen and make a real effort to improve them. This skill means that they are therefore much more likely to correct errors they make. 1. ** Introverts are less impulsive.** Extroversion has been linked with behavioral impulsivity in a **[number of studies](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0191886997800104)**. Introverts, on the other hand, think their actions through and generally make better thought out decisions. 1. ** They are more creative.** Because introverts tend to focus more intensely on things, including ideas and preferences, they develop a more obsessive and longer-term relationships with their hobbies, which often results in greater creativity. Consider Steve Jobs passion for Apple Computers or Albert Einstein’s fascination with physics. 1. ** They’re better at reading emotions.** Because introverts spend more time listening, they can sometimes have a greater ability to read the emotions of those who they are talking to. 1. ** They are more loyal.** When it comes to personal relationships, introverts value quality over quantity. This means that those friendships that do develop are often stronger and more highly valued than the more fluid and dynamic social world of the extrovert. 1. ** They can be more effective leaders.** Though there is a stereotype of a leader as a loud extrovert, this isn’t necessarily the case. When in leadership roles, introverts have been found to celebrate the diversity and creativity of their staff, whereas extroverts tend to want to put their own stamp on things. 2. ** Introverts are less emotionally reactive.** This is related to the impulsivity. Because they take the time to reflect, introverts are not emotionally reactive in the moments, like we often see with the louder people in a room. 1. ** Introverts leave bigger legacies.** Though in the short term the extrovert may be more memorable, many introverts tend to plug away at their life’s passions in solitude and create a body of work that is more comprehensive than those who spend a lot of energy socializing. Examples of this include Elon Musk, Albert Einstein, Eleanor Roosevelt, Steven Spielberg, JK Rowling, and Michael Jordan. Are you an introvert? What strengths do you think you have because of this part of your personality? Let us know in the Facebook comments!   **Attention Expanded Consciousness Readers!** **Do you want to start your mornings off with** **habits that generate true confidence? ** Then grab a free copy of our new eBook: [**MORNING MASTERY: The Simple 20 Minute Routine For Long Lasting Energy, Laser-Sharp Focus, and Stress Free Living**.](http://projectmonkeymind.com/expanded-consciousness-morning-mastery) ——————————————————————————— Ben is a freelance writer, and the co-creator of **[Project Monkey Mind](http://projectmonkeymind.com/expanded-consciousness-morning-mastery)**—a blog that helps you learn practical ways to live a productive, fulfilling and world-changing life in the digital age.
posts.html:
“I’m very picky with whom I give my energy to. I prefer to reserve my time, intensity and spirit exclusively to those who reflect sincerity.” – Dau Voire

In our society where the extrovert is constantly celebrated and the introvert often ignored, we don’t spend enough time reflecting on the benefits that a diversity of personalities can bring to the table.

To celebrate the importance of introverts I wanted to share 20 strengths that they have over extroverts!

 

  1. They are able to develop deeper focus. Because they spend more time on quiet activities, introverts are able to concentrate more easily. This is a skill that they have typically learned over years of unintentional brain training.
  1. They have stronger personal boundaries. When you live outside the confines of the group, you don’t feel the need to adjust your feelings to suit everyone else. As a result, introverts are more upfront about what they want from a situation, which sets boundaries and actually prevents feelings from getting hurt in the long run.
  1. Introverts don’t get bored. Because they are stimulated by their internal worlds, they don’t constantly feel the need to seek entertainment from the outside and don’t get bored as easily their extroverted counterparts.
  1. They are easier to get along with. Extroverts sometimes clash when there’s more than one loud person in the room, introverts on the other hand will happily take a backseat, or just avoid situations whereby there may be a lot of chest pounding or egotism.
  1. Introverts have a lowered chance of obesity. A study by Cornell Food and Brand Lab found that extroverts are more likely to take larger food portions, which in the long term can lead to obesity.
  1. They understand themselves better. Spending more time alone allows you time to reflect and learn to better understand yourself.

“Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well-ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is and pass some time in his own company.” – Seneca

  1. They learn from their mistakes. Internal homework allows introverts to spend time reflecting on why things happen and make a real effort to improve them. This skill means that they are therefore much more likely to correct errors they make.
  1. Introverts are less impulsive. Extroversion has been linked with behavioral impulsivity in a number of studies. Introverts, on the other hand, think their actions through and generally make better thought out decisions.
  1. They are more creative. Because introverts tend to focus more intensely on things, including ideas and preferences, they develop a more obsessive and longer-term relationships with their hobbies, which often results in greater creativity. Consider Steve Jobs passion for Apple Computers or Albert Einstein’s fascination with physics.
  1. They’re better at reading emotions. Because introverts spend more time listening, they can sometimes have a greater ability to read the emotions of those who they are talking to.
  1. They are more loyal. When it comes to personal relationships, introverts value quality over quantity. This means that those friendships that do develop are often stronger and more highly valued than the more fluid and dynamic social world of the extrovert.
  1. They can be more effective leaders. Though there is a stereotype of a leader as a loud extrovert, this isn’t necessarily the case. When in leadership roles, introverts have been found to celebrate the diversity and creativity of their staff, whereas extroverts tend to want to put their own stamp on things.
  2. Introverts are less emotionally reactive. This is related to the impulsivity. Because they take the time to reflect, introverts are not emotionally reactive in the moments, like we often see with the louder people in a room.
  1. Introverts leave bigger legacies. Though in the short term the extrovert may be more memorable, many introverts tend to plug away at their life’s passions in solitude and create a body of work that is more comprehensive than those who spend a lot of energy socializing. Examples of this include Elon Musk, Albert Einstein, Eleanor Roosevelt, Steven Spielberg, JK Rowling, and Michael Jordan.

Are you an introvert? What strengths do you think you have because of this part of your personality? Let us know in the Facebook comments!

 

Attention Expanded Consciousness Readers!

Then grab a free copy of our new eBook: MORNING MASTERY: The Simple 20 Minute Routine For Long Lasting Energy, Laser-Sharp Focus, and Stress Free Living.

posts.title: Stare Into Someone's Eyes for Ten Minutes and Experience Psychedelic Effects
posts.markdown: If you’ve ever taken psychedelics before, you know just how mind-bending they can be. My first foray into the world of psychedelics happened in the early years of college, and it changed how I see the world entirely. While I don’t recommend anyone make a habit out of doing psychedelics regularly, I would suggest that everyone try them at least once in their lifetime. But, obviously not everyone has access to these compounds, they can be hard to find. So, if you’re interested, there is another way to do it according to **[IFL Science](http://www.iflscience.com/brain/you-can-alter-your-mind-staring-someones-eyes-10-minutes).** And all it takes is ten minutes of staring into another person’s eyes. Skeptical? I was too. Except **[many people are trying it](http://qz.com/484146/staring-into-someones-eyes-for-ten-minutes-is-like-tripping-without-the-drugs/)** and reporting LSD-like hallucinations. University of Urbino researcher, Giovanni Caputo, conducted an experiment that put 20 people into pairs in a dimly lit room, and then had them stare directly into each other’s eyes for at least ten minutes. His results were reported in **[*Psychiatry Research*](http://www.psy-journal.com/article/S0165-1781(15)00321-2/abstract)****,** and they included some pretty whacky findings. Some people reported out-of-body experiences, others said they started seeing strange creatures and even dead people. Participants of Caputo’s study were then asked a series of questions that ranked on a five-point scale. About 30 percent of participants said they saw different animals on the faces of the other person, 7 percent said they saw a person of a different race, and a whopping 75 percent said they saw monsters. If you want to try this for yourself, grab a friend and set the mood. Make sure the light in your space is dim enough that you can’t really see color, but can make out the details of anything just a few feet around you. Then set a timer for 10 minutes, if you want, but be sure to stare into each other’s eyes for at least 30 seconds on your first go-around. The longer you can do so, the more likely you will begin to hallucinate. Have fun!

If you’ve ever taken psychedelics before, you know just how mind-bending they can be. My first foray into the world of psychedelics happened in the early years of college, and it changed how I see the world entirely.

While I don’t recommend anyone make a habit out of doing psychedelics regularly, I would suggest that everyone try them at least once in their lifetime. But, obviously not everyone has access to these compounds, they can be hard to find.

So, if you’re interested, there is another way to do it according to IFL Science. And all it takes is ten minutes of staring into another person’s eyes. Skeptical? I was too. Except many people are trying it and reporting LSD-like hallucinations.

University of Urbino researcher, Giovanni Caputo, conducted an experiment that put 20 people into pairs in a dimly lit room, and then had them stare directly into each other’s eyes for at least ten minutes. His results were reported in Psychiatry Research, and they included some pretty whacky findings.

Some people reported out-of-body experiences, others said they started seeing strange creatures and even dead people.

Participants of Caputo’s study were then asked a series of questions that ranked on a five-point scale. About 30 percent of participants said they saw different animals on the faces of the other person, 7 percent said they saw a person of a different race, and a whopping 75 percent said they saw monsters.

If you want to try this for yourself, grab a friend and set the mood. Make sure the light in your space is dim enough that you can’t really see color, but can make out the details of anything just a few feet around you. Then set a timer for 10 minutes, if you want, but be sure to stare into each other’s eyes for at least 30 seconds on your first go-around. The longer you can do so, the more likely you will begin to hallucinate.

Have fun!

posts.title: hcr-Science Says: This Is How You Should Be Boiling Your Eggs
posts.markdown: Science Has Found the Perfect Way to Boil Your Eggs Boil Your Eggs Perfectly With This Scientific Method If you’ve ever tried to boil an egg, you know that it’s not the easiest thing in the world. It probably *feels* like it should be the easiest thing in the world, because c’mon, you’re boiling an egg, but it’s often quite difficult to perfect this practice. Do it wrong, and you’re left with an egg no one wants to eat. Why is it so difficult? Well, eggs actually consist of two parts: the yolk and the white. And each of them have different compositional makeups, which means they also have unique cooking temperatures. [According to J. Kenji](http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/the-food-lab-j-kenji-lopez-alt/1121137395) [López-Alt](http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/the-food-lab-j-kenji-lopez-alt/1121137395), Egg whites cook best at 180°F (82°C). This temperature allows for a sturdy, yet tender egg white. The ideal temperature for the yolk? About 10 degrees hotter than the egg white. But, if you cook the yolk above 170°F (77°C), it starts to dry out and crumble. ![The Food Lab Page 97 (1) 2](https://qzprod.files.wordpress.com/2015/10/the-food-lab-page-97-1-21.jpg?quality=80&strip=all&w=640) Peeling is another factor when boiling eggs. If you put your eggs in cold water to begin with, the egg will bind to the shell, which makes peeling them almost impossible. And if you drop your eggs into boiling water, there’s a good chance you’ll cook the whites before the yolks. So, what should you be doing instead? [J. Kenji López-Alt ](http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/the-food-lab-j-kenji-lopez-alt/1121137395)suggests starting the eggs in boiling water, so the whites have a chance to cook, but do not stick to the shell. Once they’ve cooked a bit, you begin to add ice cubes in order to lower the water’s temperature. Then you finish with a slow, gradual cook of the eggs. Specifically, the method looks like this: bring your water to a boil, gently place your eggs in the water and let them sit for 30 seconds. Then, add ice to the water to bring the temperature down. Once you’ve added the ice, you’re pretty much done. Let the water come back up to boiling and cook the eggs for at least 11 minutes at around 190°F. **Et voilà! **Perfectly boiled eggs. [The best way to boil an egg, according to science](http://qz.com/529249/the-best-way-to-boil-an-egg-according-to-science/)
posts.html:
Science Has Found the Perfect Way to Boil Your Eggs

Boil Your Eggs Perfectly With This Scientific Method

If you’ve ever tried to boil an egg, you know that it’s not the easiest thing in the world. It probably feels like it should be the easiest thing in the world, because c’mon, you’re boiling an egg, but it’s often quite difficult to perfect this practice. Do it wrong, and you’re left with an egg no one wants to eat.

Why is it so difficult? Well, eggs actually consist of two parts: the yolk and the white. And each of them have different compositional makeups, which means they also have unique cooking temperatures.

According to J. Kenji López-Alt, Egg whites cook best at 180°F (82°C). This temperature allows for a sturdy, yet tender egg white. The ideal temperature for the yolk? About 10 degrees hotter than the egg white. But, if you cook the yolk above 170°F (77°C), it starts to dry out and crumble.

Peeling is another factor when boiling eggs. If you put your eggs in cold water to begin with, the egg will bind to the shell, which makes peeling them almost impossible. And if you drop your eggs into boiling water, there’s a good chance you’ll cook the whites before the yolks.

So, what should you be doing instead?

J. Kenji López-Alt suggests starting the eggs in boiling water, so the whites have a chance to cook, but do not stick to the shell. Once they’ve cooked a bit, you begin to add ice cubes in order to lower the water’s temperature. Then you finish with a slow, gradual cook of the eggs.

Specifically, the method looks like this: bring your water to a boil, gently place your eggs in the water and let them sit for 30 seconds. Then, add ice to the water to bring the temperature down. Once you’ve added the ice, you’re pretty much done. Let the water come back up to boiling and cook the eggs for at least 11 minutes at around 190°F.

Et voilà! Perfectly boiled eggs.

The best way to boil an egg, according to science

posts.title: Facebook Study: Dog People Have A Lot of Friends, Cat People Are Mostly Single
posts.markdown: The battle between cats and dogs is an age-old war that has left many people picking sides. Cat people get stigmatized as somewhat introverted people who would rather be in their own company, while dog people are often viewed as the outgoing, popular ones. While it’s probably not safe to generalize like that, a new Facebook study has found the stereotype to be mostly true. The research conducted by Facebook **[looked at over 160,000 American profiles](https://research.facebook.com/blog/cat-people-dog-people/)**, finding that about 30 percent of profiles that had shared photos of cats were single, compared to the 24 percent who posted pictures of dogs. In terms of number of friends, it was found that dog people, on average, had about 26 more friends than those who preferred cats. Oddly enough, the widely accepted notion that pets mimic the personalities of their owners (or vice versa) also appeared to be somewhat true. Just as cats are often seen as lazy, docile creatures who enjoy spending their time napping at home, cat people tended to post more status updates about how ‘tired’ they were. Similarly, dog owners posted about 25 percent more status updates about being ‘excited.’ ![Books that were disproportionately liked by cat and dog lovers](http://www.telegraph.co.uk/content/dam/technology/2016/08/09/13640651_268388536870333_1664501671_n-large_trans++B6KEfdt5Cgfy-ucX6LjUDzs1WSAgrDX0g9ce9re9sCo.png) One difference that researchers noticed was that cat people were invited more often to events on Facebook, suggesting that, while they may have fewer friends, their relationships tend to be more close-knit than those of dog-owners. Other differences included cat-owners’ increased likelihood of living in a big city, and preference for doing activities indoors, like watching movies, reading, etc. It was also seen that cat people enjoy science-fiction content, while dog-owners prefered to consume media that revolves around dogs. ![Disproportionately popular movies among cat and dog lovers](http://www.telegraph.co.uk/content/dam/technology/2016/08/09/13720708_874257226041583_745014611_n-large_trans++HTknAkgPXXmjqdhr7rp_ojs1WSAgrDX0g9ce9re9sCo.png) “Cat people are especially fond of fantasy, sci-fi, and anime, while dog people like love stories and things about, well, dogs,” the researchers wrote. So, there you have it! Does any of this ring true for you? It seems that, in the case of this study, age-old stereotypes hold up quite well.
posts.html:
The battle between cats and dogs is an age-old war that has left many people picking sides. Cat people get stigmatized as somewhat introverted people who would rather be in their own company, while dog people are often viewed as the outgoing, popular ones.

While it’s probably not safe to generalize like that, a new Facebook study has found the stereotype to be mostly true. The research conducted by Facebook looked at over 160,000 American profiles, finding that about 30 percent of profiles that had shared photos of cats were single, compared to the 24 percent who posted pictures of dogs.

In terms of number of friends, it was found that dog people, on average, had about 26 more friends than those who preferred cats.

Oddly enough, the widely accepted notion that pets mimic the personalities of their owners (or vice versa) also appeared to be somewhat true. Just as cats are often seen as lazy, docile creatures who enjoy spending their time napping at home, cat people tended to post more status updates about how ‘tired’ they were. Similarly, dog owners posted about 25 percent more status updates about being ‘excited.’

One difference that researchers noticed was that cat people were invited more often to events on Facebook, suggesting that, while they may have fewer friends, their relationships tend to be more close-knit than those of dog-owners.

Other differences included cat-owners’ increased likelihood of living in a big city, and preference for doing activities indoors, like watching movies, reading, etc. It was also seen that cat people enjoy science-fiction content, while dog-owners prefered to consume media that revolves around dogs.

“Cat people are especially fond of fantasy, sci-fi, and anime, while dog people like love stories and things about, well, dogs,” the researchers wrote.

So, there you have it! Does any of this ring true for you? It seems that, in the case of this study, age-old stereotypes hold up quite well.

posts.title: Feel Your Partner’s Heartbeat in Real Time Anywhere in the World With This New Ring

One thing that’s missing from text messages, emails, video chats, and phone calls, is any ability to let you “feel” the other person. A problem that is solved entirely by these fantastic new rings. And what makes them so special is that they let you feel your partner’s heartbeat in real time, regardless of where you are, as if your hand were resting in theirs. ![](https://assets.rbl.ms/7302834/980x.jpg) As someone who loves the simple comfort of feeling his partner’s heartbeat, these rings can put even the most troubled minds at rest. Not only are they stylish, coming in stainless steel and rose gold colors, but they’re incredibly easy to use and come standard with a unibody sapphire crystal surface that is unscratchable. You and your partner can now feel each other’s heartbeat in real time no matter where you are.
