posts.html:
If you’ve ever had to endure the hardship that comes with a long distance relationship, you know just how difficult it can truly be sometimes. Even with endless ways to communicate with each other from around the globe, nothing will ever be able to beat actually being with your favorite person.

One thing that’s missing from text messages, emails, video chats, and phone calls, is any ability to let you “feel” the other person.

A problem that is solved entirely by these fantastic new rings. Coming in pairs, so you and your partner can both have one, ‘HB rings’ are connected to one another via data or Wi-Fi. And what makes them so special is that they let you feel your partner’s heartbeat in real time, regardless of where you are, as if your hand were resting in theirs.

As someone who loves the simple comfort of feeling his partner’s heartbeat, these rings can put even the most troubled minds at rest.

Not only are they stylish, coming in stainless steel and rose gold colors, but they’re incredibly easy to use and come standard with a unibody sapphire crystal surface that is unscratchable. Once you and your partner have your rings, simply install the smartphone app, make sure you both have data or Wi-Fi, and then tap your ring to connect the two rings together.

And there you have it! You and your partner can now feel each other’s heartbeat in real time no matter where you are. How romantic is that?

Learn more about HB Rings (and pre-order your own) by visiting these sites:

TheTouch – Facebook – Bored Panda – Mystical Raven

h/t Higher Perspective

posts.title: hcr-5 Fun Things You Should Know About Leos
posts.markdown: 5 Fun Facts About the Leo That You Should Know 5 Fun Facts You Never Knew About the Leo! As a Leo myself, it’s always fun getting to tell people just how awesome we can really be. A powerful and energized fire sign, Leos are known for being incredibly self-confident and charismatic, while maintaining a deep conviction for loyalty to their friends and loved ones. And seeing how late July to late August is the Leo’s time of the year, now is the perfect time to learn a few fun facts about Leos and what makes them some of the best people to have in your life! Here are five fun facts about the Leo: **Leos are full of good advice** Leos aren’t interested in sugarcoating anything, so you can always be sure that their advice comes from a genuine and honest place. Highly confident and easy to talk to, Leos make great people to seek help from. **Leos are cheery and outgoing** Known for their optimism and fun-loving nature, Leos are typically happy beings. And they enjoy seeing others happy, too. So don’t be surprised if they’re great at making you laugh or want to bring your spirits up when you’re having a bad day. **Leos are ambitious and strong-willed** Once something has attracted the attention of the Leo, they’ll stop at nothing to obtain it. This means they’re great at setting goals, and then crushing them. This type of attitude is contagious, which is why you’ll want to keep them around. Not to mention, they’ll have your back every step of the way. **Leos love like no other** Leos carry with them a passion for life and love that is rivaled by no others. When they decide to love someone, they do so with 100 percent of their being. If you find yourself on the receiving end of some Leo love, you should feel lucky. It’s one of the most powerful loves you’ll ever know. **Leos know how to have fun** Charismatic, confident and outgoing, the Leo is often the life of the party. If you need a friend to have a good time with, look to your Leo buddy. Not only can you count on them for whatever happens, you’re going to have a good time doing so! http://thespiritscience.net/2016/08/11/5-fun-facts-about-the-zodiac-sign-leo/
posts.html:
5 Fun Facts About the Leo That You Should Know

5 Fun Facts You Never Knew About the Leo!

As a Leo myself, it’s always fun getting to tell people just how awesome we can really be.

A powerful and energized fire sign, Leos are known for being incredibly self-confident and charismatic, while maintaining a deep conviction for loyalty to their friends and loved ones.

And seeing how late July to late August is the Leo’s time of the year, now is the perfect time to learn a few fun facts about Leos and what makes them some of the best people to have in your life!

Here are five fun facts about the Leo:

Leos are full of good advice

Leos aren’t interested in sugarcoating anything, so you can always be sure that their advice comes from a genuine and honest place. Highly confident and easy to talk to, Leos make great people to seek help from.

Leos are cheery and outgoing

Known for their optimism and fun-loving nature, Leos are typically happy beings. And they enjoy seeing others happy, too. So don’t be surprised if they’re great at making you laugh or want to bring your spirits up when you’re having a bad day.

Leos are ambitious and strong-willed

Once something has attracted the attention of the Leo, they’ll stop at nothing to obtain it. This means they’re great at setting goals, and then crushing them. This type of attitude is contagious, which is why you’ll want to keep them around. Not to mention, they’ll have your back every step of the way.

Leos love like no other

Leos carry with them a passion for life and love that is rivaled by no others. When they decide to love someone, they do so with 100 percent of their being. If you find yourself on the receiving end of some Leo love, you should feel lucky. It’s one of the most powerful loves you’ll ever know.

Leos know how to have fun

Charismatic, confident and outgoing, the Leo is often the life of the party. If you need a friend to have a good time with, look to your Leo buddy. Not only can you count on them for whatever happens, you’re going to have a good time doing so!

http://thespiritscience.net/2016/08/11/5-fun-facts-about-the-zodiac-sign-leo/

posts.title: Living On Only 6% of Their Income, This Couple Donates $100,000 to Charity Every Year
posts.markdown: Photo Credit (Julia Wise/Jeff Kaufman) Have you ever heard of **[tithing](https://www.lds.org/topics/tithing?lang=eng)**? It’s the traditional practice of paying 10 percent of your income and gains to the church, and in return you better your chances of getting into paradise once you pass away. Now, have you ever heard of **[reverse tithing](http://ilikegiving.com/blog/behind-the-scenes-of-i-like-my-dad)**? People who practice this donate 90 percent of their income and gains to the church, keeping only 10 percent for themselves. Couple Julia Wise and Jeff Kaufman are one couple who have decided to take on a similar ideology when it comes to donating to charity. Between Jeff, the software engineer, and Julia, the social worker, the pair make a little under $245,000 annually (which notches them in the top 10 percent of American households). ![](https://www.theatlas.com/i/atlas_E1AGubvye@2x.png) Aside from taxes and savings, they manage to live on only $15,280 (6.25%) of their annual income. The rest of the money they earn, which is about $100,000 (and just under half of their total income) is given to charity. Starting in 2008, the couple has done this *every year* since. **[A few reasons why?](http://www.amazon.com/Strangers-Drowning-Grappling-Impossible-Overpowering/dp/1594204330?tag=quartz07-20)** **Income Doesn’t Necessarily Equate to Happiness** As the Beatles once said: “You can’t buy me love.” And the same goes for happiness. **[Research studying the correlation between money and happiness](http://www.brookings.edu/~/media/research/files/papers/2013/04/subjective-well-being-income/subjective-well-being-income.pdf)**has found, time and time again, that increases in income do not increase a person’s happiness **[after reaching a certain amount](http://pages.ucsd.edu/~aronatas/Kahneman%20et%20al%20Would%20You%20Be%20Happier%20Science-2006.pdf)**. When asked to rate their [life satisfaction](http://www.uvm.edu/~pdodds/files/papers/others/2009/aknin2009a.pdf) on a scale of 1 to 10, US citizens making $32,000 a year rated their lives a 7 out of 10. However, those making $64,000 a year, which is *double* the other people’s income, only rated their life satisfaction as 7.5 out of 10. A half a point increase. **Giving is good for you** **[One study](http://www.researchgate.net/profile/Lara_Aknin/publication/5494996_Spending_money_on_others_promotes_happiness/links/0c960536bc4c368a69000000.pdf)** had participants each receive an envelope with a moderate amount of money in it. They were split up into two groups: one group was told to spend the money on themselves, and the other group was told to **[spend it on someone else](https://www.apa.org/pubs/journals/releases/psp-104-4-635.pdf)**. Group 1 used the money to splurge on something they’d wanted to buy, or even to pay bills. Group 2 either bought gifts for others or donated to charities. Guess which group reported the greater levels of happiness? You guessed it, Group 2. **How can you start giving?** While giving 40 percent of your income to charity is never expected, giving to others in any way is always a good thing. There are even entire communities dedicated to donating at least 10 percent of their income to charities each year. ***[Giving What We Can](https://www.givingwhatwecan.org/)*** currently has over 1,200 members and is continuing to grow. Your donated income can make all the difference when it comes to changing the lives of those in need. And you’ll only make yourself happier **[by doing so](https://www.givingwhatwecan.org/try-giving)**!
posts.html:
Photo Credit (Julia Wise/Jeff Kaufman)

Have you ever heard of tithing? It’s the traditional practice of paying 10 percent of your income and gains to the church, and in return you better your chances of getting into paradise once you pass away.

Now, have you ever heard of reverse tithing? People who practice this donate 90 percent of their income and gains to the church, keeping only 10 percent for themselves.

Couple Julia Wise and Jeff Kaufman are one couple who have decided to take on a similar ideology when it comes to donating to charity. Between Jeff, the software engineer, and Julia, the social worker, the pair make a little under $245,000 annually (which notches them in the top 10 percent of American households).

Aside from taxes and savings, they manage to live on only $15,280 (6.25%) of their annual income. The rest of the money they earn, which is about $100,000 (and just under half of their total income) is given to charity. Starting in 2008, the couple has done this every year since.

A few reasons why?

Income Doesn’t Necessarily Equate to Happiness

As the Beatles once said: “You can’t buy me love.” And the same goes for happiness.

Research studying the correlation between money and happiness has found, time and time again, that increases in income do not increase a person’s happiness after reaching a certain amount.

When asked to rate their life satisfaction on a scale of 1 to 10, US citizens making $32,000 a year rated their lives a 7 out of 10. However, those making $64,000 a year, which is double the other people’s income, only rated their life satisfaction as 7.5 out of 10. A half a point increase.

Giving is good for you

One study had participants each receive an envelope with a moderate amount of money in it. They were split up into two groups: one group was told to spend the money on themselves, and the other group was told to spend it on someone else.

Group 1 used the money to splurge on something they’d wanted to buy, or even to pay bills. Group 2 either bought gifts for others or donated to charities.

Guess which group reported the greater levels of happiness? You guessed it, Group 2.

How can you start giving?

While giving 40 percent of your income to charity is never expected, giving to others in any way is always a good thing. There are even entire communities dedicated to donating at least 10 percent of their income to charities each year.

Giving What We Can currently has over 1,200 members and is continuing to grow. Your donated income can make all the difference when it comes to changing the lives of those in need. And you’ll only make yourself happier by doing so!

posts.title: hcr-10 Signs That Your Partner is the Best Partner You Could Ever Have
posts.markdown: 10 Signs That Your Partner is Perfect For You 10 Ways to Tell That Your Partner is Absolutely Perfect For You **They know you better than you do** Your better half is perfect for you when they know you just as well as you know yourself. They know what you’re thinking, your attitudes toward certain things, and enjoy being there for you during moments of weakness. **They love to make you smile and laugh** A perfect partner loves to see their significant other smile and be as happy as possible. If your partner’s sense of humor is something you adore, you’ll never tire of them. **They’re there for you, even when you’re grumpy** A perfect partner recognizes when their significant other is upset, irritated or frustrated, and doesn’t get down about it. They know that you have your angry moments just like everyone else. They’re not about to let those moments keep them from loving you, they know to just give you space every now and then. **They’re not judgmental of your choices when it comes to their appearance** A great spouse always supports their partner, especially when it comes to them wanting to look better or feel more attractive. However you want to present yourself to the world, they love you for it. **They’ll always be upfront with you** A great partner will never beat around the bush or lie to you. They will always give you their honest opinion because they always have your best interests in mind. **They’re good at righting any wrongs, even if it’s not immediate** Everyone makes mistakes, and a good partner knows this. If they’ve done something to upset you or frustrate you, they know that they’ll make it up to you in one way or another. Just give them some time; they always figure it out. **They understand that special moments together will always trump any sort of material possession** A good partner would rather do something with his or her significant other that will create lasting memories for both of you. Buying someone luxurious and expensive things is nice, but those things will never be able to match the feelings you have when you and your partner experience something together. **They give your family the same respect they give their own** When your better half respects and treats your family as if they were their own, you know you’ve found a keeper. Family time is always better when everyone loves and respects each other. **They truly listen, and care about what’s going on in your life** Something that truly makes a partner great is how good they are at listening to you. If they’re genuinely concerned with how your day is going and want to fix anything wrong in your life, they’re perfect for you. **They enjoy showing how much they appreciate you in different ways** Sometimes saying “I love you” just doesn’t adequately describe how much you care for a person. The perfect partner loves expressing his or her gratitude for everything you do to make their life better. From little things like making them coffee in the mornings, to big things like supporting their goals and ambitions.
posts.html:
10 Signs That Your Partner is Perfect For You

10 Ways to Tell That Your Partner is Absolutely Perfect For You

They know you better than you do

Your better half is perfect for you when they know you just as well as you know yourself. They know what you’re thinking, your attitudes toward certain things, and enjoy being there for you during moments of weakness.

They love to make you smile and laugh

A perfect partner loves to see their significant other smile and be as happy as possible. If your partner’s sense of humor is something you adore, you’ll never tire of them.

They’re there for you, even when you’re grumpy

A perfect partner recognizes when their significant other is upset, irritated or frustrated, and doesn’t get down about it. They know that you have your angry moments just like everyone else. They’re not about to let those moments keep them from loving you, they know to just give you space every now and then.

They’re not judgmental of your choices when it comes to their appearance

A great spouse always supports their partner, especially when it comes to them wanting to look better or feel more attractive. However you want to present yourself to the world, they love you for it.

They’ll always be upfront with you

A great partner will never beat around the bush or lie to you. They will always give you their honest opinion because they always have your best interests in mind.

They’re good at righting any wrongs, even if it’s not immediate

Everyone makes mistakes, and a good partner knows this. If they’ve done something to upset you or frustrate you, they know that they’ll make it up to you in one way or another. Just give them some time; they always figure it out.

They understand that special moments together will always trump any sort of material possession

A good partner would rather do something with his or her significant other that will create lasting memories for both of you. Buying someone luxurious and expensive things is nice, but those things will never be able to match the feelings you have when you and your partner experience something together.

They give your family the same respect they give their own

When your better half respects and treats your family as if they were their own, you know you’ve found a keeper. Family time is always better when everyone loves and respects each other.

They truly listen, and care about what’s going on in your life

Something that truly makes a partner great is how good they are at listening to you. If they’re genuinely concerned with how your day is going and want to fix anything wrong in your life, they’re perfect for you.

They enjoy showing how much they appreciate you in different ways

Sometimes saying “I love you” just doesn’t adequately describe how much you care for a person. The perfect partner loves expressing his or her gratitude for everything you do to make their life better.

From little things like making them coffee in the mornings, to big things like supporting their goals and ambitions.

posts.title: Kids Need to Be Bored During Their Summers, Psychologists Say
posts.markdown: Do you remember summertime as a kid? While we often celebrated it because it marked the end of the school year (and the end of class), it was, for many of us, also a very busy time to be a kid. Parents who work 12 months out of the year often scramble to find fun **[summer programs](http://www.timeout.com/new-york-kids/things-to-do/summer-camps-for-kids)** to involve their kids in. From sports camps to art school, not only do these programs offer a method of daycare for when parents are at work, but they’re supposed to be fun and engaging for the kids. But recent research has discovered that kids might actually be *too busy* during the summer. Psychologists have found that keeping kids routinely invested in other things can keep them from discovering their own passions and interests. “Your role as a parent is to prepare children to take their place in society. Being an adult means occupying yourself and filling up your leisure time in a way that will make you happy,” says Lyn Fry, a child psychologist in London with a focus on education. “If parents spend all their time filling up their child’s spare time, then the child’s never going to learn to do this for themselves.” So, what you should be doing instead? Lyn Fry suggests having a sit down with your kids at the beginning of each summer so you can make**[a collective list of anything they might be interested in](http://find.acacamps.org/)** doing during their break. These can be big things, like making a nice dinner or performing a play, or small things, like riding a bike or finding a good book to start. Once the list is made, it allows the children to decide for themselves what they would like to do when they’re bored. “It puts the onus on them to say, ‘This is what I’d like to do’,” says Fry. Remember, chances are good that your child will become bored at some point during the summer. And that’s okay. Don’t think that they’re simply wasting time. “There’s no problem with being bored,” says Fry. “It’s not a sin, is it? I think children need to learn how to be bored in order to motivate themselves to get things done. Being bored is a way to make children self-reliant.” In fact, 1930s philosopher, **[Bertrand Russell](https://www.brainpickings.org/2015/01/21/bertrand-russell-boredom-conquest-of-happiness/)**, highlights the inherent value of boredom with an entire chapter on it in his book, **[*The Conquest of Happiness*](https://www.amazon.com/Conquest-Happiness-Bertrand-Russell/dp/087140673X?tag=quartz07-20)**: “A child develops best when, like a young plant, he is left undisturbed in the same soil. Too much travel, too much variety of impressions, are not good for the young, and cause them as they grow up to become incapable of enduring fruitful monotony.”
posts.html:
Do you remember summertime as a kid? While we often celebrated it because it marked the end of the school year (and the end of class), it was, for many of us, also a very busy time to be a kid.

Parents who work 12 months out of the year often scramble to find fun summer programs to involve their kids in. From sports camps to art school, not only do these programs offer a method of daycare for when parents are at work, but they’re supposed to be fun and engaging for the kids.

But recent research has discovered that kids might actually be too busy during the summer. Psychologists have found that keeping kids routinely invested in other things can keep them from discovering their own passions and interests.

“Your role as a parent is to prepare children to take their place in society. Being an adult means occupying yourself and filling up your leisure time in a way that will make you happy,” says Lyn Fry, a child psychologist in London with a focus on education.

“If parents spend all their time filling up their child’s spare time, then the child’s never going to learn to do this for themselves.”

So, what you should be doing instead? Lyn Fry suggests having a sit down with your kids at the beginning of each summer so you can make a collective list of anything they might be interested in doing during their break. These can be big things, like making a nice dinner or performing a play, or small things, like riding a bike or finding a good book to start.

Once the list is made, it allows the children to decide for themselves what they would like to do when they’re bored.

“It puts the onus on them to say, ‘This is what I’d like to do’,” says Fry.

Remember, chances are good that your child will become bored at some point during the summer. And that’s okay. Don’t think that they’re simply wasting time.

“There’s no problem with being bored,” says Fry.

“It’s not a sin, is it? I think children need to learn how to be bored in order to motivate themselves to get things done. Being bored is a way to make children self-reliant.”

In fact, 1930s philosopher, Bertrand Russell, highlights the inherent value of boredom with an entire chapter on it in his book, The Conquest of Happiness:

“A child develops best when, like a young plant, he is left undisturbed in the same soil. Too much travel, too much variety of impressions, are not good for the young, and cause them as they grow up to become incapable of enduring fruitful monotony.”

posts.title: Man Missing Most of His Brain Challenges Early Theories of Consciousness
posts.markdown: Consciousness is something that eludes any sort of solid understanding by mankind. Yes, we’re conscious, but we have no idea why or how consciousness even exists. Basic theories surrounding consciousness suggest that it’s linked to the brain in some way. And many of those theories are now being called into question after a man missing most of his brain was found to be fully conscious. This 44-year-old Frenchman was discovered to be missing most of his brain after going to the hospital because of **[a weakness he felt in his left leg](http://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(07)61127-1/abstract)**. Scans of his body revealed that there was mostly fluid where brain matter should be, with only a thin layer of brain tissue residing near the perimeter of his skull. This man, whose brain is almost nonexistent, was married and even fathered two children. His IQ was around 75, meaning he had below-average intelligence, but could not be considered mentally handicapped. “Any theory of consciousness has to be able to explain why a person like that, who’s missing 90% of his neurons, still exhibits normal behavior,” says **[Axel Cleeremans of the Université Libre de Bruxelles](http://assc20.org/).** Scientists have labeled different parts of the brain as being responsible for certain functions, features and processes. For example, the frontal, parietal, temporal, and occipital lobes of the brain are thought to control motion, sensibility, language, vision, audition, emotional, and cognitive functionality. And yet, the fully-functional Frenchman barely had any of these brain regions left. This leads scientists to believe that the brain is capable of adapting and surviving, if the damage to the brain happens at a gradual rate. Cleeremans now believes that consciousness is something that the brain learns, which, in turn, suggests that consciousness requires only a few specific neural areas of the brain to exist. “Consciousness is the brain’s non-conceptual theory about itself, gained through experience—that is learning, interacting with itself, the world, and with other people,” he says. So,**[Cleereman’s theory suggests](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3110382/)** that consciousness exists not simply because the brain stores information, but because humans care that the brain stores information. It is the brain theorizing about itself that creates consciousness.
posts.html:
Consciousness is something that eludes any sort of solid understanding by mankind. Yes, we’re conscious, but we have no idea why or how consciousness even exists. Basic theories surrounding consciousness suggest that it’s linked to the brain in some way.

And many of those theories are now being called into question after a man missing most of his brain was found to be fully conscious.

This 44-year-old Frenchman was discovered to be missing most of his brain after going to the hospital because of a weakness he felt in his left leg. Scans of his body revealed that there was mostly fluid where brain matter should be, with only a thin layer of brain tissue residing near the perimeter of his skull.

This man, whose brain is almost nonexistent, was married and even fathered two children. His IQ was around 75, meaning he had below-average intelligence, but could not be considered mentally handicapped.

“Any theory of consciousness has to be able to explain why a person like that, who’s missing 90% of his neurons, still exhibits normal behavior,” says Axel Cleeremans of the Université Libre de Bruxelles.

Scientists have labeled different parts of the brain as being responsible for certain functions, features and processes. For example, the frontal, parietal, temporal, and occipital lobes of the brain are thought to control motion, sensibility, language, vision, audition, emotional, and cognitive functionality. And yet, the fully-functional Frenchman barely had any of these brain regions left.

This leads scientists to believe that the brain is capable of adapting and surviving, if the damage to the brain happens at a gradual rate. Cleeremans now believes that consciousness is something that the brain learns, which, in turn, suggests that consciousness requires only a few specific neural areas of the brain to exist.

“Consciousness is the brain’s non-conceptual theory about itself, gained through experience—that is learning, interacting with itself, the world, and with other people,” he says.

So, Cleereman’s theory suggests that consciousness exists not simply because the brain stores information, but because humans care that the brain stores information. It is the brain theorizing about itself that creates consciousness.

posts.title: One Girl’s Tattoo Reveals a Hidden Message About Her Mental Illness
posts.markdown: *Photo Credit: [Bekah Miles](https://www.facebook.com/remiles14)* Mental illness is something that is quite prominent all over the world, but rarely discussed on a serious level. General attitudes and behaviors surrounding mental illness are testament to how little people actually understand about the different mental illnesses affecting such a large portion of the population–which turns out to be **[around 44 million people in the U.S. alone](http://api.viglink.com/api/click?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_147086012008014&key=d315a21d6d5a1bf22f62a7d4512f1e04&libId=irpb2rbj0100rbdo000DAf1frrs9m6q94&loc=http%3A%2F%2Fhellogiggles.com%2Fgirl-amazing-tattoo-depression%2F%23read&v=1&out=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nami.org%2FLearn-More%2FMental-Health-By-the-Numbers&title=This%20girl%20got%20an%20amazing%20tattoo%20to%20start%20a%20conversation%20about%20her%20mental%20health&txt=National%20Alliance%20on%20Mental%20Illness%20(NAMI))** (or one out of every five adults). This is largely due to the fact that most people suffering from mental illness don’t feel comfortable talking about it with friends and family. “I’m fine” is the go-to phrase and attitude, when in reality, ‘fine’ is the last word they’d choose to describe how they’re feeling. 20-year-old Bekah Miles wanted to start a conversation about her mental illness, and decided the best way to go about doing so was **[getting a tattoo](https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10207864868406352&set=a.1720209891802.2101869.1434946208&type=1&fref=nf)** that adequately describes her every day struggles. The tattoo rests on the lower part of her left thigh and reads, in a beautiful handwritten typeface, “I’m fine.” That’s what everyone looking at the tattoo will see, but what Bekah sees, as she looks down at it from her perspective, are the words “Save me.” Bekah of course wanted to show off her tattoo, but she also decided to finally open up about her mental illness and the difficulty it places on her life every day. “Today, I am coming out with something that only few of you know,” Bekah wrote. “I am ready to have a conversation about my mental illness.” While Bekah’s depression has been with her for years, an actual diagnosis was given to her just last year, after she was so depressed she could barely function on a normal level. “So today, I got this tattoo,” Bekah continues. “..When everyone else sees it, they see ‘I’m fine,’ but from my viewpoint, it reads ‘save me.’ To me, it means that others see this person that seems okay, but, in reality, is not okay at all. It reminds me that people who may appear happy, [sic] may be at battle with themselves.” Bekah’s whole reasoning behind getting this tattoo is so that it will serve as somewhat of an icebreaker in social settings, saying: “[The tattoo] forces me to talk about my own struggle, and why the awareness of it is important. You’d be surprised by how many people YOU know that struggle with depression, anxiety, or other mental illness. I may only be one person, but one can save another… and that’s all I could really ask for.” The stigma people feel around their mental illness is something that often silences them. But Bekah thinks that this issue is bigger than we want to recognize, and it should be something we discuss on a big level. Her **[Facebook post](https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10207864868406352&set=a.1720209891802.2101869.1434946208&type=1&fref=nf)** has been shared over 350,000 times and has over 42,000 comments, most of which express a great deal of support, gratitude and love for Bekah’s message and goal. Bekah’s tattoo might just be a little bit of ink etched into her left leg, but for her and millions of others around the world, it represents the war that they wage every day of their life. It represents the pain and suffering of people who are silently crying out for help, unsure of how to get the help they need and feeling shamed because of how they feel. Thank you Bekah for having the courage to bring up a topic that needs to be talked about, but rarely is.
posts.html:
Photo Credit: Bekah Miles

Mental illness is something that is quite prominent all over the world, but rarely discussed on a serious level.

General attitudes and behaviors surrounding mental illness are testament to how little people actually understand about the different mental illnesses affecting such a large portion of the population–which turns out to be around 44 million people in the U.S. alone (or one out of every five adults).

This is largely due to the fact that most people suffering from mental illness don’t feel comfortable talking about it with friends and family. “I’m fine” is the go-to phrase and attitude, when in reality, ‘fine’ is the last word they’d choose to describe how they’re feeling.

20-year-old Bekah Miles wanted to start a conversation about her mental illness, and decided the best way to go about doing so was getting a tattoo that adequately describes her every day struggles.

The tattoo rests on the lower part of her left thigh and reads, in a beautiful handwritten typeface, “I’m fine.” That’s what everyone looking at the tattoo will see, but what Bekah sees, as she looks down at it from her perspective, are the words “Save me.”

Bekah of course wanted to show off her tattoo, but she also decided to finally open up about her mental illness and the difficulty it places on her life every day.

“Today, I am coming out with something that only few of you know,” Bekah wrote. “I am ready to have a conversation about my mental illness.”

While Bekah’s depression has been with her for years, an actual diagnosis was given to her just last year, after she was so depressed she could barely function on a normal level.

“So today, I got this tattoo,” Bekah continues. “..When everyone else sees it, they see ‘I’m fine,’ but from my viewpoint, it reads ‘save me.’ To me, it means that others see this person that seems okay, but, in reality, is not okay at all. It reminds me that people who may appear happy, [sic] may be at battle with themselves.”

Bekah’s whole reasoning behind getting this tattoo is so that it will serve as somewhat of an icebreaker in social settings, saying:

“[The tattoo] forces me to talk about my own struggle, and why the awareness of it is important. You’d be surprised by how many people YOU know that struggle with depression, anxiety, or other mental illness. I may only be one person, but one can save another… and that’s all I could really ask for.”

The stigma people feel around their mental illness is something that often silences them. But Bekah thinks that this issue is bigger than we want to recognize, and it should be something we discuss on a big level. Her Facebook post has been shared over 350,000 times and has over 42,000 comments, most of which express a great deal of support, gratitude and love for Bekah’s message and goal.

Bekah’s tattoo might just be a little bit of ink etched into her left leg, but for her and millions of others around the world, it represents the war that they wage every day of their life. It represents the pain and suffering of people who are silently crying out for help, unsure of how to get the help they need and feeling shamed because of how they feel.

Thank you Bekah for having the courage to bring up a topic that needs to be talked about, but rarely is.

posts.title: The Top 5 Most Spritual Places That Exist on Earth
posts.markdown: Have you ever had strange and unusual dreams when sleeping somewhere other than your home? Maybe you’ve stumbled across a certain area where you’ve experienced feelings you cannot describe or had a sudden jolt of clarity. There are certain places all over the world that are chock-full of energy. This type of concentrated energy can have profound effects on the people who bask in it, sometimes providing answers to questions you’ve had for years. Here are five of these places that we think harbor some of the most concentrated energy on Earth: **Rila, Bulgaria** The entire region of Rila has been seen to possess a great deal of energy. Specifically, the mountain ranges. Great spiritual master (and local Bulgarian), Beinsa Duno, is said to have instilled Rila with endless wisdom. People have reported feeling this energy numerous times, claiming to have strange dreams when sleeping in the area. ![](https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-LI5T-2CUQiI/V6mjK98cKgI/AAAAAAAAFvE/Qn4JretIoHE8_z2_QAHa9GrrXin0vIC4ACLcB/s640/Rila-%2BBulgaria.JPG) ![](https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1Kk3Zj1qTps/V6mjdh8o9ZI/AAAAAAAAFvI/71eZmjB5YyoHbXN2J_lyeLI5E3hKTjUTgCLcB/s640/Rila-%2BBulgaria_00.JPG) **Machu Picchu, Peru** This famous lost Incan city has been said to harbor one of the greatest energies in the world. Its location is specific. Incans built the city high in the Andes Mountains, where the energy levels are greatest. People visiting this area describe the experience as something not of this world. ![](https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-T7aCdmFme3A/V6mjrWxtFrI/AAAAAAAAFvM/8I6KLMENHTwk4Z4WWhTg4UhCwQJp0wovQCLcB/s640/Machu%2BPicchu%2Bin%2BPeru.JPG) ![](https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9lIFyPqLmO0/V6mj47LrLVI/AAAAAAAAFvU/17c_g5SbtJ8xeuav9EZCPBb70UQ2V4p0gCLcB/s640/Machu%2BPicchu%2Bin%2BPeru_00.JPG) **Socotra** Often described as “the most alien place on Earth,” Socotra consists of four small island in the Indian Ocean, just off the Horn of Africa. The biggest island of the four makes up about 95 percent of the archipelago. What makes this planet so alien? Its landscape features flora and fauna that look nothing like anything else on Earth. And that’s because about 30 percent of the plant life found on the islands doesn’t exist anywhere else on Earth. The energy found in this foreign-looking world is so strong that it has been said to connect humans to the rest of the cosmos. ![](https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Y1EZw41P2ng/V6m4eAL43kI/AAAAAAAAFvo/QRt1eNU4hqcU-Wi8UOWRhbWYeFgUYycAgCLcB/s640/Socotra.JPG) ![](https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-BQQpv5Ek3C0/V6m4107j85I/AAAAAAAAFvs/X67FSYuijkwFxBxRKoQnbh-0aZmH8-pdwCLcB/s640/Socotra_01.JPG) ![](https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CDZ0tOhx-nc/V6m5FMJcNWI/AAAAAAAAFvw/TXDR50-_VLo1XDnfBJMeJ5CiIWoFDR_QgCLcB/s640/Socotra_02.JPG) **Easter Island** You’ve most likely heard about Easter Island because of its notoriously large stone statues. The statues are shrouded in mystery, as scientists have no idea who made them or why. They’ve also found 53 stone houses without windows or doors. However, it is the “Navel of the World” that is most mysterious about Easter Island. The circular stone that holds this title is believed to possess secrets of the cosmos, as it collects spiritual energies from the Earth. ![](https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-CTByhYW2EsA/V6m5ylGRK2I/AAAAAAAAFwE/jRVQa9ThvdgUSnjHERY1X9OSISkJEahWgCLcB/s640/The%2BEaster%2BIsland.JPG) **The Bosnian Pyramids** Radio-carbon dating places the Bosnian Pyramids thousands of years before the creation of the Egyptian pyramids. In fact, they appear to be about 13,000 years old. Researchers discovered that three rooms and a small blue lake exist underneath the pyramids. The lake was found to be completely sterile and clean, with a noticeable lack of bacteria, fungi, algae, or any microorganisms. Thus, it has been given the title of “living water,” because it is believed to purify the body. This suggests that the three rooms are “healing rooms.” ![](https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-vvSo2oGxU9A/V6m7hss1hUI/AAAAAAAAFws/PrCdQjrtI1UiaCF-5l6KcfHN344BplRRgCLcB/s640/The%2BBosnian%2BPyramids.JPG) ![](https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mNGKwGByKRg/V6m7sO2leNI/AAAAAAAAFww/Dv5Dlei-x_oPkYULM9FsfPc8qrpzqdtBACLcB/s640/The%2BBosnian%2BPyramids_00.jpg)
posts.html:
Have you ever had strange and unusual dreams when sleeping somewhere other than your home? Maybe you’ve stumbled across a certain area where you’ve experienced feelings you cannot describe or had a sudden jolt of clarity.

There are certain places all over the world that are chock-full of energy. This type of concentrated energy can have profound effects on the people who bask in it, sometimes providing answers to questions you’ve had for years.

Here are five of these places that we think harbor some of the most concentrated energy on Earth:

Rila, Bulgaria

The entire region of Rila has been seen to possess a great deal of energy. Specifically, the mountain ranges. Great spiritual master (and local Bulgarian), Beinsa Duno, is said to have instilled Rila with endless wisdom. People have reported feeling this energy numerous times, claiming to have strange dreams when sleeping in the area.

Machu Picchu, Peru

This famous lost Incan city has been said to harbor one of the greatest energies in the world. Its location is specific. Incans built the city high in the Andes Mountains, where the energy levels are greatest. People visiting this area describe the experience as something not of this world.

Socotra

Often described as “the most alien place on Earth,” Socotra consists of four small island in the Indian Ocean, just off the Horn of Africa. The biggest island of the four makes up about 95 percent of the archipelago.

What makes this planet so alien? Its landscape features flora and fauna that look nothing like anything else on Earth. And that’s because about 30 percent of the plant life found on the islands doesn’t exist anywhere else on Earth.

The energy found in this foreign-looking world is so strong that it has been said to connect humans to the rest of the cosmos.

Easter Island

You’ve most likely heard about Easter Island because of its notoriously large stone statues. The statues are shrouded in mystery, as scientists have no idea who made them or why. They’ve also found 53 stone houses without windows or doors.

However, it is the “Navel of the World” that is most mysterious about Easter Island. The circular stone that holds this title is believed to possess secrets of the cosmos, as it collects spiritual energies from the Earth.

The Bosnian Pyramids

Radio-carbon dating places the Bosnian Pyramids thousands of years before the creation of the Egyptian pyramids. In fact, they appear to be about 13,000 years old. Researchers discovered that three rooms and a small blue lake exist underneath the pyramids.

The lake was found to be completely sterile and clean, with a noticeable lack of bacteria, fungi, algae, or any microorganisms. Thus, it has been given the title of “living water,” because it is believed to purify the body. This suggests that the three rooms are “healing rooms.”

posts.title: hcr-Scientists Claim Humans Possess A ‘Magnetic 6th Sense’ to Detect An Unseeable Force
posts.markdown: Dubbed ‘magnetoreception,’ this word is being used by scientists to describe one’s efficacy to perceive magnetic forces and fields. The concept is not entirely new, however, as numerous other animals have been found to use magnetoreception; primarily as a means to navigate long distances using only the Earth’s magnetic field as a guide. Among the list of animals that use magnetoreception are sea turtles, honey bees, dolphins, and lobsters. Each of these creatures possesses an inherent magnetic compass that aids in their navigation of the world around them. Unfortunately, that is pretty much all we know about the phenomena. How this internal magnetic compass gets used, how it senses magnetic fields, and what information is gathered by doing so, are all areas of speculation at this point. Joe Kirschvink, a geophysicist at the California Institute of Technology who is [currently studying humans and their magnetic sense](http://news.nationalpost.com/news/world/its-part-of-our-evolutionary-history-american-scientist-thinks-hes-found-a-sixth-sense-in-humans), says, “it’s part of our evolutionary history. Magnetoreception may be the primal sense.” Kirschvink’s study, which can be found in *Nature Communications*, posits that there is a specific protein found in the human retina that can detect magnetic fields when inserted into fruit flies. The research shows that this protein clearly serves as a magneto sensor, but there is no certainty that humans actually use it for such a purpose. “It poses the question, ‘maybe we should rethink about this [sixth sense](http://www.livescience.com/5083-cows-strange-sixth-sense.html),’” University of Massachusetts Medical School researcher Steven Reppert told [LiveScience](http://www.livescience.com/14694-humans-sixth-sense-magnetic-fields.html). “It is thought to be very important for how animals migrate. Perhaps this protein is also fulfilling an important function for sensing magnetic fields in humans.” If we look at past [scientific literature](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3833489/) surrounding this area of study, [we can see](https://www.crcpress.com/Bioelectromagnetic-and-Subtle-Energy-Medicine-Second-Edition/Rosch/p/book/9781482233193) that numerous studies have found a distinct connection between the collective behaviors of people on a global scale and solar and geomagnetic activity. It’s even been seen that disturbances of these fields can be responsible for detrimental health effects and behaviors of humans. [This data](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9783072) suggests that, [somehow](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/8199794), major parts of the human body, like the brain, cardiovascular system and nervous system, [resonate with geomagnetic frequencies](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/5784247_Solar_activity_revolutions_and_cultural_prime_in_the_history_of_mankind). For example, if the Earth’s magnetic field is somehow disrupted on a major level, it leads to health problems in humans, such as trouble sleeping, emotional confusion, feeling more tired than usual, or feeling overwhelmed for no reason at all. What’s cool is that there’s also been evidence that we are not only influenced by these magnetic fields, but are capable of influencing the fields ourselves. It’s a two-way street. Just as we accept information, we can also upload it, in a sense. One great example of this is [the human heart](https://www.amazon.ca/Heart-Intelligence-Connecting-Intuitive-Guidance/dp/1943625433). The human heart has its own electromagnetic field, and it fluctuates according to the different emotions we’re feeling at the time. These fluctuations have been measured and found to exist up to several feet outside the human body itself. *“Human emotions and consciousness interact with and encode information into the geomagnetic field and this information is distributed globally. . . . We are suggesting in essence that this encoded information is communicated nonlocally between people at a subconscious level, in effect linking all living systems. Magnetic fields act as carrier waves for this information, which can influence all living systems – positively or negatively – within the field environment as well as our collective consciousness.”* While research into this field is still in its earliest stages, the implications of what they’ve found are huge. It only serves to reaffirm the idea that our attitudes, emotions, thoughts, and intentions all [affect the world around us](https://www.collective-evolution.com/2014/11/24/what-science-is-telling-us-about-the-hearts-intuitive-intelligence/) on some level. It suggests that we can collectively change the world for the better by collectively focusing on love, gratitude and understanding. And that’s something we can all get on board with. http://www.collective-evolution.com/2016/07/07/scientists-discover-that-humans-have-a-magnetic-6th-sense-to-detect-something-we-cant-even-see/
posts.html:
Dubbed ‘magnetoreception,’ this word is being used by scientists to describe one’s efficacy to perceive magnetic forces and fields. The concept is not entirely new, however, as numerous other animals have been found to use magnetoreception; primarily as a means to navigate long distances using only the Earth’s magnetic field as a guide.

Among the list of animals that use magnetoreception are sea turtles, honey bees, dolphins, and lobsters. Each of these creatures possesses an inherent magnetic compass that aids in their navigation of the world around them.

Unfortunately, that is pretty much all we know about the phenomena. How this internal magnetic compass gets used, how it senses magnetic fields, and what information is gathered by doing so, are all areas of speculation at this point.

Joe Kirschvink, a geophysicist at the California Institute of Technology who is currently studying humans and their magnetic sense, says, “it’s part of our evolutionary history. Magnetoreception may be the primal sense.”

Kirschvink’s study, which can be found in Nature Communications, posits that there is a specific protein found in the human retina that can detect magnetic fields when inserted into fruit flies. The research shows that this protein clearly serves as a magneto sensor, but there is no certainty that humans actually use it for such a purpose.

“It poses the question, ‘maybe we should rethink about this sixth sense,’” University of Massachusetts Medical School researcher Steven Reppert told LiveScience.

“It is thought to be very important for how animals migrate. Perhaps this protein is also fulfilling an important function for sensing magnetic fields in humans.”

If we look at past scientific literature surrounding this area of study, we can see that numerous studies have found a distinct connection between the collective behaviors of people on a global scale and solar and geomagnetic activity. It’s even been seen that disturbances of these fields can be responsible for detrimental health effects and behaviors of humans.

This data suggests that, somehow, major parts of the human body, like the brain, cardiovascular system and nervous system, resonate with geomagnetic frequencies. For example, if the Earth’s magnetic field is somehow disrupted on a major level, it leads to health problems in humans, such as trouble sleeping, emotional confusion, feeling more tired than usual, or feeling overwhelmed for no reason at all.

What’s cool is that there’s also been evidence that we are not only influenced by these magnetic fields, but are capable of influencing the fields ourselves. It’s a two-way street. Just as we accept information, we can also upload it, in a sense.

One great example of this is the human heart. The human heart has its own electromagnetic field, and it fluctuates according to the different emotions we’re feeling at the time. These fluctuations have been measured and found to exist up to several feet outside the human body itself.

“Human emotions and consciousness interact with and encode information into the geomagnetic field and this information is distributed globally. . . . We are suggesting in essence that this encoded information is communicated nonlocally between people at a subconscious level, in effect linking all living systems. Magnetic fields act as carrier waves for this information, which can influence all living systems – positively or negatively – within the field environment as well as our collective consciousness.”

While research into this field is still in its earliest stages, the implications of what they’ve found are huge. It only serves to reaffirm the idea that our attitudes, emotions, thoughts, and intentions all affect the world around us on some level. It suggests that we can collectively change the world for the better by collectively focusing on love, gratitude and understanding.

And that’s something we can all get on board with.

http://www.collective-evolution.com/2016/07/07/scientists-discover-that-humans-have-a-magnetic-6th-sense-to-detect-something-we-cant-even-see/

posts.title: 99-Year-Old Lady Made 1,000 Dresses for African Children
posts.markdown: Lillian Weber isn’t your average old lady. Not only has she lived almost 100 years on this planet, but her favorite pastime is helping out people in need. Weber spends much of her free time sewing dresses for children in Africa. The charity that Weber works through is called **“[Little Dresses for Africa](http://www.littledressesforafrica.org/blog/about/)**,” and the organization is responsible for doing much more than just providing clothing. They also help in the construction of schools and find wells to dig to provide drinking water. ![99-Year-Old Woman Sews 1,000 Dresses For African Children](https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6t0pjwsbP_w/VSvQdZgn4VI/AAAAAAAAJYY/BtFZU2SvseA/s1600/99-Year-Old%2BWoman%2BSews%2B1%2C000%2BDresses%2BFor%2BAfrican%2BChildren.jpg "99-Year-Old Woman Sews 1,000 Dresses For African Children") Weber’s goal was to sew at least 1,000 dresses by the time she turned 100 years old. And Weber crushed her goal, completing all 1,000 dresses well before her birthday. “Nine times out of ten, they always say, “Well old people don’t do anything,” but they do,” **[Weber told reporters](http://wqad.com/2015/03/12/99-year-old-woman-reaches-goal-of-making-1000th-dress-before-her-100th-birthday/http://wqad.com/2015/03/12/99-year-old-woman-reaches-goal-of-making-1000th-dress-before-her-100th-birthday/http://wqad.com/2015/03/12/99-year-old-woman-reaches-goal-of-making-1000th-dress-before-her-100th-birthday/)**. “And as soon as I get this one done, I’ll probably go to the next one.”
posts.html:
Lillian Weber isn’t your average old lady. Not only has she lived almost 100 years on this planet, but her favorite pastime is helping out people in need. Weber spends much of her free time sewing dresses for children in Africa.

The charity that Weber works through is called “Little Dresses for Africa,” and the organization is responsible for doing much more than just providing clothing. They also help in the construction of schools and find wells to dig to provide drinking water.

Weber’s goal was to sew at least 1,000 dresses by the time she turned 100 years old. And Weber crushed her goal, completing all 1,000 dresses well before her birthday.

“Nine times out of ten, they always say, “Well old people don’t do anything,” but they do,” Weber told reporters.

“And as soon as I get this one done, I’ll probably go to the next one.”

posts.title: Homeless Get Renewed Dignity from Old Truck Turned Into Mobile Shower Unit
posts.markdown: It was always interesting to me to see the differences between big cities and small towns. I’ve lived in both, and have come to prefer towns simply because of the sense of community and friendliness that people exude without even trying. In cities, there are so many people around you that to say “hi” to each and every one of them would take all day, so practically no one talks to each other. So, imagine how a homeless person feels living in the big city. Not only do most people ignore them, but most people aren’t exactly sure what they need even if they wanted to help. Basics like food, water, money, and even clothes are willingly handed out, but no one ever thinks that they might just want to shower and clean themselves up a bit. Personal hygiene is just as as important as all of those other things, if not more so. Unfortunately, homeless folks don’t often have access to facilities that provide amenities like soap, clean water and a safe area to wash one’s self. Which was the motivation behind Jake Austin’s rolling shower unit that he’s dubbed, “[Shower to the People](http://www.showertothepeoplestl.org/).” For years, Austin has been actively involved in helping the homeless community in St. Louis, Missouri, but it was only just recently that he devised the mobile shower unit plan. Purchasing the truck for around $5,000 on Craigslist, Austin worked on transforming it into rolling washroom, one that he could take around the city to provide a bit of personal hygiene to those in need. A look inside quickly reveals a welcoming picture. Two shower stalls with curtains, a row of sinks, and free shower supplies make this truck quite a blessing to those in need. For water, the truck utilizes local fire hydrants and warms it using a generator. “Good hygiene promotes health, fosters hope, and restores dignity to those who may have lost it,” explains Austin. *You can learn more by visiting social media: [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ShowertothePeopleOFFICIAL/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sttpstl) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/showertothepeoplestl/) | [ShowertothepeopleSTL.org](http://www.showertothepeoplestl.org/)* ![truck-converted-mobile-shower-homeless-jake-austin-5](http://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/truck-converted-mobile-shower-homeless-jake-austin-5.jpg)     ![truck-converted-mobile-shower-homeless-jake-austin-2](http://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/truck-converted-mobile-shower-homeless-jake-austin-2.jpg)

It was always interesting to me to see the differences between big cities and small towns. I’ve lived in both, and have come to prefer towns simply because of the sense of community and friendliness that people exude without even trying. In cities, there are so many people around you that to say “hi” to each and every one of them would take all day, so practically no one talks to each other.

So, imagine how a homeless person feels living in the big city. Not only do most people ignore them, but most people aren’t exactly sure what they need even if they wanted to help. Basics like food, water, money, and even clothes are willingly handed out, but no one ever thinks that they might just want to shower and clean themselves up a bit.

Personal hygiene is just as as important as all of those other things, if not more so. Unfortunately, homeless folks don’t often have access to facilities that provide amenities like soap, clean water and a safe area to wash one’s self.

Which was the motivation behind Jake Austin’s rolling shower unit that he’s dubbed, “Shower to the People.”

For years, Austin has been actively involved in helping the homeless community in St. Louis, Missouri, but it was only just recently that he devised the mobile shower unit plan. Purchasing the truck for around $5,000 on Craigslist, Austin worked on transforming it into rolling washroom, one that he could take around the city to provide a bit of personal hygiene to those in need.

A look inside quickly reveals a welcoming picture. Two shower stalls with curtains, a row of sinks, and free shower supplies make this truck quite a blessing to those in need. For water, the truck utilizes local fire hydrants and warms it using a generator.

“Good hygiene promotes health, fosters hope, and restores dignity to those who may have lost it,” explains Austin.

You can learn more by visiting social media: Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | ShowertothepeopleSTL.org

posts.title: Get Ready For A Major Shift, Full Moon in Aquarius, 18th August
posts.markdown:
### Full moon in Aquarius 18th August 2016 (9:28 a.m. UT) 26 degrees ### **The love revolution!** **This full moon in Aquarius is on the edge of an eclipse as well as taking part in a rare Yod or “Finger of God” constellation.** **It is the beginning of an eclipse cycle that is ushering us into a new and transformative life-changing phase at immense speed, taking us to our next evolutionary level by the end of September 2016.** ** The next and strongest eclipse is on the 1st September and will culminate at the last eclipse on the 16th September.** The focal point of this full moon is the rare “Finger of God” constellation. A finger of God shows a special life transforming mission. **We are presently in the midst of a karmic mission on both a collective and personal level.** With the Full Moon, Uranus and Mercury taking part in the formation. Mercury is at the top with Jupiter and Venus on either side, while the Moon and Uranus form the base. It looks rather like a pyramid. The energies of the Full Moon and the ruler of the Full Moon the planet Uranus, are pushing forcefully and powerfully for release through Mercury at the top, which is conjoined by Jupiter and Venus. Mercury rules our rational mind and communication; Jupiter is the planet of expansiveness, truth seeking and bringer of joy and fortune. Venus is the planet of love and harmony. Both the new moon in humanitarian, free-thinking and free-spirited Aquarius and the ruler of Aquarius,Uranus the revolutionary bringer of change, are taking part in the finger of God constellation as well as positively aspecting the Sun in Leo. And together With Venus who is the closest planet to the north node of fate, **the collective karmic, overall message for Mankind, is loud and clear:** **This is a revolution of love!** **We have a chance to revolutionise the way we think, live and love. With Jupiter in opposition to Chiron promising a rare chance to heal past hurts into happiness,joy and abundance.** The Moon in humanitarian Aquarius is heralding in a new phase. A chance for mankind to heal collectively and to find new and innovative ways to heal social injustices and bring in a new and fairer social order for many and not just a few. **With the planet of communication at the focal point of the yod, the voices will become louder and clearer.** Together with Jupiter, Venus and Chiron our capacity to love and empathise is being expanded. With truth being the basis on which all else is built. Jupiter in opposition to Chiron is giving us the chance to heal past wounds within ourselves and in our relationships, to become the wise wounded healer. Infusing optimism, joy and hope into our lives and the lives of others. **We are no longer prepared to settle for less than we know we deserve.** **We will see an ever bigger and growing movement of people coming together to make a difference, becoming part of the love and healing movement.** The loud and clear message of the full moon in Aquarius as well as Uranus the ruler of Aquarius that is in aspect to the next two eclipses, is that we are being ushered in a new phase for humanity. In preparation for the intensifying of the Aquarian age in 2020, when first Saturn enters Aquarius and then Pluto and will stay in  Aquarius until 2044. ** We are beginning to see a more innovative, far-reaching vision for a better world and for Mankind.** **On a personal level, a pivotal change and major shift in awareness towards your relationships and love can take place now and in the coming weeks.** A change that will set the stage and foundation for better and happier relationships. To yourself (self-love) and others. **Venus is conjunct the north node of fate.This aspect can bring new people and loves into your life as well as stepping up the happiness and commitment level of present relationships.** After having learnt so much about how we live in delusion and fear, with a lack of real commitment to our ideas and perception of love, as well as towards our creative talents and passions in life.(Neptune in opposition to Venus conjunct south node, square Saturn) **We are ready now, to evolve to a higher level of awareness in our relationships as well as to ourselves.** Pluto trine Venus is giving us the passion, confidence as well as strength and determination to turn our dreams into reality. Passions and desires are running high and Pluto trine Venus and the nodes of fate, make “fated” attractions and “soul mate” connections possible this week. As well as the ever stronger realisation, that the one you are with, is indeed your “soul mate”, helping to further deepen your bond and commitment. **We are being pushed to evolve and out of our comfort zones by the Mars- Saturn conjunction in Sagittarius square Neptune.** Venus in Virgo now emerging out of the Saturn-Neptune square, has helped us reassess our critical, perfectionistic ideals (Neptune) that have blinded us to our beauty within. Quite possibly the one we have been searching for is already standing right before our very eyes. **The Sun in Leo is making a positive trine to Uranus. We feel the evolutionary urge to embrace change. We can feel inspired and creative and have a heightened sense of our own special uniqueness.** We know there are no set given rules or solutions or paths to take, only the ones that we create for our own special life path, purpose and special individuality. **We can gain a real sense now, of where and how, our future path to happiness lies.** It’s up to us to take responsibility and action (Mars- Saturn) and co-create the lives that we want, now. **The Sun in Leo wants to celebrate that there is only one special version of you. To be proud of who you are.** **It’s time to take centre stage and shine!** >
**“Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.” Mother Teresa**
[Vivienne Micallef-Browne](https://empowerastrology.org/2016/08/16/the-love-revolution-full-moon-in-aquarius-18th-august/)
[https://empowerastrology.org/](https://empowerastrology.org/)

The love revolution!

This full moon in Aquarius is on the edge of an eclipse as well as taking part in a rare Yod or “Finger of God” constellation.

It is the beginning of an eclipse cycle that is ushering us into a new and transformative life-changing phase at immense speed, taking us to our next evolutionary level by the end of September 2016.

The next and strongest eclipse is on the 1st September and will culminate at the last eclipse on the 16th September.

The focal point of this full moon is the rare “Finger of God” constellation. A finger of God shows a special life transforming mission.

We are presently in the midst of a karmic mission on both a collective and personal level.

With the Full Moon, Uranus and Mercury taking part in the formation. Mercury is at the top with Jupiter and Venus on either side, while the Moon and Uranus form the base. It looks rather like a pyramid.

The energies of the Full Moon and the ruler of the Full Moon the planet Uranus, are pushing forcefully and powerfully for release through Mercury at the top, which is conjoined by Jupiter and Venus.

Mercury rules our rational mind and communication; Jupiter is the planet of expansiveness, truth seeking and bringer of joy and fortune. Venus is the planet of love and harmony.

Both the new moon in humanitarian, free-thinking and free-spirited Aquarius and the ruler of Aquarius,Uranus the revolutionary bringer of change, are taking part in the finger of God constellation as well as positively aspecting the Sun in Leo.

And together With Venus who is the closest planet to the north node of fate,

the collective karmic, overall message for Mankind, is loud and clear:

This is a revolution of love!

We have a chance to revolutionise the way we think, live and love. With Jupiter in opposition to Chiron promising a rare chance to heal past hurts into happiness,joy and abundance.

The Moon in humanitarian Aquarius is heralding in a new phase. A chance for mankind to heal collectively and to find new and innovative ways to heal social injustices and bring in a new and fairer social order for many and not just a few.

With the planet of communication at the focal point of the yod, the voices will become louder and clearer.

Together with Jupiter, Venus and Chiron our capacity to love and empathise is being expanded. With truth being the basis on which all else is built. Jupiter in opposition to Chiron is giving us the chance to heal past wounds within ourselves and in our relationships, to become the wise wounded healer. Infusing optimism, joy and hope into our lives and the lives of others.

We are no longer prepared to settle for less than we know we deserve.

We will see an ever bigger and growing movement of people coming together to make a difference, becoming part of the love and healing movement.

The loud and clear message of the full moon in Aquarius as well as Uranus the ruler of Aquarius that is in aspect to the next two eclipses, is that we are being ushered in a new phase for humanity. In preparation for the intensifying of the Aquarian age in 2020, when first Saturn enters Aquarius and then Pluto and will stay in  Aquarius until 2044.

We are beginning to see a more innovative, far-reaching vision for a better world and for Mankind.

On a personal level, a pivotal change and major shift in awareness towards your relationships and love can take place now and in the coming weeks.

A change that will set the stage and foundation for better and happier relationships. To yourself (self-love) and others.

Venus is conjunct the north node of fate.This aspect can bring new people and loves into your life as well as stepping up the happiness and commitment level of present relationships.

After having learnt so much about how we live in delusion and fear, with a lack of real commitment to our ideas and perception of love, as well as towards our creative talents and passions in life.(Neptune in opposition to Venus conjunct south node, square Saturn)

We are ready now, to evolve to a higher level of awareness in our relationships as well as to ourselves.

Pluto trine Venus is giving us the passion, confidence as well as strength and determination to turn our dreams into reality.

Passions and desires are running high and Pluto trine Venus and the nodes of fate, make “fated” attractions and “soul mate” connections possible this week.
As well as the ever stronger realisation, that the one you are with, is indeed your “soul mate”, helping to further deepen your bond and commitment.

We are being pushed to evolve and out of our comfort zones by the Mars- Saturn conjunction in Sagittarius square Neptune.

Venus in Virgo now emerging out of the Saturn-Neptune square, has helped us reassess our critical, perfectionistic ideals (Neptune) that have blinded us to our beauty within. Quite possibly the one we have been searching for is already standing right before our very eyes.

The Sun in Leo is making a positive trine to Uranus. We feel the evolutionary urge to embrace change. We can feel inspired and creative and have a heightened sense of our own special uniqueness.

We know there are no set given rules or solutions or paths to take, only the ones that we create for our own special life path, purpose and special individuality.

We can gain a real sense now, of where and how, our future path to happiness lies.

It’s up to us to take responsibility and action (Mars- Saturn) and co-create the lives that we want, now.

The Sun in Leo wants to celebrate that there is only one special version of you. To be proud of who you are.

It’s time to take centre stage and shine!

“Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.” Mother Teresa
Vivienne Micallef-Browne
