posts.title: This Is What Spicy Food Is Really Doing To Your Health
posts.markdown: When it comes to cuisine, spiciness is a preference that is unique to everyone. Like my roommate and I for example: whenever we get Thai food, he gets “Thai-hot,” which is basically as spicy as you can make the food. Me? I like a nice medium or regular-hot spice level. Too much, and I start to sweat and my mouth sets on fire. I will say that, while I don’t like my food to be too spicy, I will typically pick a spicy food over a non-spicy food. And apparently**[ the rest of the country has the same tendency](https://www.qsrmagazine.com/menu-innovations/kick-it-notch)**. Consumer Flavor Trend found in a 2013 report that about 54 percent of Americans prefer hot or spicy foods, which includes different condiments, sauces and dips, as well. This number has risen steadily over the years: only 48 percent enjoyed spicy foods in 2011, and 46 percent two years prior to that. These numbers might not mean much by themselves, but a new study out of China has discovered that spicy foods might actually increase our life expectancy. The survey researchers studied had data from over 500,000 Chinese citizens which had been collected from 2004 to 2008. The survey featured questions about their diets; it also prompted people to note how much chili they consumed per week. Checking back in with their participants seven years later, researchers discovered that people who ate spicy foods at least once a week were 10 percent less likely to die. That number rose to 14 percent if the individual ate spicy foods at least three to seven times each week. “We know something about the beneficial effects of spicy foods basically from animal studies and very small-sized human studies,” associate professor at the Harvard School of Public Health, Lu Qi, told **[*Time*](http://time.com/3984274/spicy-food-chili-peppers/).** Past research has found that **[capsaicin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capsaicin)**, the active component in most spicy dishes, has ties to decreased risks of cancer and heart and respiratory diseases. Other benefits include positive effects on the metabolism, on one’s weight and on the bacteria in our stomachs. “It appears that increasing your intake moderately, just to one to two or three to five times a week, shows a very similar protective effect,” Qi said. “Just increase moderately. That’s maybe enough.” So, it might be beneficial to keep a bottle of Tabasco or Cholula handy at all times, just to give your food that extra spicy, healthy kick that it needs. As long as you’re not downing a bottle each night, it might just help you live longer.
posts.html:
When it comes to cuisine, spiciness is a preference that is unique to everyone. Like my roommate and I for example: whenever we get Thai food, he gets “Thai-hot,” which is basically as spicy as you can make the food. Me? I like a nice medium or regular-hot spice level. Too much, and I start to sweat and my mouth sets on fire.

I will say that, while I don’t like my food to be too spicy, I will typically pick a spicy food over a non-spicy food. And apparently the rest of the country has the same tendency.

Consumer Flavor Trend found in a 2013 report that about 54 percent of Americans prefer hot or spicy foods, which includes different condiments, sauces and dips, as well.

This number has risen steadily over the years: only 48 percent enjoyed spicy foods in 2011, and 46 percent two years prior to that.

These numbers might not mean much by themselves, but a new study out of China has discovered that spicy foods might actually increase our life expectancy.

The survey researchers studied had data from over 500,000 Chinese citizens which had been collected from 2004 to 2008. The survey featured questions about their diets; it also prompted people to note how much chili they consumed per week.

Checking back in with their participants seven years later, researchers discovered that people who ate spicy foods at least once a week were 10 percent less likely to die. That number rose to 14 percent if the individual ate spicy foods at least three to seven times each week.

“We know something about the beneficial effects of spicy foods basically from animal studies and very small-sized human studies,” associate professor at the Harvard School of Public Health, Lu Qi, told Time.

Past research has found that capsaicin, the active component in most spicy dishes, has ties to decreased risks of cancer and heart and respiratory diseases. Other benefits include positive effects on the metabolism, on one’s weight and on the bacteria in our stomachs.

“It appears that increasing your intake moderately, just to one to two or three to five times a week, shows a very similar protective effect,” Qi said.

“Just increase moderately. That’s maybe enough.”

So, it might be beneficial to keep a bottle of Tabasco or Cholula handy at all times, just to give your food that extra spicy, healthy kick that it needs. As long as you’re not downing a bottle each night, it might just help you live longer.

posts.title: hcr07 Symbols You Should Be Looking For in Your Dreams
posts.markdown: 7 Symbols You Should Pay Attention To When You Dream 7 Dream Symbols to Look for Once You’ve Fallen Asleep Dream world is a place where unusual and bizarre happenings don’t even make us think twice. Fantasy and nonsensical things happen regularly without question, but there is something to be taken away from certain things that you see. If you’re dreaming of certain objects or symbols, they could hold hidden meanings. Look for these seven symbols when you find yourself in dreamland: **Boxes** If you start seeing boxes in dreamworld, it’s a good sign that you feel something is being hidden from you. Empty boxes symbolize emotions of disappointment, and a large number of boxes can mean that you’re struggling with your emotions and want to stash them somewhere else. **Phones** If there’s a phone ringing in your dream, it can mean that certain personality traits of yours are starting to come into alignment with your being. If a phone is ringing and you choose not to answer it, it can mean that you want to ignore any messages or insights that you are trying to send yourself. **Flying** If you find yourself flying through the air in your dream, it’s a good sign that the dream has become lucid. Lucid dreams often happen when your subconscious is trying to reach you. Flying is symbolic of challenges or obstacles you’re working to overcome in real life. **The Moon** Any dreams that have the moon in them can be indicative of a hidden creativity that is eager to be let out. **Roads** Different types of roads can mean different things. Easy-going, paved, clean roads indicate that you feel the journey ahead of you will be relatively easy. But, if the road is dark, hard to see and you struggle navigating it, it can mean that you’re afraid of what’s to come. **Flowers** Flowers and plants can mean different things when you spot them in your dreams. If flowers are budding, it’s a sign that opportunity is just around the corner. If the flowers are dying or wilting, it can be a sign that this chapter of life is coming to an end. If you see little sproutlings, it can mean that any seeds you’ve planted are about to grow. **Water** Water takes many forms, but they often reflect how ambitious you are in life. Dreams about the ocean can mean that you’re ready to take advantage of grand opportunities by taking a few risks. If you’re dreaming of shallow bodies of water, it can mean that you’re focusing too much on something that is out of your reach at the moment.
posts.html:
7 Symbols You Should Pay Attention To When You Dream

7 Dream Symbols to Look for Once You’ve Fallen Asleep

Dream world is a place where unusual and bizarre happenings don’t even make us think twice. Fantasy and nonsensical things happen regularly without question, but there is something to be taken away from certain things that you see.

If you’re dreaming of certain objects or symbols, they could hold hidden meanings.

Look for these seven symbols when you find yourself in dreamland:

Boxes

If you start seeing boxes in dreamworld, it’s a good sign that you feel something is being hidden from you. Empty boxes symbolize emotions of disappointment, and a large number of boxes can mean that you’re struggling with your emotions and want to stash them somewhere else.

Phones

If there’s a phone ringing in your dream, it can mean that certain personality traits of yours are starting to come into alignment with your being. If a phone is ringing and you choose not to answer it, it can mean that you want to ignore any messages or insights that you are trying to send yourself.

Flying

If you find yourself flying through the air in your dream, it’s a good sign that the dream has become lucid. Lucid dreams often happen when your subconscious is trying to reach you. Flying is symbolic of challenges or obstacles you’re working to overcome in real life.

The Moon

Any dreams that have the moon in them can be indicative of a hidden creativity that is eager to be let out.

Roads

Different types of roads can mean different things. Easy-going, paved, clean roads indicate that you feel the journey ahead of you will be relatively easy. But, if the road is dark, hard to see and you struggle navigating it, it can mean that you’re afraid of what’s to come.

Flowers

Flowers and plants can mean different things when you spot them in your dreams. If flowers are budding, it’s a sign that opportunity is just around the corner. If the flowers are dying or wilting, it can be a sign that this chapter of life is coming to an end. If you see little sproutlings, it can mean that any seeds you’ve planted are about to grow.

Water

Water takes many forms, but they often reflect how ambitious you are in life. Dreams about the ocean can mean that you’re ready to take advantage of grand opportunities by taking a few risks.

If you’re dreaming of shallow bodies of water, it can mean that you’re focusing too much on something that is out of your reach at the moment.

posts.title: 5 Signs You Have an Intimidating Personality
posts.markdown: Just like everyone else in this world, those of us with personalities that people label as strong or “intimidating” have been shaped and influenced by the challenges of life. One of the only differences between strong personality types and others is *how* these experiences have shaped them. Oftentimes, people see those with strong personalities as intimidating because of their straightforward attitude and independent mindset. They’re usually blunt people that aren’t interested in any nonsense. While every person’s definition of strong will vary, these are five signs that you’re a person with a strong or “intimidating” personality: **You’re not a fan of small talk** Strong personality types know that intelligent conversation isn’t something that everyone wants to partake in all the time, but it’s really the only kind of conversation they’re interested in (at least in social settings). They enjoy conversing with people who are curious about the world and want to discuss matters of substance. Unfortunately, strong personality types get labeled as rude when they say this to a person’s face. At least they have the decency to be genuine. **You dislike ignorant or intolerant people** For the most part, people with strong personality types enjoy being intellectual by nature. Their natural curiosity has lead them to seek out information regarding all walks of life, so they’re usually quite knowledgeable. Because of this, they typically do not get along with people who speak before thinking or who generally have no idea what they’re talking about. Ignorance stems from having a closed mind, a notion that strong personality types want nothing to do with. **Your hard work creates opportunity** If you have a strong personality type, you know that hard work is one of the best ways to open up doors for yourself. As if the harder you worked, the better your chances became. A determined work ethic is a tool that strong people use to manifest opportunity where there otherwise would be none. They’re good at recognizing these created opportunities, and they’re going to use them to succeed, whether people are intimidated by their success or not. **You don’t like being in the spotlight** Strong personality types often carry with them behaviors, attitudes and mannerisms that most people admire. They naturally attract both good and bad people. But, at the end of the day, they’d honestly rather not have any of the attention. This also means that they’d rather put their head down and work than seek out any sort of attention. They’re only worried about finishing whatever needs to be finished. **You hate when people complain or have excuses** Excuses and complaints are just wasted energy in the eyes of the strong-willed. Strong personality types have worked through undesirable circumstances before, so they know things don’t always go the way you want them to, and they expect others to know the same. Complaining doesn’t serve anyone any good. Instead, they’d rather figure out a solution to the problem so that they can keep moving forward. Strong personalities don’t have time for anyone who’s not 100 percent invested.

They enjoy conversing with people who are curious about the world and want to discuss matters of substance.

Unfortunately, strong personality types get labeled as rude when they say this to a person’s face. At least they have the decency to be genuine.

For the most part, people with strong personality types enjoy being intellectual by nature. Their natural curiosity has lead them to seek out information regarding all walks of life, so they’re usually quite knowledgeable.

Because of this, they typically do not get along with people who speak before thinking or who generally have no idea what they’re talking about. Ignorance stems from having a closed mind, a notion that strong personality types want nothing to do with.

If you have a strong personality type, you know that hard work is one of the best ways to open up doors for yourself. As if the harder you worked, the better your chances became. A determined work ethic is a tool that strong people use to manifest opportunity where there otherwise would be none.

They’re good at recognizing these created opportunities, and they’re going to use them to succeed, whether people are intimidated by their success or not.

This also means that they’d rather put their head down and work than seek out any sort of attention. They’re only worried about finishing whatever needs to be finished.

Excuses and complaints are just wasted energy in the eyes of the strong-willed. Strong personality types have worked through undesirable circumstances before, so they know things don’t always go the way you want them to, and they expect others to know the same.

Complaining doesn’t serve anyone any good. Instead, they’d rather figure out a solution to the problem so that they can keep moving forward.

Strong personalities don’t have time for anyone who’s not 100 percent invested.

posts.title: hcr-9 Facts About Left-Handed People You Probably Never Knew
posts.markdown: 9 Facts About Left-Handed People That Almost Nobody Knows 9 Surprising and Little-Known Facts About People Who Are Left-Handed While I shoot left-handed when playing ice hockey and can swing a bat left-handed, I am mostly right-hand dominant. And, like many of us, I grew up with at least one friend who was left-handed. Do you have a friend who’s a lefty? They’re probably kinda weird, right? My left-handed friends were always weird. But, that could have all just been in my head. It turns out that left-handed people actually do have some pretty cool traits that are unique to them. Here are nine facts about left-handed people you probably never knew: 1. ****Left-handed folks can see better than right-handed folks when under water**** 2. **If you’re left-handed, you are at a greater risk for insomnia** 3. **Allergies and asthma affect left-handed people worse than right-handed people** 4. **About 30 million people in the United States are left-handed** 5. **Left-handed people are usually better at architecture** 6. **Left-handed folks exhibit a greater command of language** 7. **Women 40 years or older are much more likely to have a left-handed child** 8. **Left-handed people who graduate college are more likely to be wealthier than right-handed college grads** 9. **Out of 7 of the most recent presidents, 4 of them are left-handed** http://www.higherperspectives.com/left-handed-1546781995.html?page=2
posts.html:
9 Facts About Left-Handed People That Almost Nobody Knows

9 Surprising and Little-Known Facts About People Who Are Left-Handed

While I shoot left-handed when playing ice hockey and can swing a bat left-handed, I am mostly right-hand dominant. And, like many of us, I grew up with at least one friend who was left-handed.

Do you have a friend who’s a lefty? They’re probably kinda weird, right? My left-handed friends were always weird. But, that could have all just been in my head. It turns out that left-handed people actually do have some pretty cool traits that are unique to them.

Here are nine facts about left-handed people you probably never knew:

  1. Left-handed folks can see better than right-handed folks when under water
  2. If you’re left-handed, you are at a greater risk for insomnia
  3. Allergies and asthma affect left-handed people worse than right-handed people
  4. About 30 million people in the United States are left-handed
  5. Left-handed people are usually better at architecture
  6. Left-handed folks exhibit a greater command of language
  7. Women 40 years or older are much more likely to have a left-handed child
  8. Left-handed people who graduate college are more likely to be wealthier than right-handed college grads
  9. Out of 7 of the most recent presidents, 4 of them are left-handed

http://www.higherperspectives.com/left-handed-1546781995.html?page=2

posts.title: Research Finds: Smart People Are Usually Messy and Like to F*cking Cuss
posts.markdown: If you’re one who enjoys living with a bit of mess and also thinks that curse words only expand the vocabulary (rather than shrink it), then researchers have just discovered a bit of information you might like. The study, which has been published in *Language Sciences Journal*, discovered a distinct positive correlation between how often people used curse words and how big their vocabulary was. Or, people who cursed more often had bigger vocabularies. “Unfortunately, when it comes to taboo language, it is a common assumption that people who swear frequently are lazy, do not have an **[adequate vocabulary](http://www.bit.ly/2acL7bB)**, lack education, or simply cannot control themselves,” the report reads. “The overall finding of this set of studies, that taboo fluency is positively correlated with other measures of verbal fluency, undermines the [normal] view of swearing.” Another interesting find that researchers have come across is the effect that a messy environment has on a person’s creativity. The University of Minnesota conducted one study that had groups of people work on coming up with as many uses for a ping pong ball as possible. It was discovered that the groups were able to better brainstorm when they were in a messy workspace, rather than a clean one. The study also notes, however, that different workspaces provided benefits in different areas. Clean work environments were linked to people eating healthier and being punctual, while people who worked in messy areas were more creative than their cleanlier counterparts. Lastly, a third trait that has been linked to intelligence and critical thinking, is how late you stay up at night. *The Independent *recently published an article discussing a study out of the University of Madrid that tested their students’ sleep habits. What they found was that students who went to bed later had better inductive reasoning skills, and subsequently, were more likely to have higher intelligence, better academic performance, and a greater capacity for “out-of-the-box-thinking.” Skeptical? Famous people who were known to stay up late include: President Obama, Charles Darwin, Winston Churchill, Marcel Proust, and Keith Richards. Do any of these habits describe you? Yeah? You’re probably smarter than you think! h/t [Warped Speed](http://www.warpedspeed.com/intelligent-people-have-messy-rooms-and-talk-like-sailors/)
posts.html:
If you’re one who enjoys living with a bit of mess and also thinks that curse words only expand the vocabulary (rather than shrink it), then researchers have just discovered a bit of information you might like.

The study, which has been published in Language Sciences Journal, discovered a distinct positive correlation between how often people used curse words and how big their vocabulary was. Or, people who cursed more often had bigger vocabularies.

“Unfortunately, when it comes to taboo language, it is a common assumption that people who swear frequently are lazy, do not have an adequate vocabulary, lack education, or simply cannot control themselves,” the report reads.

“The overall finding of this set of studies, that taboo fluency is positively correlated with other measures of verbal fluency, undermines the [normal] view of swearing.”

Another interesting find that researchers have come across is the effect that a messy environment has on a person’s creativity. The University of Minnesota conducted one study that had groups of people work on coming up with as many uses for a ping pong ball as possible. It was discovered that the groups were able to better brainstorm when they were in a messy workspace, rather than a clean one.

The study also notes, however, that different workspaces provided benefits in different areas. Clean work environments were linked to people eating healthier and being punctual, while people who worked in messy areas were more creative than their cleanlier counterparts.

Lastly, a third trait that has been linked to intelligence and critical thinking, is how late you stay up at night.

The Independent recently published an article discussing a study out of the University of Madrid that tested their students’ sleep habits. What they found was that students who went to bed later had better inductive reasoning skills, and subsequently, were more likely to have higher intelligence, better academic performance, and a greater capacity for “out-of-the-box-thinking.”

Skeptical? Famous people who were known to stay up late include: President Obama, Charles Darwin, Winston Churchill, Marcel Proust, and Keith Richards.

Do any of these habits describe you? Yeah? You’re probably smarter than you think!

h/t Warped Speed

posts.title: Anything IS Possible- Facts Are Just an Illusion!
posts.markdown: By [**Andrea Schulman**](https://www.facebook.com/raiseyourvibrationtoday/?fref=ts) | [**Raise Your Vibration Today **](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/04/anything-is-possible-impossible/) This past week, I’ve relearned, yet again, a very important aspect about the [Law of Attraction](http://www.raiseyourvibrationtoday.com): Anything IS possible.  Seriously! Our realities are 100% a reflection of our belief structures. Everything that is going on in our lives exists because we believe in it. This includes the good, the bad and everything in-between. Don’t believe you can lose weight? You won’t. Don’t believe you can find a cure? You’ll be sick forever. Don’t believe you can start your own business? You’ll work for someone else your whole life. ## Facts are an illusion Our belief structures are what define what is possible in our lives. There are no facts, there are no prerequisites. Your life is simply a reflection of what you choose to believe in and focus on, and nothing more. So often, we drink the kool-aid,we buy into limitations and we take them as fact.  We honestly believe that there aren’t answers to our problems. We sincerely feel as if the limitations we experience are a foregone conclusion. For this reason, today, I ask you to think about something you’ve always wanted, but never even dared to dream for. Think about something that could drastically improve your life, but you’ve never for a second even taken the chance to imagine you could really have it. Take a moment to really ponder the statement “anything is possible,” and imagine that it really does apply to you and your life. ## What limiting beliefs have you been accepting as facts? Limitations can run deep, and even experienced practitioners of the Law of Attraction can still find they are able to unearth old limitations they’ve taken as fact. For example, this week, I found a cure to a medical issue I’ve dealt with my* entire *adult life. It’s a rather embarrassing medical issue, so for now we’ll just call it a “medical issue.” I’ll see if I can work up the courage to be a little more open about it, as it’s a cure that might benefit some of my readers as well-who knows? Anyway, I assumed I would be stuck with this issue forever, because I accepted it as a fact. I just accepted it as “the way things were.” I was taught at a young age that this was just something you’d have to live with forever, and I believed what I was told. I took this factor of my life as a foregone conclusion, just like we do factors of ourselves like our age, our gender and our eye color (which, by the way, are just other perceived limitations we accept as facts). ## Assumptions are dream killers I assumed my condition was due to my genetics, or something outside of my control. I assumed science didn’t have an answer, so every time I researched how to treat it I heard the same thing: “It never goes away.”  As a result, I decided long ago that this condition was just something I’d have in my life forever.  Since it wasn’t a terminal illness, and I was able to still live a really good life in spite of it, I just figured I’d deal with it forever.  The solution is pretty freaking amazing, and it’s really blown my mind.  The only reason I didn’t find it before? I never thought to ask for it! I ASSUMED it was incurable, and therefore in my reality, it was. ## Dare to dream already! Fortunately, though, I decided enough was enough. I know in my heart anything is possible, after all.  So I looked to the universe and said “I KNOW anything is possible, and I KNOW a cure can exist. Show it to me.” Then, almost immediately, it came to me.  Reminding myself that I believed in possibility gave me the conviction to ask for something and believe that it could be out there. So, I invite you to join me. Dare to dream, and dare to ask.  The universe is capable of delivering you anything, you just have to be willing to believe it is possible for you. Keep dreaming my friends! XO, Andrea *(Law of Attraction coach & educator)* ### Are you a student of the Law of Attraction? Sign up for my free [Law of Attraction newsletter](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.us9.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=36d05de151fc23b6dee2dd220&id=db39a47128 "subscribe") for conscious advice to help you attract positive outcomes into your life.  You can also become a member of my LOA member website and gain access to a library of video tutorials, ebooks, audiobooks and meditations.  Learn how to attract the things you want with fun, clarity and success!   Join today for as little as[ $1.99](https://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/membership-checkout/?level=1 "become a member for just $1.99!") or become an annual member for [30% in savings](https://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/membership-checkout/?level=2 "annual member"). *Article Source: This article was originally published at [Raise Your Vibration Today](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/04/anything-is-possible-impossible/) and has been reposted with permission from the author.*
posts.html:
By Andrea Schulman | Raise Your Vibration Today 

This past week, I’ve relearned, yet again, a very important aspect about the Law of Attraction: Anything IS possible.  Seriously!

Our realities are 100% a reflection of our belief structures. Everything that is going on in our lives exists because we believe in it. This includes the good, the bad and everything in-between.

Don’t believe you can lose weight? You won’t.

Don’t believe you can find a cure? You’ll be sick forever.

Don’t believe you can start your own business? You’ll work for someone else your whole life.

Facts are an illusion

Our belief structures are what define what is possible in our lives. There are no facts, there are no prerequisites. Your life is simply a reflection of what you choose to believe in and focus on, and nothing more.

So often, we drink the kool-aid,we buy into limitations and we take them as fact.  We honestly believe that there aren’t answers to our problems. We sincerely feel as if the limitations we experience are a foregone conclusion.

For this reason, today, I ask you to think about something you’ve always wanted, but never even dared to dream for.

Think about something that could drastically improve your life, but you’ve never for a second even taken the chance to imagine you could really have it.

Take a moment to really ponder the statement “anything is possible,” and imagine that it really does apply to you and your life.

What limiting beliefs have you been accepting as facts?

Limitations can run deep, and even experienced practitioners of the Law of Attraction can still find they are able to unearth old limitations they’ve taken as fact.

For example, this week, I found a cure to a medical issue I’ve dealt with my entire adult life. It’s a rather embarrassing medical issue, so for now we’ll just call it a “medical issue.” I’ll see if I can work up the courage to be a little more open about it, as it’s a cure that might benefit some of my readers as well-who knows?

Anyway, I assumed I would be stuck with this issue forever, because I accepted it as a fact. I just accepted it as “the way things were.” I was taught at a young age that this was just something you’d have to live with forever, and I believed what I was told. I took this factor of my life as a foregone conclusion, just like we do factors of ourselves like our age, our gender and our eye color (which, by the way, are just other perceived limitations we accept as facts).

Assumptions are dream killers

I assumed my condition was due to my genetics, or something outside of my control. I assumed science didn’t have an answer, so every time I researched how to treat it I heard the same thing: “It never goes away.” 

As a result, I decided long ago that this condition was just something I’d have in my life forever.  Since it wasn’t a terminal illness, and I was able to still live a really good life in spite of it, I just figured I’d deal with it forever. 

The solution is pretty freaking amazing, and it’s really blown my mind.  The only reason I didn’t find it before? I never thought to ask for it! I ASSUMED it was incurable, and therefore in my reality, it was.

Dare to dream already!

Fortunately, though, I decided enough was enough. I know in my heart anything is possible, after all.  So I looked to the universe and said “I KNOW anything is possible, and I KNOW a cure can exist. Show it to me.”

Then, almost immediately, it came to me.  Reminding myself that I believed in possibility gave me the conviction to ask for something and believe that it could be out there.

So, I invite you to join me. Dare to dream, and dare to ask.  The universe is capable of delivering you anything, you just have to be willing to believe it is possible for you.

Keep dreaming my friends!

XO, Andrea

(Law of Attraction coach & educator)

Are you a student of the Law of Attraction?

posts.title: 5 Chronic Conditions That Cannabis Treats Better Than Prescription Drugs
posts.markdown: While research on marijuana is growing due to it being legalized in more and more states across America, it is still banned on the federal level, making the research process very difficult.  But, as scientists and the general public start to realize the untapped potential of marijuana, the stigma and propaganda surrounding the substance has begun to fade. You may have heard of some of the popular medical strains of marijuana that have come to light in the media recently due to uplifting stories of children and debilitated people using marijuana to overcome the daily obstacles created by their conditions.  These include **[Charlotte’s Web](http://www.leafly.com/sativa/charlottes-web), [Harlequin](http://www.leafly.com/hybrid/harlequin), [Sour Tsunami](http://www.leafly.com/hybrid/sour-tsunami)**and **[Cannatonic](http://www.leafly.com/hybrid/cannatonic)**. Here are five conditions that react much better to marijuana than they do prescription drugs: **Cancer** Cancer is often the big one, as the active component in marijuana, cannabinoids, have actually been seen to **[reduce the growth of tumors](http://preventdisease.com/news/10/120310_marijuana_cuts_tumor_growth.shtml)**, as well as kill cancerous cells.   Additionally, researchers recently discovered that cannabidiol has the ability to ‘turn off’ the gene that causes metastasis in aggressive forms of cancer.   **Fibromyalgia (FM)** **[The National Pain Foundation](http://www.thenationalpainfoundation.org/pain-news.php)**conducted **[an online survey](http://www.prohealth.com/library/showarticle.cfm?libid=18893)**of over 1300 people who suffered from FM and found that 379 of them reported using cannabis for therapy, and 62 percent of them rated cannabis as “very effective” regarding the treatment of their condition.   When compared to FM patients who used Cymbalta (Duloxene) instead, about 8 percent said the drug was “very effective” and 60 percent said the drug didn’t work at all. **Epilepsy** There are a handful of drugs used to treat epilepsy, most of which increase the prominence of side effects like fatigue and lack of appetite.  They’ve also been seen to increase the risk of depression and psychoses.  New evidence shows that cannabis compounds have anticonvulsant properties, much of which has been discovered by parents seeking alternative solutions to their child’s seizures.   It is now widely believed that cannabinoid therapy might just be the best possible treatment for those who suffer from chronic epilepsy. **Multiple Sclerosis (MS)** Researchers reviewed over 2,608 studies to determine which therapies held the best evidence indicating effective treatment for MS patients and found that medical marijuana (in spray and pill form) had the most promise.   “What we learned are these specific forms of medical marijuana can ease patients’ symptoms — specific symptoms of spasticity, or muscle stiffness… and helped with frequent urination,”according to study author Dr. Pushpa Narayanaswami. **ADD & ADHD** Ritalin the drug often prescribed for those suffering from ADD and ADHD, comes with **[a variety of debilitating side effects](http://ritalindeath.com/)**.  These include abnormal thought processes, hallucinations, difficulty sleeping, stomach pain, diarrhea, headaches, lack of appetite and cottonmouth.   Patients who have used cannabis to treat their ADD or ADHD have reported that their grades actually went up from Ds and Cs, to Bs and As.  They said it was easier to focus in lecture, easier to focus their attention, and made it easier to stick to one task for extended periods of time. So, you’re probably asking yourself why people aren’t taking advantage of marijuana to treat their often terrible health conditions.   The truth is that pharmaceutical drugs are a $1 billion a year industry, and legalizing a substance that could easily treat many of the conditions that their drugs are designed to treat would take a large cut out of their profits.   If you or a loved one are suffering from a debilitating chronic condition, please do not be afraid to seek out alternative treatment solutions, including medical marijuana.
posts.html:
While research on marijuana is growing due to it being legalized in more and more states across America, it is still banned on the federal level, making the research process very difficult.  But, as scientists and the general public start to realize the untapped potential of marijuana, the stigma and propaganda surrounding the substance has begun to fade.

You may have heard of some of the popular medical strains of marijuana that have come to light in the media recently due to uplifting stories of children and debilitated people using marijuana to overcome the daily obstacles created by their conditions.  These include Charlotte’s Web, Harlequin, Sour Tsunami and Cannatonic.

Here are five conditions that react much better to marijuana than they do prescription drugs:

Cancer

Cancer is often the big one, as the active component in marijuana, cannabinoids, have actually been seen to reduce the growth of tumors, as well as kill cancerous cells.  

Additionally, researchers recently discovered that cannabidiol has the ability to ‘turn off’ the gene that causes metastasis in aggressive forms of cancer.  

Fibromyalgia (FM)

The National Pain Foundation conducted an online survey of over 1300 people who suffered from FM and found that 379 of them reported using cannabis for therapy, and 62 percent of them rated cannabis as “very effective” regarding the treatment of their condition.  

When compared to FM patients who used Cymbalta (Duloxene) instead, about 8 percent said the drug was “very effective” and 60 percent said the drug didn’t work at all.

Epilepsy

There are a handful of drugs used to treat epilepsy, most of which increase the prominence of side effects like fatigue and lack of appetite.  They’ve also been seen to increase the risk of depression and psychoses.  New evidence shows that cannabis compounds have anticonvulsant properties, much of which has been discovered by parents seeking alternative solutions to their child’s seizures.  

It is now widely believed that cannabinoid therapy might just be the best possible treatment for those who suffer from chronic epilepsy.

Multiple Sclerosis (MS)

Researchers reviewed over 2,608 studies to determine which therapies held the best evidence indicating effective treatment for MS patients and found that medical marijuana (in spray and pill form) had the most promise.  

“What we learned are these specific forms of medical marijuana can ease patients’ symptoms — specific symptoms of spasticity, or muscle stiffness… and helped with frequent urination,”according to study author Dr. Pushpa Narayanaswami.

ADD & ADHD

Ritalin the drug often prescribed for those suffering from ADD and ADHD, comes with a variety of debilitating side effects.  These include abnormal thought processes, hallucinations, difficulty sleeping, stomach pain, diarrhea, headaches, lack of appetite and cottonmouth.  

Patients who have used cannabis to treat their ADD or ADHD have reported that their grades actually went up from Ds and Cs, to Bs and As.  They said it was easier to focus in lecture, easier to focus their attention, and made it easier to stick to one task for extended periods of time.

So, you’re probably asking yourself why people aren’t taking advantage of marijuana to treat their often terrible health conditions.  

The truth is that pharmaceutical drugs are a $1 billion a year industry, and legalizing a substance that could easily treat many of the conditions that their drugs are designed to treat would take a large cut out of their profits.  

If you or a loved one are suffering from a debilitating chronic condition, please do not be afraid to seek out alternative treatment solutions, including medical marijuana.

posts.title: Retired Bishop Reveals the Real Reason Church Invented Hell
posts.markdown: If you have any experience with religion or the Church, then you know that much of what they teach centers around having people acting certain ways and doing certain things, all for the sake of having a rewarding afterlife.   Christianity, for example, says that if you do not accept Jesus Christ as your savior, you are doomed to burning in a lake of fire for eternity.  A notion that completely disregards**[every other religion and deity](http://www.wakingtimes.com/2015/03/19/20-of-the-worlds-weirdest-religious-beliefs/)**, suggesting they are not applicable to mankind.   Heaven and hell, as ideas, are so deeply entwined in the human psyche that many people simply cannot see past this dichotomy.  Which is why **[John Shelby Spong](http://www.amazon.com/gp/search/ref=as_li_qf_sp_sr_il_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&index=aps&keywords=John%20Shelby%20Spong&linkCode=as2&tag=wakitime09-20&linkId=DU7YXHOV2RD5OJEL)**, a retired Episcopal bishop, has sought to inform people on the real reason the church created this ‘myth’ of Hell, and why it’s so vital to the survival of the Church. *“I don’t think Hell exists. I happen to believe in life after death, but I don’t think it’s got a thing to do with reward and punishment. ****Religion is always in the control business, and that’s something people don’t really understand.****It’s in a guilt-producing control business. And if you have Heaven as a place where you’re rewarded for your goodness, and Hell is a place where you’re punished for your evil, then you sort of have control of the population. And so they create this fiery place which has quite literally scared the Hell out of a lot of people, throughout Christian history. And it’s part of a control tactic.”* There are many folks who look to religion for answers and guidance when it comes to navigating this often chaotic world we live in.  But as Bishop Spong explains (and I agree), religion enables people to shift responsibilities of their own life from themselves to God. *“****The church doesn’t like for people to grow up, because you can’t control grown-ups.**** That’s why we talk about being born again. When you’re born again, you’re still a child. People don’t need to be born again. They need to grow up. They need to accept their responsibility for themselves and the world.”* There’s no solid evidence pointing one way or another, meaning mankind, as a whole, really has no idea what happens after death.  So it begs the question: why do religions focus so much on places of damnation and paradise?  Control.  Control and survival of the church. *“Every church I know claims that ‘we are the true church’ – that they have some ultimate authority, ‘We have the infallible Pope,’ ‘We have the Bible.’…****The idea that the truth of God can be bound in any human system, by any human creed, by any human book, is almost beyond imagination for me.*** *God is not a Christian. God is not a Jew or a Muslim or a Hindi or Buddhist. All of those are human systems, which human beings have created to try to help us walk into the mystery of God. I honor my tradition. I walk through my tradition. But I don’t think my tradition defines God. It only points me to God.”* It speaks multitudes about religion as an ideology when a man, like Bishop Spong, who has spent a great deal of his life in service to the Church, publicly denounces the faith and everyone who practices it, doesn’t it?
posts.html:
If you have any experience with religion or the Church, then you know that much of what they teach centers around having people acting certain ways and doing certain things, all for the sake of having a rewarding afterlife.  

Christianity, for example, says that if you do not accept Jesus Christ as your savior, you are doomed to burning in a lake of fire for eternity.  A notion that completely disregards every other religion and deity, suggesting they are not applicable to mankind.  

Heaven and hell, as ideas, are so deeply entwined in the human psyche that many people simply cannot see past this dichotomy.  Which is why John Shelby Spong, a retired Episcopal bishop, has sought to inform people on the real reason the church created this ‘myth’ of Hell, and why it’s so vital to the survival of the Church.

“I don’t think Hell exists. I happen to believe in life after death, but I don’t think it’s got a thing to do with reward and punishment. Religion is always in the control business, and that’s something people don’t really understand.It’s in a guilt-producing control business. And if you have Heaven as a place where you’re rewarded for your goodness, and Hell is a place where you’re punished for your evil, then you sort of have control of the population. And so they create this fiery place which has quite literally scared the Hell out of a lot of people, throughout Christian history. And it’s part of a control tactic.”

There are many folks who look to religion for answers and guidance when it comes to navigating this often chaotic world we live in.  But as Bishop Spong explains (and I agree), religion enables people to shift responsibilities of their own life from themselves to God.

“The church doesn’t like for people to grow up, because you can’t control grown-ups. That’s why we talk about being born again. When you’re born again, you’re still a child. People don’t need to be born again. They need to grow up. They need to accept their responsibility for themselves and the world.”

There’s no solid evidence pointing one way or another, meaning mankind, as a whole, really has no idea what happens after death.  So it begs the question: why do religions focus so much on places of damnation and paradise?  Control.  Control and survival of the church.

“Every church I know claims that ‘we are the true church’ – that they have some ultimate authority, ‘We have the infallible Pope,’ ‘We have the Bible.’…The idea that the truth of God can be bound in any human system, by any human creed, by any human book, is almost beyond imagination for me.

God is not a Christian. God is not a Jew or a Muslim or a Hindi or Buddhist. All of those are human systems, which human beings have created to try to help us walk into the mystery of God. I honor my tradition. I walk through my tradition. But I don’t think my tradition defines God. It only points me to God.”

It speaks multitudes about religion as an ideology when a man, like Bishop Spong, who has spent a great deal of his life in service to the Church, publicly denounces the faith and everyone who practices it, doesn’t it?

posts.title: 3 Signs You've Met Someone From a Past Life
posts.markdown: Sometimes we’re drawn to people for reasons we cannot explain or understand.  Maybe it’s coincidence that your paths keep crossing, or maybe it’s something else. The theory of reincarnation continues to grow in popularity as more and more people become open to the idea that we’ve all lived past lives.  It’s very possible that these people we have seemingly perpetual ties to are people that we’ve known in past lives. Here are three signs that you know a person from one of your past lives: **Immediate connection or rejection** Have you ever met a person and somehow instantly knew that the two of you were going to be great friends?  It seems to happen more often than you’d think.  Soul mates and friends from past lives instantly connect with one another.   In the same way, if you suddenly have feelings of hostility toward a person, they likely harmed you in a past life.  If you don’t like someone, but you’re not sure why, this might be it. **Telepathic Link** Many people share unique connections and bonds that cannot be described or explained to others.  This type of connection or link to another person is a sign.  Maybe they contact you shortly after you’ve been thinking of them or you have a strange ability to know what they’re going to say before they say it. **Connecting through the eyes** If you, upon your first meeting someone, are drawn in by their familiar-looking eyes, it is a sign that you knew them in a prior life.   You’ve undoubtedly noticed throughout your life that there are people whose eyes you can stare into for hours without feeling a connection, and others you can stare into for a moment and feel an instant bond.   Past life experts believe that this is no coincidence, as some have suggested that our eyes do not change from life to life.
posts.html:
Sometimes we’re drawn to people for reasons we cannot explain or understand.  Maybe it’s coincidence that your paths keep crossing, or maybe it’s something else.

The theory of reincarnation continues to grow in popularity as more and more people become open to the idea that we’ve all lived past lives.  It’s very possible that these people we have seemingly perpetual ties to are people that we’ve known in past lives.

Here are three signs that you know a person from one of your past lives:

Immediate connection or rejection

Have you ever met a person and somehow instantly knew that the two of you were going to be great friends?  It seems to happen more often than you’d think.  Soul mates and friends from past lives instantly connect with one another.  

In the same way, if you suddenly have feelings of hostility toward a person, they likely harmed you in a past life.  If you don’t like someone, but you’re not sure why, this might be it.

Telepathic Link

Many people share unique connections and bonds that cannot be described or explained to others.  This type of connection or link to another person is a sign.  Maybe they contact you shortly after you’ve been thinking of them or you have a strange ability to know what they’re going to say before they say it.

Connecting through the eyes

If you, upon your first meeting someone, are drawn in by their familiar-looking eyes, it is a sign that you knew them in a prior life.  

You’ve undoubtedly noticed throughout your life that there are people whose eyes you can stare into for hours without feeling a connection, and others you can stare into for a moment and feel an instant bond.  

Past life experts believe that this is no coincidence, as some have suggested that our eyes do not change from life to life.

posts.title: 5 Toxic and Fake Imported Chinese Foods That You Should Avoid Eating at All Costs
posts.markdown: While Chinese culture is known quite well for its delicious cuisine, the Chinese food industry has been the subject of controversy as of late due to lenient regulations and standards when it comes to food quality. Food imports from China are being avoided by people from all over the world, and with good reason. Over the years, China has worked on creative, yet highly-toxic and fake food products to market overseas. A majority of these products have yet to make their way to American grocery store shelves, but they have been seen for sale on Amazon.com and eBay. Here are five fake and toxic Chinese food products that you should avoid consuming at all costs: **Imitation Eggs** ![fake eggs](http://cdn.familylifegoals.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/6880170637_01475fae59.jpg) $70 a day is what some Chinese websites are claiming you can make, simply by creating and selling fake eggs. How do you make these eggs? Well, here are **[the chemicals](http://inventorspot.com/articles/unhappy_meals_chinas_top_8_fake_foods#sthash.KpMFCOKL.dpuf)** you’ll need: Alginic acid, potassium alum, gelatin, calcium chloride, water and some artificial coloring. The shells are created using calcium carbonate. Consuming these ingredients puts you at higher risk for **[memory loss and dementia](http://inventorspot.com/articles/unhappy_meals_chinas_top_8_fake_foods)**. **Cement-filled Walnuts** ![walnut](http://cdn.theheartysoul.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/walnut.jpg) A man searching for shelled walnuts in Zhengzhou City, China, back in 2012 made a startling discovery after finally purchasing some. Inside of the walnut shells were broken pieces of concrete wrapped in paper to hide the shell’s hidden contents when shaken. You can see **[more pictures here](http://news.163.com/photoview/4T8F0001/20955.html#p=7QHN2CTC4T8F0001).** **Fake beef made from pork** ![fake chinese food](http://cdn.theheartysoul.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/china.jpg) Pork is quite a bit **[less expensive](http://theheartysoul.com/fda-pork-antibiotic-ban/)** than beef in China, which has lead some restaurants to chemically alter pork into tasting like beef. Using a beef extract and a type of glaze substance to “marinate” the meat in, they soak the meat for 90 minutes in the glaze and then sell it to customers. Doctors have said that consuming this is a form of “**[slow poisoning](http://www.chinasmack.com/2011/pictures/beef-extract-additive-used-to-change-pork-into-beef.html)**” that will eventually lead to deformities and cancer. **Baby Formula** About 12 years ago, news concerning **[fake baby formula](http://www.cbsnews.com/news/arrests-in-fake-baby-formula-case/)** and its ties to dozens of child deaths made headlines. Forty-seven people were accused of making a type of instant baby formula that consisted mainly of **[chalk](http://www.marketwatch.com/story/guid/b275ec80-1adb-11e1-add2-07212804637c?page=2)**, lacked any real nutrients, and lead to children developing a “big head disease.” This disease caused swelling and inflammation in the head while the rest of the body slowly decayed. **Synthetic Rice** A type of fake rice has been found in mass quantities in China recently. The plastic-like rice is thought to be made from a mix of potatoes and **[a synthetic resin](http://listverse.com/2015/03/15/10-bizarre-food-scams-that-could-only-happen-in-china/)**. One of the obvious indicators of fake rice is how it stays hard even after you’ve boiled it. **[Long-term effects](http://althealthworks.com/7761/plastic-rice-from-china-is-real-and-it-can-cause-serious-health-problemsyelena/)** of eating this product includes higher risk for developing cancer. So, there you have it. Five foods you should always be a little skeptical of, especially when you’re in China or have had food imported from the country. Always do your best to know what you’re putting into your body! h/t [**The Hearty Soul**](http://theheartysoul.com/fake-foods-from-china/)
posts.html:
While Chinese culture is known quite well for its delicious cuisine, the Chinese food industry has been the subject of controversy as of late due to lenient regulations and standards when it comes to food quality.

Food imports from China are being avoided by people from all over the world, and with good reason.

Over the years, China has worked on creative, yet highly-toxic and fake food products to market overseas. A majority of these products have yet to make their way to American grocery store shelves, but they have been seen for sale on Amazon.com and eBay.

Here are five fake and toxic Chinese food products that you should avoid consuming at all costs:

Imitation Eggs

$70 a day is what some Chinese websites are claiming you can make, simply by creating and selling fake eggs. How do you make these eggs? Well, here are the chemicals you’ll need: Alginic acid, potassium alum, gelatin, calcium chloride, water and some artificial coloring. The shells are created using calcium carbonate.

Consuming these ingredients puts you at higher risk for memory loss and dementia.

Cement-filled Walnuts

A man searching for shelled walnuts in Zhengzhou City, China, back in 2012 made a startling discovery after finally purchasing some. Inside of the walnut shells were broken pieces of concrete wrapped in paper to hide the shell’s hidden contents when shaken. You can see more pictures here.

Fake beef made from pork

Pork is quite a bit less expensive than beef in China, which has lead some restaurants to chemically alter pork into tasting like beef. Using a beef extract and a type of glaze substance to “marinate” the meat in, they soak the meat for 90 minutes in the glaze and then sell it to customers. Doctors have said that consuming this is a form of “slow poisoning” that will eventually lead to deformities and cancer.

Baby Formula

About 12 years ago, news concerning fake baby formula and its ties to dozens of child deaths made headlines. Forty-seven people were accused of making a type of instant baby formula that consisted mainly of chalk, lacked any real nutrients, and lead to children developing a “big head disease.”

This disease caused swelling and inflammation in the head while the rest of the body slowly decayed.

Synthetic Rice

A type of fake rice has been found in mass quantities in China recently. The plastic-like rice is thought to be made from a mix of potatoes and a synthetic resin. One of the obvious indicators of fake rice is how it stays hard even after you’ve boiled it. Long-term effects of eating this product includes higher risk for developing cancer.

So, there you have it. Five foods you should always be a little skeptical of, especially when you’re in China or have had food imported from the country. Always do your best to know what you’re putting into your body!

h/t The Hearty Soul

posts.title: 10 Ways An Alpha Woman Stands Out From Everyone Else
posts.markdown: Have you ever seen a woman that you could only really describe as an “alpha”? Oftentimes when we use the word “alpha” to describe them, it’s because they’re attractive, powerful and commanding. They can also come off as bossy, but this is only because they know what they want. You’ll know when you see one. Here are ten traits that come naturally to the alpha woman: - She’s never obnoxious or loud because of her high levels of confidence. The same confidence that makes people follow her, while simultaneously attracting only positive energies. - She’s one of those people that you just assume “has it all figured out.” She’s really just a balanced person who knows how to ebb and flow with the constant changes of life. - She doesn’t let anyone walk all over her. She sees the world how it is and isn’t afraid to tell people the honest truth. People listen to what she has to say. - She’s happy simply being herself. She doesn’t buy into the latest fads or beauty standards, her high self-confidence simply doesn’t make time for it. - In a similar facet, she doesn’t feel the need to compete with anyone but herself. Seeing how far she’s come from previous versions of herself is much more important than comparing herself to anyone else. - She can always tell the difference between helpful feedback and negative criticism, and is wise enough to learn from both. - Highly intuitive, she can sense when it’s time to get rid of a toxic relationship, be it with a friend, a partner or a boss. - Never one to assume, the alpha woman enjoys healthy communication with those in her company. She dislikes when people misunderstand her, so she’d rather clear things up than assume otherwise. - Always supported by the people in her life, she gives back the same love and support that she receives. But she also expects others to believe in themselves as much as she does. - She is the queen of balancing her work life with her social life, and recognizes how important it is to maintain that balance. She keeps her head in a good place at all times.
posts.html:
Have you ever seen a woman that you could only really describe as an “alpha”? Oftentimes when we use the word “alpha” to describe them, it’s because they’re attractive, powerful and commanding. They can also come off as bossy, but this is only because they know what they want.

You’ll know when you see one. Here are ten traits that come naturally to the alpha woman:

  • She’s never obnoxious or loud because of her high levels of confidence. The same confidence that makes people follow her, while simultaneously attracting only positive energies.
  • She’s one of those people that you just assume “has it all figured out.” She’s really just a balanced person who knows how to ebb and flow with the constant changes of life.
  • She doesn’t let anyone walk all over her. She sees the world how it is and isn’t afraid to tell people the honest truth. People listen to what she has to say.
  • She’s happy simply being herself. She doesn’t buy into the latest fads or beauty standards, her high self-confidence simply doesn’t make time for it.
  • In a similar facet, she doesn’t feel the need to compete with anyone but herself. Seeing how far she’s come from previous versions of herself is much more important than comparing herself to anyone else.
  • She can always tell the difference between helpful feedback and negative criticism, and is wise enough to learn from both.
  • Highly intuitive, she can sense when it’s time to get rid of a toxic relationship, be it with a friend, a partner or a boss.
  • Never one to assume, the alpha woman enjoys healthy communication with those in her company. She dislikes when people misunderstand her, so she’d rather clear things up than assume otherwise.
  • Always supported by the people in her life, she gives back the same love and support that she receives. But she also expects others to believe in themselves as much as she does.
  • She is the queen of balancing her work life with her social life, and recognizes how important it is to maintain that balance. She keeps her head in a good place at all times.

posts.title: This Man Ate 2 Tbs of Coconut Oil Twice a Day and This is What Happened to His Brain
posts.markdown: Coconut oil is something that I recently started using for a variety of different reasons. I like to rub a little bit on my face and through my hair after each shower for its natural moisturizing properties. Others like using it for dental health by oil pulling. And you can also use it cook with too! Now, Dr. Mary Newport has developed a theory around the digestion of coconut oil and its effects on the brain. Her theory revolved around ketone bodies. Ketone bodies are produced by our bodies whenever we digest coconut oil, and she thinks that they could be an alternative fuel for our brains. Specifically, Newport thinks that it can benefit those suffering from Alzheimer’s disease. Newport actually has first-hand experience with Alzheimer’s disease. Steve, her husband, began experiencing cognitive problems related to progressive dementia in his mid-50s. An MRI scan would eventually lead to Steve’s diagnosis of Alzheimer’s. Mary talks a bit about how it affected her husband: “Many days, often for several days in a row, he was in a fog; couldn’t find a spoon or remember how to get water out of the refrigerator… One day I would ask if a certain call came that I was expecting and he would say ‘No.’ Two days later he would remember the message from so-and-so from a couple of days earlier and what they said.” Oddly enough, it seemed as though Steve still retained information in his brain even when he had zero short-term memory. Mary got a strange feeling that his diet had something to do with it. Mary’s [investigation into ketone bodies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ketone_bodies), or medium chain triglycerides, found that they were listed as a potential treatment for people suffering from Parkinson’s disease, Huntington’s disease, multiple sclerosis, and diabetes. Which got her thinking: “In Alzheimer’s disease, the neurons in certain areas of the brain are unable to take in glucose due to [insulin resistance](http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/releases/20838.php), and slowly die off… if these cells had access to ketone bodies, they could potentially stay alive and continue to function.” So, Dr. Newport decided that her husband should try a daily regimen of coconut oil, just to see if it would have any effect. And it absolutely did. Two months after adding coconut oil to his diet, Steve was more aware and happy. He was making conversation, making jokes, and his tremors were less intense. After a year of two tablespoons of coconut oil twice every day, Mary says that Steve is a changed man. She says that, while he struggles occasionally with words, he recognizes family members, actively participates in conversation and has more lively facial expressions. “For now, we are very pleased with where he is at and should coconut oil stop or slow down the progress of his disease, it will be worth every drop that he takes.”
posts.html:
Coconut oil is something that I recently started using for a variety of different reasons. I like to rub a little bit on my face and through my hair after each shower for its natural moisturizing properties. Others like using it for dental health by oil pulling. And you can also use it cook with too!

Now, Dr. Mary Newport has developed a theory around the digestion of coconut oil and its effects on the brain. Her theory revolved around ketone bodies. Ketone bodies are produced by our bodies whenever we digest coconut oil, and she thinks that they could be an alternative fuel for our brains. Specifically, Newport thinks that it can benefit those suffering from Alzheimer’s disease.

Newport actually has first-hand experience with Alzheimer’s disease. Steve, her husband, began experiencing cognitive problems related to progressive dementia in his mid-50s. An MRI scan would eventually lead to Steve’s diagnosis of Alzheimer’s.

Mary talks a bit about how it affected her husband:

“Many days, often for several days in a row, he was in a fog; couldn’t find a spoon or remember how to get water out of the refrigerator… One day I would ask if a certain call came that I was expecting and he would say ‘No.’ Two days later he would remember the message from so-and-so from a couple of days earlier and what they said.”

Oddly enough, it seemed as though Steve still retained information in his brain even when he had zero short-term memory. Mary got a strange feeling that his diet had something to do with it.

Mary’s investigation into ketone bodies, or medium chain triglycerides, found that they were listed as a potential treatment for people suffering from Parkinson’s disease, Huntington’s disease, multiple sclerosis, and diabetes.

Which got her thinking:

“In Alzheimer’s disease, the neurons in certain areas of the brain are unable to take in glucose due to insulin resistance, and slowly die off… if these cells had access to ketone bodies, they could potentially stay alive and continue to function.”

So, Dr. Newport decided that her husband should try a daily regimen of coconut oil, just to see if it would have any effect. And it absolutely did. Two months after adding coconut oil to his diet, Steve was more aware and happy. He was making conversation, making jokes, and his tremors were less intense.

After a year of two tablespoons of coconut oil twice every day, Mary says that Steve is a changed man. She says that, while he struggles occasionally with words, he recognizes family members, actively participates in conversation and has more lively facial expressions.

“For now, we are very pleased with where he is at and should coconut oil stop or slow down the progress of his disease, it will be worth every drop that he takes.”

posts.title: These Handmade Seashell Crowns Will Make You Want to Be Queen of the Ocean
posts.markdown: ![](https://fbcdn-sphotos-a-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xap1/v/t1.0-9/1465211_432168040287200_154431617326131449_n.jpg?oh=4d131b00016f0fef0f69e9b5ab4c64df&oe=5803FEF4&__gda__=1476513801_a98997270bc29ff05791a5c821b22547) Finding seashells along coasts and in the ocean is a hobby that many maritime folks enjoy. Maybe you like finding them and then leaving them where you found them. Maybe you’ve saved a few unique ones over the years and now they lie somewhere in your home. Or maybe you collect them and then build elaborate seashell crowns and tiaras with them. No? Okay, so not everyone is like Chelsea from **[Chelsea’s Flower Crowns](http://www.chelseasflowercrowns.com/)**. This talented woman combines seashells, crystals, chains and flowers to make elaborate seashell headdresses that are unlike anything you’ve ever seen. One look at the intricate detail used to make these crowns and you’ll understand what makes them so special. Not only are they visually appealing, but donning one makes you look like mermaid royalty. ![](https://fbcdn-sphotos-g-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xap1/v/t1.0-9/13413002_466325273538143_8009129740010545689_n.jpg?oh=56658913e1ac93fdaa477033d2223f8c&oe=57F28E5B&__gda__=1477162887_972e5a1bf76e3d372819ac6416f2c5af) Chelsea does not do custom orders at the moment, but that doesn’t mean you can’t own one of these beautiful crowns (she even makes crowns for men). You can buy a unique, handmade crown by visiting **[her Etsy shop](http://www.chelseasflowercrowns.etsy.com/),** and you can learn more about her work by visiting ***[her Facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/chelseasflowercrowns/?fref=photo)***!
