posts.html:
Finding seashells along coasts and in the ocean is a hobby that many maritime folks enjoy. Maybe you like finding them and then leaving them where you found them. Maybe you’ve saved a few unique ones over the years and now they lie somewhere in your home. Or maybe you collect them and then build elaborate seashell crowns and tiaras with them.

No? Okay, so not everyone is like Chelsea from Chelsea’s Flower Crowns. This talented woman combines seashells, crystals, chains and flowers to make elaborate seashell headdresses that are unlike anything you’ve ever seen.

One look at the intricate detail used to make these crowns and you’ll understand what makes them so special. Not only are they visually appealing, but donning one makes you look like mermaid royalty.

Chelsea does not do custom orders at the moment, but that doesn’t mean you can’t own one of these beautiful crowns (she even makes crowns for men).

You can buy a unique, handmade crown by visiting her Etsy shop, and you can learn more about her work by visiting her Facebook page!

posts.title: 5 Great Psychological Tricks That Can Help You Communicate With Anyone
posts.markdown: Communicating with others can be a difficult task, especially when the person you’re trying to speak with makes it hard. But, communication is the foundation of any solid relationship, from your best friends to your romantic partners. So, it would behoove you to know a few psychological tricks of communication that can steer conversation in a positive direction. Here are five psychological tricks that will help you build better relationships: **When you get an answer you don’t like** Sometimes we get behaviors and communication that we don’t like. Like when a person lies to you, isn’t clear on something, or just leaves out an important detail entirely. When this happens, don’t ask for them to elaborate; remain calm and silent, and look them straight in the eyes attentively. They will likely feel forced into finishing any thoughts that got left out. **When you get yelled at** Stay calm and passive when someone yells at you. When a person snaps at you, it’s because their first reaction to adversity is anger. If you remain silent and calm, their anger will subside, allowing them to feel a follow-up emotion from yelling at you: guilt. This will often result in them apologizing for getting upset with you. **When you’re in group settings** Pay attention to how people react after a joke is made or when they laugh. When multiple people start laughing in the group at the same time, they will instinctively look at the person they like the most, first. Whoever they look at first can also mean it’s a person they would like to get close to. Watch closely, and you can learn a great deal about those around you. **When you’re trying to catch someone’s attention** If you find yourself smitten by a particular person and want them to notice you, find something behind one of their shoulders to stare at. Then, once you see that you’ve caught their attention, look them in the eyes and give a soft smile. It works every time. **When you’re trying to negotiate** A fairly common practice when it comes to making deals with others, many people like to throw out steep requirements and stipulations as a first move, with the hope that they can talk the person down to the deal that they originally wanted the whole time. For example, if I want a dozen peaches for $5, my first offer might be $5 for 20 peaches. Then, when they say that’s too many, I’d agree to 12 peaches for $5. People will often accept smaller requests after larger ones have been denied.
posts.html:
Communicating with others can be a difficult task, especially when the person you’re trying to speak with makes it hard. But, communication is the foundation of any solid relationship, from your best friends to your romantic partners.

So, it would behoove you to know a few psychological tricks of communication that can steer conversation in a positive direction.

Here are five psychological tricks that will help you build better relationships:

When you get an answer you don’t like

Sometimes we get behaviors and communication that we don’t like. Like when a person lies to you, isn’t clear on something, or just leaves out an important detail entirely. When this happens, don’t ask for them to elaborate; remain calm and silent, and look them straight in the eyes attentively.

They will likely feel forced into finishing any thoughts that got left out.

When you get yelled at

Stay calm and passive when someone yells at you. When a person snaps at you, it’s because their first reaction to adversity is anger. If you remain silent and calm, their anger will subside, allowing them to feel a follow-up emotion from yelling at you: guilt.

This will often result in them apologizing for getting upset with you.

When you’re in group settings

Pay attention to how people react after a joke is made or when they laugh. When multiple people start laughing in the group at the same time, they will instinctively look at the person they like the most, first. Whoever they look at first can also mean it’s a person they would like to get close to.

Watch closely, and you can learn a great deal about those around you.

When you’re trying to catch someone’s attention

If you find yourself smitten by a particular person and want them to notice you, find something behind one of their shoulders to stare at. Then, once you see that you’ve caught their attention, look them in the eyes and give a soft smile. It works every time.

When you’re trying to negotiate

A fairly common practice when it comes to making deals with others, many people like to throw out steep requirements and stipulations as a first move, with the hope that they can talk the person down to the deal that they originally wanted the whole time.

For example, if I want a dozen peaches for $5, my first offer might be $5 for 20 peaches. Then, when they say that’s too many, I’d agree to 12 peaches for $5. People will often accept smaller requests after larger ones have been denied.

posts.title: 9 Ways to Check Your Ego When It's Out of Control
posts.markdown: By [**Andrea Schulman**](https://www.facebook.com/raiseyourvibrationtoday/?fref=ts) | [**Raise Your Vibration Today **](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/09/ways-to-check-your-ego-out-of-control/) Do you worry that you may be ego-driven? It happens to most of us at some point, so you aren’t alone! To understand if you are ego-driven, it can help to understand what your ego is. The ego isn’t who you are, but rather it is just a fragment of your consciousness. ## What is the ego? See, there are several aspects that make up who you are as a conscious being.  One, is the loving light that makes up your soul. This is the part of you that is strongly connected to the divine (and therefore connected to every other being as well). The other, is your ego, or the mask you wear that tells you that you are different from others.  Your ego is your self-image in this physical reality. Because the ego observes your separation from others, it is often the part of you that seeks to protect you from others, rather than connect you with them. The ego isn’t a “bad” thing, and it isn’t something you should try to get rid of. In fact, your ego does serve a very powerful purpose. It allows you to perceive the world from a unique, differentiated perspective. Without the ego, it would probably be pretty hard to root down into this physical world, and have this experience as a separate, human consciousness. ## When an ego is out of control. With that being said, sometimes the ego does a lot more of the driving in life than is useful. An ego-driven person frequently pushes down the higher, loving aspect of him or herself and allows the ego to take primary control. The ego-driven person usually measures his or herself from a competitive viewpoint.  For this reason, ego-driven people are often in hot pursuit of being ” “stronger than,” “smarter than,” “richer than” or some other element of “better than” other people.  This is born out of the desire to protect the self, but left unchecked the ego-self can become a tyrant. An out-of-control ego forgets entirely about the importance of unity, love and our ability to connect with others in meaningful and fulfilling ways. To the ego mind, there is no connection. There are only winners and losers, and the ego desperately wants to win. ***Related Article:** “[7 Signs of An Out of Control Ego](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2015/03/03/7-signs-of-an-out-of-control-ego/ "signs of an out of control ego")“* ## How to check your ego when it’s out of control. So, what do you do when you feel your competitive ego taking more control over your life than you’d like? How do you check your ego, and allow more of your love and kindness to shine through? Here are 9 easy ways to check your ego. Next time you find yourself caught up in the rat race of “winners and losers” try one of them out! ### 1. Remember, we’re not all perfect. The ego is quick to point out other people’s mistakes and missteps. When you find yourself judging the actions of others, understand that is the ego at play. Step back into the loving aspect of yourself by remembering that you make mistakes too, and you appreciate it when people love you in spite of them. ### 2. Remind yourself that people often act out when they are hurting. There’s nothing more annoying to an ego-driven person than another ego-driven person! However, it’s possible to check your ego even in the presence of someone else who is fully ego-driven. Just remember that those who are ego-driven are often acting out of fear or pain. Their competitive natures are typically driven by the threats they perceive from the outside world. When people are hurting or scared, they often step into the ego-self for protection. ### 3. List out the things that are most important to you in life. Think about what you want to look back on when you are on your deathbed. The achievements and experiences you ultimately wish to have will likely resonate much more strongly with your higher self than with your ego. ### 4. Practice gratitude for the things you already have. The ego is more concerned with what he or she doesn’t have, as again, the ego is very worried about coming up short. Gratitude reminds you of all of the ways you are supported and abundant, and therefore have no reason to worry about losing. ### 5. Think back on a time someone showed you they really loved you. Looking back on loving memories is an excellent way to connect back into your higher self. Just thinking about being connected in love is often enough to tap you in to your higher knowing. ### 6. Help someone less fortunate than yourself. Helping those less fortunate than yourself reminds you that you really don’t like for people to lose in life. The loving aspect of yourself wants everyone to win. When one of us loses, we all lose! ### 7. Give someone a long hug. The simple act of connecting with another person in a loving manner can help bring you back into resonance with the loving aspects of yourself. ### 8. Meditate, to center back into the loving part of yourself. The ego thrives on mental clutter and fearful, worrisome  thoughts. Clear out the mental clutter with meditation. ### 9. Play devil’s advocate for the people you are arguing with or competing against. Why might they be right? Why might it be good for them to “win” instead of you? Playing devil’s advocate allows you to connect with another person’s perspective, rather than separate from it. ## *Keep your perspective as high as possible, but respect your ego too!* Remember, we all have an ego, and that’s ok. You aren’t supposed to be without an ego, and it does serve a very powerful and important purpose. Without an ego, it’s unlikely that we would have a separate sense of self in this human experience. The ego makes the game of life a lot more exciting and interesting. An ego allows you view reality like a movie, with you getting to be one of the characters. With that being said, a life driven entirely by the ego can be a very sad and unfortunate one. Our ability to connect, to love, and to laugh together is what makes this human experience so wonderful and enjoyable. When we allow our egos to take control in life, we disconnect from the most satisfying elements of life. It’s like we forget it’s all just a movie, and we take things much more seriously than we need to. A life driven entirely by the ego is one filled with pain, anger and frustration. ## You are infinite and eternal, and everything is going to be ok. Ultimately, we are connected to every being on the planet, and beyond. We are all connected to an infinite source consciousness. In fact we all ultimately ARE infinite source consciousness. This means, in the end, there is nothing to fear, and nothing we need protection from. Everything that makes up this universe is us, and we it. This reality is simply a platform we’ve created to play around in and experience. The threats our ego perceive exist only in the illusion that is this physical reality.  All of the struggle, and all of the pain is just a part of the ride. It isn’t anything we really need protection from, in the end, as it is [our own creation](http://www.raiseyourvibrationtoday.com "Raise Your Vibration Today"). Again, it’s just like watching a movie. There’s a lot more going on when the show’s over! See yourself as a character in the movie, enjoying the ride, but keep that inner knowing that you are connected to something far greater than this individual life experience.  Remember, we’re all in this together. We are all one, therefore we are all actually safe as infinite, eternal beings. Your ego will try to get you to forget this, but your higher perspective knows this well. Put your ego in the passenger seat to enjoy the ride of life, but let your higher perspective do the driving. Everything is going to be just fine in the end. XO, Andrea *(Law of Attraction coach & educator)* ### Are you a student of the Law of Attraction? Sign up for my free [Law of Attraction newsletter](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.us9.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=36d05de151fc23b6dee2dd220&id=db39a47128 "subscribe") for conscious advice to help you attract positive outcomes into your life.  You can also become a member of my LOA member website and gain access to a library of video tutorials, ebooks, audiobooks and meditations.  Learn how to attract the things you want with fun, clarity and success!   Join today for as little as[ $1.99](https://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/membership-checkout/?level=1 "become a member for just $1.99!") or become an annual member for [30% in savings](https://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/membership-checkout/?level=2 "annual member"). *Article Source: This article was originally published at [Raise Your Vibration Today](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/09/ways-to-check-your-ego-out-of-control/) and has been republished with permission from the artist.*

To understand if you are ego-driven, it can help to understand what your ego is. The ego isn’t who you are, but rather it is just a fragment of your consciousness.

See, there are several aspects that make up who you are as a conscious being.  One, is the loving light that makes up your soul. This is the part of you that is strongly connected to the divine (and therefore connected to every other being as well).

The other, is your ego, or the mask you wear that tells you that you are different from others.  Your ego is your self-image in this physical reality. Because the ego observes your separation from others, it is often the part of you that seeks to protect you from others, rather than connect you with them.

The ego isn’t a “bad” thing, and it isn’t something you should try to get rid of. In fact, your ego does serve a very powerful purpose. It allows you to perceive the world from a unique, differentiated perspective. Without the ego, it would probably be pretty hard to root down into this physical world, and have this experience as a separate, human consciousness.

With that being said, sometimes the ego does a lot more of the driving in life than is useful. An ego-driven person frequently pushes down the higher, loving aspect of him or herself and allows the ego to take primary control.

The ego-driven person usually measures his or herself from a competitive viewpoint.  For this reason, ego-driven people are often in hot pursuit of being ” “stronger than,” “smarter than,” “richer than” or some other element of “better than” other people. 

This is born out of the desire to protect the self, but left unchecked the ego-self can become a tyrant. An out-of-control ego forgets entirely about the importance of unity, love and our ability to connect with others in meaningful and fulfilling ways.

To the ego mind, there is no connection. There are only winners and losers, and the ego desperately wants to win.

Related Article: “7 Signs of An Out of Control Ego“

How to check your ego when it’s out of control.

So, what do you do when you feel your competitive ego taking more control over your life than you’d like? How do you check your ego, and allow more of your love and kindness to shine through?

Here are 9 easy ways to check your ego. Next time you find yourself caught up in the rat race of “winners and losers” try one of them out!

1. Remember, we’re not all perfect.

The ego is quick to point out other people’s mistakes and missteps. When you find yourself judging the actions of others, understand that is the ego at play. Step back into the loving aspect of yourself by remembering that you make mistakes too, and you appreciate it when people love you in spite of them.

2. Remind yourself that people often act out when they are hurting.

There’s nothing more annoying to an ego-driven person than another ego-driven person! However, it’s possible to check your ego even in the presence of someone else who is fully ego-driven. Just remember that those who are ego-driven are often acting out of fear or pain. Their competitive natures are typically driven by the threats they perceive from the outside world. When people are hurting or scared, they often step into the ego-self for protection.

3. List out the things that are most important to you in life.

Think about what you want to look back on when you are on your deathbed. The achievements and experiences you ultimately wish to have will likely resonate much more strongly with your higher self than with your ego.

4. Practice gratitude for the things you already have.

The ego is more concerned with what he or she doesn’t have, as again, the ego is very worried about coming up short. Gratitude reminds you of all of the ways you are supported and abundant, and therefore have no reason to worry about losing.

5. Think back on a time someone showed you they really loved you.

Looking back on loving memories is an excellent way to connect back into your higher self. Just thinking about being connected in love is often enough to tap you in to your higher knowing.

6. Help someone less fortunate than yourself.

Helping those less fortunate than yourself reminds you that you really don’t like for people to lose in life. The loving aspect of yourself wants everyone to win. When one of us loses, we all lose!

7. Give someone a long hug.

The simple act of connecting with another person in a loving manner can help bring you back into resonance with the loving aspects of yourself.

8. Meditate, to center back into the loving part of yourself.

The ego thrives on mental clutter and fearful, worrisome  thoughts. Clear out the mental clutter with meditation.

9. Play devil’s advocate for the people you are arguing with or competing against.

Why might they be right? Why might it be good for them to “win” instead of you? Playing devil’s advocate allows you to connect with another person’s perspective, rather than separate from it.

Keep your perspective as high as possible, but respect your ego too!

Remember, we all have an ego, and that’s ok. You aren’t supposed to be without an ego, and it does serve a very powerful and important purpose. Without an ego, it’s unlikely that we would have a separate sense of self in this human experience.

The ego makes the game of life a lot more exciting and interesting. An ego allows you view reality like a movie, with you getting to be one of the characters.

With that being said, a life driven entirely by the ego can be a very sad and unfortunate one. Our ability to connect, to love, and to laugh together is what makes this human experience so wonderful and enjoyable. When we allow our egos to take control in life, we disconnect from the most satisfying elements of life. It’s like we forget it’s all just a movie, and we take things much more seriously than we need to.

A life driven entirely by the ego is one filled with pain, anger and frustration.

You are infinite and eternal, and everything is going to be ok.

Ultimately, we are connected to every being on the planet, and beyond. We are all connected to an infinite source consciousness. In fact we all ultimately ARE infinite source consciousness.

This means, in the end, there is nothing to fear, and nothing we need protection from. Everything that makes up this universe is us, and we it.

This reality is simply a platform we’ve created to play around in and experience. The threats our ego perceive exist only in the illusion that is this physical reality.  All of the struggle, and all of the pain is just a part of the ride. It isn’t anything we really need protection from, in the end, as it is our own creation.

Again, it’s just like watching a movie. There’s a lot more going on when the show’s over! See yourself as a character in the movie, enjoying the ride, but keep that inner knowing that you are connected to something far greater than this individual life experience. 

Remember, we’re all in this together. We are all one, therefore we are all actually safe as infinite, eternal beings. Your ego will try to get you to forget this, but your higher perspective knows this well.

Put your ego in the passenger seat to enjoy the ride of life, but let your higher perspective do the driving. Everything is going to be just fine in the end.

XO, Andrea

posts.title: 6 Excellent Reasons to ALWAYS Embrace Change
posts.markdown: By [**Andrea Schulman**](https://www.facebook.com/raiseyourvibrationtoday/?fref=ts) | [**Raise Your Vibration Today **](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/10/reasons-to-always-embrace-change/) Lost your job? Going through a breakup? Moving to a new place where you don’t know anyone? Change can be pretty traumatic if you let it get to you! However, there are a lot of reasons to embrace change. Good or bad, pretty or ugly, change has the ability to enhance your life for the better when you choose to get on board with it. ## *Embrace change because…* ### 1. Change is inevitable. The only constant in life is change. You can embrace change, or you can fight it, but change WILL happen. Might as well go with the flow! ### 2. Change creates more excitement and adventure in your life. Honestly, if life never changed you would be so bored! While stability is comfortable, too much stability feels stagnant. Change can give your life positive momentum. ### 3. Change will reveal to you who’s really important in your life. You’ll never be quite so inclined to know who’s really there for you when you move, get married, have a baby or lose a friend. Big changes have a way of revealing to you the people in your life who are your biggest positive influences (and not-so-positive influences!). ### 4. Change is an opportunity to become someone new, or try on a new identity. When you suddenly find yourself single, in a new job or on another new path, suddenly you have the opportunity to try on a new role. Sometimes a new role comes with a new look, a new skill set and/or a new routine. It can be a lot of fun to become a new person. ### 5. Change adds chapters to your life story. The more change you experience in life, the more chapters you have to look back on. The more stories you have to tell your grandkids, and the more lessons you can share with the people you care about. A full life is one chock full of changing times, places, people and experiences. ### 6. Change is the universe’s way of preparing you for something you’ve been wanting. Sometimes, the quickest route to your dreams is taken by smashing through a brick wall. The universe has a way of shaking things up when we are ready to transition to the next level. Embracing the change ensures you receive the positive benefits on the other side of it. If life is changing quickly for you right now, strap on your seatbelt, hold on to your hat, and do your best to embrace the transition you are experiencing. There will be good things that result from this change, and the more you can go with the flow, the quicker you’ll reap the benefit of this shift. XO, Andrea *(Law of Attraction coach & educator)* ### Are you a student of the Law of Attraction? Sign up for my free [Law of Attraction newsletter](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.us9.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=36d05de151fc23b6dee2dd220&id=db39a47128 "subscribe") for conscious advice to help you attract positive outcomes into your life.  You can also become a member of my LOA member website and gain access to a library of video tutorials, ebooks, audiobooks and meditations.  Learn how to attract the things you want with fun, clarity and success!   Join today for as little as[ $1.99](https://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/membership-checkout/?level=1 "become a member for just $1.99!") or become an annual member for [30% in savings](https://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/membership-checkout/?level=2 "annual member"). *Article Source: This article was originally published at [Raise Your Vibration Today](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/10/reasons-to-always-embrace-change/) and has been republished with the author’s permission.*

By Andrea Schulman | Raise Your Vibration Today 

Lost your job? Going through a breakup? Moving to a new place where you don’t know anyone?

Change can be pretty traumatic if you let it get to you! However, there are a lot of reasons to embrace change. Good or bad, pretty or ugly, change has the ability to enhance your life for the better when you choose to get on board with it.

Embrace change because…

1. Change is inevitable.

The only constant in life is change. You can embrace change, or you can fight it, but change WILL happen. Might as well go with the flow!

2. Change creates more excitement and adventure in your life.

Honestly, if life never changed you would be so bored! While stability is comfortable, too much stability feels stagnant. Change can give your life positive momentum.

3. Change will reveal to you who’s really important in your life.

You’ll never be quite so inclined to know who’s really there for you when you move, get married, have a baby or lose a friend. Big changes have a way of revealing to you the people in your life who are your biggest positive influences (and not-so-positive influences!).

4. Change is an opportunity to become someone new, or try on a new identity.

When you suddenly find yourself single, in a new job or on another new path, suddenly you have the opportunity to try on a new role. Sometimes a new role comes with a new look, a new skill set and/or a new routine. It can be a lot of fun to become a new person.

5. Change adds chapters to your life story.

The more change you experience in life, the more chapters you have to look back on. The more stories you have to tell your grandkids, and the more lessons you can share with the people you care about. A full life is one chock full of changing times, places, people and experiences.

6. Change is the universe’s way of preparing you for something you’ve been wanting.

Sometimes, the quickest route to your dreams is taken by smashing through a brick wall. The universe has a way of shaking things up when we are ready to transition to the next level. Embracing the change ensures you receive the positive benefits on the other side of it.

If life is changing quickly for you right now, strap on your seatbelt, hold on to your hat, and do your best to embrace the transition you are experiencing. There will be good things that result from this change, and the more you can go with the flow, the quicker you’ll reap the benefit of this shift.

XO, Andrea

(Law of Attraction coach & educator)

posts.title: Stunning Photos Capture the Beauty and Sweetness of Kids With Down Syndrome
posts.markdown: Photographer **[Julie Willson](https://www.facebook.com/JuleD-Photography-108755545907576/)** uses her photography skills to illustrate the innocence, sweetness, and beauty of kids who suffer from Down Syndrome. She understands that every person and family on this planet is uniquely beautiful and stunning in their own way.  And those with Down Syndrome are no different.  She sees how others often look at those with Down Syndrome, with uncertainty, with confusion, and sometimes with negativity, and seeks to change these feelings. Julie’s own sister, Dina, was born with Down Syndrome, giving her firsthand experience with the condition.  While others often wrote her sister off as simply a kid with a disability, Julie and her family recognized Dina for the unique and beautiful person that she was. Down Syndrome is often accompanied by a variety of different health problems, meaning their time with us is often limited.  Willson’s family did all that they could to make the most of the time Dina had left with them.   Dina passed away four years ago, but her passing inspired her sister to show the world just how beautiful people with Down Syndrome are.  This photography project was started with the memory Dina in Julie’s heart, and has led to some powerful imagery. ![Sadly, Dina passed away four years ago due to congestive heart failure. This is common in those who have Down Syndrome.](http://cdn5.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/11/jule-10-600x427.jpg) ![Down Syndrome is a genetic disorder caused by the presence of an extra chromosome. It can affect anyone, but thanks to medical advancements, people with Down Syndrome are living longer, happier, healthier lives.](http://cdn7.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/11/jule-3-600x427.jpg) ![But because of her heart condition, Dina was not expected to live long. However, with help from her family, she doubled her life expectancy.](http://cdn6.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/11/jule-4-600x428.jpg) ![Julie says that thanks to her parents, Dina lived a full, happy life.](http://cdn4.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/11/jule-5-600x427.jpg) ![Willson describes Dina as having a "sweet, yet stubborn" personality, and that she was able to love unconditionally and didn't waster her time worrying.](http://cdn6.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/11/jule-2-600x427.jpg) ![As a result of knowing and growing up with Dina, Willson today wants to help others appreciate people with Down Syndrome, and help them see their individual, unique personalities. ](http://cdn4.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/11/jule-6-600x427.jpg) ![She wants to let parents know that while it has its challenges, Down Syndrome is nothing to fear, and won't make the child's or the parents' lives any worse. ](http://cdn7.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/11/jule-7-600x427.jpg) ![And to show people everywhere that those with Down Syndrome have just as much to offer the world as anyone else. ](http://cdn9.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/11/jule-8-600x428.jpg) ![She hopes that these photos will help people see that children with Down Syndrome have so much to give.](http://cdn7.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/11/jule-9-600x427.jpg) Willson hopes that, through her photography, she can help others see what she sees when she looks at these sweethearts: that Down Syndrome is merely one aspect of their life, not something that is entirely destructive. Learn more about Down Syndrome on the [National Down Syndrome Society](http://www.ndss.org/) website and check out more of Wilson’s work on her [Facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/JuleD-Photography-108755545907576/). We hope you’ll share this if you want to spread the message that all kids are worth the love and celebration that we give them! http://www.littlethings.com/julie-willson-downs-syndrome-awareness/
posts.html:
Photographer Julie Willson uses her photography skills to illustrate the innocence, sweetness, and beauty of kids who suffer from Down Syndrome.

She understands that every person and family on this planet is uniquely beautiful and stunning in their own way.  And those with Down Syndrome are no different.  She sees how others often look at those with Down Syndrome, with uncertainty, with confusion, and sometimes with negativity, and seeks to change these feelings.

Julie’s own sister, Dina, was born with Down Syndrome, giving her firsthand experience with the condition.  While others often wrote her sister off as simply a kid with a disability, Julie and her family recognized Dina for the unique and beautiful person that she was.

Down Syndrome is often accompanied by a variety of different health problems, meaning their time with us is often limited.  Willson’s family did all that they could to make the most of the time Dina had left with them.  

Dina passed away four years ago, but her passing inspired her sister to show the world just how beautiful people with Down Syndrome are.  This photography project was started with the memory Dina in Julie’s heart, and has led to some powerful imagery.

Willson hopes that, through her photography, she can help others see what she sees when she looks at these sweethearts: that Down Syndrome is merely one aspect of their life, not something that is entirely destructive.

Learn more about Down Syndrome on the National Down Syndrome Society website and check out more of Wilson’s work on her Facebook page.

We hope you’ll share this if you want to spread the message that all kids are worth the love and celebration that we give them!

posts.title: This Couple Cruises the Pan-American Highway in a Solar-Powered 1967 VW Van
posts.markdown: ![](http://assets.inhabitat.com/wp-content/blogs.dir/1/files/2013/01/the-dangerz-solar-powered-volkswagen-bus.jpg) If you’ve ever gone on a cross-country expedition, you know that life on the road can be anything but normal.  A buddy of mine and myself embarked on a month-long trip that took us across much of the Southwestern United States last summer.  While we were spending most of our nights in hammocks at various campgrounds, we were also basically living out of his jeep.   Our lives would have been a lot easier had we spent the time that [**The Dangerz**](http://www.thedangerz.com/) did when they refurbished a 1967 Volkswagen van, turning it into the ultimate road trip vehicle. The Dangerz, along with their dog, Karma, took their VW Van (that is outfitted with a solar system) down the**[Pan-American Highway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pan-American_Highway)**, a system of roads and freeways that travels from Prudhoe Bay in Alaska, all the way down to the lower regions of South America. While the Dangerz may have officially started their journey in 2012, they took plenty of time beforehand refurbishing their VW van so that they could live in it comfortably.   They ripped out all traces of the rotten foam and shag that covered the interior of the bus and installed a layer of foil-backed butyl to reduce vibration, and then covered it with closed cell foam to keep ambient noise from travelling wildly inside the bus. Once they had that down, they installed all of their bedding, seating, cabinets and kitchen equipment.  Their amenities include a popup table that is attached to the rear cargo door, a propane cooktop with storage above and space for a water tank underneath, and a refrigerator. Their van also has a few eco-friendly features.  Kirei, a material made of 100 percent recycle sorghum root, covers the cabinet doors and face of the refrigerator.  And a 135W solar panel, resting on the van’s roof, charges two 12 volt batteries stored under the van’s seats for any power needs when in remote areas.   ![](http://assets.inhabitat.com/wp-content/blogs.dir/1/files/2013/01/Dangerz-VW-Solar-Van-Panamerican-Highway-7.jpg) “For the solar controller we went with a Sunsaver Duo, which seems to be the controller of choice with the added bonus of being very affordable and easy to use,” explain the couple. “The handy panel tells us how much energy we are pulling off the sun, how much we are drawing at any given time and how much power we have left to draw.  We also hooked everything up to the starter battery so that we can track its power level and recharge it from the sun as needed.  An isolator ensures that the starter battery won’t draw down and leave us stranded simply because we stay up late and leave the lights on like motel 6.” ![](http://assets.inhabitat.com/wp-content/blogs.dir/1/files/2013/01/Dangerz-VW-Solar-Van-Panamerican-Highway-5.jpg) ![](http://assets.inhabitat.com/wp-content/blogs.dir/1/files/2013/01/Dangerz-VW-Solar-Van-Panamerican-Highway-6.jpg) ![](http://assets.inhabitat.com/wp-content/blogs.dir/1/files/2013/01/Dangerz-VW-Solar-Van-Panamerican-Highway-9.jpg) What do you think? Would you want to trade your job for a life on the road? Maybe if you had a sweet VW van to do it in, right?
posts.html:
If you’ve ever gone on a cross-country expedition, you know that life on the road can be anything but normal.  A buddy of mine and myself embarked on a month-long trip that took us across much of the Southwestern United States last summer.  While we were spending most of our nights in hammocks at various campgrounds, we were also basically living out of his jeep.  

Our lives would have been a lot easier had we spent the time that The Dangerz did when they refurbished a 1967 Volkswagen van, turning it into the ultimate road trip vehicle.

The Dangerz, along with their dog, Karma, took their VW Van (that is outfitted with a solar system) down the Pan-American Highway, a system of roads and freeways that travels from Prudhoe Bay in Alaska, all the way down to the lower regions of South America.

While the Dangerz may have officially started their journey in 2012, they took plenty of time beforehand refurbishing their VW van so that they could live in it comfortably.  

They ripped out all traces of the rotten foam and shag that covered the interior of the bus and installed a layer of foil-backed butyl to reduce vibration, and then covered it with closed cell foam to keep ambient noise from travelling wildly inside the bus.

Once they had that down, they installed all of their bedding, seating, cabinets and kitchen equipment.  Their amenities include a popup table that is attached to the rear cargo door, a propane cooktop with storage above and space for a water tank underneath, and a refrigerator.

Their van also has a few eco-friendly features.  Kirei, a material made of 100 percent recycle sorghum root, covers the cabinet doors and face of the refrigerator.  And a 135W solar panel, resting on the van’s roof, charges two 12 volt batteries stored under the van’s seats for any power needs when in remote areas.  

“For the solar controller we went with a Sunsaver Duo, which seems to be the controller of choice with the added bonus of being very affordable and easy to use,” explain the couple.

“The handy panel tells us how much energy we are pulling off the sun, how much we are drawing at any given time and how much power we have left to draw.  We also hooked everything up to the starter battery so that we can track its power level and recharge it from the sun as needed.  An isolator ensures that the starter battery won’t draw down and leave us stranded simply because we stay up late and leave the lights on like motel 6.”

What do you think? Would you want to trade your job for a life on the road? Maybe if you had a sweet VW van to do it in, right?

posts.title: These Stunning Pieces of Glow-in-the-Dark Jewelry Will Make Anyone Feel Magical
posts.markdown: Remember how cool glow-in-the-dark things were when you were a kid?  I remember the first time I saw the glow-in-the-dark stars and moons covering my friend’s ceiling.  What was barely visible when the lights were on, became stunning and awe-inspiring in the dark. If you’ve ever wanted to carry with you a bit of that magical feeling, then these glow-in-the-dark pieces of jewelry are definitely for you.  **[Sold on Etsy](http://ad.zanox.com/ppc/?29541758C78078187&zpar0=%5B%5Bcom%5D%5D&ulp=%5B%5Bhttps://www.etsy.com/shop/Papillon9?source=aw&awc=6220_1465307331_1e222edefd6220c757e3c88d5d04e63c&utm_source=affiliate_window&utm_medium=affiliate&utm_campaign=us_location_buyer&utm_content=259915%5D%5D)**, Canadian jewelry designer and photographer, Manon Richard, handcrafts these magical pieces herself. To achieve the desired effect, Richard lathers on luminous phosphorescent paint which gives the piece its turquoise glow when ‘charged.’  To charge the paint, simply hold it under a lamp for a few minutes or set it in the sun for a few hours. “When I was young I was scared of sleeping in the dark, I had a little light that was flashing in the wall power switch and this little light reassured me every time. I think it was the beginning of the passion of everything that glows in the dark!” said Manon. posts.title: When You Stop Having Sex, 5 Things Happen to Your Body
posts.markdown: When it comes to sex and the mystery of a foreign body, rumors and unexplored myths often run rampant.  You know, old sayings or euphemisms like, “if you don’t use it, you’ll lose it.” While there are certain physical side effects of**[not having sex for long periods of time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_abstinence)**, they’re basically just health benefits that you’re not receiving by having sex. Which means, no, **[your vagina isn’t going to close up shop for good](http://www.bustle.com/articles/103312-can-you-become-a-virgin-again-how-your-body-changes-if-you-havent-had-sex-in)** if it’s been a while.  Celibacy effects all of us differently, both physically and mentally.  On the physical side of things, these effects are hardly worth losing sleep over. Here are five things that happen to the body when you stop knockin’ boots: **Girls, you won’t get ‘tighter’** A popular urban myth is that the tightness of a woman’s vagina is somehow correlated with the**[number of sexual partners they’ve had](http://www.thedebrief.co.uk/sex/sex-stories/ask-an-adult-what-happens-if-you-don-t-have-sex-for-ages-20150439853)**; meaning that if you abstain from sex, you’ll somehow tighten those muscles back up.  This is entirely untrue.   Taking a break from sex doesn’t make you tighter, however, the vagina might fall out of its habit of expanding and relaxing as a response to arousal or penetration.  This might be the ‘tightness’ people refer to. **Men, you might experience erectile dysfunction** Research on abstinence in men found correlations indicating an**[increased chance of erectile dysfunction in men](http://www.medicaldaily.com/use-it-or-lose-it-how-age-hormones-and-masturbation-predict-sexual-health-329366)**who abstained for long periods of time.  These studies were done on older men, it should be noted, but the conclusion was that routine sex had an overall positive effect on erections. **Your immune system isn’t as healthy** Sexual activity has been linked to positive effects on the body’s immune system.  So, if you’re not getting action regularly, you might be more prone to sickness and infection. **You’re more stressed** Again, this is a case where not having sex robs you of health benefits.  Having sex is**[directly correlated with reduced stress levels](https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/how-the-mind-heals-the-body/201412/the-stress-sex-connection),** or ‘stress-busting.’  Small studies have discovered that people who do not have regular intercourse often experience higher blood pressure spikes as a response to stress than people who get laid regularly. **You won’t be as smart as you could be** For some reason, an **[old wives’ tale says that abstinence makes you more intelligent](http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-2539416/How-sex-make-smarter-Scientists-say-encourages-growth-brain-cells-improves-long-term-memory.html)**, when in reality, the opposite is true.  Scientists have found that sexual activity actually **[boosts neuron growth](http://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2014/01/how-sex-affects-intelligence-and-vice-versa/282889/)** in the brain’s hippocampus.  Pretty sweet, right?
posts.html:
When it comes to sex and the mystery of a foreign body, rumors and unexplored myths often run rampant.  You know, old sayings or euphemisms like, “if you don’t use it, you’ll lose it.”

While there are certain physical side effects of not having sex for long periods of time, they’re basically just health benefits that you’re not receiving by having sex.

Which means, no, your vagina isn’t going to close up shop for good if it’s been a while.  Celibacy effects all of us differently, both physically and mentally.  On the physical side of things, these effects are hardly worth losing sleep over.

Here are five things that happen to the body when you stop knockin’ boots:

Girls, you won’t get ‘tighter’

A popular urban myth is that the tightness of a woman’s vagina is somehow correlated with the number of sexual partners they’ve had; meaning that if you abstain from sex, you’ll somehow tighten those muscles back up.  This is entirely untrue.  

Taking a break from sex doesn’t make you tighter, however, the vagina might fall out of its habit of expanding and relaxing as a response to arousal or penetration.  This might be the ‘tightness’ people refer to.

Men, you might experience erectile dysfunction

Research on abstinence in men found correlations indicating an increased chance of erectile dysfunction in men who abstained for long periods of time.  These studies were done on older men, it should be noted, but the conclusion was that routine sex had an overall positive effect on erections.

Your immune system isn’t as healthy

Sexual activity has been linked to positive effects on the body’s immune system.  So, if you’re not getting action regularly, you might be more prone to sickness and infection.

You’re more stressed

Again, this is a case where not having sex robs you of health benefits.  Having sex is directly correlated with reduced stress levels, or ‘stress-busting.’  Small studies have discovered that people who do not have regular intercourse often experience higher blood pressure spikes as a response to stress than people who get laid regularly.

You won’t be as smart as you could be

For some reason, an old wives’ tale says that abstinence makes you more intelligent, when in reality, the opposite is true.  Scientists have found that sexual activity actually boosts neuron growth in the brain’s hippocampus.  Pretty sweet, right?

posts.title: Consciously Control Your Immune System Using Wim Hof’s Breathing Technique
posts.markdown: If you’ve ever wondered how extraordinary people do the extraordinary things they do, a lot of it has to do with the power of their mind and their ability to control the functions of their body.  One great example of a person who has done this, is Wim Hof. You’ve probably seen pictures of this man or maybe even videos of the crazy feats he does that push his body to the limit.  Holder of 20 Guinness World Records, Hof has climbed Everest and Kilimanjaro in shorts and shoes, rested peacefully in ice baths for hours, and even run a full marathon in 122 degree Fahrenheit heat without food and water. The secret to his success is called “**[The Wim Hof Method](http://dealguardian.net/product/831/?hop=highexistence&page=miniclass)**,” and it’s a breathing technique that gives you complete control over the autonomous systems within your body.  This **[3-day video course](http://dealguardian.net/product/831/?hop=highexistence&page=miniclass)** will teach Hof’s method for free. Even though Hof uses this technique to withstand deathly cold and hot temperatures, it can also be used to stave off disease and illness.  In fact, Wim is collaborating with university researchers to find a way to prove that everyone has the ability to do the things he is doing. His motivation behind doing so is his vision of a world without sickness.  A vision he’s already started working toward by doing experiments that involve using the Wim Hof Method to overcome the injection of a bacterium that causes nausea, puking and fever for many days.  Something he’s done before with minimal side effects. **The Wim Hof Method** You can practice the breathing technique Hof uses by following these steps: **Find a place to get comfortable and then close your eyes** Sit however is most comfortable for you, and practice expanding the lungs as much as possible to see if you feel any sense of constriction.  This practice is recommended to be done in the morning after you wake up because you have an empty stomach. **Warm your body up** Inhale as deep as you can, drawing in air until there is a small pressure on the inside of your chest from the solar plexus.  Hold your inhale for a short moment and then exhale as entirely as possible, pushing the air out of your lungs with your core muscles.  Hold your exhale for a moment.  Do this at least 15 times to prepare the body. **30 Power Breaths** Just as if you were blowing up a balloon, inhale using your nose and exhale using your mouth, but in quick, powerful breaths.  Doing this pulls the belly inward when you breathe out, and outward as your breathe in.  Try to maintain a steady pace and don’t be afraid to use your stomach. **Analyze your body** During your power breath exercise, try to establish a complete awareness of your body.  Which areas of your body need energy?  Which areas of your body have too much already?  Are there any blockages you can readily notice?  Acknowledge them, and then send them the needed energy and warmth to release.   **Hold** After you’ve completed your 30 rapid breaths, fill your lungs with air once more to their limit.  Then, exhale out all of the air completely and hold this for as long as possible.  Open the energy pathways of your body by relaxing into the hold.  Once you experience your gasp reflex on the top of your chest, let go of the breath. **Recovery breathing** Draw in breath again to max capacity.  Notice your chest growing and let go of any tension around the solar plexus.  Once you’ve reached max capacity, hold it one more time.  Let your chin touch your chest and stay steady for about 15 seconds. Recognize your ability to direct energy through your awareness and continue to move more and more inward as you let go.  After doing this for 15 seconds, you’ve completed round one. If you’re just starting this practice, one or two rounds is all you need to do.  Doing it daily with increasing number of rounds will help your practice grow.  If you begin to feel more comfortable with your practice, add other exercises and stretches to make it your own. Dizziness or pain means you should relax out of your posture, lie on your back and breathe normally.  And remember to always take 5 minutes at the end of each practice to relax, reflect, and scan your body. h/t[** High Existence **](http://highexistence.com/the-wim-hof-method-revealed-how-to-consciously-control-your-immune-system/)
posts.html:
If you’ve ever wondered how extraordinary people do the extraordinary things they do, a lot of it has to do with the power of their mind and their ability to control the functions of their body.  One great example of a person who has done this, is Wim Hof.

You’ve probably seen pictures of this man or maybe even videos of the crazy feats he does that push his body to the limit.  Holder of 20 Guinness World Records, Hof has climbed Everest and Kilimanjaro in shorts and shoes, rested peacefully in ice baths for hours, and even run a full marathon in 122 degree Fahrenheit heat without food and water.

The secret to his success is called “The Wim Hof Method,” and it’s a breathing technique that gives you complete control over the autonomous systems within your body.  This 3-day video course will teach Hof’s method for free.

Even though Hof uses this technique to withstand deathly cold and hot temperatures, it can also be used to stave off disease and illness.  In fact, Wim is collaborating with university researchers to find a way to prove that everyone has the ability to do the things he is doing.

His motivation behind doing so is his vision of a world without sickness.  A vision he’s already started working toward by doing experiments that involve using the Wim Hof Method to overcome the injection of a bacterium that causes nausea, puking and fever for many days.  Something he’s done before with minimal side effects.

The Wim Hof Method

You can practice the breathing technique Hof uses by following these steps:

Find a place to get comfortable and then close your eyes

Sit however is most comfortable for you, and practice expanding the lungs as much as possible to see if you feel any sense of constriction.  This practice is recommended to be done in the morning after you wake up because you have an empty stomach.

Warm your body up

Inhale as deep as you can, drawing in air until there is a small pressure on the inside of your chest from the solar plexus.  Hold your inhale for a short moment and then exhale as entirely as possible, pushing the air out of your lungs with your core muscles.  Hold your exhale for a moment.  Do this at least 15 times to prepare the body.

30 Power Breaths

Just as if you were blowing up a balloon, inhale using your nose and exhale using your mouth, but in quick, powerful breaths.  Doing this pulls the belly inward when you breathe out, and outward as your breathe in.  Try to maintain a steady pace and don’t be afraid to use your stomach.

Analyze your body

During your power breath exercise, try to establish a complete awareness of your body.  Which areas of your body need energy?  Which areas of your body have too much already?  Are there any blockages you can readily notice?  Acknowledge them, and then send them the needed energy and warmth to release.  

Hold

After you’ve completed your 30 rapid breaths, fill your lungs with air once more to their limit.  Then, exhale out all of the air completely and hold this for as long as possible.  Open the energy pathways of your body by relaxing into the hold.  Once you experience your gasp reflex on the top of your chest, let go of the breath.

Recovery breathing

Draw in breath again to max capacity.  Notice your chest growing and let go of any tension around the solar plexus.  Once you’ve reached max capacity, hold it one more time.  Let your chin touch your chest and stay steady for about 15 seconds.

Recognize your ability to direct energy through your awareness and continue to move more and more inward as you let go.  After doing this for 15 seconds, you’ve completed round one.

If you’re just starting this practice, one or two rounds is all you need to do.  Doing it daily with increasing number of rounds will help your practice grow.  If you begin to feel more comfortable with your practice, add other exercises and stretches to make it your own.

Dizziness or pain means you should relax out of your posture, lie on your back and breathe normally.  And remember to always take 5 minutes at the end of each practice to relax, reflect, and scan your body.

h/t High Existence

posts.title: What Kind of Week Will You Have? Find Out Here!
posts.markdown: The start of the week is here and that means new things for all of us. From the looks of it, this week will be busy. Busy, but exciting! There is a ton of stuff on the horizon that we have to look forward to, and possibly even a bit of growth as we let go of other things. Below, you will select which card you feel most attracted to. **How do you do it?** - Gently shut your eyes and take a deep breath as you relax into a peaceful state. - Start a focused internal dialogue, asking yourself: “What does this week have in store for me?” - Open your eyes, look at each card and then pick whichever one calls to you the most. - Read what your card has to say and remember it, even if you have to jot it down somewhere. If you meditate, meditate on the message on the week ahead of you. - Be prepared to accept any and all guidance that your higher being is trying to give you this week. **The 7 of Swords** ![Picture](http://www.awakeningpeople.com/uploads/4/2/8/2/42825745/card-purple_2.jpg) You have a powerful intuition, so listen when it’s trying to warn you of something you might be missing. If a situation in your life just doesn’t seem right at the moment, it’s probably not, but you’re unsure as to why. These hidden details will come out this week as the truth is revealed and brought to your attention. This will create a crossroads as you decide what to do; just remember that it is likely a blessing that doesn’t look like one at face value. **The Fool** ![Picture](http://www.awakeningpeople.com/uploads/4/2/8/2/42825745/card-yello_2.jpg?128) The Fool is symbolic of the limitless potential you possess at this moment in time. The fool is always prepared to embark on new endeavors, so if you’ve chosen this card, it means that the start of something new is looming. You will have to overcome any fears you have in order to push forward with your life. Gather your courage and create the positive change you wish to see for your life. **The Queen of Pentacles** ![Picture](http://www.awakeningpeople.com/uploads/4/2/8/2/42825745/card-blue_4.jpg?137) Symbolic of independence, fertility, practicality and stability, the Queen of Pentacles is known for her ability to find the perfect balance between home life and career life. Drawing this card means that you are ready to embrace a more independent lifestyle. The Queen’s energy will give you the needed push to establish the balance you unknowingly crave. But you’re ready. Just try to be as aware of your surroundings as possible; you need to be able to recognize opportunities before you can seize them. h/t: [**The Mystical Moon**](http://themysticalmoon.blogspot.com/)
posts.html:
The start of the week is here and that means new things for all of us. From the looks of it, this week will be busy. Busy, but exciting! There is a ton of stuff on the horizon that we have to look forward to, and possibly even a bit of growth as we let go of other things.

Below, you will select which card you feel most attracted to.

How do you do it?

  • Gently shut your eyes and take a deep breath as you relax into a peaceful state.
  • Start a focused internal dialogue, asking yourself: “What does this week have in store for me?”
  • Open your eyes, look at each card and then pick whichever one calls to you the most.
  • Read what your card has to say and remember it, even if you have to jot it down somewhere. If you meditate, meditate on the message on the week ahead of you.
  • Be prepared to accept any and all guidance that your higher being is trying to give you this week.

The 7 of Swords

You have a powerful intuition, so listen when it’s trying to warn you of something you might be missing. If a situation in your life just doesn’t seem right at the moment, it’s probably not, but you’re unsure as to why.

These hidden details will come out this week as the truth is revealed and brought to your attention. This will create a crossroads as you decide what to do; just remember that it is likely a blessing that doesn’t look like one at face value.

The Fool

The Fool is symbolic of the limitless potential you possess at this moment in time. The fool is always prepared to embark on new endeavors, so if you’ve chosen this card, it means that the start of something new is looming.

You will have to overcome any fears you have in order to push forward with your life. Gather your courage and create the positive change you wish to see for your life.

The Queen of Pentacles

Symbolic of independence, fertility, practicality and stability, the Queen of Pentacles is known for her ability to find the perfect balance between home life and career life. Drawing this card means that you are ready to embrace a more independent lifestyle.

The Queen’s energy will give you the needed push to establish the balance you unknowingly crave. But you’re ready. Just try to be as aware of your surroundings as possible; you need to be able to recognize opportunities before you can seize them.

h/t: The Mystical Moon

posts.title: How Often Do You See Crows? This Is What They Symbolize
posts.markdown: It feels like I see crows pretty regularly where I live. The giant, black birds that look as menacing as they look regal, are always swooping down for snacks or sitting atop a high perch as they observe the happenings of their surroundings. Many people believe they are symbolic of death, and while that might be the general consensus, they’re also symbolic of **[numerous other things](http://www.motherearthnews.com/nature-and-environment/crows-and-ravens-zmaz06djzraw.aspx)**that people usually aren’t aware of. **A bit about crows** Crows are some of the smartest birds flying around today. The size of their brain compared to the size of their body is the same ratio that chimpanzees typically exhibit, which isn’t too far away from humans. They have**[excellent memory](http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-2009278/Crows-excellent-memory-helps-tell-human-friend-foe.html)** and have been seen in studies to be capable of warning fellow crows of danger. **Symbolism** As we discussed earlier, **[death is the usual symbolism](http://www.avesnoir.com/10-amazing-crow-facts/)** crows are known for. Throughout various tales and legends, the crow is the being that helps guide souls from the living world into the next world; the afterlife. They’re inherently wise when it comes to death, change, and the cyclical nature of life. Seeing a crow can be a spiritual message, or a warning. If you notice any crows visiting the same house or area, it can be indicative that a passing will take place there shortly. **Change** Crows are also **[symbolic of change](http://www.universeofsymbolism.com/symbolic-crow-meaning.html)**. When the crow is reaching out to us, we may experience sudden visions of who we are meant to be on the truest level. The crow sees our soul for exactly what it is. It knows what we’re capable of doing, and will remind us of our potential. In that same capacity, the crow will encourage you to step outside of your comfort zone so that you can discover all that lies ahead of you. So don’t be afraid to chase after opportunity or success. **Magic, and the ability to *****see*** The **[blackness of the crow](http://www.shamanicjourney.com/crow-power-animal-symbol-of-sacred-law-change)**is highly symbolic of the night, and the darkness from which all life is and creation is wrought. It is also a reminder that you carry with you this power to create the destiny (or life) that you want for yourself. The appearance of a crow can also be a sign that you are gifted with clairvoyance, an extrasensory perception that lets you peer into the realm of spirits. So, next time you see a crow, watch it, listen to it, observe its being. It is probably a sign. It is there to help you move forward in life, whatever that looks like for you. If you’re in the midst of a change, you will persevere, as long as you remain true to yourself. h/t [**Collective Evolution**](http://www.collective-evolution.com/2016/04/24/have-you-been-seeing-crows-what-the-crow-symbolizes-more-than-just-death/)
posts.html:
It feels like I see crows pretty regularly where I live. The giant, black birds that look as menacing as they look regal, are always swooping down for snacks or sitting atop a high perch as they observe the happenings of their surroundings.

Many people believe they are symbolic of death, and while that might be the general consensus, they’re also symbolic of numerous other things that people usually aren’t aware of.

A bit about crows

Crows are some of the smartest birds flying around today. The size of their brain compared to the size of their body is the same ratio that chimpanzees typically exhibit, which isn’t too far away from humans.

They have excellent memory and have been seen in studies to be capable of warning fellow crows of danger.

Symbolism

As we discussed earlier, death is the usual symbolism crows are known for. Throughout various tales and legends, the crow is the being that helps guide souls from the living world into the next world; the afterlife.

They’re inherently wise when it comes to death, change, and the cyclical nature of life. Seeing a crow can be a spiritual message, or a warning.

If you notice any crows visiting the same house or area, it can be indicative that a passing will take place there shortly.

Change

Crows are also symbolic of change. When the crow is reaching out to us, we may experience sudden visions of who we are meant to be on the truest level. The crow sees our soul for exactly what it is. It knows what we’re capable of doing, and will remind us of our potential.

In that same capacity, the crow will encourage you to step outside of your comfort zone so that you can discover all that lies ahead of you. So don’t be afraid to chase after opportunity or success.

Magic, and the ability to see

The blackness of the crow is highly symbolic of the night, and the darkness from which all life is and creation is wrought. It is also a reminder that you carry with you this power to create the destiny (or life) that you want for yourself.

The appearance of a crow can also be a sign that you are gifted with clairvoyance, an extrasensory perception that lets you peer into the realm of spirits.

So, next time you see a crow, watch it, listen to it, observe its being. It is probably a sign. It is there to help you move forward in life, whatever that looks like for you. If you’re in the midst of a change, you will persevere, as long as you remain true to yourself.

h/t Collective Evolution

posts.title: Nothing is Solid. This is The World of Quantum Physics.
posts.markdown: You’ve probably heard of the world of quantum physics, but aren’t exactly sure what it is or why it’s important.  Prominent physicists (who have won Nobel Prizes) have worked hard to show the rest of us that the physical world is actually just one giant ocean of energy.  This type of physics operates on the understanding that nothing is solid. The other notion that they’ve worked to prove is the idea that our thoughts are ultimately what’re holding this ocean of energy together, forming the ‘objects’ that we see with our eyes. But the reason we see a person, and not a floating mass of energy, is because much like a movie or animated film, we’re seeing multiple frames per second so fast that the eye gets tricked into viewing what seems like one continuous frame. How we interpret the world around us is very limited by how we’re able to do so, specifically, our 5 physical senses.  Your ability to see, hear, touch, smell and taste allow you form a rough gist of what’s going on around you, but the image you form in your head is far from complete and not as accurate as you’d hope. Most of these interpretations originate from the ‘internal map’ of reality that we’ve created over time; the map represents the collective of your life experiences. So, if our thoughts are linked to this unseeable ocean of energy, and they determine what types of energies get formed, then it is not absurd to accept that our thoughts literally change the universe.  And, by extension of this, you become that which you think about most. From this perspective, quantum physics works to demonstrate that the world is not rigid and unchangeable, but rather an incredibly fluid plane that is constructed from both individual and collective thoughts. On the smallest possible level, our bodies are made, and exist, purely out of energy.  Use this information to change how you see the world; know that you have the power within you to manifest your greatest desires. h/t [**John Assaraf**](http://johnassaraf.com/law-of-attraction/why-you-should-be-aware-of-quantum-physics-2)

But the reason we see a person, and not a floating mass of energy, is because much like a movie or animated film, we’re seeing multiple frames per second so fast that the eye gets tricked into viewing what seems like one continuous frame.

posts.title: Using Coconut Oil Regularly? This Is What You Should Know
posts.markdown: I recently just started using coconut oil for all after my brother recommended I try it. At first, I wasn’t sure what I’d use it for. But, it turns out that you can use it for just about anything. My brother uses it to oil pull, which is a method of dental hygiene. I like to use it mainly as a moisturizer. I rub a tiny bit of coconut oil into my hair after most showers, as well as on my face and beard. And I especially like to use it on my tattoos, to keep them from getting too dry. The type of coconut oil you buy is important, however, as the composition of the fatty acids will be different for each type. **[Medium-chain saturated fatty acids](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medium-chain_triglyceride)** can be found in about 90 percent of coconut oils. Preferably, you want medium-chain fatty acids because the body easily digests and absorbs them. Also, because they are capable of freely moving between the blood-brain barrier, which means they can be utilized as either a source of energy, or for one’s neurological well being. Virgin (unrefined) coconut oil is what you should be looking for. It’s inexpensive, it tastes good, it’s entirely natural, and you can find it just about anywhere. Its inherent medicinal properties include: - Anti-inflammatory - Anti-microbial (infection-fighting) - Anti-oxidant - Improved nutrient absorption - Anti-carcinogenic, i.e. boosts the immune system and can prevent the growth of cancer Here are a few other practices that utilize coconut oil to achieve a desired effect or health benefit: **Age Spots** Rubbing coconut oil on any age spots or liver spots can help the spots fade faster. **Bug Bites** Not only does coconut oil speed up the healing process of **[bug bites](http://theheartysoul.com/essential-oils-bugs/),** but it can eliminate itching and burning sensations. **Burns (and Sunburns)** Apply coconut oil regularly to any burns or sunburns to prevent permanent damage and boost healing. **Lube** Coconut oil can be used as a natural, and safe, personal lubricant for when you’re playing with a friend, or just with yourself. It is not safe to use with latex, however! **Acid Reflux / Indigestion** Coconut oil can **[help relieve symptoms](http://theheartysoul.com/kill-parasites-naturally/)** of acid reflux and indigestion if consumed directly after a meal. These five uses for coconut oil only begin to scratch the surface of what this amazing oil can do. To see the full list, click **[here](http://theheartysoul.com/uses-for-coconut-oil/)**. And then go buy a jar to see for yourself just how great coconut oil really is! h/t [**The Hearty Soul **](http://theheartysoul.com/uses-for-coconut-oil/)
posts.html:
I recently just started using coconut oil for all after my brother recommended I try it. At first, I wasn’t sure what I’d use it for. But, it turns out that you can use it for just about anything.

My brother uses it to oil pull, which is a method of dental hygiene. I like to use it mainly as a moisturizer. I rub a tiny bit of coconut oil into my hair after most showers, as well as on my face and beard. And I especially like to use it on my tattoos, to keep them from getting too dry.

The type of coconut oil you buy is important, however, as the composition of the fatty acids will be different for each type.

Medium-chain saturated fatty acids can be found in about 90 percent of coconut oils. Preferably, you want medium-chain fatty acids because the body easily digests and absorbs them. Also, because they are capable of freely moving between the blood-brain barrier, which means they can be utilized as either a source of energy, or for one’s neurological well being.

Virgin (unrefined) coconut oil is what you should be looking for. It’s inexpensive, it tastes good, it’s entirely natural, and you can find it just about anywhere. Its inherent medicinal properties include:

  • Anti-inflammatory
  • Anti-microbial (infection-fighting)
  • Anti-oxidant
  • Improved nutrient absorption
  • Anti-carcinogenic, i.e. boosts the immune system and can prevent the growth of cancer

Here are a few other practices that utilize coconut oil to achieve a desired effect or health benefit:

Age Spots

Rubbing coconut oil on any age spots or liver spots can help the spots fade faster.

Bug Bites

Not only does coconut oil speed up the healing process of bug bites, but it can eliminate itching and burning sensations.

Burns (and Sunburns)

Apply coconut oil regularly to any burns or sunburns to prevent permanent damage and boost healing.

Lube

Coconut oil can be used as a natural, and safe, personal lubricant for when you’re playing with a friend, or just with yourself. It is not safe to use with latex, however!

Acid Reflux / Indigestion

Coconut oil can help relieve symptoms of acid reflux and indigestion if consumed directly after a meal.

These five uses for coconut oil only begin to scratch the surface of what this amazing oil can do. To see the full list, click here.

And then go buy a jar to see for yourself just how great coconut oil really is!

h/t The Hearty Soul

posts.title: A Quick Guide To Understanding The Spiritual Meaning of Numbers
posts.markdown: Numbers are very intriguing part of human life. While some see numbers as completely arbitrary symbols that only represent certain number values, others know that each one is connected to the universe in its own unique way. Numbers are inherent within all of nature. So, it would be in your best interest to learn a bit about what each number means and how you might be able to apply it to your life at the moment. Here is a short guide to understanding the meaning of different numbers: **Number: One** The number one is closely tied to strong wills, positivity, and raw energy. If you’re seeing the number one all over the place throughout your days, it can mean that you are destined to start a new chapter of your life soon. This is the time to start something new, and the number one is telling us to do so. **Number: Two** Two symbolizes kindness, balance, and duality. If you’re seeing a lot of two’s lately, the number is calling on you to make a decision about something. It’s telling you to ditch indecision and side with whichever choice most closely aligns with your being. **Number: Three** Three is often related with magic, intuition, and opportunity, as it’s also closely tied to time: the past, present, and future. If three’s are plentiful in your life, you are being called on to express any creativity you’ve been holding back, or to think about the direction your life is going. It can also mean that you may soon be rewarded or successful in life. **Number: Four** The number four is largely symbolic of stability and being grounded. It’s a nice square number, one that is found in many areas of life. We have four seasons, four main directions on a compass, and four main elements (water, wind, fire, earth), just to name a few. If you’re seeing four’s, think about making a change in the direction of your origins, your roots. You need to get back to solid ground. **Number: Five** Movement, adventure, and travel are all symbolized by the number five. It is also highly influential in change. If a large number of fives start appearing in your life, prepare yourself for change, chaos, or adventure (or maybe all three). **Number: Six** Six is one of the most powerful numbers in the universe. It symbolizes harmony, love, balance and truth. Six is the number we call upon when we seek guidance in the handling of sensitive issues. It is the light that provides balance to our spirits and our minds. **Number: Seven** Seven is a number that is associated with magic, just like the number three. However, seven largely deals with how we perceive and create the reality we live in by actively trying to manifest that reality through heightened consciousness and awareness. Which means it’s also closely tied to illusions of grandeur. **Number: Eight** The number eight symbolizes wealth, success and business, and this is because of eight’s cyclical nature: it’s like an infinity sign. You will see eights where success can only be achieved through a dedicated work ethic. The number eight symbolizes momentum: once you pick up speed, you only increase from there. **Number: Nine** At the apex of vibrations, the number nine represents satisfaction, accomplishment, and the ability to influence. Nine is inherent in intellect, creativity, and one’s influence over their current circumstances. Nine wants us to understand our abilities and how they can fit in with the rest of the world to make lasting, positive change.

posts.title: One Dog’s Miraculous Recovery After His Front Legs Were Cut Off With a Sword
posts.markdown: Everyone, meet Cola, the ecstatic pup you see in the video above. As you can tell from the video, Cola is missing his two front legs, a condition he was forced into after his owner’s neighbor came after him with a sword for chewing up a pair of shoes. Cola was 9 months old when the neighbor cut off both of his front legs using a sword. But Cola’s spirits are definitely not down, as you can tell. His miraculous recovery from the terrible incident that happened last year is thanks to the collective support and donations from people around the world like yourself. Cola received special care from a clinic in Bangkok. The clinic team gave Cola ample time to recover before pressing onward with plans to outfit him with prosthetic limbs. While at the clinic, Cola’s owner decided to leave him under their care, as he feared taking Cola home where his neighbor still lived. The neighbor who attacked Cola was given a month of jail time. I know, it’s not entirely fitting of the crime. But had this same incident happened only two years ago, the attacker would not have served any jail time at all. Thailand only just passed its first ever Animal Welfare Law back in 2014. But the story has a happy ending. Co-founder of Soi Dog Foundation (the organization who paid for Cola’s recovery), Gill Dalley, decided to adopt Cola and take him back to Phuket. As fate would have it, Gill uses prosthetic limbs herself after losing both of her legs attempting to save a dog about 10 years ago. You can learn more about Cola and Gill’s story, as well as donate to help more dogs like Cola, here: [Donate](https://ert.soidog.org/cola) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/SoiDogPageInEnglish/) | [Gill’s Story](http://www.soidog.org/en/about-soi-dog/gills-story/)

Everyone, meet Cola, the ecstatic pup you see in the video above. As you can tell from the video, Cola is missing his two front legs, a condition he was forced into after his owner’s neighbor came after him with a sword for chewing up a pair of shoes. Cola was 9 months old when the neighbor cut off both of his front legs using a sword.
