posts.title: Spiritual Awakening in the Digital Age
posts.markdown: by **[Frank M. Wanderer](http://powerofconsciousness.blogspot.hu/)**Ph.D. In our days the Facebook generation have debuted on the revolving stage of life. The Facebook  generation started in 1996 with Facebook and its members are born today, too. They are often called ”turn of the millenium generation,” and the most recent term is ”digital natives.” They have grown up with the new technologies (computer, mobile phone, Internet), and they are hardly able to imagine their life without these. The services offered by the new technologies are part of their daily life, they are conveniently at home in the online world of the Internet. *Belonging to virtual communities (e. g. Facebook) is more important for them than building personal connections*. They spend less and less time reading, and more and more time playing computer games. They are able to occupy themselves with several things simultaneously; they are used to receiving large amounts of information in a short time. But the way they manage information has been transformed, as the vast amounts of information they receive online is overwhelming, and they do not have time to process and arrange it. A lot of it soon loses actuality, so very often people do not remember the information itself, but the way of accessing it. For them, information should be interesting, and not so much its reality or accuracy. In this way, they receive a lot of information that is unsuited to their age, and they are emotionally unable to cope with it. The rapid stream of information leaves no time for people to process and arrange it; freshly shared information is coming in from minute to minute, and because of the lack of meta-communication, the information itself is often misunderstood. *[The human Mind ](http://powerofconsciousness.blogspot.hu/2015/01/the-power-of-conditioned-mind.html)has been conditioned by traditions and social expectations for centuries. T[he conditioned patterns of behaviour](https://egoalertnessconsciousness.wordpress.com/2016/02/16/9-things-to-know-abouth-the-fixed-conditioned-mental-patterns/) constitute personal identity and provide the foundations for human behaviour. * Nowadays, however, the ”Facebook generation” is a lot more difficult to condition in the old ways, since for them traditions–religious or social–are much less important than these were for the previous generations. It is closely related with the fact that the mind of the new generation is more open to new things, and the handling of the immense amounts of information requires an entirely new attitude and way of thinking. The safe shelter of traditions is now lost, the openness of the new generations make them exposed and vulnerable in the stream of large amounts of information. **The Collection of our Masks** *In our daily life we tend to cover our real face with a set of masks. Our personal identity is the collection of our various masks. We immediately put on one of those masks whenever we are not alone.* Whenever there is another person in the room with us, one of our masks is automatically fixed on our face, matching the situation and the other person. We ourselves have created these masks unconsciously, under the influence of our parents and teachers, in the course of our life. As a child we made efforts to meet all the innumerable expectations of society reaching us through our parents and teachers. *Perhaps the first of these masks is that of the ”good kid” mask, as our conditioned us to the behavioural patterns of a good child. Then, as we grow up, the number of our masks begin to increase steadily.* In our daily life, we need a wide range of masks, as we encounter a large number of different situations and people, and we have a suitable mask for every situation. We tend to behave differently with our boss or with our subordinates, with our children, with our husband and wife, with our friends and with our enemies. Our identity is therefore made up by the collection of our masks that we show to the outside world, and very often we are not even aware of that. These mask were imposed upon us by society, and after a while we begin to identify with the masks. We have eventually completely identified with the masks. *The online world even further increases the number of our masks, as it offers us the possibility to assume a new identity, that is, the online personality.* This is the mask that we hold up in front of us when we are online. A lot of us have several of such masks, meeting the demands of the specific online communities we are in connection with. The online masks used in cyberspace play an increasingly important role at the new generation, the Facebook-community when they formulate their own identity. *The** online personality is necessary to protect its bearer against the dangers of the new world, or to place the bearer into a position that the individual would never be able to achieve in the real world.* At more and more members of the Facebook generation we witness that they increasingly identify with their online personality. *These masks are so closely attached to them, the persons so strongly identify with their masks that they have alrwady forgotten about their original face. It affects the relationship of these people with others*. *** ****** *****Supermarket and the Santa Claus Feeling** *Our real identity is, however, hidden deeply under these masks.* The glue of identification fixes these daily masks on us so powerfully that we feel almost entirely the same as the masks. *The insistence of the Facebook-generation on their masks is a lot more powerful than the way most ordinary people stick to their own daily masks*. The reason why they tend to insist on their a masks more powerfully than other people is that these young people do not need to face the disappointments and suffering of the real world, as they can be anyone in the fantasies of the cyberworld. If they dislike any of their online masks, they can quickly make a new one, or they are present in cyberspace with several masks, even opposing ones, at the same time. They submerge into a world that they have themselves created and where their possibilities are endless. That is how they drift farther and farther away from the Miracle, and sink even deeper into a dream, a cyber-dream. *Some young people, however, have already reached the boundaries of that cyber-dreamworld, and they talk about strange experiences.* I have recently read the confessions of two teenage boys about how they see the world now and what their ideas about it are. *One of them says the following*: ”I called my experience the *supermarket-feeling.* Not that it overcomes me in supermarkets only. Sometimes I have it at school celebrations or in the middle of a railway station. I do not think I sense it coming, or it overcomes me because I do one particular thing that triggers it, it simply occurs. Then I am standing there in a supermarket, and lots of people with their shopping trolleys march before me–the whole life. While I am standing there, I feel like crying. There is only one question left in me there, and that is: ’Why?’” *The confession of another young person*: ”Do you remember, when we were finally told that Santa Claus was not real, it was just a big game, in which everybody participated, parents, teachers, older brothers, absolutely everybody? Just when the big secret was revealed, were we able to return to our normal daily activities, without playing roles and whispering into ears behind the back of others. I saw the world in a similar way. Everything was very mysterious, like a big game, that was the only way it could be, and in no other way. Everybody cooperated, everybody played their role very well. Every human being, the Earth, the oceans and the stars, was involved in the great game. Only I was not; not yet. I unconsciously realized, more and more clearly, that I had to wait for that revelation. I started to hope strongly that I would be able to see through the scene, and then real life would begin for me finally. But, as opposed to the tale of Santa Claus, nobody ever calls you to tall you the secret. I had to make the discovery myself, I was sure. Only then would the confusion in connection with appearance and reality clear up. There is no other way.” **The Awakening of the Facebook Generation** The confessions above indicate that the youngsters unconsciously sensed that the masks–no matter how ordinary they are–false, *they do not belong to these masks, and it is not the masks that constitute their real identity. *They also sensed that *nobody was going to show them the way out of the mental confusion in connection with appearance and reality*, and they themselves had to find it. If you also belong to the Facebook generation, it is essential to pay attention to these emotions and do not just disregard them offhand. *These emotions show that [the Consciousness](https://egoalertnessconsciousness.wordpress.com/2016/02/07/3-stages-in-the-evolution-of-the-human-spirit-ego-alertness-consciousness/) that is dormant in your present state of ordinary consciousness, begins to wake up, and no longer identifies with the forms and shapes.* This awakening means that your nicely constructed and allegedly impenetrable personal identity begins to crumble and you find yourself in an empty space, where you are able to witness the dance of forms and shapes like an external observer. *This is experiencing the Miracle, the witnessing Presence. * This experience, this Presence is the gate you may step through towards the Miracle, to the quiet of your real Self. That is why it is *important that you should not be scared of that experience, do not begin to rebuild your former identity, do not be closed into the ordinary ways of the mind. Remain in the experience, and submit to the Miracle of Consciousness! * From the book>> : [Frank M. Wanderer](http://powerofconsciousness.blogspot.hu/): [The Biggest Obstacle to Enlightenment: How to Escape from the Prison of Mind Games?](http://www.amazon.com/Biggest-Obstacle-Enlightenment-Escape-Prison-ebook/dp/B00L0JTS3U/?_encoding=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=ur2&tag=spir02-20&linkId=FZBN2XM43KRE65T7 "http://www.amazon.com/Biggest-Obstacle-Enlightenment-Escape-Prison-ebook/dp/B00L0JTS3U") **About the author:** [Frank M. Wanderer Ph.D](http://powerofconsciousness.blogspot.hu/p/about-me.html) is a professor of psychology, a consciousness researcher and writer. Frank is the author of the books „[The Revolution of Consciousness: Deconditioning the Programmed Mind](http://www.amazon.com/Revolution-Consciousness-Deconditioning-Programmed-Mind-ebook/dp/B00Y7D3UY4/ref=sr_1_5?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1432555445&sr=1-5)” and “[3 Stages in the Evolution of the Human Spirit](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B01BJBJV5S?ref_=pe_2427780_160035660/p/content-preface-i.html) [EGO – ALERTNESS – CONSCIOUSNESS](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B01BJBJV5S?ref_=pe_2427780_160035660/p/content-preface-i.html)“
posts.html:
by Frank M. Wanderer Ph.D.

In our days the Facebook generation have debuted on the revolving stage of life. The Facebook  generation started in 1996 with Facebook and its members are born today, too. They are often called ”turn of the millenium generation,” and the most recent term is ”digital natives.”

They have grown up with the new technologies (computer, mobile phone, Internet), and they are hardly able to imagine their life without these. The services offered by the new technologies are part of their daily life, they are conveniently at home in the online world of the Internet. Belonging to virtual communities (e. g. Facebook) is more important for them than building personal connections.

They spend less and less time reading, and more and more time playing computer games. They are able to occupy themselves with several things simultaneously; they are used to receiving large amounts of information in a short time. But the way they manage information has been transformed, as the vast amounts of information they receive online is overwhelming, and they do not have time to process and arrange it. A lot of it soon loses actuality, so very often people do not remember the information itself, but the way of accessing it. For them, information should be interesting, and not so much its reality or accuracy.

In this way, they receive a lot of information that is unsuited to their age, and they are emotionally unable to cope with it. The rapid stream of information leaves no time for people to process and arrange it; freshly shared information is coming in from minute to minute, and because of the lack of meta-communication, the information itself is often misunderstood.

The human Mind has been conditioned by traditions and social expectations for centuries. The conditioned patterns of behaviour constitute personal identity and provide the foundations for human behaviour. 

Nowadays, however, the ”Facebook generation” is a lot more difficult to condition in the old ways, since for them traditions–religious or social–are much less important than these were for the previous generations.

It is closely related with the fact that the mind of the new generation is more open to new things, and the handling of the immense amounts of information requires an entirely new attitude and way of thinking. The safe shelter of traditions is now lost, the openness of the new generations make them exposed and vulnerable in the stream of large amounts of information.

The Collection of our Masks

In our daily life we tend to cover our real face with a set of masks. Our personal identity is the collection of our various masks. We immediately put on one of those masks whenever we are not alone. Whenever there is another person in the room with us, one of our masks is automatically fixed on our face, matching the situation and the other person.

We ourselves have created these masks unconsciously, under the influence of our parents and teachers, in the course of our life. As a child we made efforts to meet all the innumerable expectations of society reaching us through our parents and teachers. Perhaps the first of these masks is that of the ”good kid” mask, as our conditioned us to the behavioural patterns of a good child. Then, as we grow up, the number of our masks begin to increase steadily.

In our daily life, we need a wide range of masks, as we encounter a large number of different situations and people, and we have a suitable mask for every situation. We tend to behave differently with our boss or with our subordinates, with our children, with our husband and wife, with our friends and with our enemies. Our identity is therefore made up by the collection of our masks that we show to the outside world, and very often we are not even aware of that. These mask were imposed upon us by society, and after a while we begin to identify with the masks. We have eventually completely identified with the masks.

The online world even further increases the number of our masks, as it offers us the possibility to assume a new identity, that is, the online personality. This is the mask that we hold up in front of us when we are online. A lot of us have several of such masks, meeting the demands of the specific online communities we are in connection with. The online masks used in cyberspace play an increasingly important role at the new generation, the Facebook-community when they formulate their own identity. The online personality is necessary to protect its bearer against the dangers of the new world, or to place the bearer into a position that the individual would never be able to achieve in the real world.

At more and more members of the Facebook generation we witness that they increasingly identify with their online personality. These masks are so closely attached to them, the persons so strongly identify with their masks that they have alrwady forgotten about their original face. It affects the relationship of these people with others.

  Supermarket and the Santa Claus Feeling

Our real identity is, however, hidden deeply under these masks. The glue of identification fixes these daily masks on us so powerfully that we feel almost entirely the same as the masks. The insistence of the Facebook-generation on their masks is a lot more powerful than the way most ordinary people stick to their own daily masks.

The reason why they tend to insist on their a masks more powerfully than other people is that these young people do not need to face the disappointments and suffering of the real world, as they can be anyone in the fantasies of the cyberworld. If they dislike any of their online masks, they can quickly make a new one, or they are present in cyberspace with several masks, even opposing ones, at the same time. They submerge into a world that they have themselves created and where their possibilities are endless. That is how they drift farther and farther away from the Miracle, and sink even deeper into a dream, a cyber-dream.

Some young people, however, have already reached the boundaries of that cyber-dreamworld, and they talk about strange experiences. I have recently read the confessions of two teenage boys about how they see the world now and what their ideas about it are.

One of them says the following: ”I called my experience the supermarket-feeling. Not that it overcomes me in supermarkets only. Sometimes I have it at school celebrations or in the middle of a railway station. I do not think I sense it coming, or it overcomes me because I do one particular thing that triggers it, it simply occurs. Then I am standing there in a supermarket, and lots of people with their shopping trolleys march before me–the whole life. While I am standing there, I feel like crying. There is only one question left in me there, and that is: ’Why?’”

The confession of another young person: ”Do you remember, when we were finally told that Santa Claus was not real, it was just a big game, in which everybody participated, parents, teachers, older brothers, absolutely everybody? Just when the big secret was revealed, were we able to return to our normal daily activities, without playing roles and whispering into ears behind the back of others. I saw the world in a similar way. Everything was very mysterious, like a big game, that was the only way it could be, and in no other way. Everybody cooperated, everybody played their role very well. Every human being, the Earth, the oceans and the stars, was involved in the great game. Only I was not; not yet. I unconsciously realized, more and more clearly, that I had to wait for that revelation. I started to hope strongly that I would be able to see through the scene, and then real life would begin for me finally. But, as opposed to the tale of Santa Claus, nobody ever calls you to tall you the secret. I had to make the discovery myself, I was sure. Only then would the confusion in connection with appearance and reality clear up. There is no other way.”

The Awakening of the Facebook Generation

The confessions above indicate that the youngsters unconsciously sensed that the masks–no matter how ordinary they are–false, they do not belong to these masks, and it is not the masks that constitute their real identity. They also sensed that nobody was going to show them the way out of the mental confusion in connection with appearance and reality, and they themselves had to find it.

If you also belong to the Facebook generation, it is essential to pay attention to these emotions and do not just disregard them offhand. These emotions show that the Consciousness that is dormant in your present state of ordinary consciousness, begins to wake up, and no longer identifies with the forms and shapes.

This awakening means that your nicely constructed and allegedly impenetrable personal identity begins to crumble and you find yourself in an empty space, where you are able to witness the dance of forms and shapes like an external observer. This is experiencing the Miracle, the witnessing Presence.

This experience, this Presence is the gate you may step through towards the Miracle, to the quiet of your real Self. That is why it is important that you should not be scared of that experience, do not begin to rebuild your former identity, do not be closed into the ordinary ways of the mind. Remain in the experience, and submit to the Miracle of Consciousness! 

From the book>> : Frank M. Wanderer: The Biggest Obstacle to Enlightenment: How to Escape from the Prison of Mind Games?

About the author:

Frank M. Wanderer Ph.D is a professor of psychology, a consciousness researcher and writer. Frank is the author of the books „The Revolution of Consciousness: Deconditioning the Programmed Mind” and “3 Stages in the Evolution of the Human Spirit EGO – ALERTNESS – CONSCIOUSNESS“

posts.title: Find Out the Verb That Defines YOU, Based on Your Zodiac Sign
posts.markdown: After careful study of each sign, we’ve come up with the verb that best defines each of them. Locate your zodiac sign below and see what verb is tied to you. Then, ponder your verb for a little while; think about whether or not this verb is portraying a positive or negative aspect of who you are. We grow into better people by gaining a heightened awareness of ourselves. **Aries – “Defend”** Aries love to protect the people they love and care most about. Similar to your romantic equal, the Virgo, you love being the type of person that helps others and fixes problems. **Leo – “Seduce”** Almost everyone loves hanging out with a Leo. They’re witty, attractive and usually smell pretty good. Not to mention they’re chock-full of confidence and charisma, which only makes their seductive nature easier. **Sagittarius – “Move”** As a Sagittarius, you’re always moving. This means that you get bored easily and hate when things are stagnant. You like change and thrive in it. **Taurus – “Direct”** Taurus don’t care for modesty. They *need* to let people know where their boundaries are. That way people know exactly where they stand with the Taurus. You don’t typically enjoy small talk; you’d rather people just get to the point. **Virgo – “Do”** Virgos are notorious for being the most productive of all the zodiac signs. Chances are good that you’re already neck-deep in things to do, but you wouldn’t have it any other way. You like staying busy. **Capricorn – “Climb”** Capricorns love challenges and obstacles because of how it feels when they overcome them. They’re competitive in nature, never settling for anything less than the best. **Gemini – “Change”** The Gemini’s somewhat random nature makes them unpredictable. They can switch from light and playful to serious and assertive at a moment’s notice, but it makes sense because they’re really just a giant ball of emotions and ideas. **Libra – “Balance”** Libras strive to create balance in their life by being somewhat good at everything, even if finding that balance isn’t always easy. Libras are incredibly aware of any shortcomings, which is why they try so hard to be masters of the world. **Aquarius – “Soften”** As a genuinely kind and nurturing person, your presence in almost every setting makes things less abrasive and more enjoyable. You see the good in everyone, wishing the best for everyone, especially when it comes to finding soul mates. **Cancer – “Nest”** Cancers love building homes or nests, and this applies to all aspects of a Cancer’s life. You prefer stability and loyalty above all else. Which is why you want to find someone you can build something real with. **Scorpio – “Plot”** Scorpios are known are their pensive nature. They’re always thinking, always planning, always trying to find a way to come out on top. Your mind is a maze the likes of which no one has ever seen; largely because you won’t let anyone in. **Pisces – “Feel”** Being a Pisces means that you’re one of the most empathic signs in all of the zodiac. You’re highly emotional, feeling things before you can fully understand why, which also makes it incredibly difficult to communicate with you sometimes. h/t [**Raven Fon**](http://mysticalraven.com/)

Aries – “Defend”

posts.title: This Abstract Image Test Will Determine Your Dominant Personality Trait
posts.markdown: What you see in these images will reveal your strongest characteristic. Will it be wisdom, courage, passion, honesty, kindness, or intuition? What you see says a lot about you. Interpretation is key to life, and what you see if what your life will become. So the real question is, what do you see?

posts.title: 10 Reasons Apple Cider Vinegar Is the Remedy For Everything But Death
posts.markdown: Apple cider vinegar is one of those things that works for some people, but not for others. Even though it might not be right for some people, a great deal of research has shown time and time again that apple cider vinegar is full of medicinal benefit. Here are ten solid reasons (out of many!) you should consider adding apple cider vinegar to your diet: **It’s been seen to fight cancer** Research surrounding cancer and the use of apple cider vinegar to treat some aspects of it has found that vinegar, at the very least, kills certain types of **[cancer cells](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15237578/)**. A study out of China found that a link between vinegar consumption and reduced risk of **[oesophageal cancer](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12875624/).** Anti-tumor characteristics are believed to be linked to acetic acid. **Reduced risk of cardiovascular disease** ACV (apple cider vinegar) is full of **[chlorogenic acids](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/8068036)**that have been seen to help reduce bad cholesterol and keep it from building up in your blood vessels. **It can help you lose weight** **[Japanese researchers](http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2009/06/090622103820.htm)** discovered that acetic acid, which is plentiful in ACV, might help reduce the accumulation of body fat. One study found that, between a group of people drinking plain water regularly over 12 weeks, and a group with vinegar added to their diet, the vinegar group**[lost 1 to 2 pounds](http://www.webmd.com/diet/obesity/apple-cider-vinegar-and-health?page=1)** over the same time period. **It prevents muscle fatigue** When your muscles become exhausted or overworked, they suffer due to low levels of minerals and electrolytes. One tablespoon of ACV with water before a workout will ensure your body has plenty of electrolytes, while also helping reduce levels of lactic acid in the muscles. **It gets rid of dandruff** Make a solution of equal parts water and ACV, mix together and rub through your scalp and hair, place a bathing cap over your hair, and then wait for 1 to 2 hours before rinsing it out. If you do this at least one to two times a week, **[you should see results](http://theheartysoul.com/acv-hair-tricks/)**. **It is a known disinfectant and killer of bacteria** Vinegar has been cited as being used to treat wounds for **[over 2,000 years](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3495363/)**. Modern research has since proven that vinegar kills bacteria such as **[E. coli](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9713753)** and **[S. aureus](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12597475)**. Not to mention it’s natural, so you can use it to clean produce and also as a food preservative. **It can reduce your risk for diabetes** Postprandial glycemia is a term that refers to increased levels of sugar in the blood after consuming a meal, and is a large reason why pre-diabetics eventually get diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes. Research from Arizona University found that drinking a solution containing 20 grams of ACV, 49 grams of water, and one teaspoon of saccharine after eating a meal can reduce the amount of sugar that flows into the bloodstream by 35 percent. **It helps reduce infection in our teeth** One test exposed 100 teeth to E. faecalis bacteria and found that, when exposed to ACV, the**[bacteria count was reduced significantly](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21531598)**, but not completely gotten rid of. **It can help you detox** Certain foods that we consume act as protective agents, helping prevent the accumulation of toxins. ACV is one of those, as its unique blend of acids targets toxins, helping our bodies clear them out more efficiently. **It soothes sunburns and insect bites** **[Sunburns](http://familylifegoals.com/home-remedies-for-burns/)** and bug bites are very common in the summertime, and ACV is great for treating them. Using a solution of equal parts water and ACV, apply the solution to the affected area of the skin using some form of cotton and you should feel relief from burns, bites and stings.

Apple cider vinegar is one of those things that works for some people, but not for others. Even though it might not be right for some people, a great deal of research has shown time and time again that apple cider vinegar is full of medicinal benefit.

Here are ten solid reasons (out of many!) you should consider adding apple cider vinegar to your diet:

It’s been seen to fight cancer

Research surrounding cancer and the use of apple cider vinegar to treat some aspects of it has found that vinegar, at the very least, kills certain types of cancer cells. A study out of China found that a link between vinegar consumption and reduced risk of oesophageal cancer. Anti-tumor characteristics are believed to be linked to acetic acid.

Reduced risk of cardiovascular disease

ACV (apple cider vinegar) is full of chlorogenic acids that have been seen to help reduce bad cholesterol and keep it from building up in your blood vessels.

It can help you lose weight

Japanese researchers discovered that acetic acid, which is plentiful in ACV, might help reduce the accumulation of body fat. One study found that, between a group of people drinking plain water regularly over 12 weeks, and a group with vinegar added to their diet, the vinegar group lost 1 to 2 pounds over the same time period.

It prevents muscle fatigue

When your muscles become exhausted or overworked, they suffer due to low levels of minerals and electrolytes. One tablespoon of ACV with water before a workout will ensure your body has plenty of electrolytes, while also helping reduce levels of lactic acid in the muscles.

It gets rid of dandruff

Make a solution of equal parts water and ACV, mix together and rub through your scalp and hair, place a bathing cap over your hair, and then wait for 1 to 2 hours before rinsing it out. If you do this at least one to two times a week, you should see results.

It is a known disinfectant and killer of bacteria

Vinegar has been cited as being used to treat wounds for over 2,000 years. Modern research has since proven that vinegar kills bacteria such as E. coli and S. aureus. Not to mention it’s natural, so you can use it to clean produce and also as a food preservative.

It can reduce your risk for diabetes

Postprandial glycemia is a term that refers to increased levels of sugar in the blood after consuming a meal, and is a large reason why pre-diabetics eventually get diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes.

Research from Arizona University found that drinking a solution containing 20 grams of ACV, 49 grams of water, and one teaspoon of saccharine after eating a meal can reduce the amount of sugar that flows into the bloodstream by 35 percent.

It helps reduce infection in our teeth

One test exposed 100 teeth to E. faecalis bacteria and found that, when exposed to ACV, the bacteria count was reduced significantly, but not completely gotten rid of.

It can help you detox

Certain foods that we consume act as protective agents, helping prevent the accumulation of toxins. ACV is one of those, as its unique blend of acids targets toxins, helping our bodies clear them out more efficiently.

It soothes sunburns and insect bites

Sunburns and bug bites are very common in the summertime, and ACV is great for treating them. Using a solution of equal parts water and ACV, apply the solution to the affected area of the skin using some form of cotton and you should feel relief from burns, bites and stings.

posts.title: Drumming in Groups is Just as Effective as Prozac, One Study Finds
posts.markdown: If you’re someone who uses **[Prozac](http://www.webmd.com/drugs/2/drug-6997/prozac-oral/details)** regularly, you might want to consider ditching the drug and **[joining a drumming group instead](http://www.greenmedinfo.com/disease/depression). ** [A new study](http://dx.plos.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0151136) has discovered that group drumming can have significant positive effects on a person’s well being, including improvements in their depression, anxiety and**[social resilience](http://www.transre.org/en/blog/what-social-resilience/)**. To test this, UK researchers tasked the treatment group in their study with 90-minutes of group drumming every week, over 10 weeks. The size of these drumming groups consisted of about 15 to 20 people. Each member of the treatment group was given a traditional African djembe drum, and were asked to sit in a circle with the other drummers. The participants engaged in about 20% instruction and talking, and then made music with their drums for the other 80% of the time. What they found is quite remarkable. The control group, which was tasked with attending social community events, like quiz nights, women’s group meetings and book clubs, made no significant improvements in depression, anxiety or social resilience. The drumming group, on the other hand, made drastic improvements. And, these positive changes were still seen 3 months later during a follow up. What’s even cooler is that there was a noticeable shift in the immune profiles of those who participated **[in the drumming group](http://www.greenmedinfo.com/therapeutic-action/drumming)**. They went from pro-inflammatory to anti-inflammatory responses. The implications for such findings are quite significant. They let us peer into a world of treatment that does not revolve around pharmaceutical drugs. One that promotes side-effect free benefits and treatment options that do not focus on simply suppressing symptoms, but getting rid of them. If you’ve been depressed, anxious or struggling to cope in social environments, you might want to search for a local drumming group to join so you can start making music, and possibly **[change your life](http://www.greenmedinfo.com/therapeutic-action/drumming)** in the process. h/t: [**GreenMedInfo**](http://www.greenmedinfo.com/blog/group-drumming-better-prozac-study-suggests)
posts.html:
If you’re someone who uses Prozac regularly, you might want to consider ditching the drug and joining a drumming group instead.

A new study has discovered that group drumming can have significant positive effects on a person’s well being, including improvements in their depression, anxiety and social resilience.

To test this, UK researchers tasked the treatment group in their study with 90-minutes of group drumming every week, over 10 weeks. The size of these drumming groups consisted of about 15 to 20 people. Each member of the treatment group was given a traditional African djembe drum, and were asked to sit in a circle with the other drummers.

The participants engaged in about 20% instruction and talking, and then made music with their drums for the other 80% of the time.

What they found is quite remarkable. The control group, which was tasked with attending social community events, like quiz nights, women’s group meetings and book clubs, made no significant improvements in depression, anxiety or social resilience. The drumming group, on the other hand, made drastic improvements. And, these positive changes were still seen 3 months later during a follow up.

What’s even cooler is that there was a noticeable shift in the immune profiles of those who participated in the drumming group. They went from pro-inflammatory to anti-inflammatory responses.

The implications for such findings are quite significant. They let us peer into a world of treatment that does not revolve around pharmaceutical drugs. One that promotes side-effect free benefits and treatment options that do not focus on simply suppressing symptoms, but getting rid of them.

If you’ve been depressed, anxious or struggling to cope in social environments, you might want to search for a local drumming group to join so you can start making music, and possibly change your life in the process.

h/t: GreenMedInfo

posts.title: 5 Plants That Will Clean the Air in Your Home
posts.markdown: If you’re looking to bring a bit of life into your home or office space, one of the best ways to go about doing so is by introducing plant life that will help purify the air you breathe. **[A new study](http://www.eurekalert.org/emb_releases/2016-08/acs-str072116.php)** regarding plants and their ability to purify air found that certain plants are better at it than others. Many people are completely unaware of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that often inhabit the spaces of a home due to cigarette smoke, paint, furniture, copiers and printers, different cleaning supplies and clothes that need to be dry-cleaned. “Buildings, whether new or old, can have high levels of VOCs in them, sometimes so high that you can smell them,” says Vadoud Niri, PhD, an assistant professor of chemistry who led the new study. To reduce your risk of **[long-term health problems](http://www.health.com/health/article/0,,20411032,00.html)**, you might want to look into getting one of these five plants for your living space: **Dracaena (*****Dracaena frangas)*** ![Dracaena-fragrans-resized](http://expandedconsciousness.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Dracaena-fragrans-resized-300x194.jpg) While each of the five plants listed here did fairly well in removing acetone (the chemical largely found in nail polish remover) from the air, the Dracaena plant came out on top, absorbing a whopping 94 percent of gasses in the air (over a 12-hour study period) when compared to the other plants.   **Jade Plant (*****Crassula argentea)*** [![jade-476900_960_720](http://expandedconsciousness.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/jade-476900_960_720-300x194.jpg)](http://expandedconsciousness.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/jade-476900_960_720.jpg) The Jade plant is an low-maintenance succulent that is symbolic of friendship, luck, and money. This plant was most effective at removing toluene (91 percent from the air), which is a odorous chemical mostly found in paint thinner **Spider Plant (*****Chrolophytum comosum)*** [![Spider-plant-revised](http://expandedconsciousness.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Spider-plant-revised-300x194.jpg)](http://expandedconsciousness.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Spider-plant-revised.jpg) This wonderful plant was very effective at removing chemicals that we often see in ink, rubber, adhesives, paint and varnishes. Over the 12-hour study period, this plan absorbed 62 percent of ethylbenzene, 92 percent of p-Xylenes, and 93 percent of o-Xylene. It thrives in most environments, and there’s a good chance it’ll give you baby spider plants that you can pot if you’d like more. **Bromeliad (*****Guzmania lingulata)*** [![bromeliad-660420_960_720](http://expandedconsciousness.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/bromeliad-660420_960_720-300x194.jpg)](http://expandedconsciousness.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/bromeliad-660420_960_720.jpg) Related to the pineapple, Bromeliad is best used to get rid of benzene in the air. Benzene is a toxic gas that comes from the exhaust of motor vehicles as well as cigarettes. It removed about 92 percent of Benzene from the air, as well as 80 percent of six of the other eight chemicals used in the study, which makes it the perfect plant for the home and work space. **Caribbean Tree Cactus (*****Consolea falcata)*** [![3111983507_6a427579dc_b](http://expandedconsciousness.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/3111983507_6a427579dc_b-300x194.jpg)](http://expandedconsciousness.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/3111983507_6a427579dc_b.jpg) If you’re a fan of cacti, this is the plant for you. It does well with a good amount of sunlight, producing tiny flowers when it’s happy. While it did not receive top marks when compared to the other plants, it is still very effective in purifying the air around you. It removed about 80 percent of ethylbenzene, p-Xylenes, and acetone, and about 60 percent of benzene, toluene, and o-Xylene. So, there you have it. Pick any one of these five plants and you can’t go wrong. **[Biofiltration](http://www.health.com/health/gallery/0,,20357829,00.html)** is something that’s been studied since the 80’s. NASA even put together **[their own list](http://www.goodhousekeeping.com/home/gardening/a32552/houseplants-that-purify-air/)**of the plants they believe are best to have in your home! h/t: [**Health.com**](http://www.health.com/home/air-purifying-plants)
posts.html:
If you’re looking to bring a bit of life into your home or office space, one of the best ways to go about doing so is by introducing plant life that will help purify the air you breathe.

A new study regarding plants and their ability to purify air found that certain plants are better at it than others.

Many people are completely unaware of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that often inhabit the spaces of a home due to cigarette smoke, paint, furniture, copiers and printers, different cleaning supplies and clothes that need to be dry-cleaned.

“Buildings, whether new or old, can have high levels of VOCs in them, sometimes so high that you can smell them,” says Vadoud Niri, PhD, an assistant professor of chemistry who led the new study.

To reduce your risk of long-term health problems, you might want to look into getting one of these five plants for your living space:

Dracaena (Dracaena frangas)

While each of the five plants listed here did fairly well in removing acetone (the chemical largely found in nail polish remover) from the air, the Dracaena plant came out on top, absorbing a whopping 94 percent of gasses in the air (over a 12-hour study period) when compared to the other plants.

 

Jade Plant (Crassula argentea)

The Jade plant is an low-maintenance succulent that is symbolic of friendship, luck, and money. This plant was most effective at removing toluene (91 percent from the air), which is a odorous chemical mostly found in paint thinner

Spider Plant (Chrolophytum comosum)

This wonderful plant was very effective at removing chemicals that we often see in ink, rubber, adhesives, paint and varnishes. Over the 12-hour study period, this plan absorbed 62 percent of ethylbenzene, 92 percent of p-Xylenes, and 93 percent of o-Xylene. It thrives in most environments, and there’s a good chance it’ll give you baby spider plants that you can pot if you’d like more.

Bromeliad (Guzmania lingulata)

Related to the pineapple, Bromeliad is best used to get rid of benzene in the air. Benzene is a toxic gas that comes from the exhaust of motor vehicles as well as cigarettes. It removed about 92 percent of Benzene from the air, as well as 80 percent of six of the other eight chemicals used in the study, which makes it the perfect plant for the home and work space.

Caribbean Tree Cactus (Consolea falcata)

If you’re a fan of cacti, this is the plant for you. It does well with a good amount of sunlight, producing tiny flowers when it’s happy. While it did not receive top marks when compared to the other plants, it is still very effective in purifying the air around you. It removed about 80 percent of ethylbenzene, p-Xylenes, and acetone, and about 60 percent of benzene, toluene, and o-Xylene.

So, there you have it. Pick any one of these five plants and you can’t go wrong. Biofiltration is something that’s been studied since the 80’s. NASA even put together their own list of the plants they believe are best to have in your home!

h/t: Health.com

posts.title: How to Tell If The Salmon You're Eating is Safe and Healthy
posts.markdown: As a man who grew up in (and now lives in) a landlocked state, seafood hasn’t ever really a normal part of my diet. You always hear about the lengths businesses go to to have fresh seafood shipped in, but it will obviously never taste as good as the creatures that get caught two hours before they end up on your dinner table. But, while traditional seafood escapes me, salmon is something I can get on board with. Because I can catch it myself, and then prepare it for myself. And it is delicious. Not to mention it’s chock-full of healthy nutrients that are hard to find elsewhere. **What You Need to Know** If you’re like me and enjoy salmon, you should know that **[there’s a big difference](http://theheartysoul.com/gmo-salmon/)** between the fish that are bred in farms, and the fish that one catches in the wild. The natural flavor of the salmon you eat, how fatty it is and how nutritious it is, all depend on *where* the salmon lived and *how* it lived its life. ![2-salmon](http://cdn.theheartysoul.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/salmon1.jpg) Color is going to tell you a lot about the salmon you’re about to eat. In the picture above, can you tell which salmon looks healthier? On the left, we have Alaskan sockeye salmon that was caught in the wild. On the right, we have salmon that was farmed. As you can tell, the wild-caught salmon is a deep, rich red color. This is what **[you want your salmon to look like](http://theheartysoul.com/farmed-salmon-health-dangers/)**. You don’t want salmon that looks as pale as the farmed fish. **Astaxanthin** The deep red color that we want is determined by how rich with astaxanthin the meat is. Astaxanthin is a red molecule that is found in algae, plankton and krill, and it’s incredibly good for you. Health benefits of this red molecule include: improved blood flow, anti-inflammatory properties, increased energy levels, and could possibly even increase muscle strength endurance (according to one study). Wild fish naturally gain astaxanthin from eating plankton, or other aquatic life containing the substance. Farmed fish receive a food pellet that contains a synthetic version of astaxanthin. This synthetic version is made from petrolchemicals (such as coal), which means its chemical makeup is not the same as the naturally-produced stuff. **Farmed Fish Diet** Another reason fish meat suffers in quality is, again, due to the nature of the feed they are given. In addition to synthetic astaxanthin, fish food uses fish oils and fish meal that are at risk of being contaminated with mercury. To try to reduce levels of heavy metal contamination, farmers began feeding fish an entirely new diet consisting of corn and soy. Being fish, salmon do not normally eat soy or corn, and the poor quality of meat on the ones that do, reflects that. Their poor diet **[leads to illness](http://www.healthy-holistic-living.com/fish-oil-and-breast-cancer.html)**, which leads to farmers needing to pump them full of antibiotics to keep them alive so they eventually end up on your dinner plate. **Mercury in Salmon** While much of what you just read is somewhat upsetting, the good news is that wild-caught salmon has traditionally always been at very low risk of being contaminated by mercury, as reported by both the FDA and EPA. These organizations both agree that you can eat wild-caught salmon numerous times a week. So, there you have it. Knowing the difference between good and bad salmon is as simple as knowing which color it should be. Don’t get fooled into buying salmon that has the potential to be dangerous to your health, enjoy eating the good stuff! h/t: [**TheHeartSoul**](http://theheartysoul.com/farmed-salmon-health-dangers/)
posts.html:
As a man who grew up in (and now lives in) a landlocked state, seafood hasn’t ever really a normal part of my diet. You always hear about the lengths businesses go to to have fresh seafood shipped in, but it will obviously never taste as good as the creatures that get caught two hours before they end up on your dinner table.

But, while traditional seafood escapes me, salmon is something I can get on board with. Because I can catch it myself, and then prepare it for myself. And it is delicious. Not to mention it’s chock-full of healthy nutrients that are hard to find elsewhere.

What You Need to Know

If you’re like me and enjoy salmon, you should know that there’s a big difference between the fish that are bred in farms, and the fish that one catches in the wild. The natural flavor of the salmon you eat, how fatty it is and how nutritious it is, all depend on where the salmon lived and how it lived its life.

Color is going to tell you a lot about the salmon you’re about to eat. In the picture above, can you tell which salmon looks healthier?

On the left, we have Alaskan sockeye salmon that was caught in the wild. On the right, we have salmon that was farmed. As you can tell, the wild-caught salmon is a deep, rich red color. This is what you want your salmon to look like. You don’t want salmon that looks as pale as the farmed fish.

Astaxanthin

The deep red color that we want is determined by how rich with astaxanthin the meat is. Astaxanthin is a red molecule that is found in algae, plankton and krill, and it’s incredibly good for you.

Health benefits of this red molecule include: improved blood flow, anti-inflammatory properties, increased energy levels, and could possibly even increase muscle strength endurance (according to one study).

Wild fish naturally gain astaxanthin from eating plankton, or other aquatic life containing the substance. Farmed fish receive a food pellet that contains a synthetic version of astaxanthin. This synthetic version is made from petrolchemicals (such as coal), which means its chemical makeup is not the same as the naturally-produced stuff.

Farmed Fish Diet

Another reason fish meat suffers in quality is, again, due to the nature of the feed they are given.

In addition to synthetic astaxanthin, fish food uses fish oils and fish meal that are at risk of being contaminated with mercury. To try to reduce levels of heavy metal contamination, farmers began feeding fish an entirely new diet consisting of corn and soy.

Being fish, salmon do not normally eat soy or corn, and the poor quality of meat on the ones that do, reflects that. Their poor diet leads to illness, which leads to farmers needing to pump them full of antibiotics to keep them alive so they eventually end up on your dinner plate.

Mercury in Salmon

While much of what you just read is somewhat upsetting, the good news is that wild-caught salmon has traditionally always been at very low risk of being contaminated by mercury, as reported by both the FDA and EPA. These organizations both agree that you can eat wild-caught salmon numerous times a week.

So, there you have it. Knowing the difference between good and bad salmon is as simple as knowing which color it should be. Don’t get fooled into buying salmon that has the potential to be dangerous to your health, enjoy eating the good stuff!

h/t: TheHeartSoul

posts.title: How to Recognize Early Signs of Stroke, Even If You're Young
posts.markdown: There’s a good chance that you’ve probably heard of someone dying from a stroke. It’s a scary prospect for anyone, and something that people all of ages and backgrounds should be aware of. It’s not limited to gender, age, or ethnicity, meaning anyone can have one at any moment in their life. So, what is stroke? Many people have called them “brain attacks,” even though the brain itself is not actually being attacked. Stroke happens when**[blood flow to the brain](https://my.clevelandclinic.org/services/heart/disorders/carotid-artery/Carotid-Artery-Dissection)** gets cut off. The brain is then deprived of the oxygen it needs to survive, so many brain cells end up dying as a result. When brain cells die, they lose their ability to influence whichever part of the mind or body they were controlling. Last February, model and social media icon, **[Katie May](http://www.si.com/extra-mustard/photos/2015/11/24/katie-may-lovely-lady-day/start)**, passed away from stroke at the age of 34. During a photo shoot the month before, Katie fell while she was on set and “tweaked her neck,” leading her to complain about**[a pinched nerve](http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/model-katie-death-fall-photo-shoot-article-1.2521755)** on Twitter shortly before being hospitalized due to the stroke. “When you’re younger and in relatively good health, you think that having a stroke is not a possibility,” says David Liebeskind, MD, director of the Neurovascular Programs at Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center. **So, what kind of symptoms should you be on the lookout for so you can prevent stroke?** If you start experiencing sudden bouts of **[dizziness or intense headaches](http://www.health.com/health/article/0,,20959568_2,00.html)**, don’t “wait and see.” Get to the hospital as fast as you can. Associate professor in the department of neurology at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine, David Newman-Toker, MD, says these are the two main symptoms to look for if you’re a woman under the age of 45, and that they also might come with hiccups or feelings of nausea. Dr. Liebeskind says that loss of language, alterations in sight or vision, strength or sensory capacities, are all indicators as well. “If you have a combination [of symptoms], then something’s more likely to be off,” he notes. Another good indicator is if these symptoms are completely abnormal for you, or have just started after a recent incident, like a fall or a tumble. In which case, “you have to lean on the side of taking [your symptoms] seriously,” says Dr. Liebeskind. Whatever the case may be, if you’re experiencing symptoms and are even somewhat concerned, **[don’t hesitate to go to the hospital](http://news.health.com/2015/12/21/more-evidence-that-time-to-treatment-is-crucial-for-stroke/).**

There’s a good chance that you’ve probably heard of someone dying from a stroke. It’s a scary prospect for anyone, and something that people all of ages and backgrounds should be aware of. It’s not limited to gender, age, or ethnicity, meaning anyone can have one at any moment in their life.

So, what is stroke? Many people have called them “brain attacks,” even though the brain itself is not actually being attacked. Stroke happens when blood flow to the brain gets cut off. The brain is then deprived of the oxygen it needs to survive, so many brain cells end up dying as a result. When brain cells die, they lose their ability to influence whichever part of the mind or body they were controlling.

Last February, model and social media icon, Katie May, passed away from stroke at the age of 34. During a photo shoot the month before, Katie fell while she was on set and “tweaked her neck,” leading her to complain about a pinched nerve on Twitter shortly before being hospitalized due to the stroke.

“When you’re younger and in relatively good health, you think that having a stroke is not a possibility,” says David Liebeskind, MD, director of the Neurovascular Programs at Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center.

So, what kind of symptoms should you be on the lookout for so you can prevent stroke?

If you start experiencing sudden bouts of dizziness or intense headaches, don’t “wait and see.” Get to the hospital as fast as you can. Associate professor in the department of neurology at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine, David Newman-Toker, MD, says these are the two main symptoms to look for if you’re a woman under the age of 45, and that they also might come with hiccups or feelings of nausea.

Dr. Liebeskind says that loss of language, alterations in sight or vision, strength or sensory capacities, are all indicators as well.

“If you have a combination [of symptoms], then something’s more likely to be off,” he notes.

Another good indicator is if these symptoms are completely abnormal for you, or have just started after a recent incident, like a fall or a tumble. In which case, “you have to lean on the side of taking [your symptoms] seriously,” says Dr. Liebeskind.

Whatever the case may be, if you’re experiencing symptoms and are even somewhat concerned, don’t hesitate to go to the hospital.

posts.title: 7 Clever Psychological Tricks That Will Help You Navigate Life
posts.markdown: Life can be difficult sometimes. But, there are certain tips and tricks of the mind that can help you get through most of the situations you encounter. The human brain is a wonderful thing, and also a predictable thing at times. Add these seven psychological tricks to your wealth of knowledge so that you can navigate life a little bit easier: **If you’re feeling nervous** One thing that calms human nerves is the process of eating. When we eat, the primal aspects of our brain kick in, letting the rest of the body know that everything is okay, because we wouldn’t be eating if we were in danger, right? Chew gum or find something to eat when you’re nervous. **Your expressions can create emotions** If you’ve ever heard the phrase “happiness is a skill,” then this trick fits perfectly within that realm. If you’re feeling down, physically make yourself smile. Simply the act of smiling will help you feel more happy. **If you have an important interview** Pretend that the person who’s interviewing you is one of the your oldest, bestest friends. If you can imagine this, your attitude and demeanor will be contagious, encouraging the other person to act in the same way. **When you don’t know what you’re doing** Keep acting like you know exactly what you’re doing. For most people, it’s hard to differentiate between a person who actually knows what they’re talking about and someone who is simply confident enough to sound like they know what they’re talking about. If people think you have the answers, they will rally behind you. **When working face-to-face with people** If you work in an environment where you have to deal with people face-to-face regularly, find some way to put a mirror directly behind you. People are less likely to act mean or rude when they can see themselves, because no one wants to see themselves acting poorly. **If you’re planning a first date** Don’t go the boring route of ‘dinner and a movie.’ Plan something that will be exciting and new. Afterward, they will forever associate that thrilling and exciting time they had, with *you.* **When you first meet someone** Do your best to look at, and pay attention to, the color of their eyes. Eye contact is something that says a lot about a person. When first meeting a person, they will enjoy the extra bit of effort to look them in the eyes while you communicate. https://brightside.me/article/15-clever-psychological-tricks-which-everyone-should-know-17055/?platform=hootsuite
posts.html:
Life can be difficult sometimes. But, there are certain tips and tricks of the mind that can help you get through most of the situations you encounter.

The human brain is a wonderful thing, and also a predictable thing at times.

Add these seven psychological tricks to your wealth of knowledge so that you can navigate life a little bit easier:

If you’re feeling nervous

One thing that calms human nerves is the process of eating. When we eat, the primal aspects of our brain kick in, letting the rest of the body know that everything is okay, because we wouldn’t be eating if we were in danger, right? Chew gum or find something to eat when you’re nervous.

Your expressions can create emotions

If you’ve ever heard the phrase “happiness is a skill,” then this trick fits perfectly within that realm. If you’re feeling down, physically make yourself smile. Simply the act of smiling will help you feel more happy.

If you have an important interview

Pretend that the person who’s interviewing you is one of the your oldest, bestest friends. If you can imagine this, your attitude and demeanor will be contagious, encouraging the other person to act in the same way.

When you don’t know what you’re doing

Keep acting like you know exactly what you’re doing. For most people, it’s hard to differentiate between a person who actually knows what they’re talking about and someone who is simply confident enough to sound like they know what they’re talking about.

If people think you have the answers, they will rally behind you.

When working face-to-face with people

If you work in an environment where you have to deal with people face-to-face regularly, find some way to put a mirror directly behind you. People are less likely to act mean or rude when they can see themselves, because no one wants to see themselves acting poorly.

If you’re planning a first date

Don’t go the boring route of ‘dinner and a movie.’ Plan something that will be exciting and new. Afterward, they will forever associate that thrilling and exciting time they had, with you.

When you first meet someone

Do your best to look at, and pay attention to, the color of their eyes. Eye contact is something that says a lot about a person. When first meeting a person, they will enjoy the extra bit of effort to look them in the eyes while you communicate.

https://brightside.me/article/15-clever-psychological-tricks-which-everyone-should-know-17055/?platform=hootsuite

posts.title: Treat Anxiety, Bloating, Cramps and Sleep Problems With These Different Teas
posts.markdown: Just like you hear so many people say, “There’s an app for that” when it comes to solving all of life’s problems, they should really be saying, “[**There’s a tea for that**.](http://news.health.com/2016/03/02/a-daily-cup-of-tea-may-soothe-your-heart/)” So many of life’s everyday, annoying problems that can be remedied by drinking different kinds of tea. From insomnia to debilitating cramps to headaches. See if any of the six teas below can help make your life even just a little bit better. **Bloating** If you’re looking to help out your digestive system and get rid of that post-meal pudgy belly, Fennel tea is the hero you deserve. It’s comprised of compounds that help ease gastrointestinal spasms, which makes it easier for gas to pass through your system, which in turn gets rid of the bloating feeling. **If you can’t shake a cough** Irritated throat? Coughing all the time and tired of it? You need Marshmallow tea. Brewing the roots and leaves of this magical herb into a tea is a remedy that has been handed down through generations for over a century. **When you need to calm your nerves** If you’ve got butterflies in your stomach and can’t seem to get rid of your anxious nerves, Chamomile is the tea for you. Its compounds act in a similar way as Valium’s. One study out of the University of Pennsylvania discovered that people with anxiety disorders reported significant relief from symptoms after taking a chamomile supplement over the course of eight weeks, when compared to the control group. **If you can’t sleep** If you want to fall asleep and stay asleep when you’re ready for bed, Lavender tea might do the trick. Research surrounding Lavender tea has found that even smelling Lavender has the ability to put people to sleep. It’s also been seen to reduce blood pressure and lower your heart rate. **For menstrual cramping** If you’re not a fan of Ibuprofen, ginger tea is an adequate substitute. A study conducted in 2009 discovered that ginger tea was just as effective as Ibuprofen when it came to relieving pain from period cramps. **To sooth stomach pain** Peppermint tea is a great drink to make when your digestive system is waging war on you. It helps relax gastrointestinal muscles, making it easier to digest food. One important thing to note, however, is that you should not drink peppermint tea if your pain stems from acid reflux. *You can find all of the teas listed above for sale on Amazon.com!*

posts.title: If You Eat 5 Walnuts Then Wait 4 Hours This Is What Will Happen To You!
posts.markdown: Like many people, I’ve always loved eating various different nuts. There are so many different types of nuts that you can choose from, and each one has unique characteristics that make them smell, taste and feel different. If you’re like me and enjoy walnuts, recent research has some good news for us. Consuming at least a handful of nuts every day helps reduce the risk of heart disease. It’s also found that nuts help**[improve cholesterol levels](http://jn.nutrition.org/content/early/2014/02/05/jn.113.182907)**and blood pressure levels only 4 hours after people eat nuts or consume nut oils. Researchers **[conducting the study](http://jn.nutrition.org/content/early/2014/02/05/jn.113.182907)** were the first to identify the compounds in walnuts that are responsible for such amazing health benefits. They note that by eating even just three tablespoons of walnut oil, the health of your blood vessels will improve within 4 hours. This is due to nut oils increasing the flexibility of blood vessels. Nut oils particularly benefit endothelial cells, which are the cells that line each of our blood vessels. If you’ve been looking for a healthy practice to add to your already healthy life, or if you’re just starting on your quest towards being healthier, a handful of walnuts each day is a good (and easy) place to start! “And only by consuming a handful of walnuts or walnut oil for four days in a week you can significantly reduce the risk of heart disease,” said Dr. Penny Kris Etherton, professor of nutrition at Penn State University in Pennsylvania. h/t: [**RealFarmacy**](http://www.realfarmacy.com/5-walnuts-4-hours/)

Like many people, I’ve always loved eating various different nuts. There are so many different types of nuts that you can choose from, and each one has unique characteristics that make them smell, taste and feel different.

If you’re like me and enjoy walnuts, recent research has some good news for us. Consuming at least a handful of nuts every day helps reduce the risk of heart disease. It’s also found that nuts help improve cholesterol levels and blood pressure levels only 4 hours after people eat nuts or consume nut oils.

Researchers conducting the study were the first to identify the compounds in walnuts that are responsible for such amazing health benefits. They note that by eating even just three tablespoons of walnut oil, the health of your blood vessels will improve within 4 hours.

This is due to nut oils increasing the flexibility of blood vessels. Nut oils particularly benefit endothelial cells, which are the cells that line each of our blood vessels.

If you’ve been looking for a healthy practice to add to your already healthy life, or if you’re just starting on your quest towards being healthier, a handful of walnuts each day is a good (and easy) place to start!

“And only by consuming a handful of walnuts or walnut oil for four days in a week you can significantly reduce the risk of heart disease,” said Dr. Penny Kris Etherton, professor of nutrition at Penn State University in Pennsylvania.

posts.title: 5 Things to Avoid Doing While Mercury Is In Retrograde (Aug. 30 - Sept. 22)
posts.markdown: Everyone get ready because Mercury is about to be in retrograde once again, marking the third time that it will have happened this year. Starting on August 30th, we can expect it to last until September 22nd. As you may or may not know, when a celestial body is said to be “in retrograde,” it simply means that it will appear to be traveling backwards along its orbital path, even though it actually isn’t. However, this distortion in Mercury’s path causes things to operate a bit differently here on Earth. Anticipate trouble when it comes to travel, communicating and learning while Mercury is in retrograde. And if you’d like to survive this retrograde cycle with a bit of grace, avoid doing these five things: **Buying big ticket items that cost *****a lot***** of money** During retrograde cycles it is very common for people to indulge in the purchasing of expensive items. Maybe you think that it’s a deal you don’t want to miss out on, come to find out that the product you bought is actually broken or not what you thought it was. If you are planning a big purchase, do your best to secure a warranty or some sort of insurance that will provide you a bit of room for error. **Pay attention to your bank account** Having to pay bills is probably one of the worst things about being an adult. But if you’re the type to avoid looking at your bank accounts, take the time to go over them when this retrograde cycle starts. During this time, your brain is more open to analyzing finances. If you need to start paying on a loan, build yourself a new budget, or reconcile your checkbook, now is the time. **Try to stick with the career / job you have now** Mercury in retrograde means that things have an increased chance of not going the way you want them to. If a new job opportunity has made itself known to you, you’re probably best off just ignoring it for the time being. Wait for Mercury to be back in prograde before pursuing a change in livelihood. **Avoid traveling!** Traveling can be a stressful endeavor when you *have* the planets’ favor; it’s even worse when you don’t. You’ll likely experience an increased number of delays, cancellations, missed flights, lost luggage and messed up reservations. If there’s no way avoiding traveling, do your best to have all your ducks in a row. Traveler’s insurance might be a good idea. **Avoid contracts** When Mercury is in retrograde, our normal thought processes change slightly. It might seem like signing a big contract is the best way to go in the moment, but then you’ll quickly find yourself analyzing the situation from a different perspective, deciding that you could have done things differently and better. Just be extra careful when it comes to signing any contracts or documents that will lock you into long-term commitments.
posts.html:
Everyone get ready because Mercury is about to be in retrograde once again, marking the third time that it will have happened this year. Starting on August 30th, we can expect it to last until September 22nd.

As you may or may not know, when a celestial body is said to be “in retrograde,” it simply means that it will appear to be traveling backwards along its orbital path, even though it actually isn’t. However, this distortion in Mercury’s path causes things to operate a bit differently here on Earth.

Anticipate trouble when it comes to travel, communicating and learning while Mercury is in retrograde.

And if you’d like to survive this retrograde cycle with a bit of grace, avoid doing these five things:

Buying big ticket items that cost a lot of money

During retrograde cycles it is very common for people to indulge in the purchasing of expensive items. Maybe you think that it’s a deal you don’t want to miss out on, come to find out that the product you bought is actually broken or not what you thought it was.

If you are planning a big purchase, do your best to secure a warranty or some sort of insurance that will provide you a bit of room for error.

Pay attention to your bank account

Having to pay bills is probably one of the worst things about being an adult. But if you’re the type to avoid looking at your bank accounts, take the time to go over them when this retrograde cycle starts.

During this time, your brain is more open to analyzing finances. If you need to start paying on a loan, build yourself a new budget, or reconcile your checkbook, now is the time.

Try to stick with the career / job you have now

Mercury in retrograde means that things have an increased chance of not going the way you want them to. If a new job opportunity has made itself known to you, you’re probably best off just ignoring it for the time being. Wait for Mercury to be back in prograde before pursuing a change in livelihood.

Avoid traveling!

Traveling can be a stressful endeavor when you have the planets’ favor; it’s even worse when you don’t. You’ll likely experience an increased number of delays, cancellations, missed flights, lost luggage and messed up reservations.

If there’s no way avoiding traveling, do your best to have all your ducks in a row. Traveler’s insurance might be a good idea.

Avoid contracts

When Mercury is in retrograde, our normal thought processes change slightly. It might seem like signing a big contract is the best way to go in the moment, but then you’ll quickly find yourself analyzing the situation from a different perspective, deciding that you could have done things differently and better.

Just be extra careful when it comes to signing any contracts or documents that will lock you into long-term commitments.

posts.title: 10 Reasons You Should Avoid Drinking Soy Milk
posts.markdown: Soy milk has recently come into mainstream culture, **[much to the chagrin of nutritionists](http://www.westonaprice.org/soy-alert/studies-showing-adverse-effects-of-soy)** and health experts everywhere. While it is often touted as being the healthier choice when it comes to buying milk, that notion could not be**[further from the truth](http://www.westonaprice.org/images/pdfs/fdasoyreferences.pdf)**. So you are aware, the ingredients in soy milk are as follows: - Soy milk (filtered water, whole soybeans) - Cane Sugar - Sea Salt - Carrageenan - Natural flavor - Calcium carbonate - Vitamin A Palmitate - Vitamin D2 - Riboflavin (B2) - Vitamin B12 You should avoid drinking soy milk for the following reasons: 1. Soybeans are chock-full of “antinutrients.” Consuming only two glasses of soy milk a day has the potential to change a woman’s menstrual cycle. 2. It will cause the body to need more vitamin B12 and vitamin D. 3. Soybeans have been seen to increase clotting of the red blood cells because of haemagglutinin, making them clump together. 4. Almost *all* of soy is genetically modified in some way, and is one of the most highly contaminated foods when it comes to pesticides. 5. Soy products have been seen to contain large amounts of phytic acid. Phytic acid inhibits the body’s utilization of calcium, magnesium, copper, iron and zinc. 6. Soy products have been seen to contain toxic levels of aluminum, which has damaging effects on the nervous system and kidneys, and has been tied to the development of Alzheimer’s disease. 7. Soy is made of a compound that resembles vitamin B12, but that is not easily processed by our bodies. This, in turn, creates a B12 deficiency. 8. Soy proteins are often subject to high temperatures when they are being processed into soy protein isolate or vegetable protein, which makes them unhealthy for our digestive processes. 9. If a woman has breast cancer, the isoflavones in soy have been seen to exacerbate the growth of cancer cells. 10. Soy naturally contains different plant estrogens, known as phytoestrogens. These phytoestrogens alter endocrine functionality, which can lead to infertility and breast cancer in women.
posts.html:
Soy milk has recently come into mainstream culture, much to the chagrin of nutritionists and health experts everywhere. While it is often touted as being the healthier choice when it comes to buying milk, that notion could not be further from the truth.

So you are aware, the ingredients in soy milk are as follows:

  • Soy milk (filtered water, whole soybeans)
  • Cane Sugar
  • Sea Salt
  • Carrageenan
  • Natural flavor
  • Calcium carbonate
  • Vitamin A Palmitate
  • Vitamin D2
  • Riboflavin (B2)
  • Vitamin B12

You should avoid drinking soy milk for the following reasons:

  1. Soybeans are chock-full of “antinutrients.” Consuming only two glasses of soy milk a day has the potential to change a woman’s menstrual cycle.
  2. It will cause the body to need more vitamin B12 and vitamin D.
  3. Soybeans have been seen to increase clotting of the red blood cells because of haemagglutinin, making them clump together.
  4. Almost all of soy is genetically modified in some way, and is one of the most highly contaminated foods when it comes to pesticides.
  5. Soy products have been seen to contain large amounts of phytic acid. Phytic acid inhibits the body’s utilization of calcium, magnesium, copper, iron and zinc.
  6. Soy products have been seen to contain toxic levels of aluminum, which has damaging effects on the nervous system and kidneys, and has been tied to the development of Alzheimer’s disease.
  7. Soy is made of a compound that resembles vitamin B12, but that is not easily processed by our bodies. This, in turn, creates a B12 deficiency.
  8. Soy proteins are often subject to high temperatures when they are being processed into soy protein isolate or vegetable protein, which makes them unhealthy for our digestive processes.
  9. If a woman has breast cancer, the isoflavones in soy have been seen to exacerbate the growth of cancer cells.
  10. Soy naturally contains different plant estrogens, known as phytoestrogens. These phytoestrogens alter endocrine functionality, which can lead to infertility and breast cancer in women.

posts.title: Video: Rare Footage Shows a Baby Being Born in a Fully Intact Amniotic Sac
posts.markdown:
Childbirth will always be something that fascinates me. I can’t even begin to adequately describe the gratitude I have for the women in this world. Part of me is somewhat jealous that they get to experience the process of giving life to another being. In the footage below, one nurse captures the rare moment when an unborn baby is pulled out of his mother in a still fully intact amniotic sac. Traditionally, this amniotic sac is what breaks when you hear a woman say, “my water just broke.” But this baby’s sac never ruptured, much to the shock and surprise of the nurses and doctors operating in this Spanish hospital. To make things even more abnormal, this baby’s twin was delivered in a normal fashion just minutes before his arrival. This type of birth **[is called an “en caul” birth](http://www.babymed.com/labor-delivery/en-caul-baby-birth)**, which means “helmeted head” or “veil.” If you’ve never heard of en caul births, you’re not alone. They’re incredibly rare, occurring once out of every 80,000 births, if not fewer. The baby can be seen writhing around in its sac, curled up in the fetal position. If you look closely, you can see the blue umbilical cord wrapped neatly around the babe. Gathered around the baby are doctors and nurses who are in utter awe, recognizing that they are witnessing something truly remarkable and rare. A medical miracle lay right before their very eyes.
*Remember to share this video with friends and family who would also be shocked and amazed by this baby’s miraculous birth!*

To make things even more abnormal, this baby’s twin was delivered in a normal fashion just minutes before his arrival. This type of birth is called an “en caul” birth, which means “helmeted head” or “veil.”

If you’ve never heard of en caul births, you’re not alone. They’re incredibly rare, occurring once out of every 80,000 births, if not fewer.

The baby can be seen writhing around in its sac, curled up in the fetal position. If you look closely, you can see the blue umbilical cord wrapped neatly around the babe.
