A medical miracle lay right before their very eyes.

Remember to share this video with friends and family who would also be shocked and amazed by this baby’s miraculous birth!

posts.title: 5 Things To Consider Before Dating a Scorpio
posts.markdown: Scorpios are easily one of the most passionate, yet mysterious signs of the zodiac. They’re always thinking about something and bring an intense intimate energy to the bedroom. You should know these five things about the Scorpio before you commit to anything long-term: **They cannot be controlled** Trying to control your partner is never a good idea, and if you try to do so with a Scorpio, they won’t have any of it. They’re independent creatures that enjoy doing exactly what they want to do, without having anyone else say otherwise. They’ll listen to what you have to say, but don’t expect them to change simply because of something you’ve said. **They’re fiery and passionate** When it comes to lovers, you will rarely ever find one more passionate than the Scorpio. They dominate the bedroom better than any lead character in a steamy romance novel. If you like excitement between the sheets, you’re lucky to have a Scorpio. **They like creating a bit of mystery** Scorpios enjoy being the mysterious figure in people’s lives. As such, they also enjoy when others play mysterious toward them. They like solving puzzles and putting together clues, so don’t be readily available whenever they want you. Play hard to get just a little bit. **They’re loyal above all else** Scorpios, while they are notorious for passion and independence, are also very loyal. Once they’ve committed to you, there’s no one else that will distract them. They’re keepers. **They get hot, fast** Scorpios have intense emotions, so they are often prone to intense emotional outbursts. They go through various highs and lows, so their lovers need to learn how to navigate the Scorpio’s ebb and flow effectively.

posts.title: Drinking Tea From Boiled Bananas Will Change the Way You Sleep
posts.markdown: Almost everyone has had those restless nights where sleep just isn’t something that is going to happen for you. You close your eyes, expecting to fall asleep, but never do. Instead, you just toss and turn while your mind moves from one anxious thought to the next until suddenly, subtle rays of daylight are flashing through your curtains, letting you know that the night has come and gone while you tried your hardest to get some rest. When you’re not sleeping well, it’s hard to tackle the challenges of everyday life simply due to a lack of energy. If you’re one who struggles to fall asleep and stay asleep, you might want to try out some **banana tea**, because why not? If it means getting a good night’s rest and a productive following day, it’s more than worth it. **Why does it work?** Bananas (and especially banana **peels**) are chock-full of potassium and magnesium. When these two powerful substances combine, they can help **[prevent restless nights](http://theheartysoul.com/powerful-relaxation-mineral/)**through increased muscle relaxation. Before you try this, you’re going to want 100 percent organic bananas. If they are not organic, you will be boiling a peel that is coated in toxic pesticides. So, you *have* to use organic. The recipe is quick, taking just 10 minutes to complete. **What you need** To start, you’ll need at least one organic banana, one small pot of water, and if you’d like a bit of extra flavor, you can add some cinnamon. Now, slice off either end of your banana and place the banana and peel into your boiling water. Let it boil for about 10 minutes. Then, using a colander for filtration, pour the boiled liquid into a mug. Let it cool a little bit, and enjoy. Once you’ve finished your drink, you can eat the boiled banana and its peel to help increase the effects of your tea. **Why you need to be getting good sleep** If you hadn’t noticed, not getting enough sleep makes the following day that much worse. Not to mention, there are **[legitimate negative health consequences](http://theheartysoul.com/health-effects-of-not-enough-sleep/)**when we do not give our bodies the rest they need. When we’re not sleeping well, our cognitive functioning suffers. And it shows. It’s pretty much impossible to focus on anything, and doing even the most mundane of tasks can be challenging. Our natural response behaviors are all over the place. And, lack of sleep has been correlated with obesity, diabetes and even cancer. An irregular sleep cycle is something that needs to be figured out and remedied, so finding a solution that works for you is important. Banana tea is one solution that works for a number of people, and it could work for you!

You close your eyes, expecting to fall asleep, but never do. Instead, you just toss and turn while your mind moves from one anxious thought to the next until suddenly, subtle rays of daylight are flashing through your curtains, letting you know that the night has come and gone while you tried your hardest to get some rest.

When you’re not sleeping well, it’s hard to tackle the challenges of everyday life simply due to a lack of energy. If you’re one who struggles to fall asleep and stay asleep, you might want to try out some banana tea, because why not? If it means getting a good night’s rest and a productive following day, it’s more than worth it.

Why does it work?

Bananas (and especially banana peels) are chock-full of potassium and magnesium. When these two powerful substances combine, they can help prevent restless nights through increased muscle relaxation.

Before you try this, you’re going to want 100 percent organic bananas. If they are not organic, you will be boiling a peel that is coated in toxic pesticides. So, you have to use organic. The recipe is quick, taking just 10 minutes to complete.

What you need

To start, you’ll need at least one organic banana, one small pot of water, and if you’d like a bit of extra flavor, you can add some cinnamon.

Now, slice off either end of your banana and place the banana and peel into your boiling water. Let it boil for about 10 minutes. Then, using a colander for filtration, pour the boiled liquid into a mug. Let it cool a little bit, and enjoy.

Once you’ve finished your drink, you can eat the boiled banana and its peel to help increase the effects of your tea.

Why you need to be getting good sleep

If you hadn’t noticed, not getting enough sleep makes the following day that much worse. Not to mention, there are legitimate negative health consequences when we do not give our bodies the rest they need.

When we’re not sleeping well, our cognitive functioning suffers. And it shows. It’s pretty much impossible to focus on anything, and doing even the most mundane of tasks can be challenging. Our natural response behaviors are all over the place. And, lack of sleep has been correlated with obesity, diabetes and even cancer.

An irregular sleep cycle is something that needs to be figured out and remedied, so finding a solution that works for you is important. Banana tea is one solution that works for a number of people, and it could work for you!

posts.title: Get Ready For A Major Shift, New Moon Solar Eclipse in Virgo, September 1st
posts.markdown:
### By [Vivienne Micallef-Browne](https://empowerastrology.org) ### **And we’re going to let it burn!** **The New Moon solar eclipse at 9 degrees Virgo on the 1st September, 09:01 UTC** **Eclipses are the most powerful transits that you can experience. They herald major beginnings and endings, burning and purifying.** **Solar Eclipses tend to create new beginnings and bright new opportunities.** **Usually, they are exciting, are often very positive, and bring news out of the blue.** **This Solar Eclipse in Virgo is immensely significant, the major activity cycle for 2016 begins now. The North Node and Virgo-Jupiter are highly active.** **We have been building up and preparing for this event of the New Moon Solar Eclipse and the month of September all year!** **We are about to be rapidly transported onto the next level of our evolutionary development.** We have two powerful eclipses back to back in September. The Solar eclipse on the 1st September and a Lunar eclipse on the 16th September. We will all feel the effects of the two eclipses but even more so if you have personal planets in your horoscope that are directly aspected by the eclipse. **Eclipses can uproot us, surprise us, and get us moving. They shake us up so that we can move from one level of maturity to another, to a higher plane, very rapidly. Eclipses want us to change, and change we do!** **Anything that we have been holding onto that no longer serves our highest purpose will fall away during the two eclipses in September. Wheter that be people, circumstances or limiting and negative patterns of thinking and behaving.** A Solar Eclipse happens when the Earth, Moon and Sun are perfectly aligned in a straight line and Moon covers the Sun’s centre, leaving the Sun’s visible outer edges to form a “ring of fire” or around the Moon. **The moon is in the heart of the Sun. The Sun is burning away and purifying everything that no longer serves our highest good.** **The eclipse is burning away self-doubt and delusions. You will know what is right and what is good for you.** **It is a powerful inner purification of Matter, Consciousness and Spirit.** The Sun is our conscious sense of self, our sense of life purpose, our will and our ability to radiate our essence. The Moon is our feelings, our memory, our needs, and our personal access to our creative source and our unconscious. **When the Moon obscures the Sun, as in a Solar Eclipse, it allows something from the unconscious to leak out past the brilliant light of the conscious self.** **The eclipse can provide the necessary catalyst to overcome a circumstance, obstacle (Saturn) or illusion (Neptune)** **Any last baggage has to go. We need to travel light as our new path is unfolding, we need to be prepared. We will be rapidly pushed along in a new direction, to our higher path and consciousness. Leaving the past and the old ways behind forever.** Our lives will then rapidly move forward, carrying us to the next level. And to a new and better way of relating to love, to our relationships and to free ourselves of Self-limiting beliefs. **We have the opportunity to burn away old karma in love and dysfunctional patterns forever.** **This is heart opening energy** **The eclipse happens at the same time as one of the best aspects of the year, Jupiter Conjunct Venus in Virgo.** **This eclipse is under the best possible influences promising us success, happiness, growth and abundance whatever occurrences and changes may happen in September.** **Jupiter and Venus are at their closest now and won’t be this close again until 2065. So the energy is extremely strong and significant.** Mercury, the ruler of the eclipse, is conjunct Jupiter and Venus.Jupiter expands everything it touches, expanding our capacity to feel joy, love and happiness and bringing good vibes, joy, love abundance and wisdom. **Jupiter is expanding our consciousness and our hearts.** **We are essentially reaping the rewards in September for all our hard won efforts, spiritually, physically and materially in September.** Mercury turns retrograde on the 30th August until the 22nd September.Mercury governs our rational mind and communication. Mercury retrograde helps us to turn inward and reflect. Conjunct Jupiter and Venus we are able to access inner wisdom and joy. **The Mercury retrograde will give us a chance to rethink and revalue the path we are on, so that any doubts we may have through the September eclipse season about where we are heading and our life’s purpose, will become clearer to us by the end of September.** Chiron, the wounded healer, is in opposition to Jupiter and Mercury, we can gain much healing, insight wisdom and love during the retrograde period, helping to confirm that we are on the right path, as much will be changing fast and rapidly during the September eclipse period. Chiron the Shaman and wounded healer is also in Pisces, in exact opposition to Jupiter. Jupiter is on a mission to find the truth. Healing is to be found in the truth. We will feel clearer, more positive and self-confident about any major decisions or changes to be made by the end of September when Mercury turns direct. **And ultimately we are being guided towards a higher conscious state, higher forms of love and happiness in our lives.** Indeed, with Mars in Sagittarius exactly square the nodes of fate on the day of the retrograde 30th August, we are being pushed to evolve and step up to our life’s purpose and path whether we are ready or not. The new moon and sun in Virgo are in opposition to Neptune in Pisces. Highlighting The Virgo- Pisces Axis.which symbolises is the connection between Mind, Body and Spirit. The Virgo Solar Eclipse brings to light any shadow Virgo issues of perfectionism or self-doubt that get in the way of giving our gifts to the world, with fear often being behind these thoughts. The Virgo part of all of us is learning to understand perfection as a process and practice, not an result, and the best way to perfect our skills is to use them. Start where you are, take the first small step, and then the next step will become clear. When Virgo spends to much time in her mind, she loses her connection with her emotions, Soul and Spirit, leading to anxiety and excessive worrying that can have mental and physical effects. Between the need to let go of knowing every last detail and learn to accept what is, as it is. Until the analytical Virgo learns to see the bigger picture to trust and go with the flow, they will not be able to live a balanced life. **Watch out for any major insights, opportunities, developments or meetings with significant new people or from the past throughout September, but especially on the 4th September, when the Sun in Virgo meets up in an exact conjunction with the the north node of fate at 12 degrees Virgo.** Saturn in Sagittarius is helping us to master, focus with perseverance and staying power our minds, talents, skills, healing powers and techniques (Virgo). While Mars manifests and puts them into action. With Mars and Saturn in Sagittarius the teacher of knowledge and wisdom, Virgo and Neptune the healer and the spiritualist, conjunct the nodes of fate, many feel called to the teaching, healing and spiritual professions at this moment in time. **Mars in the fire sign of Sagittarius is breaking through all limitations and Jupiter and Venus shining brightly and visibly to the naked eye currently in the night sky, its time to ignite your inner fire, for a renewed passion for life!** Mars in Sagittarius is about to make a positive aspect (trine) to the revolutionary planet of Uranus and Eris the awakener, both in Aries the middle of September and Jupiter is entering Libra (love, harmony, justice) on 9th September together they are paving the way for the: **Revolution of Love!** As well as healing, (Chiron) awakening (Uranus, Eris) and fairness and Justice for all and not the few. (Jupiter in Libra) On both a personal and collective level. **We will find the September energies positively culminating on the New Moon in Libra September 30th together with Jupiter in Libra heralding a new healthy paradigm for better relationships and love.** **With many karmic lovers meeting and coming together during the Jupiter in Libra transit from September 9th 2016to October 2017** **“Burn”** >
**“We, we don’t have to worry ’bout nothing** > **‘Cause we got the fire, and we’re burning one hell of a something** > **They, they gonna see us from outer space, outer space** > **Light it up, like we’re the stars of the human race, human race**** When the light started out they don’t know what they heard** > **Strike the match, play it loud, giving love to the world** > **We’ll be raising our hands, shining up to the sky** > **‘Cause we got the fire, fire, fire** > **Yeah we got the fire, fire, fire****And we gonna let it burn, burn, burn, burn”**
**Ellie Goulding**

Usually, they are exciting, are often very positive, and bring news out of the blue.

We have been building up and preparing for this event of the New Moon Solar Eclipse and the month of September all year!

We are about to be rapidly transported onto the next level of our evolutionary development.

We have two powerful eclipses back to back in September. The Solar eclipse on the 1st September and a Lunar eclipse on the 16th September.

We will all feel the effects of the two eclipses but even more so if you have personal planets in your horoscope that are directly aspected by the eclipse.

Eclipses can uproot us, surprise us, and get us moving. They shake us up so that we can move from one level of maturity to another, to a higher plane, very rapidly. Eclipses want us to change, and change we do!

Anything that we have been holding onto that no longer serves our highest purpose will fall away during the two eclipses in September. Wheter that be people, circumstances or limiting and negative patterns of thinking and behaving.

A Solar Eclipse happens when the Earth, Moon and Sun are perfectly aligned in a straight line and Moon covers the Sun’s centre, leaving the Sun’s visible outer edges to form a “ring of fire” or around the Moon.

The moon is in the heart of the Sun. The Sun is burning away and purifying everything that no longer serves our highest good.

The eclipse is burning away self-doubt and delusions. You will know what is right and what is good for you.

It is a powerful inner purification of Matter, Consciousness and Spirit.

The Sun is our conscious sense of self, our sense of life purpose, our will and our ability to radiate our essence. The Moon is our feelings, our memory, our needs, and our personal access to our creative source and our unconscious.

When the Moon obscures the Sun, as in a Solar Eclipse, it allows something from the unconscious to leak out past the brilliant light of the conscious self.

The eclipse can provide the necessary catalyst to overcome a circumstance, obstacle (Saturn) or illusion (Neptune)

Any last baggage has to go. We need to travel light as our new path is unfolding, we need to be prepared. We will be rapidly pushed along in a new direction, to our higher path and consciousness. Leaving the past and the old ways behind forever.

Our lives will then rapidly move forward, carrying us to the next level. And to a new and better way of relating to love, to our relationships and to free ourselves of Self-limiting beliefs.

We have the opportunity to burn away old karma in love and dysfunctional patterns forever.

This is heart opening energy

The eclipse happens at the same time as one of the best aspects of the year, Jupiter Conjunct Venus in Virgo.

This eclipse is under the best possible influences promising us success, happiness, growth and abundance whatever occurrences and changes may happen in September.

Jupiter and Venus are at their closest now and won’t be this close again until 2065. So the energy is extremely strong and significant.

Mercury, the ruler of the eclipse, is conjunct Jupiter and Venus.Jupiter expands everything it touches, expanding our capacity to feel joy, love and happiness and bringing good vibes, joy, love abundance and wisdom.

Jupiter is expanding our consciousness and our hearts.

We are essentially reaping the rewards in September for all our hard won efforts, spiritually, physically and materially in September.

Mercury turns retrograde on the 30th August until the 22nd September.Mercury governs our rational mind and communication. Mercury retrograde helps us to turn inward and reflect. Conjunct Jupiter and Venus we are able to access inner wisdom and joy.
The Mercury retrograde will give us a chance to rethink and revalue the path we are on, so that any doubts we may have through the September eclipse season about where we are heading and our life’s purpose, will become clearer to us by the end of September.

Chiron, the wounded healer, is in opposition to Jupiter and Mercury, we can gain much healing, insight wisdom and love during the retrograde period, helping to confirm that we are on the right path, as much will be changing fast and rapidly during the September eclipse period.

Chiron the Shaman and wounded healer is also in Pisces, in exact opposition to Jupiter. Jupiter is on a mission to find the truth. Healing is to be found in the truth.

We will feel clearer, more positive and self-confident about any major decisions or changes to be made by the end of September when Mercury turns direct.

And ultimately we are being guided towards a higher conscious state, higher forms of love and happiness in our lives.

Indeed, with Mars in Sagittarius exactly square the nodes of fate on the day of the retrograde 30th August, we are being pushed to evolve and step up to our life’s purpose and path whether we are ready or not.

The new moon and sun in Virgo are in opposition to Neptune in Pisces. Highlighting The Virgo- Pisces Axis.which symbolises is the connection between Mind, Body and Spirit.

The Virgo Solar Eclipse brings to light any shadow Virgo issues of perfectionism or self-doubt that get in the way of giving our gifts to the world, with fear often being behind these thoughts. The Virgo part of all of us is learning to understand perfection as a process and practice, not an result, and the best way to perfect our skills is to use them. Start where you are, take the first small step, and then the next step will become clear.

When Virgo spends to much time in her mind, she loses her connection with her emotions, Soul and Spirit, leading to anxiety and excessive worrying that can have mental and physical effects. Between the need to let go of knowing every last detail and learn to accept what is, as it is. Until the analytical Virgo learns to see the bigger picture to trust and go with the flow, they will not be able to live a balanced life.
Watch out for any major insights, opportunities, developments or meetings with significant new people or from the past throughout September, but especially on the 4th September, when the Sun in Virgo meets up in an exact conjunction with the the north node of fate at 12 degrees Virgo.

Saturn in Sagittarius is helping us to master, focus with perseverance and staying power our minds, talents, skills, healing powers and techniques (Virgo). While Mars manifests and puts them into action.

With Mars and Saturn in Sagittarius the teacher of knowledge and wisdom, Virgo and Neptune the healer and the spiritualist, conjunct the nodes of fate, many feel called to the teaching, healing and spiritual professions at this moment in time.

Mars in the fire sign of Sagittarius is breaking through all limitations and Jupiter and Venus shining brightly and visibly to the naked eye currently in the night sky, its time to ignite your inner fire, for a renewed passion for life!
Mars in Sagittarius is about to make a positive aspect (trine) to the revolutionary planet of Uranus and Eris the awakener, both in Aries the middle of September and Jupiter is entering Libra (love, harmony, justice) on 9th September together they are paving the way for the:

Revolution of Love!

As well as healing, (Chiron) awakening (Uranus, Eris) and fairness and Justice for all and not the few. (Jupiter in Libra)

On both a personal and collective level.
We will find the September energies positively culminating on the New Moon in Libra September 30th together with Jupiter in Libra heralding a new healthy paradigm for better relationships and love.

With many karmic lovers meeting and coming together during the Jupiter in Libra transit from September 9th 2016to October 2017

posts.title: Everyone Will Experience These 5 Loneliest Moments At Some Point in Their Life
posts.markdown: Growing up on this planet is hard. There’s no instruction manual, so we’re pretty much left to our own devices when it comes to major success or falling flat on our faces. Also, no one tells you just how hard it’s going to be, because, how can they? Everyone’s life is unique. That being said, there are numerous experiences that will cause us extreme loneliness, and they’ll happen to almost all of us at least once. **Losing contact with a good friend** This has happened on more than one occasion for myself. You build a solid relationship with a close friend, never really noticing how quickly time is passing by the two of you, until *poof* they’re gone, and you’re not sure where they went. Maybe they had to move because of a job or due to family, but they’re gone and you’re not quite sure what happened to them. **Uprooting your life and moving to a new area** Moving to a new city or town where you don’t know *anyone* is one of the hardest and loneliest things anyone will ever do. New friends, new partners, new jobs, new everything. Ironically enough, this might be why most people never move away from their roots. A large number of people pass away just 60 miles from where they were born, having never lived anywhere else. **Losing a loved one** Death is the age-old problem that humanity has been trying to solve since we could fathom the notion. Watching a loved one perish is one of the hardest things a person will ever do. There will always be an emptiness left behind by that person. You can’t just call or text them whenever you want now, you can’t just invite them over for dinner, and you can’t just see how they’re doing. They’re just gone. **When you have something to say, but no one listens to you** This can happen to anyone in any social circle, be it at work, at home, or with your family and friends. It’s very demeaning and hurtful when people you think care about you can’t even give you the time of day. You feel disrespected, like your ideas and thoughts don’t matter. You feel lonely. **When your partner leaves you** Having a lover or partner up and leave you for any reason can be a traumatic and lonely time. The hurt is amplified if they’ve left you for another person, getting on with their life in a manner that not only doesn’t involve you, but with someone who has replaced you. Know that there is someone out there better for you anyway. Things fall apart so better things can come together. http://www.higherperspectives.com/loneliest-moments-1554450602.html?c=taco

Losing contact with a good friend

This has happened on more than one occasion for myself. You build a solid relationship with a close friend, never really noticing how quickly time is passing by the two of you, until *poof* they’re gone, and you’re not sure where they went.

Maybe they had to move because of a job or due to family, but they’re gone and you’re not quite sure what happened to them.

A large number of people pass away just 60 miles from where they were born, having never lived anywhere else.

Death is the age-old problem that humanity has been trying to solve since we could fathom the notion. Watching a loved one perish is one of the hardest things a person will ever do. There will always be an emptiness left behind by that person.

You can’t just call or text them whenever you want now, you can’t just invite them over for dinner, and you can’t just see how they’re doing. They’re just gone.

When you have something to say, but no one listens to you

You feel disrespected, like your ideas and thoughts don’t matter. You feel lonely.

posts.title: 4 Things That Make a Soul Mate Different From a Life Partner
posts.markdown: When it comes to figuring out who the important people in your life are, it’s not always easy to differentiate between life partners and soul mates. I know, you probably thought they were the same thing (most people do), but they are actually quite different. There are four key differences between **[life partners](http://foreverconscious.com/the-difference-between-soulmates-and-life-partners)**and your soul mates: **Their Purpose** Soul mates are people who come into our lives at the exact moment we need them to. Your paths have crossed because you are destined to help each other grow. You’re both at stages in life where you need the other to progress forward, and once you’ve achieved this goal, you part ways, each taking a separate path. Sometimes this process is painful, but know that one day a life partner will find their way to you. This person shares your dreams, goals and visions of the future, and sticks around for longer than just one stage of your life. **Attraction** We’re usually drawn to our soul mates because of similarities and likenesses. The two of you share many personality traits, including your flaws. This is where things get messy. You cannot have balance between two people who are so similar. A life partner is someone who brings that balance to your life. Their strengths are your weaknesses and your strengths are their weaknesses. This balance is what will help the two of you build a lasting relationship. **Intuition** **[Soul mates are highly intuitive](http://www.higherperspectives.com/soul-mates-and-life-partners-1406180231.html)** between each other. They already know each other without ever having really *known* each other, which makes communication easy. With your life partner, **[things are bit more complicated](http://tinybuddha.com/blog/you-already-know-your-soul-mate/)**and require more effort. But this effort is well worth the energy and time you spend. The more you put into learning about your partner, the deeper you understand them; it is this deep understanding that generates more love. **Soul mates appear during certain events in life** Our soul mates usually make their presence known shortly after a major event has happened in our lives. It might be a big promotion, the death of a loved one, or the start of a new chapter in your life. Soul mates are somewhat linked to these events. They’re there to help you sort through everything that’s happening in the moment, but eventually fall to the wayside. Life partners grow and **[evolve alongside you](https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/talking-apes/201601/relationships-are-learning-environments)**. What they mean to you and what they bring to your life will change in some way almost every day, but they’ll always be by your side, just as you will always be by theirs. You grow together, not apart.
posts.html:
When it comes to figuring out who the important people in your life are, it’s not always easy to differentiate between life partners and soul mates. I know, you probably thought they were the same thing (most people do), but they are actually quite different.

There are four key differences between life partners and your soul mates:

Their Purpose

Soul mates are people who come into our lives at the exact moment we need them to. Your paths have crossed because you are destined to help each other grow. You’re both at stages in life where you need the other to progress forward, and once you’ve achieved this goal, you part ways, each taking a separate path.

Sometimes this process is painful, but know that one day a life partner will find their way to you. This person shares your dreams, goals and visions of the future, and sticks around for longer than just one stage of your life.

Attraction

We’re usually drawn to our soul mates because of similarities and likenesses. The two of you share many personality traits, including your flaws. This is where things get messy. You cannot have balance between two people who are so similar.

A life partner is someone who brings that balance to your life. Their strengths are your weaknesses and your strengths are their weaknesses. This balance is what will help the two of you build a lasting relationship.

Intuition

Soul mates are highly intuitive between each other. They already know each other without ever having really known each other, which makes communication easy.

With your life partner, things are bit more complicated and require more effort. But this effort is well worth the energy and time you spend. The more you put into learning about your partner, the deeper you understand them; it is this deep understanding that generates more love.

Soul mates appear during certain events in life

Our soul mates usually make their presence known shortly after a major event has happened in our lives. It might be a big promotion, the death of a loved one, or the start of a new chapter in your life. Soul mates are somewhat linked to these events. They’re there to help you sort through everything that’s happening in the moment, but eventually fall to the wayside.

Life partners grow and evolve alongside you. What they mean to you and what they bring to your life will change in some way almost every day, but they’ll always be by your side, just as you will always be by theirs. You grow together, not apart.

posts.title: 5 Natural Antibiotics That Our Ancestors Used and You Should Use Too
posts.markdown: The advent of modern medicine has provided mankind with optimal health the likes of which we’ve never seen before. Catch a sexually transmitted disease after a hot night with a stranger? There are pills for that. Have a bacterial bug that’s slowly filling your entire body with mucus and phlegm? There are pills for that too. Pretty much any common ailment that would have killed a person 200 years ago is now easily gotten rid of with pills. But, **[at what cost](http://blogs.naturalnews.com/12-natural-antibiotics-ancestors-used-instead-pills/)**? Antibiotics have been mankind’s “go-to” pharmaceutical for almost every major illness imaginable for the past couple decades. And just as everything else in this world evolves, so do the nasty bugs that try to kill us from within. This means that as we continue to use antibiotics to fight off infection, the bugs that infect us learn how to overcome (and survive) the pills we ingest to kill them. Before the arrival of antibiotics, humans used a variety of different “**[natural](http://www.healthy-holistic-living.com/12-natural-antibiotics-that-our-ancestors-used-instead-of-pills.html)**” antibiotics found in nature. In fact, many holistic people still utilize these traditional antibiotic substances to fight off illness. And we might want to start doing the same if we hope to stave off the onset of a “superbug” that could potentially wipe out a majority of mankind. Here are five **[natural antibiotics](http://www.myhealthwire.com/news/herbs-supplements/796)** to use instead of pharmaceuticals: **Oregano & oregano oil** While oregano is a popular spice used to flavor some of our favorite Italian entrees, many people are completely unaware of its antibacterial properties. It’s been seen to help improve digestive function and even help some people lose weight. Carvacrol, an oil found in oregano, has shown to be quite effective in killing bacteria. There’s more than **[meets the eye](http://www.coolhealthyrecipes.com/10-natural-antibiotics-that-our-ancestors-used-instead-of-pills/2/)** when it comes to oregano. **Honey** Honey is **[one of the best](http://higherperspective.com/2014/05/5-natural-antibiotics-already-kitchen.html)** and most widely known natural antibiotics. It’s even been recorded that ancient Romans used honey during battles to help treat the wounds of fallen soldiers, as it helps prevent infection. As a natural antibiotic, antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory and antiseptic substance, honey has been one of mankind’s primary natural medicines for thousands of years. It provides a boost to the immune system, removes toxins from our bodies, aids in digestion, and helps the liver function more efficiently. **Turmeric** You can eat turmeric, the spice commonly found in Indian food, or you can even rub it on your body to gain its health benefits. What’s even cooler is that you can mix together honey and turmeric into a paste that can be used to treat infected areas of the body. **Coconut Oil** Coconut oil never gets the credit it deserves. It has natural anti-fungal and anti-microbial properties and is chock-full of antioxidants that can’t be gained from anything else. You can apply it externally or consume it raw. It enhances the immune system, helps thyroid function, improve brain function, and has been seen to balance cholesterol and blood sugar levels. Put a spoonful into your coffee in the mornings or in your meals throughout the day to give yourself more energy and clarity. **Grapefruit Seed Extract** A study published in the Journal of Alternative and Complementary Medicine found that grapefruit seed extract (GSE) was effective in combatting over 800 types of viruses and bacteria, over a hundred types of fungi, and a variety of different parasites. It contains high levels of antioxidants, boosts the immune system, and helps our digestive functioning by promoting healthy bacteria in our guts.
posts.html:
The advent of modern medicine has provided mankind with optimal health the likes of which we’ve never seen before. Catch a sexually transmitted disease after a hot night with a stranger? There are pills for that. Have a bacterial bug that’s slowly filling your entire body with mucus and phlegm? There are pills for that too.

Pretty much any common ailment that would have killed a person 200 years ago is now easily gotten rid of with pills. But, at what cost?

Antibiotics have been mankind’s “go-to” pharmaceutical for almost every major illness imaginable for the past couple decades. And just as everything else in this world evolves, so do the nasty bugs that try to kill us from within. This means that as we continue to use antibiotics to fight off infection, the bugs that infect us learn how to overcome (and survive) the pills we ingest to kill them.

Before the arrival of antibiotics, humans used a variety of different “natural” antibiotics found in nature. In fact, many holistic people still utilize these traditional antibiotic substances to fight off illness.

And we might want to start doing the same if we hope to stave off the onset of a “superbug” that could potentially wipe out a majority of mankind. Here are five natural antibiotics to use instead of pharmaceuticals:

Oregano & oregano oil

While oregano is a popular spice used to flavor some of our favorite Italian entrees, many people are completely unaware of its antibacterial properties. It’s been seen to help improve digestive function and even help some people lose weight. Carvacrol, an oil found in oregano, has shown to be quite effective in killing bacteria.

There’s more than meets the eye when it comes to oregano.

Honey

Honey is one of the best and most widely known natural antibiotics. It’s even been recorded that ancient Romans used honey during battles to help treat the wounds of fallen soldiers, as it helps prevent infection. As a natural antibiotic, antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory and antiseptic substance, honey has been one of mankind’s primary natural medicines for thousands of years.

It provides a boost to the immune system, removes toxins from our bodies, aids in digestion, and helps the liver function more efficiently.

Turmeric

You can eat turmeric, the spice commonly found in Indian food, or you can even rub it on your body to gain its health benefits. What’s even cooler is that you can mix together honey and turmeric into a paste that can be used to treat infected areas of the body.

Coconut Oil

Coconut oil never gets the credit it deserves. It has natural anti-fungal and anti-microbial properties and is chock-full of antioxidants that can’t be gained from anything else. You can apply it externally or consume it raw. It enhances the immune system, helps thyroid function, improve brain function, and has been seen to balance cholesterol and blood sugar levels.

Put a spoonful into your coffee in the mornings or in your meals throughout the day to give yourself more energy and clarity.

Grapefruit Seed Extract

A study published in the Journal of Alternative and Complementary Medicine found that grapefruit seed extract (GSE) was effective in combatting over 800 types of viruses and bacteria, over a hundred types of fungi, and a variety of different parasites.

It contains high levels of antioxidants, boosts the immune system, and helps our digestive functioning by promoting healthy bacteria in our guts.

posts.title: Harvard Psychologist Discovered 8 Types of Intelligence, Which One Describes You?
posts.markdown: Howard Gardner, psychologist at Harvard University, has coined the theory of multiple intelligences. This theory suggests that each and every person has a dominant type of intelligence that best defines their way of thinking. Knowing which type you have will only help you navigate the complicated avenues of life!

posts.title: 5 Reasons That Intelligent People Struggle to Find Love
posts.markdown: As pretty much everyone figures out at one point or another, relationships will be some of the hardest things you will ever have to deal with in your life. People are too complex, unique and robust for it to be any other way. Unfortunately, this also means that we’re prone to acting irrational and doing irrational things. Intelligent people have it even worse. Their “intelligent” nature often creates more problems than it solves. Here are five reasons that intelligent people struggle a little bit when it comes to intimate relationships: **They’re highly analytic** Intelligent people are always drawing from past experiences and past outcomes when trying to solve their current problems. Unfortunately, this means that they often make conclusions too quickly, rather than letting the situation play out on its own. So they’re prone to jumping ship at the first sign of trouble, rather than waiting to see what happens. **They struggle to let their guard down** Being so aware of all of the things that could potentially go wrong in a relationship keeps intelligent people from bringing down their walls and letting people in. They’ve opened up in the past and been burned, so they’re not about to let the same thing happen all over again. This makes them come off as cold and unavailable, which isn’t what they want at all. **They’re straightforward and direct** They’re almost so straight-to-the-point that it becomes a fault. They don’t hesitate to say what they’re thinking, which often causes others to see them as rude and crass. But, they’re not about to stop being direct for the sake of others, which can be a tough trait to have during sensitive situations. **They tend to choose head over heart** Intelligent individuals are used to using the power of their brain to overcome all of life’s problems. However, they’re usually not as familiar with navigating life using their hearts. The intense emotions and desires of the heart are not something they fully understand, so they usually choose to ignore it entirely. **They often choose personal success over relationships** Intelligent people have lived a life achieving validation through successes in academia. They know which areas of life they excel in, so they often prefer to spend much of their time doing things they’re good at, rather than wasting time and energy on a relationship they can’t even begin to understand. http://diply.com/pea/article/reasons-intelligent-people-struggle-to-find-love/2
posts.html:
As pretty much everyone figures out at one point or another, relationships will be some of the hardest things you will ever have to deal with in your life. People are too complex, unique and robust for it to be any other way. Unfortunately, this also means that we’re prone to acting irrational and doing irrational things.

Intelligent people have it even worse. Their “intelligent” nature often creates more problems than it solves.

Here are five reasons that intelligent people struggle a little bit when it comes to intimate relationships:

They’re highly analytic

Intelligent people are always drawing from past experiences and past outcomes when trying to solve their current problems. Unfortunately, this means that they often make conclusions too quickly, rather than letting the situation play out on its own.

So they’re prone to jumping ship at the first sign of trouble, rather than waiting to see what happens.

They struggle to let their guard down

Being so aware of all of the things that could potentially go wrong in a relationship keeps intelligent people from bringing down their walls and letting people in. They’ve opened up in the past and been burned, so they’re not about to let the same thing happen all over again.

This makes them come off as cold and unavailable, which isn’t what they want at all.

They’re straightforward and direct

They’re almost so straight-to-the-point that it becomes a fault. They don’t hesitate to say what they’re thinking, which often causes others to see them as rude and crass. But, they’re not about to stop being direct for the sake of others, which can be a tough trait to have during sensitive situations.

They tend to choose head over heart

Intelligent individuals are used to using the power of their brain to overcome all of life’s problems. However, they’re usually not as familiar with navigating life using their hearts. The intense emotions and desires of the heart are not something they fully understand, so they usually choose to ignore it entirely.

They often choose personal success over relationships

Intelligent people have lived a life achieving validation through successes in academia. They know which areas of life they excel in, so they often prefer to spend much of their time doing things they’re good at, rather than wasting time and energy on a relationship they can’t even begin to understand.

http://diply.com/pea/article/reasons-intelligent-people-struggle-to-find-love/2

posts.title: This Couple Built a Greenhouse AROUND Their Home For Warmth and Food
posts.markdown: ![greenhouse shell](http://www.realfarmacy.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/greenhouse-shell.jpg) When you live in Stockholm, Sweden, there are a few unpleasant things you have to deal with. One of those being the average temperature sitting around the usual low of 27 degrees on any night in January. This also means that growing food is almost impossible. So, one couple devised a plan to solve both problems, and they did it by building a greenhouse *around* their home. It’s quite genius, really. Marie Granmar and Charles Sacilotto don’t have to use solar panels or electronic devices to make use of the energy they gain from the sun. They live in absolute sustainability and comfortability thanks to this creative endeavor of theirs. The couple has dubbed it “Naturhus,” and its design was inspired by Bengt Warne, a Swedish eco-architect who was also a mentor to Charles Sacilotto. If you can, try to imagine lounging around in your bathing suit, surrounded by plant life and vegetables, in your backyard in the middle of winter. How does it work? During the daytime, the sun’s rays heat the home and the outside growing areas. Additional heat is also stored in the bedrock upon which the house rests. Between the two, their home stays a comfortable temperature year-round. But, they didn’t stop there. They also utilize collected rainwater for different household needs and compost all of their kitchen waste. And, Sacilotto, who is also an engineer, designed the home’s sewage system, which is fairly complex compared to most: “The sewage system begins with a urine-separating toilet and uses centrifuges, cisterns, grow beds and garden ponds to filter the water and compost the remains,” [reports Fair Companies](http://faircompanies.com/videos/view/family-wraps-home-in-greenhouse-to-warm-up-stockholm-weather/). You can check out a video tour of the home by watching the video below: > [Couple Builds Greenhouse AROUND House to Grow Food and Keep Warm](http://www.realfarmacy.com/greenhouse-around-house/)

If you can, try to imagine lounging around in your bathing suit, surrounded by plant life and vegetables, in your backyard in the middle of winter.

But, they didn’t stop there. They also utilize collected rainwater for different household needs and compost all of their kitchen waste. And, Sacilotto, who is also an engineer, designed the home’s sewage system, which is fairly complex compared to most:

posts.title: Adults Everywhere Are Rethinking How They Talk to Children After Watching THIS Video
posts.markdown: “**[Every Opportunity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VxyxywShewI)**” is a video with a powerful message, and it illustrates a big picture idea when it comes to how interactions with adults can affect a child’s education. The video, which was released by **[The Atlanta Speech School](https://www.atlantaspeechschool.org/)**, shows what a day at school looks like as seen through the eyes of a young student. This particular student starts his day with enthusiasm and readiness, but his courage and motivation slowly fades as he interacts with educators and adults throughout his day. In a press release issued by the school, they claim that their video attempts to “demonstrate how small changes in adult behavior, both inside and outside of the classroom, can enhance a child’s approach and her ability to learn.” If you’re around little ones or have young ones of your own, it’s at least something to consider! h/t [**HuffPo**](http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/eye-opening-video-will-make-adults-reconsider-the-way-they-talk-to-children_us_57b36f62e4b0edfa80d9ddcc)
posts.html:
“Every Opportunity” is a video with a powerful message, and it illustrates a big picture idea when it comes to how interactions with adults can affect a child’s education.

The video, which was released by The Atlanta Speech School, shows what a day at school looks like as seen through the eyes of a young student. This particular student starts his day with enthusiasm and readiness, but his courage and motivation slowly fades as he interacts with educators and adults throughout his day.

In a press release issued by the school, they claim that their video attempts to “demonstrate how small changes in adult behavior, both inside and outside of the classroom, can enhance a child’s approach and her ability to learn.”

If you’re around little ones or have young ones of your own, it’s at least something to consider!

h/t HuffPo

posts.title: This Dying Woman Threw a Farewell Party On the Eve of Her Suicide
posts.markdown: *Photos via Niels Alpert* For many people, when it’s time to part ways with friends and loved ones as we pass over to the other side, traditional proceedings only include funerals and maybe the scattering of ashes. As we progress forward with more enlightened attitudes toward assisted suicide, we’ll undoubtedly start to see more stories like Betsy Davis. This 41-year-old painter and performance artist decided to take matters into her own hands after being diagnosed with ALS (**[amyotrophic lateral sclerosis](http://www.alsa.org/about-als/what-is-als.html?referrer=https://www.google.com/)**), a neurodegenerative disease that slowly kills nerve cells found in the brain and spinal cord. ![](http://cdn2.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2016/08/1J5bY1dRgKae936c68daee105641-3735194-Amanda_Friedland_left_adjusts_her_friend_Betsy_Davis_s_sash_as_s-a-8_1470947909380-600x398.jpg) She planned a party that would be held over the course of two days and which 30 friends and loved ones would be invited to. “These circumstances are unlike any party you have attended before, requiring emotional stamina, centeredness, and openness,” reads her invitations. Betsy also made it clear that she only had one rule for attending the party: no crying in front of her. Betsy’s body was slowly starting to shut down, and this party was her way of not only saying goodbye to her loved ones, but also of letting them know that it would all be okay. Because after the party was over, Betsy would be one of the first Californians to utilize her state’s doctor-assisted suicide law for the terminally ill, by being administered a lethal dose of drugs. The party was a grand affair. Guests were playing music, enjoying drinks, and eating Betsy’s favorite pizza while watching her favorite movies. As her speech was starting to slur, she had caretakers translating for speech for guests as she moved around the party spending time with each guest. As the weekend passed, and Betsy’s party was ending, one final photo was taken as everyone said their goodbyes. A canopy bed resting on a hillside would be where her final moments were spent. Wearing a kimono she purchased after being diagnosed with ALS in 2013, Betsy was taken to her bed at 6:45pm, and watched the sun set as her doctor injected her with drugs. Within four hours, Betsy was gone. “What Betsy did gave her the most beautiful death that any person could ever wish for,” exclaimed one of Betsy’s friends. “By taking charge, she turned her departure into a work of art.” *Please share with friends and family members who would be touched by Betsy’s celebration of life and death.*
posts.html:
Photos via Niels Alpert

For many people, when it’s time to part ways with friends and loved ones as we pass over to the other side, traditional proceedings only include funerals and maybe the scattering of ashes. As we progress forward with more enlightened attitudes toward assisted suicide, we’ll undoubtedly start to see more stories like Betsy Davis.

This 41-year-old painter and performance artist decided to take matters into her own hands after being diagnosed with ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis), a neurodegenerative disease that slowly kills nerve cells found in the brain and spinal cord.

She planned a party that would be held over the course of two days and which 30 friends and loved ones would be invited to.

“These circumstances are unlike any party you have attended before, requiring emotional stamina, centeredness, and openness,” reads her invitations.

Betsy also made it clear that she only had one rule for attending the party: no crying in front of her.

Betsy’s body was slowly starting to shut down, and this party was her way of not only saying goodbye to her loved ones, but also of letting them know that it would all be okay. Because after the party was over, Betsy would be one of the first Californians to utilize her state’s doctor-assisted suicide law for the terminally ill, by being administered a lethal dose of drugs.

The party was a grand affair.

Guests were playing music, enjoying drinks, and eating Betsy’s favorite pizza while watching her favorite movies. As her speech was starting to slur, she had caretakers translating for speech for guests as she moved around the party spending time with each guest.

As the weekend passed, and Betsy’s party was ending, one final photo was taken as everyone said their goodbyes.

A canopy bed resting on a hillside would be where her final moments were spent. Wearing a kimono she purchased after being diagnosed with ALS in 2013, Betsy was taken to her bed at 6:45pm, and watched the sun set as her doctor injected her with drugs.

Within four hours, Betsy was gone.

“What Betsy did gave her the most beautiful death that any person could ever wish for,” exclaimed one of Betsy’s friends.

“By taking charge, she turned her departure into a work of art.”

Please share with friends and family members who would be touched by Betsy’s celebration of life and death.

posts.title: “No Homework” Policy Continues to Grow in Popularity Amongst Teachers
posts.markdown: “After much research this summer, I am trying something new,” **[reads a note that was sent home with one student](https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10208920380439663&set=a.2192657828875.118537.1620033655&type=3&theater). ** “I ask that you spend your evenings doing things that are proven to correlate with student success. Eat dinner as a family, read together, play outside, and get your children to bed early.” Brandy Young, a teacher at Godley Elementary school in Texas, sent these notes home with all of her second-grade students, letting their parents know that they would not be receiving additional work to take home at the end of their days. This note explains that Young is trying a different approach after finding evidence that children actually benefit more from a ‘no homework’ style of policy. And she’s not the only one. Growing support for such policies has spurred numerous academic institutions to ditch homework almost entirely. For example, **[Baltimore County schools](http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2016/08/23/baltimore-co-school-wont-be-grading-students-on-homework-behavior/)**have done away with homework and conduct as criteria for how children achieve overall grades. “Homework assignments provide students with an additional opportunity to practice, deepen their understanding, and/or increase progress toward meeting standards and expectations. … [T]he results from homework should be used to provide feedback, and the scores should be entered as a **nongraded** assignment …” reads a **[report published by the school district](https://www.bcps.org/academics/grading/Grading-and-Reporting-Procedures.pdf).** Homedale Elementary in southwest Idaho has implemented an even stricter no homework policy by banning it entirely for all kids who attend their school. “When the kids go home I want them to play, and create and use their imaginations and spend time with family,” said **[Principal Terri Vasquez to ](http://www.ktvb.com/news/education/homedale-school-adopts-no-homework-policy/306395728)**KTVB news. Many parents have expressed relief regarding the no homework policy, saying that even their first-graders were swamped with up to an hour of homework each night. While **[National Education Association](http://www.nea.org/tools/16938.htm)** standards advocate only 10 to 20 minutes of homework a night for first-graders, with it increasing by 10 minutes for each grade after, many students (and parents) also have extracurricular activities they struggle to make time for. **[Cory Turner, of NPR](http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2015/09/19/439472033/homework-a-new-users-guide),** commented on this recent trend, highlighting the fact that there comes a time when students choose whether or not they want to take on a heavier workload: “The fact is, some students do have a ton of homework. In high school we see a kind of student divergence — between those who choose or find themselves tracked into less-rigorous coursework and those who enroll in honors classes or multiple Advanced Placement courses.” **[Previous research](http://expandedconsciousness.com/2016/08/06/homework/)** has found that elementary school students do not benefit nearly as much from homework as students in middle school or high school, and it appears that more and more educators are starting to believe the same. So, for people like myself, who absolutely loathed doing homework throughout school (but still did okay on exams), I can say that this is a great idea. However, whether or not this practice of ‘no homework’ will stand the test of time remains to be seen!
posts.html:
“After much research this summer, I am trying something new,” reads a note that was sent home with one student.

“I ask that you spend your evenings doing things that are proven to correlate with student success. Eat dinner as a family, read together, play outside, and get your children to bed early.”

Brandy Young, a teacher at Godley Elementary school in Texas, sent these notes home with all of her second-grade students, letting their parents know that they would not be receiving additional work to take home at the end of their days.

This note explains that Young is trying a different approach after finding evidence that children actually benefit more from a ‘no homework’ style of policy.

And she’s not the only one.

Growing support for such policies has spurred numerous academic institutions to ditch homework almost entirely. For example, Baltimore County schools have done away with homework and conduct as criteria for how children achieve overall grades.

“Homework assignments provide students with an additional opportunity to practice, deepen their understanding, and/or increase progress toward meeting standards and expectations. … [T]he results from homework should be used to provide feedback, and the scores should be entered as a nongraded assignment …” reads a report published by the school district.

Homedale Elementary in southwest Idaho has implemented an even stricter no homework policy by banning it entirely for all kids who attend their school.

“When the kids go home I want them to play, and create and use their imaginations and spend time with family,” said Principal Terri Vasquez to KTVB news.

Many parents have expressed relief regarding the no homework policy, saying that even their first-graders were swamped with up to an hour of homework each night.

While National Education Association standards advocate only 10 to 20 minutes of homework a night for first-graders, with it increasing by 10 minutes for each grade after, many students (and parents) also have extracurricular activities they struggle to make time for.

Cory Turner, of NPR, commented on this recent trend, highlighting the fact that there comes a time when students choose whether or not they want to take on a heavier workload:

“The fact is, some students do have a ton of homework. In high school we see a kind of student divergence — between those who choose or find themselves tracked into less-rigorous coursework and those who enroll in honors classes or multiple Advanced Placement courses.”

Previous research has found that elementary school students do not benefit nearly as much from homework as students in middle school or high school, and it appears that more and more educators are starting to believe the same.

So, for people like myself, who absolutely loathed doing homework throughout school (but still did okay on exams), I can say that this is a great idea. However, whether or not this practice of ‘no homework’ will stand the test of time remains to be seen!

posts.title: 5 Foods That Help With Depression
posts.markdown: Food is one of the most common things we turn to when life isn’t going our way. Something about eating delicious stuff makes the pain or anxiety we’re feeling a little less awful. But, if you’re **[one of the 350 million](https://www.adaa.org/about-adaa/press-room/facts-statistics)** people who suffers from depression, you know all too well that it takes a lot more than a couple pints of ice cream to boost your mood. It’s pretty normal for depressed and anxious people to be taking medicine that combats the effects of their condition, but what many people don’t know is that diet can affect our mental health just as much as anything else. Certain foods contain certain vitamins, minerals, fats and antioxidants that can help change our brain chemistry. If you’ve been depressed or anxious lately, try incorporating these five natural foods into your diet and see if anything changes for you! **Whole Grains** When we’re trying to shed a few extra pounds, carbohydrates aren’t exactly our friends, but when it comes to making us feel better, they’re perfect. Whole grains are rich in tryptophan, an amino acid that is vital in the brain’s creation of serotonin and melatonin. **[Studies have found](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2850196/)** that diets that are rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains can reduce shifts in mood and relieve anxiety and depression. **Nuts** Full of omega-3 fatty acids, protein and antioxidants, nuts can also help relieve depression and anxiety symptoms. President of the Inflammation Foundation, **[Dr. Barry Sears](http://www.drsears.com/),** says that eating raw nuts with a high polyphenol count will work the best. “Almonds and walnuts would be good choices. It’s more the magnesium in the nuts that promotes calmness,” he told*Medical Daily*. If you don’t like either of those nuts, cashews will also do the trick. They’re full of iron, magnesium, Vitamin B6, protein and other amino acids. **Blueberries** Blueberries’ high levels of antioxidants have been found to relieve**[feelings of depression](https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/04/160405175653.htm)**. They also have a fairly high vitamin C content level, which has been found to reduce levels of cortisol, the stress hormone, which in turn reduces anxiety. **Dairy** Anxious feelings and thoughts have been tied to low blood sugar levels. Thus, consuming dairy foods, like yogurt or eggs, are great for fighting off depression and anxiety. Not to mention, they’re great sources of protein, which helps in the production of healthy neurotransmitters in the brain. “Yes, there is truth to the ‘old saying’ about drinking hot milk before bed! The ingredient tryptophan has a natural calming agent that actually relaxes you without medication. Tryptophan can be found in milk, all dairy products, and turkey,” Beverly Hills psychotherapist, Dr. Fran Walfish, told *Medical Daily*. **Dark Chocolate** Containing tyrosine, dark chocolate works as a natural antidepressant by increasing levels of dopamine. Because dopamine directly influences our emotional state by activating the pleasure centers of the brain, its levels are important to our happiness and mood. It’s widely known that the cocoa found in dark chocolates causes the release of serotonin through the relaxing of blood vessels in the brain. It’s also been seen to reduce cortisol levels and release [‘**feel good’ endorphins**](http://psychcentral.com/blog/archives/2009/04/27/chocolate-and-mood-disorders/).
posts.html:
Food is one of the most common things we turn to when life isn’t going our way. Something about eating delicious stuff makes the pain or anxiety we’re feeling a little less awful. But, if you’re one of the 350 million people who suffers from depression, you know all too well that it takes a lot more than a couple pints of ice cream to boost your mood.

It’s pretty normal for depressed and anxious people to be taking medicine that combats the effects of their condition, but what many people don’t know is that diet can affect our mental health just as much as anything else.

Certain foods contain certain vitamins, minerals, fats and antioxidants that can help change our brain chemistry. If you’ve been depressed or anxious lately, try incorporating these five natural foods into your diet and see if anything changes for you!

Whole Grains

When we’re trying to shed a few extra pounds, carbohydrates aren’t exactly our friends, but when it comes to making us feel better, they’re perfect. Whole grains are rich in tryptophan, an amino acid that is vital in the brain’s creation of serotonin and melatonin.

Studies have found that diets that are rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains can reduce shifts in mood and relieve anxiety and depression.

Nuts

Full of omega-3 fatty acids, protein and antioxidants, nuts can also help relieve depression and anxiety symptoms. President of the Inflammation Foundation, Dr. Barry Sears, says that eating raw nuts with a high polyphenol count will work the best.

“Almonds and walnuts would be good choices. It’s more the magnesium in the nuts that promotes calmness,” he toldMedical Daily.

If you don’t like either of those nuts, cashews will also do the trick. They’re full of iron, magnesium, Vitamin B6, protein and other amino acids.

Blueberries

Blueberries’ high levels of antioxidants have been found to relieve feelings of depression. They also have a fairly high vitamin C content level, which has been found to reduce levels of cortisol, the stress hormone, which in turn reduces anxiety.

Dairy

Anxious feelings and thoughts have been tied to low blood sugar levels. Thus, consuming dairy foods, like yogurt or eggs, are great for fighting off depression and anxiety. Not to mention, they’re great sources of protein, which helps in the production of healthy neurotransmitters in the brain.

“Yes, there is truth to the ‘old saying’ about drinking hot milk before bed! The ingredient tryptophan has a natural calming agent that actually relaxes you without medication. Tryptophan can be found in milk, all dairy products, and turkey,” Beverly Hills psychotherapist, Dr. Fran Walfish, told Medical Daily.

Dark Chocolate

Containing tyrosine, dark chocolate works as a natural antidepressant by increasing levels of dopamine. Because dopamine directly influences our emotional state by activating the pleasure centers of the brain, its levels are important to our happiness and mood.

It’s widely known that the cocoa found in dark chocolates causes the release of serotonin through the relaxing of blood vessels in the brain.

It’s also been seen to reduce cortisol levels and release ‘feel good’ endorphins.

posts.title: Good News: You DON'T Have to Remove People From Your Life
posts.markdown: By [**Andrea Schulman**](https://www.facebook.com/raiseyourvibrationtoday/?fref=ts) | [**Raise Your Vibration Today **](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/30/remove-people-from-your-life/) Are you worried that if you don’t remove people from your life they will plague you with their negativity? One of the common things I hear from people in the [Law of Attraction](http://www.raiseyourvibrationtoday.com "Raise Your Vibration Today: Law of Attraction Coaching and Education") community is that they are very concerned about surrounding themselves only with positive and uplifting people. They worry that they have to remove people from their lives, especially so-called “toxic people.” While being around positive and uplifting people makes it easier to maintain a high vibration, it can be hard to eliminate long-time friends and family members.  We also often have other people like coworkers and neighbors who are hard to avoid. ***Related Article:**[Feeling Provoked? This Is Your Best Defense](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/05/feeling-provoked-your-best-defense/ "Feeling Provoked? This Is Your Best Defense")* The good news is that you absolutely do not have to get rid of anyone in your life, and you still can create a circle of positive and uplifting people. ## Keeping Everyone & Still Keeping it Positive How? Well, the behaviors and actions we witness in others are direct a reflection of our expectations.  For example, if I expect my mother-in-law is going to insult me, she probably will. If I expect my coworker to steal my lunch out of the company fridge, he probably will too. However, if I expect my mother-in-law to babysit my kids for me, she probably will.  If I expect my coworker to help me with a project at work, he probably will too. The thing is, we can attract “good” or “bad” behaviors from literally anyone!  The trick is in learning to manage our expectations about people. ## Energy flows where attention goes Remember to focus as much as you can on the good, and ignore the bad as frequently as possible.  In time this two-sided approach will help transform the toxic people, making them more positively-minded and easy to deal with (at least when they are around you)! Now, I know it can be challenging to think positively about people who have treated you negatively for a long time, so be patient with this process.  Over time, your ability to focus on the positive will get easier and easier as the Law of Attraction gains momentum. Ultimately, you don’t have to remove people from your life to be surrounded by positive people. Happy Manifesting! XO, Andrea *(Law of Attraction coach & educator)* ### Are you a student of the Law of Attraction? Sign up for my free [Law of Attraction newsletter](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.us9.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=36d05de151fc23b6dee2dd220&id=db39a47128 "subscribe") for conscious advice to help you attract positive outcomes into your life.  You can also become a member of my LOA member website and gain access to a library of video tutorials, ebooks, audiobooks and meditations.  Learn how to attract the things you want with fun, clarity and success!   Join today for as little as[ $1.99](https://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/membership-checkout/?level=1 "become a member for just $1.99!") or become an annual member for [30% in savings](https://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/membership-checkout/?level=2 "annual member"). *Article Source: This article was originally published at [Raise Your Vibration Today](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/30/remove-people-from-your-life/) and has been republished with permission from the author.*
posts.html:
By Andrea Schulman | Raise Your Vibration Today 

Are you worried that if you don’t remove people from your life they will plague you with their negativity?

One of the common things I hear from people in the Law of Attraction community is that they are very concerned about surrounding themselves only with positive and uplifting people. They worry that they have to remove people from their lives, especially so-called “toxic people.”

While being around positive and uplifting people makes it easier to maintain a high vibration, it can be hard to eliminate long-time friends and family members.  We also often have other people like coworkers and neighbors who are hard to avoid.

Related Article: Feeling Provoked? This Is Your Best Defense

The good news is that you absolutely do not have to get rid of anyone in your life, and you still can create a circle of positive and uplifting people.

Keeping Everyone & Still Keeping it Positive

How? Well, the behaviors and actions we witness in others are direct a reflection of our expectations.  For example, if I expect my mother-in-law is going to insult me, she probably will. If I expect my coworker to steal my lunch out of the company fridge, he probably will too.

However, if I expect my mother-in-law to babysit my kids for me, she probably will.  If I expect my coworker to help me with a project at work, he probably will too.

The thing is, we can attract “good” or “bad” behaviors from literally anyone!  The trick is in learning to manage our expectations about people.

Energy flows where attention goes

Remember to focus as much as you can on the good, and ignore the bad as frequently as possible.  In time this two-sided approach will help transform the toxic people, making them more positively-minded and easy to deal with (at least when they are around you)!

Now, I know it can be challenging to think positively about people who have treated you negatively for a long time, so be patient with this process.  Over time, your ability to focus on the positive will get easier and easier as the Law of Attraction gains momentum. Ultimately, you don’t have to remove people from your life to be surrounded by positive people.

Happy Manifesting!

XO, Andrea

(Law of Attraction coach & educator)

posts.title: EASY Law of Attraction Strategy: The "Wish List"
posts.markdown: By [**Andrea Schulman**](https://www.facebook.com/raiseyourvibrationtoday/?fref=ts) | [**Raise Your Vibration Today **](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/24/fun-law-attraction-strategy-wish-list/) Today’s [Law of Attraction](http://www.raiseyourvibrationtoday.com) strategy is a technique you can use to attract more of the **material** things that you want. I call it the “wish list” strategy. For this technique, sit down once a week to write down a wish list.  Identify 5-10 items that you’d like to “attract” with the Law of Attraction.  Be sure to include a range of items that are expensive, moderately expensive and inexpensive on your list. ***Related Article:**[Make a Wish! 19 Magical Moments to Ask for What You Want](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/05/05/make-a-wish-magical-moments/)* When you’ve finished writing your list, look over each item and spend at least a couple of minutes imaging how it would feel to have each one as your own. *** ***It’s very important that you don’t imagine ***how*** you are going to get them, but only imagine having them in your possession***.***  Then, find a box to put your list in, and put it somewhere safe.  Each week, add your new wish lists to this box. ## Revisit your wish list over time! After a few months, open up the box and pull out the lists.  Chances are, you are going to find that many of these items have come into your possession one way or another.  You may have bought some with money you suddenly came into, found a great deal on others or even been gifted or lent one by a friend or relative. The wish list is a great way to get into the habit of visualizing the things you want without stressing out about them.  Additionally, when you review the lists, you will see evidence of the Law of Attraction at work.  This will help you gain more confidence in the process. Happy wishing! XO, Andrea ### Are you a student of the Law of Attraction? posts.html:
By Andrea Schulman | Raise Your Vibration Today 

Today’s Law of Attraction strategy is a technique you can use to attract more of the material things that you want. I call it the “wish list” strategy.

For this technique, sit down once a week to write down a wish list.  Identify 5-10 items that you’d like to “attract” with the Law of Attraction.  Be sure to include a range of items that are expensive, moderately expensive and inexpensive on your list.

Related Article: Make a Wish! 19 Magical Moments to Ask for What You Want

When you’ve finished writing your list, look over each item and spend at least a couple of minutes imaging how it would feel to have each one as your own.  It’s very important that you don’t imagine how you are going to get them, but only imagine having them in your possession.  Then, find a box to put your list in, and put it somewhere safe.  Each week, add your new wish lists to this box.

Revisit your wish list over time!

After a few months, open up the box and pull out the lists.  Chances are, you are going to find that many of these items have come into your possession one way or another.  You may have bought some with money you suddenly came into, found a great deal on others or even been gifted or lent one by a friend or relative.

The wish list is a great way to get into the habit of visualizing the things you want without stressing out about them.  Additionally, when you review the lists, you will see evidence of the Law of Attraction at work.  This will help you gain more confidence in the process.

Happy wishing!

XO, Andrea
