posts.title: Sticking With the Law of Attraction, Even When Times Are Tough
posts.markdown: By [**Andrea Schulman**](https://www.facebook.com/raiseyourvibrationtoday/?fref=ts) | [**Raise Your Vibration Today **](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/08/31/law-of-attraction-when-times-are-tough/) How is your [Law of Attraction](http://www.raiseyourvibrationtoday.com "Raise Your Vibration Today: Law of Attraction Coaching and Education") journey going? Are you sticking with the LOA, even when times are tough? When I was introduced to the Law of Attraction several years ago, I instantly felt lighter and more optimistic.  I was super excited about the possibilities that laid ahead, and I couldn’t wait to start creating a better life for myself. However, I found that in the first couple of years, I was often frustrated and disappointed that things weren’t happening quicker for me.  I was still stuck in a stressful and disappointing job, some of my close personal relationships were in turmoil and I continued to worry about money every. single. day.  I understood the concept of the Law of Attraction, but many of my dreams continued to stay out of reach. At times, I worried that I just didn’t have what it took to make my dreams come true. ## Giving up on the LOA Lots of people give up on the LOA in the early years because of frustrations like these. Fortunately for me, I kept my faith in the process and kept moving forward.  My number one goal in life became learning how to apply this law effectively, and I knew if I just kept putting one foot in front of the other I would get better and better at it. If you’re reading this blog post, chances you’re cut from the same cloth. And that’s a really good thing. ***Related Article:**[15 Ways to Overcome Fear of Failure](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/05/06/overcome-fear-of-failure/)* ## Stay the course Sticking with the Law of Attraction has paid off in dividends for me, and it will for you too. You’ll be amazed how your life evolves if you just stay the course. Today, I live a free and unencumbered life. I’ve got the job of my dreams, my relationships are MUCH more harmonious and the money is flowing with ease. I do what I want to do, when I want to do it, thanks to the Law of Attraction. Of course, today I’ve still got dreams out there to achieve, but they are far bigger and better than any of those smaller and “safer” dreams from my past life. My confidence in my manifesting abilities has grown exponentially, and it continues to expand day after day. ## Change is occurring, and accumulating over time! In all honesty, I have no idea how I used to cope with all of the anxiety and stress from my previous life! I can’t believe how much effort and frustration I used to invest in those smaller concerns. If you can relate to my early years and at times worry that you don’t have what it takes to make things happen with the Law of Attraction, please remember that all you have to do is put one foot in front of the other. Stay optimistic and keep learning and you will do big things with your life. I guarantee it! XO, Andrea *(Law of Attraction coach & educator)* ### Are you a student of the Law of Attraction? posts.html:
By Andrea Schulman | Raise Your Vibration Today 

How is your Law of Attraction journey going? Are you sticking with the LOA, even when times are tough?

When I was introduced to the Law of Attraction several years ago, I instantly felt lighter and more optimistic.  I was super excited about the possibilities that laid ahead, and I couldn’t wait to start creating a better life for myself.

However, I found that in the first couple of years, I was often frustrated and disappointed that things weren’t happening quicker for me.  I was still stuck in a stressful and disappointing job, some of my close personal relationships were in turmoil and I continued to worry about money every. single. day. 

I understood the concept of the Law of Attraction, but many of my dreams continued to stay out of reach. At times, I worried that I just didn’t have what it took to make my dreams come true.

Giving up on the LOA

Lots of people give up on the LOA in the early years because of frustrations like these.

Fortunately for me, I kept my faith in the process and kept moving forward.  My number one goal in life became learning how to apply this law effectively, and I knew if I just kept putting one foot in front of the other I would get better and better at it.

If you’re reading this blog post, chances you’re cut from the same cloth. And that’s a really good thing.

Related Article: 15 Ways to Overcome Fear of Failure

Stay the course

Sticking with the Law of Attraction has paid off in dividends for me, and it will for you too. You’ll be amazed how your life evolves if you just stay the course.

Today, I live a free and unencumbered life. I’ve got the job of my dreams, my relationships are MUCH more harmonious and the money is flowing with ease. I do what I want to do, when I want to do it, thanks to the Law of Attraction.

Of course, today I’ve still got dreams out there to achieve, but they are far bigger and better than any of those smaller and “safer” dreams from my past life. My confidence in my manifesting abilities has grown exponentially, and it continues to expand day after day.

Change is occurring, and accumulating over time!

In all honesty, I have no idea how I used to cope with all of the anxiety and stress from my previous life! I can’t believe how much effort and frustration I used to invest in those smaller concerns.

If you can relate to my early years and at times worry that you don’t have what it takes to make things happen with the Law of Attraction, please remember that all you have to do is put one foot in front of the other. Stay optimistic and keep learning and you will do big things with your life. I guarantee it!

XO, Andrea

(Law of Attraction coach & educator)

Are you a student of the Law of Attraction?

posts.title: This Old Dog Has Become Famous For His 4-Mile Jaunts to Town to Say Hi to Everyone
posts.markdown: This Old Dog Walks 4 Miles Every Day Just to Say Hi to the Townspeople Every Day This Old Dog Walks 4 Miles Into Town Just to Say Hi For the past 12 years, one legendary dog has been commuting four miles every day into the town of Longville, Minnesota, just so he can say ‘hey’ to the people who work in its various shops and businesses. Bruno “the wandering dog” joined this loving community over ten years ago as a pup. The man who found Bruno mistakenly thought he belonged to Larry LaVallee, a local resident in the area. Bruno was not Larry’s dog, but something spurred him to take in this stray pup anyway. Larry soon found out that Bruno was not like other dogs. He had a craving for adventure. One that could only be satisfied by his long jaunts into town. Bruno kept escaping, so Larry chained him up. But even that failed when Bruno almost hung himself trying to get out one day. Since then, Larry has come to terms with Bruno’s frequent journeys and has even gotten used to the numerous people who call him explaining they’ve found his dog. They’re usually confused when Larry tells them that Bruno is fine and that he’ll make his way home by himself eventually. Longville has become accustomed to Bruno’s visits, so much so that they now look forward to him coming every day. Bruno usually frequents the city hall, the library, the ice cream shop, the grocery store, and several other shops around town. In fact, to show their appreciation for Bruno, they even erected a carved wooden statue of him and dubbed him the town’s ambassador! > [Every Day This Old Dog Walks 4 Miles To Town Just To Say Hi To Everyone](http://www.boredpanda.com/dog-4-mile-walk-to-town-bruno-longville/)
posts.html:
This Old Dog Walks 4 Miles Every Day Just to Say Hi to the Townspeople

Every Day This Old Dog Walks 4 Miles Into Town Just to Say Hi

For the past 12 years, one legendary dog has been commuting four miles every day into the town of Longville, Minnesota, just so he can say ‘hey’ to the people who work in its various shops and businesses.

Bruno “the wandering dog” joined this loving community over ten years ago as a pup. The man who found Bruno mistakenly thought he belonged to Larry LaVallee, a local resident in the area. Bruno was not Larry’s dog, but something spurred him to take in this stray pup anyway.

Larry soon found out that Bruno was not like other dogs. He had a craving for adventure. One that could only be satisfied by his long jaunts into town. Bruno kept escaping, so Larry chained him up. But even that failed when Bruno almost hung himself trying to get out one day.

Since then, Larry has come to terms with Bruno’s frequent journeys and has even gotten used to the numerous people who call him explaining they’ve found his dog. They’re usually confused when Larry tells them that Bruno is fine and that he’ll make his way home by himself eventually.

Longville has become accustomed to Bruno’s visits, so much so that they now look forward to him coming every day. Bruno usually frequents the city hall, the library, the ice cream shop, the grocery store, and several other shops around town.

In fact, to show their appreciation for Bruno, they even erected a carved wooden statue of him and dubbed him the town’s ambassador!

Every Day This Old Dog Walks 4 Miles To Town Just To Say Hi To Everyone

posts.title: One Teacher Asked Her Students a Simple Question and Was Heartbroken by Their Answers
posts.markdown: If you can think back to being a kid for a second, try to remember how hard it was to make sense of the world around you. Everything is entirely new to you. Not only do you have school responsibilities to worry about, but there’s a whole world of social cues and gestures you’re learning to navigate. **[Kyle Schwartz](http://www.boredpanda.com/student-notes-i-wish-my-teacher-knew-social-problems-kyle-schwartz/)**, third grade teacher at Doull Elementary School in Denver, Colorado, gave her students a seemingly harmless task: finish the sentence “I wish my teacher knew…” What she found was heartbreaking. And it spurred her to reach out to teachers from around the world, asking them to ask their students the same question. On **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kylemschwartz?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor)**, the hashtag “**[#iwishmyteacherknew](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23iwishmyteacherknew)**” went viral as more and more teachers posted their student’s responses. posts.title: 4 Reasons Clever People Struggle to Fall in Love, Backed By Science
posts.markdown: Love is one of those things that can absolutely drive a person mad, while at the same time being one of the things they crave most. It makes so many of us act out of character, and at times, completely stupid. For clever people, it’s even harder. Here are four reasons why clever people have a tough time getting involved romantically with others: **They’re constantly analyzing their own feelings, and the feelings of others** Clever people have an uncanny ability to observe, collect bits and pieces of info, and then piece together accurate conclusions. When it comes to love, however, they have a bad habit of overanalyzing things, which leads them to panic at the first sign of trouble. They don’t handle fights or arguments well. **They don’t let down their walls very fast** Intelligent people are all too aware of just how risky relationships can be, mainly because their minds never let them forget. They’re constantly thinking of the wide array of things that have the potential to go wrong at any moment. So, they’re not keen on opening up to just anyone. **They often go off of past experiences** Clever individuals struggle to not repeat the same mistakes that destroyed their previous relationships. They’re masters at getting so anxious and worked up about the *possibility* of things going wrong, that they end up projecting this fear and this negative energy onto the person they’re with at the moment, which usually causes things to go very, very wrong. **They’re often single by choice** Many intelligent people recognize the benefits of being single, or simply prefer it. If they’re more comfortable flying solo, then you can assume that that’s what they’re going to do. If you’re concerned about them being alone, don’t be; they’ve likely made the choice to be single, rather than being forced into it. And they’re entirely comfortable being their own company.

And they’re entirely comfortable being their own company.

posts.title: This Compact Camper is Perfect for the Avid Traveler
posts.markdown: Everyone knows that summertime is *the* time to travel, camp, explore and just be outside.  And you know that you and everyone else out there has their favorite adventure gear, camp spots, and relaxation destinations prepped and ready to go–or maybe you don’t.  Maybe you’re the type who likes spontaneous outings that haven’t been planned at all.   Either way, this compact camper is the perfect travel companion if you’re trying to see a bit more of the world. It’s smaller than pretty much every RV (recreational vehicle) you’ve ever seen, making it immediately more practical and less expensive.  But what’s even more amazing is what happens when you simply pull the handle on the camper. Dubbed the Gidget Retro Camper, this Australian-developed camper features a television entertainment center, a kitchen and sink, as well as refrigerators.  They’re powered largely by solar energy, and some models come with a shower and hot water. If you’re looking for a relatively cheap solution for any and all road trips, adventures, or travel plans, the Gidget might be what you’re looking for.  It retails for about $15,000–a fraction of what it would cost to buy a $100,000 RV.

posts.title: 5 Things Successful People Do to Stay Calm
posts.markdown: For some of us, when we’re struggling in our personal lives, we’re struggling in our work lives. It’s very easy to let the ups and downs of your personal life affect how productive or effective you are at work. In fact, **[TalentSmart](http://www.talentsmart.com/)** studied over a million people and found that people who performed the best in life (in the top 90 percent) are capable of controlling their emotions during stressful or emotional times in their life. Everyone has some level of stress that they deal with. However, it’s incredibly important to make sure your levels do not stay high for long periods of time. One Yale study found that prolonged stress can cause degeneration of the area of the brain that is associated with self-control. The downside is that our minds actually *need* stress to operate. Some brain functions don’t kick in until we’ve reached certain stress thresholds. Thus begins the battle for balance. Here are five ways that successful people manage their stress so they can perform at optimal levels: **They’re incredibly grateful** If you’re someone who rarely feels appreciative for the quality of your life, you could be slowly killing yourself. Showing gratitude and having a grateful mindset has been seen to reduce stress hormone levels by 23 percent. Research out of the University of California found that grateful attitudes and behaviors improved mood, energy, and physical well-being. **They never ask “what if?”** When you start thinking about what *could *have happened, you’re wasting energy on a mindset that ultimately does not benefit you in any way. There are a million possibilities for the things that happen every day. If you focus entirely on all of those different things, you only create more anxiety and stress. **They strive to stay positive** As humans, we’re very capable of shifting the way we think. Which is good when our wandering brains insist on focusing only on negative things. When we’re in a negative mindset, any positive thought can change the direction of our thinking. If there’s nothing positive to reflect on from that day, think back to something in the past week or month. Or shift your thoughts toward something that you’re looking forward to. Always have something positive to fall back on when your mind goes negative. **They disconnect** In a world full of social technologies that have made it possible to communicate with one another from wherever we are in the world, it can be incredibly difficult to escape work responsibilities even for a short amount of time. But the importance of disconnecting cannot be stressed enough. Force yourself to go off grid every once and awhile; turn off your phone, ignore your emails. You’ll feel refreshed and rejuvenated. **They make sure to get enough rest** If there’s one thing to take away from this article, it’s that you need to be getting an adequate amount of sleep *every* night. Sleep literally causes our brains to recharge and defragment, which in turn makes us alert and level-headed when we wake. When we don’t get enough sleep, our levels of self-control, attention, and memory, all suffer. We also gain increased levels of stress hormone, even when there is nothing to stress us out. The first step you should be focused on taking is making sure you’re getting enough sleep; if you don’t, everything else becomes that much harder. h/t: [**Steemit**](https://steemit.com/inspiration/@talentsmart/how-successful-people-stay-calm)
posts.html:
For some of us, when we’re struggling in our personal lives, we’re struggling in our work lives. It’s very easy to let the ups and downs of your personal life affect how productive or effective you are at work. In fact, TalentSmart studied over a million people and found that people who performed the best in life (in the top 90 percent) are capable of controlling their emotions during stressful or emotional times in their life.

Everyone has some level of stress that they deal with. However, it’s incredibly important to make sure your levels do not stay high for long periods of time. One Yale study found that prolonged stress can cause degeneration of the area of the brain that is associated with self-control.

The downside is that our minds actually need stress to operate. Some brain functions don’t kick in until we’ve reached certain stress thresholds. Thus begins the battle for balance.

Here are five ways that successful people manage their stress so they can perform at optimal levels:

They’re incredibly grateful

If you’re someone who rarely feels appreciative for the quality of your life, you could be slowly killing yourself. Showing gratitude and having a grateful mindset has been seen to reduce stress hormone levels by 23 percent.

Research out of the University of California found that grateful attitudes and behaviors improved mood, energy, and physical well-being.

They never ask “what if?”

When you start thinking about what could have happened, you’re wasting energy on a mindset that ultimately does not benefit you in any way. There are a million possibilities for the things that happen every day. If you focus entirely on all of those different things, you only create more anxiety and stress.

They strive to stay positive

As humans, we’re very capable of shifting the way we think. Which is good when our wandering brains insist on focusing only on negative things. When we’re in a negative mindset, any positive thought can change the direction of our thinking. If there’s nothing positive to reflect on from that day, think back to something in the past week or month. Or shift your thoughts toward something that you’re looking forward to.

Always have something positive to fall back on when your mind goes negative.

They disconnect

In a world full of social technologies that have made it possible to communicate with one another from wherever we are in the world, it can be incredibly difficult to escape work responsibilities even for a short amount of time. But the importance of disconnecting cannot be stressed enough.

Force yourself to go off grid every once and awhile; turn off your phone, ignore your emails. You’ll feel refreshed and rejuvenated.

They make sure to get enough rest

If there’s one thing to take away from this article, it’s that you need to be getting an adequate amount of sleep every night. Sleep literally causes our brains to recharge and defragment, which in turn makes us alert and level-headed when we wake.

When we don’t get enough sleep, our levels of self-control, attention, and memory, all suffer. We also gain increased levels of stress hormone, even when there is nothing to stress us out.

The first step you should be focused on taking is making sure you’re getting enough sleep; if you don’t, everything else becomes that much harder.

h/t: Steemit

posts.title: A Few Good Reasons to NEVER Let a Dog Lick Your Face
posts.markdown: Being a dog person means a few things. You’re usually pretty carefree and easygoing, you are probably extroverted, and you might occasionally let your dog give you some love by licking your face. I, personally, had always found it a bit weird that people**[let dogs lick their faces](http://www.pedigree.com/all-things-dog/article-library/are-dog-licks-really-kisses.aspx)**. But after becoming quite close with my mom’s miniature schnauzer, Sophie, I’m starting to understand it a little better. The unfortunate truth is that a dog’s mouth is NOT the cleanest place in the world, despite the fact that so many people seem to think so. As dog expert, **[Marty Becker, says](http://amzn.to/2bt9mz1)**: “All you have to do is **[look, watch, smell](http://abcnews.go.com/2020/Health/story?id=1213870)** and you’ll realize that is not true… They raid the garbage can. You know, we give each other a peck on the cheek when we say hello, they give each other a peck on the rear end.” If you’ve ever owned a dog, you know just how disgusting they can be at times. They regularly eat vomit, poop, and pretty much anything that is dead or decaying. John Oxford of Queen Mary University in London, expands on this notion a bit further: “It is not just what is carried in saliva. Dogs spend half their life with their noses in nasty corners or hovering over dog droppings so their muzzles are full of bacteria, viruses and germs of all sorts.” As numerous people have found out the hard way, letting a dog lick you might seem innocent at first, but it can quickly escalate into something else entirely. One **[UK woman caught an infection](http://casereports.bmj.com/content/2016/bcr-2016-215450.full?sid=d9093269-91af-43aa-a20a-b957742b1394)** from her Italian greyhound’s slobber. She had no idea that she was even infected until she started slurring her speech while talking on the phone with a family member. Her health was**[rapidly declining](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25828064)**, and by the time emergency services got to her, she was slumped over in a chair. It took her two weeks in the intensive care unit, along with a large amount of antibiotics, to see her fully recovered. Among the illnesses you can catch from your furry friend are **[ringworm infections](http://www.prevention.com/health/healthy-living/11-diseases-you-can-get-from-your-pet/slide/2), [MRSA (staph infection)](http://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/mrsa/basics/definition/con-20024479)**, and **[capnocytophaga canimorsus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capnocytophaga_canimorsus)**, which as you will see below, is quite nasty. The hands you see here are the result of the man’s dog licking his open wound. His feet were not so lucky, as one of them had to be amputated. Don’t risk your health and wellbeing for the sake of your dog’s affection. Even though these cases are not incredibly common, there have been **[13 similar cases](http://www.cbsnews.com/news/womans-pet-dog-gave-her-life-threatening-infection/)** throughout the United Kingdom recently, illustrating a very real threat.

“All you have to do is look, watch, smell and you’ll realize that is not true… They raid the garbage can. You know, we give each other a peck on the cheek when we say hello, they give each other a peck on the rear end.”

If you’ve ever owned a dog, you know just how disgusting they can be at times. They regularly eat vomit, poop, and pretty much anything that is dead or decaying. John Oxford of Queen Mary University in London, expands on this notion a bit further:

“It is not just what is carried in saliva. Dogs spend half their life with their noses in nasty corners or hovering over dog droppings so their muzzles are full of bacteria, viruses and germs of all sorts.”

posts.title: Psychology Says: You Might Be Better Off Single
posts.markdown: One psychologist claims that staying single gives people a chance to “live their best, most authentic and most meaningful life,” while also stating that the idea of a blissful marriage is entirely myth. At the American Psychological Association’s annual convention in Denver, professor Bella DePaulo challenged the widely accepted idea that marriage helps people live happier, longer or healthier lives. “The available findings are telling. For example, research comparing people who have stayed single with those who have stayed married shows that single people have a heightened sense of self-determination and they are more likely to experience ‘a sense of continued growth and development’ as a person,” said Professor DePaulo. She continues: “Other research shows that single people value meaningful work more than married people do … another study of lifelong single people showed that self-sufficiency serves them well: the more self-sufficient they were, the less likely they were to experience negative emotions. For married people, just the opposite was true.” By looking at the numbers reported by the **[Office for National Statistics](https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/populationandmigration/populationestimates/datasets/populationestimatesbymaritalstatusandlivingarrangements)**, we can see that just last year there were 16.2 million single people in the UK, versus 23.7 million married people. If we travel back to 2002, there were 12.5 million single people, and an almost identical 23 million married ones. DePaulo says that the reasons more people are choosing the single life are “rarely acknowledged.” “Single people are more connected to parents, siblings, friends, neighbours, and coworkers than married people are, and when people marry, they become more insular. “The preoccupation with the perils of loneliness can obscure the profound benefits of solitude. “It is time for a more accurate portrayal of single people and single life – one that recognizes the real strengths and resilience of people who are single, and what makes their lives so meaningful.” DePaulo continues to explain that, while people who get married are often supported and celebrated by their friends, family and peers, being single often invites being targeted, stigmatized, and stereotyped by the same crowds. She hopes that more people start to recognize the lack of evidence supporting the notion that marriage makes people happier and healthier, while also recognizing that we often invest too much time and energy into finding “The One.”
posts.html:
One psychologist claims that staying single gives people a chance to “live their best, most authentic and most meaningful life,” while also stating that the idea of a blissful marriage is entirely myth.

At the American Psychological Association’s annual convention in Denver, professor Bella DePaulo challenged the widely accepted idea that marriage helps people live happier, longer or healthier lives.

“The available findings are telling. For example, research comparing people who have stayed single with those who have stayed married shows that single people have a heightened sense of self-determination and they are more likely to experience ‘a sense of continued growth and development’ as a person,” said Professor DePaulo.

She continues: “Other research shows that single people value meaningful work more than married people do … another study of lifelong single people showed that self-sufficiency serves them well: the more self-sufficient they were, the less likely they were to experience negative emotions. For married people, just the opposite was true.”

By looking at the numbers reported by the Office for National Statistics, we can see that just last year there were 16.2 million single people in the UK, versus 23.7 million married people. If we travel back to 2002, there were 12.5 million single people, and an almost identical 23 million married ones.

DePaulo says that the reasons more people are choosing the single life are “rarely acknowledged.”

“Single people are more connected to parents, siblings, friends, neighbours, and coworkers than married people are, and when people marry, they become more insular.

“The preoccupation with the perils of loneliness can obscure the profound benefits of solitude.

“It is time for a more accurate portrayal of single people and single life – one that recognizes the real strengths and resilience of people who are single, and what makes their lives so meaningful.”

DePaulo continues to explain that, while people who get married are often supported and celebrated by their friends, family and peers, being single often invites being targeted, stigmatized, and stereotyped by the same crowds.

She hopes that more people start to recognize the lack of evidence supporting the notion that marriage makes people happier and healthier, while also recognizing that we often invest too much time and energy into finding “The One.”

posts.title: 5 Wonderful Things That Happen to the Body When We Eat Beets
posts.markdown: How often do you eat beets? Because I personally have never really been a fan of them. When I started working the salad bar at Whole Foods Market, I quickly became intrigued by them simply because of the stunning, vibrant magenta color liquid that they leaked when I cut them. Maybe you’ve never tried beets, maybe you have and don’t like them; either way, they’re full of nutritional value and we should all make beets a normal part of our diets because of it. Here are five great health benefits we gain by eating beets! **Improved Blood Pressure** Part of what makes beets so rich in color are the nitrates contained within. When we eat beets, our bodies convert these nitrates into nitric oxide, a compound known for **[relaxing blood vessels](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23231777)** and increasing circulation in the process. If you struggle maintaining **[healthy blood pressure levels](http://hyper.ahajournals.org/content/51/3/617.long)**, beets might be the remedy! **Decreased risk for Heart Disease** Eating beets can drastically lower your risk for heart disease because they contain two things: a plant alkaloid known as **[betaine](http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/80/3/539.full)**, and the valuable B-vitamin, **[folate](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12871094)**. These two together help reduce**[homocysteine levels](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3610948/)** in our blood, a compound that can damage arteries and cause heart disease if left unchecked. **It boosts your stamina** If you’ve ever seen an athlete pee and it’s a crimson or pink color, you can be sure that they eat beets regularly. Why? Because the nitrates found in beets help**[improve endurance](http://jap.physiology.org/content/107/4/1144.long)**, and they turn your pee pink. One study that had cyclists pedal to exhaustion over a certain period of time, found that cyclists who drank beet juice could pedal their hardest for **[15 percent longer](http://jap.physiology.org/content/107/4/1144.long)** than the control group. You’ll need anywhere from three to five beets to boost your performance, and you’ll want to eat them at least two to three hours before you need their enhancing effects. **Improved Brain Function** As mentioned previously, the nitrates found in beets help dilate blood vessels, improving blood circulation. It’s been seen that the body’s ability to convert nitrates into nitric oxide slows down as we grow older. A 2010 study found that people who consumed diets high in nitrates for at least two days received more blood flow to their **[brain’s frontal lobe](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3018552/)**; an area of the brain associated with one’s attention to detail, and ability to focus and organize. **Your liver will be healthier** The liver is the organ in our bodies that is responsible for cleaning everything up. It filters our blood, and you can give it a helping hand by eating your beets every day. **[Betaine](http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/80/3/539.full)**, the aforementioned healthy amino acid found in beets, has been seen to prevent and even decrease the amount of fat that ends up in the liver. Studies on animals have found that beet juice increases levels of healthy enzymes in the bloodstream. In people, it’s been seen to improve liver function, reduce cholesterol a tiny bit, and reduce the size of the liver itself.
posts.html:
How often do you eat beets? Because I personally have never really been a fan of them. When I started working the salad bar at Whole Foods Market, I quickly became intrigued by them simply because of the stunning, vibrant magenta color liquid that they leaked when I cut them.

Maybe you’ve never tried beets, maybe you have and don’t like them; either way, they’re full of nutritional value and we should all make beets a normal part of our diets because of it.

Here are five great health benefits we gain by eating beets!

Improved Blood Pressure

Part of what makes beets so rich in color are the nitrates contained within. When we eat beets, our bodies convert these nitrates into nitric oxide, a compound known for relaxing blood vessels and increasing circulation in the process.

If you struggle maintaining healthy blood pressure levels, beets might be the remedy!

Decreased risk for Heart Disease

Eating beets can drastically lower your risk for heart disease because they contain two things: a plant alkaloid known as betaine, and the valuable B-vitamin, folate.

These two together help reduce homocysteine levels in our blood, a compound that can damage arteries and cause heart disease if left unchecked.

It boosts your stamina

If you’ve ever seen an athlete pee and it’s a crimson or pink color, you can be sure that they eat beets regularly. Why? Because the nitrates found in beets help improve endurance, and they turn your pee pink. One study that had cyclists pedal to exhaustion over a certain period of time, found that cyclists who drank beet juice could pedal their hardest for 15 percent longer than the control group.

You’ll need anywhere from three to five beets to boost your performance, and you’ll want to eat them at least two to three hours before you need their enhancing effects.

Improved Brain Function

As mentioned previously, the nitrates found in beets help dilate blood vessels, improving blood circulation. It’s been seen that the body’s ability to convert nitrates into nitric oxide slows down as we grow older.

A 2010 study found that people who consumed diets high in nitrates for at least two days received more blood flow to their brain’s frontal lobe; an area of the brain associated with one’s attention to detail, and ability to focus and organize.

Your liver will be healthier

The liver is the organ in our bodies that is responsible for cleaning everything up. It filters our blood, and you can give it a helping hand by eating your beets every day.

Betaine, the aforementioned healthy amino acid found in beets, has been seen to prevent and even decrease the amount of fat that ends up in the liver.

Studies on animals have found that beet juice increases levels of healthy enzymes in the bloodstream. In people, it’s been seen to improve liver function, reduce cholesterol a tiny bit, and reduce the size of the liver itself.

posts.title: 5 Things to Recognize When An Empath Is In Your Presence
posts.markdown: Have you ever been around someone that people just seem to naturally gravitate toward? Maybe that someone is you, or your friend, or your family member. They’re people that others just feel comfortable with, like you could unload all of your problems and troubles in life and they’d be there to listen. These people are often known as empaths. They’re incredibly in tune with their own energy, but are also prone to absorbing the energies of others. There are a few things you’ll pick up on when you’re in the presence of an empath: **If you ask for advice, heed what we have to say** While many empaths, including myself, love listening to what others have to say, even when the topic of discussion is one that is hard to talk about. We’re ready to give advice and insight, but we hate when people do not listen to us or write us off as crazy. Listen to what we have to say, just as we have listened to you. **Do your best to never lie to an empath** If you’re looking to burn a bridge between yourself and an empath, the best way to do so is by lying to them. Lying is a behavior that incites very painful emotions for us. Many of us have had best friends lie straight to our face, never realizing we knew it the whole time. **They live to heal** An empath is one who wants nothing but for others to be healthy and happy. This is why you want to keep them around. You can trust their advice, because you know that they truly only want the best for you. **We’re not fans of narcissists** Empaths are too capable of detecting BS to be able to cope with narcissists. We absolutely cannot stand people who are vain, materialistic, or egotistical, and will most likely show it in some passive way. **We enjoy laughing every day** Most empaths spend a majority of their time in their heads. They’re tethered to a physical body, of course, but daydreaming is a common practice. Laughter is something that helps bring us back to the present moment, one that isn’t completely overwhelmed by the happenings of the world. This is why we can often be found watching some ridiculous movie or cartoon, or reading books written for children; we find joy in simple things. h/t [**MysticalRaven**](http://mysticalraven.com/health/2522/10-things-youll-notice-when-youre-in-the-presence-of-an-empath)

If you ask for advice, heed what we have to say

posts.title: The Biggest Native American Protest in History Is Happening Right Now
posts.markdown: Last Wednesday, **[a federal court declared](https://thinkprogress.org/bakken-pipeline-injunction-hearing-ca5054efeeb9#.mupvs2ggo)** that it will rule on the issue of a controversial pipeline that is currently being built across the Dakotas, Iowa and Illinois, in September. The Bakken pipeline is already about 48 percent complete, and is set to start delivering oil come January. It’s also being protested by the largest number of Native Americans (and allies) in the history of Native American protests. Why? Because this roughly $4 billion pipeline will cut through numerous watersheds and sacred sites, and brings with it a drastically **[increased potential for spill damage](https://www.fws.gov/uploadedFiles/DAPL%20Easements%20Draft%20EA%20%2012.17.15.pdf)**. If this pipe were to break or become damaged at any point along its 1,150 mile course, it could destroy thousands of acres of fertile farmland or our precious forests and rivers. *Every day,* some 570,000 barrels of crude oil would be traveling through four different Midwestern states and countless waterways. ![](http://thebakken.com/uploads/posts/web/2016/08/Energy_Transfer_Partners_export_map_14702596027619.JPG) The Standing Rock Sioux Tribe put forth an injunction request against the Bakken Pipeline’s creation. Judge James E. Boasberg has said that he will rule on the matter as soon as the 9th of September. “We are pleased that we had our day in court today, and we look forward to a ruling soon,” said Standing Rock Sioux Tribal Chairman Dave Archaumbault II. “I believe that everyone who attended the hearing today will understand that the tribe is seeking fundamental justice here.” Just a month before, the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe sued the Army Corps of Engineers over permits given to DakotaAcess to build a portion of the pipeline in an area about a half-mile north of a reservation, and through the Missouri River. ![](https://d262ilb51hltx0.cloudfront.net/max/800/1*dDB4oM5xKyK6v53Z3thV8A.jpeg) Outside the court hearing in Washington, D.C., gathered crowds of (mostly) Native Americans, some even coming from Arizona, to rally together in support of those who are trying to see the end of this major pipeline project. Actresses Susan Sarandon and Shailene Woodley were also present at the protest. Woodley, who’s been in North Dakota protesting for months, is one of several celebrities who has called for the project’s termination. ![](http://www.climateark.org/shared/alerts/img/tar_sands_before_after.jpg)*The Tar Sands of Canada, a ‘Before & After’ photo showing the devastation that oil drilling and transport does to the land* Do you think we should allow the construction of such a major pipeline with a potential for tremendous damage? What if I told you that we’d be selling the oil to countries in Europe and Asia, countries that are naturally moving away from oil as an energy resource at an attempt to go green?
posts.html:
Last Wednesday, a federal court declared that it will rule on the issue of a controversial pipeline that is currently being built across the Dakotas, Iowa and Illinois, in September. The Bakken pipeline is already about 48 percent complete, and is set to start delivering oil come January.

It’s also being protested by the largest number of Native Americans (and allies) in the history of Native American protests.

Why? Because this roughly $4 billion pipeline will cut through numerous watersheds and sacred sites, and brings with it a drastically increased potential for spill damage. If this pipe were to break or become damaged at any point along its 1,150 mile course, it could destroy thousands of acres of fertile farmland or our precious forests and rivers.

Every day, some 570,000 barrels of crude oil would be traveling through four different Midwestern states and countless waterways.

The Standing Rock Sioux Tribe put forth an injunction request against the Bakken Pipeline’s creation. Judge James E. Boasberg has said that he will rule on the matter as soon as the 9th of September.

“We are pleased that we had our day in court today, and we look forward to a ruling soon,” said Standing Rock Sioux Tribal Chairman Dave Archaumbault II.

“I believe that everyone who attended the hearing today will understand that the tribe is seeking fundamental justice here.”

Just a month before, the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe sued the Army Corps of Engineers over permits given to DakotaAcess to build a portion of the pipeline in an area about a half-mile north of a reservation, and through the Missouri River.

Outside the court hearing in Washington, D.C., gathered crowds of (mostly) Native Americans, some even coming from Arizona, to rally together in support of those who are trying to see the end of this major pipeline project. Actresses Susan Sarandon and Shailene Woodley were also present at the protest.

Woodley, who’s been in North Dakota protesting for months, is one of several celebrities who has called for the project’s termination.

The Tar Sands of Canada, a ‘Before & After’ photo showing the devastation that oil drilling and transport does to the land

Do you think we should allow the construction of such a major pipeline with a potential for tremendous damage? What if I told you that we’d be selling the oil to countries in Europe and Asia, countries that are naturally moving away from oil as an energy resource at an attempt to go green?

posts.title: 5 Karmaic Laws That Have the Potential to Change Your Life
posts.markdown: Change Your Life With These 5 Laws of Karma At a very basic level, karma operates under cause and effect type principles. Your actions *now* will have a direct influence on what happens to you *later*. Which is ultimately why our fates are not written in stone. When we do good deeds for others, like buying the coffee of the next person in line or giving a homeless person a meal, we create a ripple effect. There’s now a possibility that this person we’ve helped will “pay it forward” by doing a good deed of their own, and there’s a chance that we created a positive energy source with our actions. Here are five laws of Karma that can change your life: **The Great Law – “As you sow, so shall you reap.”** To explain this law simply: every single action we perform and thought that we have has a consequence, be it good or bad. In order to achieve what we desire most, whether it be love, peace, or prosperity, we must be willing to shift our being into alignment with our desires. **The Law of Creation – “What we desire comes through participation”** The reality that we’ve all been born into has been shaped by the intentions of others over the course of time. Because we are all intertwined as one in the universe, it is our intentions and willfulness that shape creation. Surround yourself with people and objects that are in line with your deepest desires. **The Law of Humility – “Refusal to accept what is”** Acceptance is a universal theme for various different systems of belief, and with good reason. We cannot begin to change our reality if we are in complete denial about every aspect of that reality. When we choose to think about the negative, instead of taking action to change the negative, we’re only furthering rumination and stagnation. **The Law of Here and Now – “The Present is all we have”** When we find ourselves thinking about the past, wishing we did things differently, or when we’re worrying about an uncertain future, we take away our chance at seizing opportunities in the present. We cannot move forward if we’re not living in the moment. **The Law of Patience and Reward – “Nothing of value is created without a patient mindset”** There are rarely shortcuts in life, and wishful thinking is not one of them. You cannot achieve all of your goals and desires immediately. Only with great patience and a persistent work ethic can we reap our greatest rewards, and the lasting joy that comes with them. https://www.powerofpositivity.com/12-laws-of-karma-that-will-change-your-life/
posts.html:
Change Your Life With These 5 Laws of Karma

At a very basic level, karma operates under cause and effect type principles. Your actions now will have a direct influence on what happens to you later. Which is ultimately why our fates are not written in stone.

When we do good deeds for others, like buying the coffee of the next person in line or giving a homeless person a meal, we create a ripple effect. There’s now a possibility that this person we’ve helped will “pay it forward” by doing a good deed of their own, and there’s a chance that we created a positive energy source with our actions.

Here are five laws of Karma that can change your life:

The Great Law – “As you sow, so shall you reap.”

To explain this law simply: every single action we perform and thought that we have has a consequence, be it good or bad. In order to achieve what we desire most, whether it be love, peace, or prosperity, we must be willing to shift our being into alignment with our desires.

The Law of Creation – “What we desire comes through participation”

The reality that we’ve all been born into has been shaped by the intentions of others over the course of time. Because we are all intertwined as one in the universe, it is our intentions and willfulness that shape creation. Surround yourself with people and objects that are in line with your deepest desires.

The Law of Humility – “Refusal to accept what is”

Acceptance is a universal theme for various different systems of belief, and with good reason. We cannot begin to change our reality if we are in complete denial about every aspect of that reality. When we choose to think about the negative, instead of taking action to change the negative, we’re only furthering rumination and stagnation.

The Law of Here and Now – “The Present is all we have”

When we find ourselves thinking about the past, wishing we did things differently, or when we’re worrying about an uncertain future, we take away our chance at seizing opportunities in the present. We cannot move forward if we’re not living in the moment.

The Law of Patience and Reward – “Nothing of value is created without a patient mindset”

There are rarely shortcuts in life, and wishful thinking is not one of them. You cannot achieve all of your goals and desires immediately. Only with great patience and a persistent work ethic can we reap our greatest rewards, and the lasting joy that comes with them.

https://www.powerofpositivity.com/12-laws-of-karma-that-will-change-your-life/

posts.title: 3 Healthy Reasons To Eat Black-Spotted Bananas
posts.markdown: Bananas are one fruit that seem to be “hit or miss” regarding how many people like to eat them. For example, I love bananas. I eat one probably every day. But my best friend (and roommate) absolutely loathes them. He can barely even stand the smell for some reason. And my girlfriend won’t eat them unless they’re somewhat green, or “fresh” as she describes them. In the United States, bananas are consumed the most out of all the fruits, even being eaten more often than apples and oranges. Whenever you purchase fruit, you can kind of gauge what they will taste like based on how long ago you purchased them. Usually the day you buy fruit, it’s not very ripe. Like with bananas, my girlfriend will only eat unripe bananas that have been bought recently. And I know a large number of people that will not touch a banana if it’s bruised and covered in black spots. But that’s a terrible mindset to have when it comes to bananas! As bananas continue to ripen, sure they develop these dark spots, but they also become more healthy and nutritious for you. Banana’s TNF levels increase as they become more ripe. TNF, or tumor necrosis factor, is a cancer-fighting compound that helps destroy abnormal cells in the body. High levels of TNF and antioxidants from bananas help strengthen our immune system and can help generate more white blood cells! So, next time you want to pass up the black-spotted banana, think about your health! They might look unappealing, but they taste the same and are packed with nutrition. Eating bananas provide a number of other health benefits as well. Here are just a few that come to mind: **Heartburn** Bananas are a natural antacid that can help relieve symptoms of heartburn and acid reflux. **Blood Pressure** Bananas have low sodium levels and high potassium levels, which helps lower blood pressure and prevent heart attack and stroke. **Depression** Bananas contain high levels of tryptophan, a compound that our bodies use to create serotonin. Serotonin is a neurotransmitter that helps improve mood, promotes relaxation, and makes people feel a bit happier. If you’re depressed, add bananas to your diet.

posts.title: 5 Important Things to Remember When We Break Up With Soul Mates
posts.markdown: When it comes to splitting up with a person you’ve grown close to, both intimately and otherwise, it can be one of the hardest things you’ll ever have to do. When we have partners for long periods of time, we grow together in many ways. We get used to having them as active participants in our life. Having to change the way you think about them and how you act toward them can be devastating. But, we must remember that we are still traveling along on our personal journeys through this world. The end of one relationship can make room for the next big chapter of your life. You will continue to move forward without them, experiencing life fully, if you can remember these five things during your troubled time: **You learn from your mistakes** Each time you and a partner decide to split up, there’s usually a lesson to be learned by both of you. If you can figure out what this lesson is, you can learn from it and move forward knowing you won’t make the same mistake twice. When we break up with a person, we heal and grow into a better person over time. Use this newfound freedom to explore who you are *right now* so you can be ready for the next opportunity. **The relationship might have been a bit too fiery** Sometimes when our soul mates make their way into our lives it’s with a fiery passion that burns hot and fast. Particularly when we start seeing someone who is basically a mirror image of ourselves. When two of the same type of people come together, there’s bound to be problems. Do your best to recognize that this person just wasn’t meant to be in your life in that way. It’s simply a matter of compatibility more so than anything else. **Timing can be everything** Sometimes two people come together simply out of convenience. When we’re traveling along on our paths and another person’s path is traveling right along side our own, it’s incredibly easy to build a connection. Remember that just because things are easy, it doesn’t necessarily mean they are good. If you’re worried about never finding that easiness again, know that you will. **Worrying about them won’t make things easier on you** When a breakup happens, both parties are feeling guilty. The unfortunate truth is that, in order to heal properly, you have to rid your mind of any thoughts concerning this person. You can’t be worried about their well-being right now; you have to focus on you and your own happiness. Letting go of them will ultimately be what sets you free. **They weren’t there to solve your life’s problems** For some of us, it can be hard to remember to be independent outside of a relationship. Sometimes we enter into one, and then completely forget how to function alone. If you’re feeling afraid that this person won’t be there to help you anymore, you need to remember that you don’t really need anyone else’s help, and that you can’t rely on others for your own happiness. This person may have made your life a little easier by taking on some of the responsibility, but you’re entirely capable of being happy on your own. Never become dependent on someone else for the happiness in your life.
posts.html:
When it comes to splitting up with a person you’ve grown close to, both intimately and otherwise, it can be one of the hardest things you’ll ever have to do. When we have partners for long periods of time, we grow together in many ways. We get used to having them as active participants in our life. Having to change the way you think about them and how you act toward them can be devastating.

But, we must remember that we are still traveling along on our personal journeys through this world. The end of one relationship can make room for the next big chapter of your life.

You will continue to move forward without them, experiencing life fully, if you can remember these five things during your troubled time:

You learn from your mistakes

Each time you and a partner decide to split up, there’s usually a lesson to be learned by both of you. If you can figure out what this lesson is, you can learn from it and move forward knowing you won’t make the same mistake twice.

When we break up with a person, we heal and grow into a better person over time. Use this newfound freedom to explore who you are right now so you can be ready for the next opportunity.

The relationship might have been a bit too fiery

Sometimes when our soul mates make their way into our lives it’s with a fiery passion that burns hot and fast. Particularly when we start seeing someone who is basically a mirror image of ourselves. When two of the same type of people come together, there’s bound to be problems.

Do your best to recognize that this person just wasn’t meant to be in your life in that way. It’s simply a matter of compatibility more so than anything else.

Timing can be everything

Sometimes two people come together simply out of convenience. When we’re traveling along on our paths and another person’s path is traveling right along side our own, it’s incredibly easy to build a connection.

Remember that just because things are easy, it doesn’t necessarily mean they are good. If you’re worried about never finding that easiness again, know that you will.

Worrying about them won’t make things easier on you

When a breakup happens, both parties are feeling guilty. The unfortunate truth is that, in order to heal properly, you have to rid your mind of any thoughts concerning this person. You can’t be worried about their well-being right now; you have to focus on you and your own happiness.

Letting go of them will ultimately be what sets you free.

They weren’t there to solve your life’s problems

For some of us, it can be hard to remember to be independent outside of a relationship. Sometimes we enter into one, and then completely forget how to function alone. If you’re feeling afraid that this person won’t be there to help you anymore, you need to remember that you don’t really need anyone else’s help, and that you can’t rely on others for your own happiness.

This person may have made your life a little easier by taking on some of the responsibility, but you’re entirely capable of being happy on your own. Never become dependent on someone else for the happiness in your life.

posts.title: One Yogi's Stunning Body Poses Are Inspiring the Lives of the Mentally Ill
posts.markdown: ![Yoga-therapy-ptsd-anxiety-depression-heidi-williams](http://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/yoga-therapy-ptsd-anxiety-depression-heidi-williams-22-57ca9dc177738__700.jpg) As a woman who survived being raped and the major depression, PTSD, and anxiety disorders that came along with it, Heidi Williams finally found peace of mind in the practice of yoga. And she wants to send a positive, helpful message to others who suffer from similar conditions. “It was in this place of mental illness hell that I found yoga and grace. Yoga brought me to a safe place again. A place of peace and self-acceptance,” Heidi told Mantra Yoga + Health. After attempting to kill herself, and almost losing her 6-month-old child in the process, Heidi used yoga to make a major transformation into the happy, positive person she is now. She’s created **[online support communities](https://www.facebook.com/groups/heidiwilliamssupportgroup/)** for people who have had similar experiences and need to connect with others. Heidi’s primary goal is to offer yoga retreats and classes that are designed specifically for people suffering from mental illness symptoms, like PTSD, depression and anxiety. If you want to keep up with Heidi and her inspiring story,**[follow her on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/heidiwilliams89/),** a platform she uses to help bring others out of their darkness.
